USFM file edited 2022-09-24 17:40 by ScriptedBibleEditor v0.14

G‹Matthaios›G

1  The_scroll of_the_birth of_G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G chosen_one/messiah, son of_G‹H‹Dauid/(Dāvid)›H›G, son of_G‹H‹Abra'am/('Avərāhām)›H›G: 2 G‹H‹Abra'am bore G‹H‹Isa'ak/(Yiʦəḩāq)›H›G, and G‹H‹Isa'ak bore G‹H‹Yakōb/(Ya'aqov)›H›G, and G‹H‹Yakōb bore G‹H‹Youda/(Yəhūdāh)›H›G and the brothers of_him, 3 And G‹H‹Youda bore G‹H‹Fares/(Fereʦ)›H›G and G‹H‹Zara/(Zeraḩ)›H›G of G‹H‹Thamar/(Tāmār)›H›G, And G‹H‹Fares bore G‹H‹Hesrōm/(Ḩeʦərōn)›H›G, And G‹H‹Hesrōm bore G‹H‹Aram/(Rām)›H›G, 4 And G‹H‹Aram bore G‹H‹Aminadab/('Ammiynādāv)›H›G, And G‹H‹Aminadab bore G‹H‹Na'assōn/(Naḩəshōn)›H›G, And G‹H‹Na'assōn bore G‹H‹Salmōn/(Saləmōn)›H›G, 5 And G‹H‹Salmōn bore G‹H‹Bo'oz/(Bo'az)›H›G of G‹H‹Ɽaⱪab/(Rāḩāv)›H›G, And G‹H‹Bo'oz bore G‹H‹Yōbēd/Ōbēd/('Ōvēd)›H›G of G‹H‹Ɽouth/(Rūt)›H›G, And G‹H‹Yōbēd bore G‹H‹Yessai/(Yishay)›H›G, 6 And G‹H‹Yessai bore G‹H‹Dauid the king.
   And G‹H‹Dauid bore G‹H‹Solomōn/(Shəlmoh)›H›G of the wife of_G‹H‹Ourias/('Uriyyāh)›H›G, 7 And G‹H‹Solomōn bore G‹H‹Ɽoboam/(Rəḩavə'ām)›H›G, And G‹H‹Ɽoboam bore G‹H‹Abia/('Avīāh)›H›G, And G‹H‹Abia bore G‹H‹Asaf/('Āşāf)›H›G, 8 And G‹H‹Asaf bore G‹H‹Yōsafat/(Yəhōshāfāţ)›H›G, And G‹H‹Yōsafat bore G‹H‹Yōram/(Yōrām)›H›G, And G‹H‹Yōram bore G‹H‹Ozias/('Uzziyyāh)›H›G, 9 And G‹H‹Ozias bore G‹H‹Yōatham/(Yōtām)›H›G, And G‹H‹Yōatham bore G‹H‹Aⱪaz/('Āḩāz)›H›G, And G‹H‹Aⱪaz bore G‹H‹Hezekias/(Ḩizəqiyyāh)›H›G, 10 And G‹H‹Hezekias bore G‹H‹Manassēs/(Mənashsheh)›H›G, And G‹H‹Manassēs bore G‹H‹Amōs/('Āmōʦ)›H›G, And G‹H‹Amōs bore G‹H‹Yōsias/(Y'oshiyyāh)›H›G, 11 And G‹H‹Yōsias bore G‹H‹Yeⱪonias/(Yəkānəyāh)›H›G and the brothers of_him during the deportation to_G‹H‹Babulōn/(Bāvel?)›H›G.
   12 And after the deportation to_G‹H‹Babulōn, G‹H‹Yeⱪonias bore G‹H‹Salathiēl/(Shə'aləttiy'ēl)›H›G, And G‹H‹Salathiēl bore G‹H‹Zorobabel/(Zərubbāvel)›H›G, 13 And G‹H‹Zorobabel bore G‹H‹Abioud/('Avīhūd)›H›G, And G‹H‹Abioud bore G‹H‹Eliakeim/('Eləyāqīm)›H›G, And G‹H‹Eliakeim bore G‹H‹Azōr/('Azzūr)›H›G, 14 And G‹H‹Azōr bore G‹H‹Sadōk/(Tsādōq)›H›G, And G‹H‹Sadōk bore G‹H‹Aⱪeim/(Yōqīm)›H›G, And G‹H‹Aⱪeim bore G‹H‹Elioud/('Ēl-hōd)›H›G, 15 And G‹H‹Elioud bore G‹H‹Eleazar/('Elə'āzār)›H›G, And G‹H‹Eleazar bore G‹H‹Matthan/(Mattān)›H›G, And G‹H‹Matthan bore G‹H‹Yakōb, 16 And G‹H‹Yakōb bore G‹H‹Yōsēf/(Yōşēf)›H›G the husband of_G‹H‹Maria/(Mirəyām)›H›G, of whom was_born G‹H‹Yēsous, the one being_called the_chosen_one.
   17 Therefore all the generations from G‹H‹Abra'am to G‹H‹Dauid were fourteen generations, and from G‹H‹Dauid until the deportation to_G‹H‹Babulōn fourteen generations, and from the deportation to_G‹H‹Babulōn to the chosen_one fourteen generations.
   18 And the birth of_G‹H‹Yēsous chosen_one was thus: the mother of_him G‹H‹Maria having_been_betrothed to_G‹H‹Yōsēf, before them to_come_together, she_was_found having in womb by the_ holy _spirit.
   19 And G‹H‹Yōsēf the husband of_her, being righteous and not willing to_expose her, was_counseled to_send_ her _away secretly.
   20 But these things having_been_considered of_him, see, an_angel of_the_master was_seen to_him in a_dream saying: G‹H‹Yōsēf, son of_G‹H‹Dauid, may_ not _be_afraid to_receive G‹H‹Maria the wife of_you, for the one in her having_been_born is from the_ holy _spirit.
   21 And she_will_be_bearing a_son, and you_will_be_calling the name of_him G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, for he will_be_saving the people of_him from the sins of_them.
   22 And all this has_become, in_order_that the thing having_been_spoken by the_master through the prophet may_be_fulfilled saying, 23 see, the virgin will_be_having in womb and will_be_bearing a_son, and they_will_be_calling the name of_him G‹H‹Emmanouēl/('Immānū'ēl)›H›G, which is being_translated: god with us.
   24 And G‹H‹Yōsēf having_been_raised from the sleep, did as the angel of_the_master commanded to_him, and received the wife of_him, 25 and was_ not _knowing her until of_which she_bore a_son, and he_called the name of_him, G‹H‹Yēsous.
  Mat 2  And G‹H‹Yēsous having_been_born in G‹Bēthle'em›G of_Rx-G‹Youdaia›G-Rx in the_days of_Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx the king, see, Rx-wise_men-Rx from east arrived in G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G 2 saying: Where is the one, having_been_born king of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G.
   For we_saw the star of_him in the east and we_came to_worship before_him.
   3 And king Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx having_heard was_disturbed, and all G‹H‹Hierousalēm with him.
   4 And having_gathered_together all the chief_priests and scribes of_the people, he_was_inquiring from them where the chosen_one/messiah is_being_born.
   5 And they said to_him: In G‹Bēthle'em›G of_Rx-G‹Youdaia›G-Rx, for thus it_has_been_written through the prophet: 6 and you G‹Bēthle'em›G, land of_G‹H‹Youda/(Yəhūdāh)›H›G, are by_no_means least among the rulers of_G‹H‹Youda, for out_of of_you will_be_coming_out a_leading one, who will_be_shepherding the people of_me Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx.
   7 Then Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx having_ secretly _called the Rx-wise_men-Rx, ascertained from them the time of_the appearing star.
   8 And having_sent them to G‹Bēthle'em›G he_said: Having_been_gone, search_out exactly for the little_child, and when you_all_may_find him, report to_me so_that also_I having_come may_worship before_him.
   9 And having_heard from_the king, they_were_gone, and see, the star, which they_saw in the east, was_going_before them until having_come it_was_stood over where the little_child was.
   10 And having_seen the star, they_were_elated with_ great _joy exceedingly.
   11 And having_come into the house, they_saw the little_child with G‹H‹Maria/(Mirəyām)›H›G the mother of_him, and having_fallen they_worshipped before_him, and having_opened_up the treasures of_them, they_offered gifts to_him: gold, and frankincense, and myrrh.
   12 And having_been_warned in a_dream not to_return to Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx, they_withdrew by another way into the country of_them.
   13 And having_withdrawn from_them, see, an_angel of_the_master is_appearing in a_dream to_G‹H‹Yōsēf/(Yōşēf)›H›G saying: Having_been_raised, take the little_child and the mother of_him and be_fleeing into G‹H‹Aiguptos/(Miʦərayim)›H›G, and be there until I_may_tell to_you, for Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx is_going to_be_seeking the little_child, to_destroy him.
   14 And having_been_raised, he_took the little_child and the mother of_him by_night and withdrew into G‹H‹Aiguptos, 15 and he_was there until the death of_Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx, in_order_that may_be_fulfilled the word having_been_spoken by the_master through the prophet saying: out_of of_G‹H‹Aiguptos I_called the son of_me.
   16 Then Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx, having_seen that he_was_mocked by the Rx-wise_men-Rx, was_enraged exceedingly and having_sent_out, he_killed all the boys in G‹Bēthle'em›G and in all the regions of_it from two_year and lower, according_to the time which he_ascertained from the Rx-wise_men-Rx.
   17 Then the word was_fulfilled having_been_spoken through G‹H‹Yeremias/(Yirəməyāh)›H›G the prophet saying, 18 a_voice in G‹H‹Ɽama/(Rāmāh)›H›G was_heard, weeping and great mourning, G‹H‹Ɽaⱪēl/(Rāḩēl)›H›G weeping for_the children of_her, and was_ not _wanting to_be_comforted, because they_are not.
   19 But Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx having_died, see, an_angel of_the_master is_appearing in a_dream to_G‹H‹Yōsēf in G‹H‹Aiguptos 20 saying: Having_been_raised, take the little_child and the mother of_him, and be_going into the_land of_Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx, for the ones seeking the life of_the little_child have_died.
   21 And having_been_raised, he_took the little_child and the mother of_him, and came_in into the_land of_Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx.
   22 But having_heard that G‹Arⱪelaos›G is_reigning over_Rx-G‹Youdaia›G-Rx instead_of the father of_him Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx, he_was_afraid to_go_away there, and having_been_warned in a_dream, he_withdrew into the districts of_G‹H‹Galilaia/(Gālīl)›H›G, 23 and having_come, he_dwelt into a_city being_called G‹Nazaret›G, so_that the word may_be_fulfilled having_been_spoken through the prophets, he_will_be_being_called a_G‹from_Nazaret›G.
  Mat 3  And in those days G‹Yōannēs›G the immerser is_arriving, proclaiming in the desert of_Rx-G‹Youdaia›G-Rx 2 saying: Be_repenting, for the kingdom of_the heavens has_neared.
   3 For this is the one having_been_spoken through G‹H‹Ēsaias/(Yəsha'əyāh)›H›G the prophet saying: the_voice of_a_shouting one in the desert: Prepare the way of_the_master, be_making the paths of_him straight.
   4 And G‹Yōannēs›G himself was_having the clothing of_him from hairs of_a_camel and a_ leather _belt around the waist of_him, and the food of_him was locusts and wild honey.
   5 Then G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G, and all Rx-G‹Youdaia›G-Rx, and all the surrounding_region of_the G‹H‹Yordanēs/(Yarəddēn)›H›G was_going_out to him, 6 and they_were_being_immersed by him in the G‹H‹Yordanēs River, confessing the sins of_them.
   7 But having_seen many of_the G‹Farisaios_sect›G and G‹Saddoukaios_sect›G coming to the immersion of_him, he_said to_them: Brood of_vipers, who warned to_you_all to_flee from the coming severe_anger.
   8 Therefore produce fruit worthy of_repentance.
   9 And you_all_may_ not _suppose to_be_saying among yourselves, we_are_having G‹H‹Abra'am/('Avərāhām)›H›G father, for I_am_saying to_you_all that god is_able these children to_G‹H‹Abra'am out_of the stones to_raise.
   10 And already the axe is_lying to the root of_the trees, therefore every tree not producing good fruit is_being_cut_off and is_being_throw into the_fire.
   11 I on_one_hand am_immersing you_all with water to repentance, on_the_other_hand the one coming after me is mightier than me, of_whom not I_am worthy to_bear the sandals.
   He will_be_immersing you_all with the_ holy _spirit and with_fire.
   12 Of_whom the winnowing_fork is in the hand of_him, and he_will_be_clearing_out the threshing_floor of_him, and will_be_gathering_together the wheat of_him into the barn, of_him, but the chaff he_will_be_burning_up with_ inextinguishable _fire.
   13 Then G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G is_arriving from G‹H‹Galilaia to the G‹H‹Yordanēs to G‹Yōannēs›G, to_be_immersed by him.
   14 But was_forbidding him saying: I am_having need to_be_immersed by you, and you are_coming to me.
   15 But G‹H‹Yēsous answering said to him: Allow it now, for thus it_is befitting to_us to_fulfill all righteousness.
   Then he_is_allowing him.
   16 And having_been_immersed, G‹H‹Yēsous immediately went_up from the water, and see, the heavens were_opened_up, and he_saw the spirit of_god coming_down as a_dove and coming on him.
   17 And see, a_voice out_of of_the heavens saying: This is the son of_me, the beloved in whom I_took_pleasure.
  Mat 4  Then G‹H‹Yēsous was_brought_up into the desert by the spirit to_be_tempted by the devil.
   2 And having_fasted forty days and forty nights, later he_hungered.
   3 And the one tempting having_approached, said to_him: If you_are the_son of_god, speak that these stones may_become loaves.
   4 But he answering said: It_has_been_written: the person not only by bread will_be_living, but by every word going_out through the_mouth of_god.
   5 Then the devil is_taking him to the holy city, and stood him on the pinnacle of_the temple, 6 and he_is_saying to_him: If you_are the_son of_god, throw yourself down, for it_has_been_written, will_be_commanding to_the angels of_him concerning you, and: they_will_be_carrying you in their_hands, lest you_may_strike the foot of_you against a_stone.
   7 G‹H‹Yēsous was_saying to_him: Again it_has_been_written: you will_ not _be_testing the_master the god of_you.
   8 Again the devil is_taking him to a_ high _mountain exceedingly, and is_showing to_him all the kingdoms of_the world and the glory of_them, 9 and he_said to_him, all these things to_you I_will_be_giving, if having_fallen you_may_worship before_me.
   10 Then G‹H‹Yēsous is_saying to_him: Be_going_away, G‹H‹Satan/(Sāţān)›H›G, for it_has_been_written: you_will_be_worshipping the_master the god of_you, and only unto_him you_will_be_serving.
   11 Then the devil is_leaving him, and see, angels approached and were_serving unto_him.
   12 And having_heard that G‹Yōannēs›G was_given_over, he_withdrew into G‹H‹Galilaia/(Gālīl)›H›G.
   13 And having_left G‹Nazaret›G, having_come he_dwelt at G‹Kafarna'oum›G, which is by_the_seaside in the_regions of_G‹H‹Zaboulōn/(Zəvūlūn)›H›G and G‹H‹Nefthaleim/(Nafəttālī)›H›G, 14 in_order_that the word may_be_fulfilled having_been_spoken by G‹H‹Ēsaias/(Yəsha'əyāh)›H›G the prophet saying, 15 land of_G‹H‹Zaboulōn and land of_G‹H‹Nefthaleim, way of_the_sea, beyond the G‹H‹Yordanēs/(Yarəddēn)›H›G, G‹H‹Galilaia of_the pagans.
   16 The people sitting in darkness saw a_ great _light, and to_the ones sitting in a_land and shadow of_death, a_light rose on_them.
   17 from then G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G began to_be_proclaiming and to_be_saying: Be_repenting, for the kingdom of_the heavens has_neared.
   18 And walking beside the sea Two he_saw, of_G‹H‹Galilaia brothers, Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx being_called G‹Petros›G and G‹Andreas›G the brother of_him, throwing a_throwing_net into the sea, for they_were fishermen.
   19 And he_is_saying to_them: Come after me, and I_will_be_making you_all fishermen of_people.
   20 And immediately having_left the nets, they_followed after_him.
   21 And having_advanced from_there, he_saw two other brothers, G‹H‹Yakōbos/(Ya'aqov)›H›G the son of_G‹Zebedaios›G and G‹Yōannēs›G the brother of_him, in the boat with G‹Zebedaios›G the father of_them, preparing the nets of_them, and he_called them.
   22 And immediately having_left the boat and the father of_them, they_followed after_him.
   23 And the G‹H‹Yēsous he_was_going_around in all G‹H‹Galilaia, teaching in the synagogues of_them, and proclaiming the gospel of_the kingdom, and healing every disease and every sickness among the people.
   24 And the report of_him went_away into all Rx-G‹H‹Suria/('Arām)›H›G-Rx.
   And they_brought to_him all the ones sickly, having with_various diseases, and being_gripped_with with_torments, being_demon_possessed, and being_epileptic, and paralytic, and he_healed them.
   25 And great crowds followed after_him from G‹H‹Galilaia, and the_G‹Dekapolis›G, and G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G, and Rx-G‹Youdaia›G-Rx, and beyond the G‹H‹Yordanēs.
  Mat 5  And having_seen the crowds, he_went_up on the mountain, and him having_sat_down, the apprentices/followers of_him approached to_him.
   2 And having_opened_up the mouth of_him, he_was_teaching them saying, 3 Blessed are the poor in_the spirit, because to_them is the kingdom of_the heavens.
   4 Blessed are the ones mourning, because they will_be_being_comforted.
   5 Blessed are the gentle, because they will_be_inheriting the earth.
   6 Blessed are the ones hungering and thirsting for_righteousness, because they will_be_being_satisfied.
   7 Blessed are the merciful, because they will_be_being_shown_mercy.
   8 Blessed are the pure in_heart, because they will_be_seeing god.
   9 Blessed are the peacemaking, because they will_be_being_called sons of_god.
   10 Blessed are the ones having_been_persecuted on_account righteousness, because to_them is the kingdom of_the heavens.
   11 Blessed are_you_all whenever they_may_deride you_all and may_pursue and they_may_say all evil lying against you_all on_account of_me.
   12 Be_rejoicing and be_exulting, because the reward of_you_all is great in the heavens, for thus they_persecuted the prophets before you_all.
   13 You_all are the salt of_the earth, but if the salt may_be_made_tasteless, with what it_will_be_being_salted.
   It_is_being_effective for nothing anymore, except having_been_throw out, to_be_being_trampled by the people.
   14 You_all are the light of_the world.
   a_city lying on a_mountain Is_ not _able to_be_hidden.
   15 And_not they_are_lighting a_lamp and are_putting it under a_basket, but on the lampstand, and it_is_shining for_all the ones in the house.
   16 Thus let_ the light of_you_all _shine before the people, so_that they_may_see the good works of_you_all, and may_glorify the father of_you_all in the heavens.
   17 You_all_may_ not _think that I_came to_tear_down the law or the prophets, I_came not to_tear_down, but to_fulfill.
   18 For, truly I_am_saying to_you_all, until heaven and earth may_pass_away, one Iota or one serif by_no_means may_ not _pass_away from the law, until all things may_become.
   19 Whoever therefore if may_break of_these the one of_the commandments least, and may_teach the people thus, will_be_being_called least in the kingdom of_the heavens, but whoever may_practice and may_teach, this one will_be_being_called great in the kingdom of_the heavens.
   20 For I_am_saying to_you_all that if righteousness of_you_all not may_abound more of_the scribes and G‹Farisaios_sect›G, by_no_means you_all_may_ not _come_in into the kingdom of_the heavens.
   21 You_all_heard that it_was_said to_the ancients: you will_ not _be_murdering, and whoever, may_murder, will_be liable to_the judgment.
   22 But I am_saying to_you_all that everyone being_angered by_the brother of_him, will_be liable to_the judgment, and whoever may_say to_the brother of_him: Raca, will_be liable to_the council, and whoever may_say: Foolish, will_be liable to G‹geenna›G of_fire.
   23 Therefore if you_may_be_offering the gift of_you at the altar, and_there you_may_be_reminded that the brother of_you is_having something against you, 24 leave the gift of_you there before the altar.
   And be_going_away first be_reconciled to_the brother of_you, and then having_come, be_offering the gift of_you.
   25 Be agreeing with_the opponent of_you quickly, as_long_as which you_are with him on the way, lest the opponent may_give_ you _over to_the judge, and the judge to_the attendant, and you_will_be_being_throw into prison.
   26 Truly, I_am_saying to_you, by_no_means you_may_ not _come_out from_there, until you_may_give_back the last quadran.
   27 You_all_heard that it_was_said: you will_ not _be_committing_adultery.
   28 But I am_saying to_you_all that everyone looking at_a_woman in_order that to_lust for_her, already committed_adultery with_her in the heart of_him.
   29 And if the right eye of_you is_stumbling you, pluck_out it and throw it from you, for it_is_benefitting for_you that one of_the members of_you may_perish, and all the body of_you may_ not _be_throw into G‹geenna›G.
   30 And if the right hand of_you is_stumbling you, cut_off it and throw it from you, for it_is_benefitting for_you that one of_the members of_you may_perish, and all the body of_you may_ not _go_away into G‹geenna›G.
   31 And it_was_said: whoever may_send_away the wife of_him, him_let_give divorce to_her.
   32 But I am_saying to_you_all that everyone sending_away the wife of_him, except on_account of_sexual_immorality, is_making her to_be_committing_adultery, and whoever may_marry having_been_sent_away her, is_causing_adultery.
   33 Again you_all_heard that it_was_said to_the ancients: you will_ not _be_perjuring, but you_will_be_giving_back to_the master the oaths of_you.
   34 But I am_saying to_you_all not to_ actually _swear, neither by heaven, because it_is the_throne of_god, 35 nor by the earth, because it_is the_footstool of_the feet of_him, nor in G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G, because it_is the_city of_the great king, 36 nor may_you_swear by the head of_you, because you_are_ not _being_able to_make one hair white.
   or black.
   37 But let_be the statement of_you_all, yes be yes, no be no, and the additional than these things is from evil.
   38 You_all_heard that it_was_said: eye for an_eye and tooth for a_tooth.
   39 But I am_saying to_you_all, not to_resist against_the evil, but whoever is_slapping you you on the right cheek, of_you turn to_him also the other, 40 and to_the one willing you to_be_judged and to_take the tunic of_you, allow to_him also your coat, 41 and whoever you may_compel one mile, be_going with him two.
   42 To_the one requesting you, give, and to_the one wanting from you to_borrow, you _may_ not _be_turned_away.
   43 You_all_heard that it_was_said: you_will_be_loving the neighbor of_you, and you_will_be_hating the enemy of_you.
   44 But I am_saying to_you_all, be_loving the the_enemies of_you_all, and be_praying for the ones persecuting you_all, 45 so_that you_all_may_become sons of_the father of_you_all who in the_heavens, because he_is_rising the sun of_him on evil and good, and is_raining on the_righteous and unrighteous.
   46 For if you_all_may_love the ones loving you_all, what reward are_you_all_having.
   Not also the tax_collectors are_doing the same.
   47 And if you_all_may_greet the brothers of_you_all only, what additional things are_you_all_doing.
   Not also the pagans are_doing the same.
   48 Therefore you_all will_be perfect as the heavenly father of_you_all is perfect.
  Mat 6  be_taking_heed not to_be_practicing the righteousness of_you_all before the people, in_order that to_be_seen by_them, and if not surely, you_all_are_having no reward with the father of_you_all, who is in the heavens.
   2 Therefore whenever you_may_be_doing alms, you_may_ not _trumpet before you, as the hypocrites are_doing in the synagogues and in the streets, so_that they_may_be_glorified by the people.
   Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all, they_are_receiving_fully the reward of_them.
   3 But of_you doing alms, not let_know the left hand of_you what the right hand of_you is_doing, 4 so_that the alms of_you may_be in secret, and the father of_you, the one seeing in secret, will_be_giving_back to_you.
   5 And whenever you_may_be_praying, you_all_will_ not _be like the hypocrites, because they_are_loving to_be_praying in the synagogues and having_stood on the corners of_the roads, so_that they_may_be_seen by_the people.
   Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all, they_are_receiving_fully the reward of_them.
   6 But you whenever you_may_be_praying, come_in into the private_room of_you and having_shut the door of_you, pray to_the father of_you, who is in secret, and the father of_you, the one seeing in secret, will_be_giving_back to_you.
   7 And praying you_all_may_ not _babble as the pagans, for they_are_supposing that in the many_words of_them they_will_be_being_listened_to.
   8 Therefore you_all _may_ not _be_likened to_them, for the god the father of_you_all has_known what things you_all_are_having need before the time you_all to_request him.
   9 Therefore you_all be_praying thus: father of_us, the one in the heavens, let_ the name of_you _be_sanctified.
   10 let_ the kingdom of_you _come, let_be_ the will of_you _become, on earth also as in heaven.
   11 Give to_us today the daily_needed bread of_us.
   12 And forgive to_us the debts of_us, as we also forgave to_the debtors of_us.
   13 And you_may_ not _carry_in us into temptation, but rescue us from evil.
   14 For if you_all_may_forgive to_people the transgressions of_them, the heavenly father of_you_all will_ also _be_forgiving to_you_all.
   15 But if you_all_may_ not _forgive to_people the transgressions of_them, neither the father of_you_all will_be_forgiving the transgressions of_you_all.
   16 And whenever you_all_may_be_fasting, be_ not _becoming downthrow like the hypocrites, for they_are_disfiguring the appearances of_them, so_that they_may_be_seen by_the people fasting.
   Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all, they_are_receiving_fully the reward of_them.
   17 But you fasting, anoint the head of_you and wash the face of_you, 18 so_that you _may_ not _be_seen by_the people fasting, but to_the father of_you who is in secret, and the father of_you, the one seeing in secret, will_be_giving_back to_you.
   19 Be_ not _storing_up treasures on the earth for_you_all, where moth and corrosion is_destroy, and where thieves are_digging_through and are_stealing, 20 but be_storing_up for_you_all treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor corrosion is_destroying, and where thieves not are_digging_through nor are_stealing.
   21 For where the treasure of_you is, there will_be also the heart of_you.
   22 The lamp of_the body is the eye.
   Therefore if the eye of_you may_be healthy, the whole body of_you will_be bright.
   23 But if the eye of_you may_be evil, all the body of_you will_be dark.
   Therefore if the light in you is darkness, how_great is the darkness.
   24 No_one is_able to_be_serving for_two masters, for either he_will_be_hating the one and he_will_be_loving the other, or he_will_be_upholding of_the_one and he_will_be_despising of_the other.
   You_all_are_ not _being_able to_be_serving for_god and money.
   25 Because_of this I_am_saying to_you_all, be_ not _worrying for_the life of_you_all what you_all_may_eat or what you_all_may_drink, nor for_the body of_you_all what you_all_may_dress_in.
   Not the life is more than the food, and the body than the clothing.
   26 Consider on the birds of_the sky, that neither they_are_sowing, nor they_are_reaping, nor they_are_gathering_together into barns, and the heavenly father of_you_all is_feeding them, are_ not you_all _carrying_value more than them.
   27 And who of you_all worrying is_able to_add one hour to the lifespan of_him.
   28 And about clothing why are_you_all_worrying.
   Observe how the lilies of_the field are_growing, they_are_ not _laboring nor are_they_spinning, 29 but I_am_saying to_you_all that not_even G‹H‹Solomōn/(Shəlmoh)›H›G in all the glory of_him clothed like one of_these.
   30 But if god is_ thus _dressing the grass of_the field being today, and tomorrow being_throw into the_furnace, not by_much more for_you_all, little_faith ones.
   31 Therefore you_all_may_ not _worry saying: What may_we_eat, or: What may_we_drink, or: What may_we_clothed.
   32 For the pagans are_seeking_after all these things.
  , for the heavenly father of_you_all has_known that you_all_are_needing of_ all _these things.
   33 But be_seeking first the kingdom and the righteousness of_him, and all these things will_be_being_added to_you_all.
   34 Therefore you_all_may_ not _worry for the_ next _day, for the_ next _day will_be_worrying about_itself.
   The Evil of_it sufficient to_the day is.
  Mat 7  Be_ not _judging, in_order_that you_all _may_ not _be_judged, 2 with for what judgment you_all_are_judging, you_all_will_be_being_judged, and with what measure you_all_are_measuring, it_will_be_being_measured to_you_all.
   3 And why you_are_looking the speck in the eye of_the brother of_you, but you_are_ not _observing the speck beam in your eye.
   4 Or how you_will_be_saying to_the brother of_you: Allow that I_may_throw_out the speck from the eye of_you, and see, the beam is in the eye of_you.
   5 Hypocrite, first throw_out the beam from the eye of_you, and then you_will_be_seeing_clearly to_throw_out the speck from the eye of_the brother of_you.
   6 You_all_may_ not _give the holy thing to_the dogs, nor you_all_may_throw the pearls of_you_all before the pigs, lest they_will_be_trampling them with the feet of_them, and having_been_turned they_may_attack you_all.
   7 Be_requesting and it_will_be_being_given to_you_all, be_seeking and you_all_will_be_finding, be_knocking and it_will_be_being_opened_up to_you_all.
   8 For everyone requesting is_receiving, and the one seeking is_finding, and to_the one knocking it_will_be_being_opened_up.
   9 Or which a_person is of you_all, whom the son of_him will_be_requesting a_loaf, not will_be_handing_out a_stone to_him.
   10 Or also will_be_requesting a_fish, not will_be_handing_out a_serpent to_him.
   11 Therefore if you_all being evil, have_known to_be_giving good gifts to_the children of_you_all, to_how_much more the father of_you_all who is in the heavens will_be_giving good things to_the ones requesting him.
   12 Therefore all things, if as_many_as you_all_may_be_wanting that the people may_be_doing to_you_all, thus you_all also be_doing to_them.
   For this is the law and the prophets.
   13 Come_in through the narrow gate, because the gate is wide and the way is broad leading_away to destruction, and many are the ones coming_in through it, 14 how narrow is the gate and the way leading_away to life having_been_narrowed is, and few are the ones finding it.
   15 Be_taking_heed of the false_prophets, who are_coming to you_all in clothing of_sheep, but inside they_are swindling wolves.
   16 You_all_will_be_knowing them by the fruits of_them.
   Surely_not they_are_gathering grapes from thorns, or figs from thistles.
   17 Thus every good tree is_producing good fruits, but the bad tree is_producing evil fruits.
   18 A_ good _tree is_ not _able to_bear evil fruits, nor a_ bad _tree to_be_producing good fruits.
   19 Every tree not producing good fruit is_being_cut_off and is_being_throw into fire.
   20 Consequently surely you_all_will_be_knowing them by the fruits of_them.
   21 Not everyone saying to_me: master, master, will_be_coming_in into the kingdom of_the heavens, but the one doing the will of_the father of_me who is in the heavens.
   22 Many will_be_saying to_me on that day: master, master, not we_prophesied in_your name, and we_throw_out demons in_your name, and many in_your name miracles we_did.
   23 And then I_will_be_confessing to_them, I_ never _knew you_all: be_going_away from me, you_all working lawlessness.
   24 Therefore everyone whoever is_hearing these words of_me and is_doing them, they_will_be_being_likened to_a_ prudent _man, who built the house of_him on the rock.
   25 And the rain came_down, and the floods came, and the winds blew, and they_fell_against to_ that _house, and it_ not _fell, for it_had_been_established on the rock.
   26 And everyone hearing these words of_me and not doing them, will_be_being_likened to_a_ foolish _man, who built the house of_him on the sand.
   27 And the rain came_down, and the floods came, and the winds blew, and they_struck against_ that _house, and it_fell and the fall of_it was great.
   28 And it_became, when G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G finished these words, the crowds were_being_astonished, at the teaching of_him, 29 for he_was teaching them as having authority, and not as the scribes of_them.
  Mat 8  And him having_come_down from the mountain, great crowds followed after_him.
   2 And see, a_leper having_approached, was_kneeling to_him saying: master, if you_may_be_willing, you_are_being_able to_cleanse me.
   3 And having_stretched_out his hand, he_touched against_him saying: I_am_willing, be_cleansed.
   And immediately of_leprosy of_him was_cleansed.
   4 And G‹H‹Yēsous is_saying to_him: Be_seeing you_may_tell to_no_one, but be_going yourself, show to_the priest, and offer the gift which G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G commanded, for a_testimony to_them.
   5 And having_come_in of_him into G‹Kafarna'oum›G, a_centurion approached to_him imploring him 6 and saying, master, the paralytic servant of_me has_been_laid in the house, being_tormented terribly.
   7 And he_is_saying to_him: I having_come, will_be_healing him.
   8 And the centurion answering was_saying: master, I_am not worthy that you_may_come_in under the roof of_me, but only speak by_the_word and the servant of_me will_be_being_healed.
   9 For I also am a_man being_appointed under authority, having soldiers under myself, and I_am_saying to_this one: Be_gone, and he_is_going, and to_another: Be_coming, and he_is_coming, and to_the slave of_me: Do this, and he_is_doing it.
   10 And G‹H‹Yēsous having_heard, Rx-marvelled-Rx and said to_the ones following: Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all, I_found so_much faith from no_one in Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx.
   11 And I_am_saying to_you_all that many from east and west will_be_coming and will_be_being_reclined with G‹H‹Abra'am/('Avərāhām)›H›G, and G‹H‹Isa'ak/(Yiʦəḩāq)›H›G, and G‹H‹Yakōb/(Ya'aqov)›H›G, in the kingdom of_the heavens, 12 but the sons of_the kingdom will_be_being_throw_out into the the outer darkness, there will_be weeping and grating of_teeth.
   13 And G‹H‹Yēsous said to_the centurion: Be_going, let_it_be_become with_you as you_believed.
   And the servant was_healed in that hour.
   14 And G‹H‹Yēsous having_come to the house of_G‹Petros›G, he_saw the mother_in_law of_him having_been_laid and being_feverish, 15 and he_touched against_the hand of_her, and the fever left her, and she_was_raised, and was_serving unto_him.
   16 And having_become evening, they_brought many to_him being_demon_possessed, and he_throw_out the spirits by_a_word, and he_healed all the ones being sickly, 17 so_that the word may_be_fulfilled having_been_spoken by G‹H‹Ēsaias/(Yəsha'əyāh)›H›G the prophet saying: himself took the sicknesses of_us and bore the diseases.
   18 And G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G having_seen crowd around him, he_commanded them to_go_away to the side across.
   19 And one scribe having_approached, said to_him: Teacher, I_will_be_following after_you wherever you_may_be_going_away.
   20 And G‹H‹Yēsous is_saying to_him: foxes are_having burrows and birds of_the sky nests, but the_son of_Man is_having no where he_may_be_laying his head.
   21 And another of_the apprentices/followers said to_him: master, permit to_me first to_go_away and to_bury the father of_me.
   22 But G‹H‹Yēsous is_saying to_him: Be_following after_me and leave the dead to_bury dead by_themselves.
   23 And the apprentices/followers of_him having_boarded with_him into the_boat, followed after_him.
   24 And see, a_ great _storm became in the sea, so_that the boat to_be_being_covered by the waves, but he was_sleeping.
   25 And having_approached, they_raised him saying: master, save us, we_are_perishing.
   26 And he_is_saying to_them: Why are_you_all fearful, little_faith ones.
   Then having_been_raised, he_gave_rebuke to_the winds and the sea, and a_ great _calm became.
   27 And the people Rx-marvelled-Rx saying: What_kind_of man is this, that both the winds and the sea are_submitting to_him.
   28 And him having_come to the side across to the region of_the G‹Gadarēnos›G, two being_demon_possessed met with_him coming_out out_of the tombs, exceedingly dangerous so_that not anyone to_be_was_able to_pass_by by that way.
   29 And see, they_cried_out saying: What to_us and to_you, son of_god.
   You_came here to_torment us before the_time.
   30 And a_herd of_ many _pigs was far from them being_fed.
   31 And the demons were_imploring him saying: If you_are_throwing_ us _out, send_ us _out into the herd of_pigs.
   32 And he_said to_them: Be_going.
   And having_come_out they_went_away into the pigs, and see, all the herd rushed down the steep_bank into the sea, and they_died_off in the waters.
   33 And the ones feeding them fled, and having_gone_away into the city, they_reported all things and the things of_the ones being_demon_possessed.
   34 And see, all the city came_out to a_meeting with_G‹H‹Yēsous, and having_seen him, they_implored him that he_may_depart from the regions of_them.
  Mat 9  And having_boarded into a_boat, he_crossed_over and came to his own city.
   2 And see, they_were_bringing a_paralytic to_him on a_bed having_been_laid.
   And G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G having_seen the faith of_them, he_said to_the paralytic: Be_having_courage, child, the sins of_you are_being_forgiven.
   3 And see, some of_the scribes said among themselves: This man is_slandering.
   4 And G‹H‹Yēsous having_seen the thoughts of_them said: for_ Why _reason are_you_all_considering evil in the hearts of_you_all.
   5 For which is easier to_say: The sins of_you /Are_being_forgiven, or to_say: Be_raising and be_walking.
   6 But in_order_that you_all_may_have_known that the son of_Man is_having authority on the earth to_be_forgiving sins (then he_is_saying to_the paralytic): Having_been_raised, take_up the bed of_you and be_going to the house of_you.
   7 And having_been_raised, he_went_away to the house of_him.
   8 But having_seen this, the crowds were_afraid and they_glorified god, who having_given such authority to_humans.
   9 And G‹H‹Yēsous passing_by from_there, he_saw a_man being_called G‹Matthaios›G sitting at the tax_office, and he_is_saying to_him.
   Be_following after_me.
   And having_risen_up, he_followed after_him.
   10 And it_became of_him reclining in the house, and see, many tax_collectors and sinners having_come were_reclining with_G‹H‹Yēsous and the apprentices/followers of_him.
   11 And having_seen it, the G‹Farisaios_sect›G were_saying to_the apprentices/followers of_him: for_ Why _reason is_ the teacher of_you_all _eating with the tax_collectors and sinners.
   12 And he having_heard said: The ones being_strong are_ not _having need of_a_physician, but the ones being sickly.
   13 But having_been_gone, learn what is this: I_am_wanting mercy and not sacrifice, for I_came not to_call the_righteous ones, but sinners.
   14 Then the apprentices/followers of_G‹Yōannēs›G are_approaching to_him saying: for_ Why _reason we and the G‹Farisaios_sect›G are_fasting, but the apprentices/followers of_you are_ not _fasting.
   15 And G‹H‹Yēsous said to_them: The sons of_the bridal_chamber Are_ not _being_able to_be_mourning, for as_long_as the bridegroom is with them.
   But days will_be_coming whenever the bridegroom may_be_taken_away from them, and then they_will_be_fasting.
   16 But no_one is_putting_on a_patch of_ unshrunken _cloth on a_ old _garment, for is_tearing_away the patch of_it from the garment, and a_worse tear is_becoming.
   17 Nor they_are_putting new wine into old wineskins, and if not surely, the wineskins are_being_burst, and the wine is_being_poured_out and the wineskins are_being_destroyed.
   But they_are_putting new wine into new wineskins, and both are_being_preserved.
   18 of_him speaking These things to_them, see, one ruler having_approached, he_was_kneeling to_him saying, The daughter of_me now died, but having_come lay_on the hand of_you on her and she_will_be_living.
   19 And G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G having_been_raised, followed after_him and the apprentices/followers of_him.
   20 And see, a_woman hemorrhaging twelve years having_approached behind, she_touched against_the fringe of_the garment of_him.
   21 For she_was_saying in herself: If only I_may_touch against_the garment of_him, I_will_be_being_healed.
   22 But G‹H‹Yēsous having_been_turned and having_seen her said: Be_having_courage, daughter, the faith of_you has_healed you.
   And the woman was_healed from that hour.
   23 And G‹H‹Yēsous having_come into the house of_the ruler, and having_seen the flute_players and the crowd being_distressed 24 he_was_saying: Be_withdrawing, for the little_girl not died_off, but she_is_sleeping.
   And they_were_ridiculing of_him.
   25 But when the crowd was_throw_out, having_come_in he_took_hold of_the hand of_her, and the little_girl was_raised.
   26 And this news came_out into all the that land.
   27 And passing_by from_there with_G‹H‹Yēsous, two blind men followed after_him crying_out and saying: Show_mercy to_us, son of_G‹H‹Dauid/(Dāvid)›H›G.
   28 And having_come into the house, the blind men approached to_him, and G‹H‹Yēsous is_saying to_them: You_all_are_believing that I_am_being_able to_do this.
   They_are_saying to_him: Yes, master.
   29 Then he_touched against_the eyes of_them saying: According_to the faith of_you_all let_it_be_become to_you_all.
   30 And the eyes of_them were_opened_up.
   And G‹H‹Yēsous was_admonished to_them saying: Be_seeing that let_ no_one _be_knowing.
   31 But the ones having_come_out, they_spread_ him _abroad in all that land.
   32 And them coming_out, see, they_brought to_him mute being_demon_possessed.
   33 And the demon having_been_throw_out, the mute man spoke.
   And the crowds Rx-marvelled-Rx saying: It_was_ never _seen thus in Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx.
   34 But the G‹Farisaios_sect›G were_saying: He_is_throwing_out demons by the ruler of_the demons.
   35 And G‹H‹Yēsous was_going_around all the cities and the villages, teaching in the synagogues of_them, and proclaiming the gospel of_the kingdom, and healing every disease and every sickness.
   36 And having_seen the crowds, he_was_feeling_compassion for them, because they_were having_been_troubled and having_been_helpless, as_if sheep not having a_shepherd.
   37 Then he_is_saying to_the apprentices/followers of_him: On_one_hand the harvest is great, on_the_other_hand the workers are few, 38 therefore be_besought of_the master of_the harvest, so_that he_may_send_forth workers into the harvest of_him.
  Mat 10  And having_called_to the twelve apprentices/followers of_him, he_gave to_them authority over_ unclean _spirits, so_as to_be_throwing_ them _out and to_be_healing every disease and every sickness.
   2 And of_the_twelve ambassadors the names is these: first Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx being_called G‹Petros›G, and G‹Andreas›G the brother of_him, and G‹H‹Yakōbos/(Ya'aqov)›H›G the son of_G‹Zebedaios›G, and G‹Yōannēs›G the brother of_him, 3 Rx-G‹Filippos›G-Rx and G‹Bartholomaios›G, G‹Thōmas›G and G‹Matthaios›G the tax_collector, G‹H‹Yakōbos the son of_G‹Alfaios›G also was G‹Thaddaios›G, 4 Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx the G‹member_of_Kananitēs›G and G‹H‹Youdas/(Yəhūdāh)›H›G G‹Iskariōtēs›G, who also having_given_ him _over.
   5 G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G sent_out these twelve having_commanded to_them saying: You_all_may_ not _go_away into the_way of_the_pagans, and you_all_may_ not _come_in into city of_the_G‹H‹Samareitēs/(Shomərōn)›H›G, 6 but rather be_going to the having_lost sheep of_the_house of_Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx.
   7 And going be_proclaiming saying, the kingdom of_the heavens /Has/_neared.
   8 Be_healing ailing ones, be_raising the_dead, be_cleansing the_lepers, be_throwing_out demons, you_all_received undeservedly, give undeservedly.
   9 You_all_may_ neither _acquire gold, nor silver, nor copper in the belts of_you_all, 10 nor knapsack for the_way, nor two tunics, nor sandals, nor staff, for the worker is worthy of_the food of_him.
   11 and Into whatever city or village you_all_may_come_in, search_out who in it is worthy, and_ remain _there until you_all_may_come_out.
   12 And coming_in into the house, greet it.
   13 And if on_one_hand the house may_be worthy, let_ the peace of_you_all _come on it, on_the_other_hand if may_be not worthy, let_ the peace of_you_all _be_returned to you_all.
   14 And whoever may_ not _receive you_all, nor may_hear the words of_you_all, coming_out out of_the house or that city, shake_off the dust of_the feet of_you_all.
   15 Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all, it_will_be more_tolerable for_the_land of_G‹H‹Sodoma/(Şədom)›H›G and of_G‹H‹Gomorra/('Amorāh)›H›G on the_day of_judgment, than for_ that _city.
   16 See I am_sending_ you_all _out as sheep in the_midst of_wolves, therefore be_becoming shrewd as serpents and innocent as the doves.
   17 But be_taking_heed of people, for they_will_be_giving_ you_all _over into councils, and they_will_be_flogging you_all in the synagogues of_them, 18 and you_all_will_be_being_brought before and governors also kings on_account me, for a_testimony to_them and to_the pagans.
   19 But whenever they_may_give_ you_all _over, you_all_may_ not _worry how or what you_all_may_speak, for what you_all_may_speak will_be_being_given to_you_all in that hour.
   20 For you_all are not the ones speaking, but the spirit of_the father of_you_all speaking in you_all.
   21 And brother will_be_giving_over brother to death, and father child, and children will_be_rising_up against parents, and they_will_be_putting_ them _to_death.
   22 And you_all_will_be being_hated by all because_of the name of_me, but the one having_endured to the_end, this one will_be_being_saved.
   23 But whenever they_may_be_persecuting you_all in this city, be_fleeing to the next, for, truly I_am_saying to_you_all, by_no_means you_all_may_ not _finish the cities of_the Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx, until the son of_Man may_come.
   24 A_apprentice/follower is not above the teacher, nor a_slave above the master of_him.
   25 Sufficient it_is for_the apprentice/follower that he_may_become as the teacher of_him, and the slave as the master of_him.
   If they_called the home_owner G‹Be'elzeboul›G, to_how_much more the household of_him.
   26 Therefore not be_afraid of_them, for nothing is having_been_covered which will_ not _be_being_revealed, and hidden which will_ not _be_being_known.
   27 What I_am_telling to_you_all in the darkness, speak in the light, and what you_all_are_hearing in the ear, proclaim on the housetops.
   28 And not be_afraid of the ones killing_off the body, but not being_able to_kill_off the soul, but rather be_fearing the one being_able to_destroy both soul and body in G‹geenna›G.
   29 Not two sparrows is_being_sold for_an_G‹assarion_coin›G.
   And not one of them will_be_falling to the ground, apart_from the father of_you_all.
   30 But the hairs of_the head of_you_all also are all having_been_numbered.
   31 Therefore be_ not _fearing, you_all are_carrying_value than many sparrows.
   32 Therefore everyone who will_be_confessing in me before people, also_I will_be_confessing in him before the father of_me who is in the_heavens.
   33 But whoever may_disown me before people, also_I will_be_disowning him before the father of_me who is in the_heavens.
   34 Not you_all_may_think that I_came to_bring peace to the earth, I_came not to_bring peace, but a_sword.
   35 For I_came to_divide a_man against the father of_him, and a_daughter against the mother of_her, and a_daughter-in-law against the mother_in_law of_her 36 and enemies of_the person the household of_him.
   37 The one loving father or mother above me, is not worthy of_me, and the one loving son or daughter above me, is not worthy of_me.
   38 And who is_ not _taking the cross of_him and is_following after me, is not worthy of_me.
   39 The one having_found the life of_him will_be_losing it, and the one having_lost the life of_him on_account me will_be_finding it.
   40 The one receiving you_all is_receiving me, and the one receiving me is_receiving the one having_sent_ me _out.
   41 The one receiving a_prophet in name of_a_prophet, will_be_receiving the_reward of_a_prophet, and the one receiving a_righteous one in the_name of_a_righteous one, will_be_receiving the_reward of_a_righteous one.
   42 And whoever may_give_to_drink one of_these of_little ones a_cup of_cool water, only in the_name of_a_apprentice/follower, truly, I_am_saying to_you_all, by_no_means he_may_ not _lose the reward of_him.
  Mat 11  And it_became when G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G finished directing to_the twelve apprentices/followers of_him, he_departed from_there to_be_teaching and to_be_proclaiming in the cities of_them.
   2 And G‹Yōannēs›G, having_heard in the prison the works of_the chosen_one/messiah, having_sent through of_the apprentices/followers of_him, 3 said to_him: Are you the one coming, or are_we_waiting for_another.
   4 And G‹H‹Yēsous answering said to_them: Having_been_gone report to_G‹Yōannēs›G what you_all_are_hearing and you_all_are_seeing: 5 blind are_receiving_sight, and lame are_walking, lepers are_being_cleansed, and deaf are_hearing, and dead are_being_raised, and poor are_being_gospel_preached.
   6 And he_is blessed who may_ not _be_offended in me.
   7 And these going, G‹H‹Yēsous began to_be_saying to_the crowds concerning G‹Yōannēs›G, you_all_came_out into the desert to_see What.
   A_reed being_shaken by wind.
   8 But you_all_came_out to_see.
   what A_man having_been_dressed in fine clothes.
   See the ones wearing fine clothes in the houses of_the kings 9 but why you_all_came_out.
   To_see a_prophet.
   Yes, I_am_saying to_you_all, and more_important than a_prophet.
   10 This one is concerning whom it_has_been_written: see, I am_sending_out the messenger of_me before the_face of_you, who will_be_preparing the way of_you before you.
   11 Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all, not has_been_raised among the_born ones of_women greater than G‹Yōannēs›G the immerser.
   But the_least in the kingdom of_the heavens, is greater than he.
   12 And from the days of_G‹Yōannēs›G the immerser until now, the kingdom of_the heavens is_forcing, and forceful_men they_are_snatching it.
   13 For all the prophets and the law prophesied until G‹Yōannēs›G.
   14 And if you_all_are_willing to_receive it, he is G‹H‹Ēlias/('Ēliyyāh)›H›G, the one going to_be_coming.
   15 The one having ears to_be_hearing, let_him_be_hearing.
   16 But to_what I_will_be_likening this generation.
   It_is similar to_little_children sitting in the marketplaces, who calling_out to_the others 17 are_saying: We_played_the_flute for_you_all and you_all_ not _danced, we_lamented and you_all_ not _mourn.
   18 For G‹Yōannēs›G came neither eating nor drinking, and they_are_saying: He_is_having a_demon.
   19 the son of_Man Came eating and drinking, and they_are_saying: See a_man, a_glutton and a_drunkard, a_friend of_tax_collectors and of_sinners.
   But wisdom was_justified by the her children.
   20 Then he_began to_be_deriding the cities in which the most miracles of_him became, because they_ not _repented.
   21 Woe to_you, G‹Ⱪorazin›G.
   Woe to_you, G‹Bēthsaida›G.
   Because if the miracles having_become in you_all became in G‹H‹Turos/(Tsor)›H›G and G‹H‹Sidōn/(Tsīdōn)›H›G, long_ago they_ would _repented in sackcloth and ashes.
   22 However I_am_saying to_you_all, it_will_be more_tolerable for_G‹H‹Turos and G‹H‹Sidōn in day of_judgment than for_you_all.
   23 Also you, G‹Kafarna'oum›G, will_ not _be_being_exalted to heaven.
   You_will_be_coming_down to G‹Hadēs›G.
   Because if the miracles which having_become in you, were_become in G‹H‹Sodoma/(Şədom)›H›G, would remained until the day today.
   24 However I_am_saying to_you_all that it_will_be more_tolerable for_the_land of_G‹H‹Sodoma in day of_judgment than for_you.
   25 At that time G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G answering said: I_am_confessing to_you, father, master of_the heaven and the earth, that you_hid these things from wise and intelligent, and you_revealed them to_infants.
   26 Yes, father, because thus it_became good_pleasure before you.
   27 All things was_given_over to_me by the father of_me, and no_one is_knowing_fully the son, except the father, nor anyone is_knowing_fully the father, except the son, and to_whom if the son may_be_wishing to_reveal him.
   28 Come to me, all you_all wearied and having_been_burdened, and_I will_be_resting you_all.
   29 Take_up the yoke of_me on you_all, and learn from me, because I_am gentle and humble in_heart: and you_all_will_be_finding rest for_the souls of_you_all.
   30 For the yoke of_me is easy and the burden of_me is light.
  Mat 12  At that time, G‹H‹Yēsous was_gone on_the sabbaths through the grainfields, and the the_apprentices/followers of_him hungered, and began to_be_plucking heads_of_grain and to_be_eating.
   2 And the G‹Farisaios_sect›G having_seen, said to_him: See the apprentices/followers of_you are_doing what it_is_ not _permitting to_be_doing on the_sabbath.
   3 But he said to_them: Not you_all_read what G‹H‹Dauid/(Dāvid)›H›G did, when he_hungered and the ones with him.
   4 How he_came_in into the house of_god, and they_ate the bread of_the presence, which it_was not permitting for_him to_eat, nor for_the ones with him, except only for_the priests.
   5 Or you_all_ not _read in the law that on_the sabbaths the priests in the temple are_profaning the sabbath, and they_are innocent.
   6 But I_am_saying to_you_all that one greater than the temple is here.
   7 But if you_all_had_known what this is: I_am_wanting mercy and not sacrifice, you_all_ would not _convicted the innocent.
   8 For the son of_Man is master of_the sabbath.
   9 And having_departed from_there, he_came into the synagogue of_them.
   10 And see, a_man having a_ withered _hand.
   And they_asked him saying: is_it_permitting to_be_healing on_the sabbaths.
   In_order_that they_may_accuse against_him.
   11 And he said to_them: What person will_be of you_all, who will_be_having one sheep, and if this may_fall_in into a_pit on_the sabbaths, will_ not _be_taking_hold_of it and will_be_raising it.
   12 For_how_much therefore a_human is_carrying_value than a_sheep.
   So_then it_is_permitting to_be_doing good on_the sabbaths.
   13 Then he_is_saying to_the man: Stretch_out the hand of_you.
   And he_stretched_out it, and it_was_restored, healthy as the other.
   14 But, the G‹Farisaios_sect›G having_come_out received a_counsel against him, so_that they_may_destroy him.
   15 But G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G having_known, withdrew from_there.
   And a_great many followed after_him, and he_healed them all, 16 and he_warned to_them that they_may_ not _make him manifest.
   17 In_order_that the word may_be_fulfilled having_been_spoken by G‹H‹Ēsaias/(Yəsha'əyāh)›H›G the prophet saying, 18 see, the servant of_me whom I_chose, the beloved of_me whom the soul of_me took_pleasure.
   I_will_be_putting the spirit of_me on him, and he_will_be_reporting justice to_the pagans.
   19 He will_ not _be_Rx-quarrelling-Rx, nor will_be_crying_out, nor will_ anyone _be_hearing the voice of_him in the roads.
   20 By_no_means he_will_be_breaking a_reed having_been_bruised, and by_no_means he_will_be_extinguishing a_wick being_smoldering, until he_may_send_forth justice to victory.
   21 And the_pagans will_be_hoping in_the name of_him.
   22 Then a_being_demon_possessed man was_brought to_him, blind and mute, and he_healed him, so_that the mute man to_be_speaking and to_be_seeing.
   23 And all the crowds were_Rx-marvelling-Rx and were_saying: Surely_not this one is the son of_G‹H‹Dauid/(Dāvid)›H›G.
   24 And the G‹Farisaios_sect›G having_heard said: This man is_ not _throwing_out demons, except by G‹Be'elzeboul›G, ruler of_the demons.
   25 And having_known the thoughts of_them, he_said to_them: Every kingdom having_been_divided against itself is_being_desolated, and every city or house having_been_divided against itself will_ not _be_being_stood.
   26 And if G‹H‹Satan/(Sāţān)›H›G is_throwing_out G‹H‹Satan, he_was_divided against himself.
   Therefore how will_ the kingdom of_him _be_being_established.
   27 And if I am_throwing_out demons by G‹Be'elzeboul›G, the sons of_you_all by whom are_they_throwing_out.
   Because_of this, they will_be judges of_you_all.
   28 But if by the_spirit of_god I am_throwing_out demons, consequently the kingdom of_god came on you_all.
   29 Or how is_able anyone to_come_in into the house of_the strong man and to_snatch the goods of_him, if not first he_may_bind the strong man.
   And then he_will_be_thoroughly_plundering the household of_him.
   30 The one not being with me is against me, and the one not gathering_together with me is_scattering.
   31 Because_of this I_am_saying to_you_all, every sin and slander will_be_being_forgiven to_the people, but the slander of_the spirit will_ not _be_being_forgiven.
   32 And if whoever may_speak a_word against the son of_Man, it_will_be_being_forgiven to_him, but whoever may_speak against the holy spirit, it will_ not _be_being_forgiven to_him, neither in this the age nor in the one coming.
   33 Either make the tree good and the fruit of_it good, or make the tree bad and the fruit of_it bad, for the tree is_being_known by the fruit.
   34 Brood of_vipers, being evil how you_all_are_being_able to_be_speaking good things.
   For the mouth is_speaking out_of the excess of_the heart.
   35 The good person is_sending_forth good out_of his good treasure, and the evil person is_sending_forth evil out_of his evil treasure.
   36 But I_am_saying to_you_all that every idle word that the people will_be_speaking, they_will_be_giving_back an_account for it in day of_judgment.
   37 For by the words of_you you_will_be_being_justified, and by the words of_you you_will_be_being_convicted.
   38 Then some of_the scribes and G‹Farisaios_sect›G answered to_him saying: Teacher, we_are_wanting to_see a_sign from you.
   39 But he answering said to_them, a_ evil and adulterous _generation is_seeking_after a_sign, and a_sign will_ not _be_being_given to_it, except the sign of_G‹H‹Yōnas/(Yōnāh)›H›G the prophet.
   40 For as G‹H‹Yōnas was in the belly of_the three huge_fish three days and nights, thus the son of_Man will_be of_the days and three nights in the heart three earth.
   41 The_ G‹H‹Nineuitēs/(ones_from_Nīnəvēh)›H›G _men will_be_standing_up in the judgment with the this generation, and they_will_be_condemning it, because they_repented at the proclamation of_G‹H‹Yōnas, and see, one_greater than G‹H‹Yōnas is here.
   42 The_queen of_the_south will_be_being_raised in the judgment with the this generation, and will_be_condemning it, because she_came from the ends of_the earth to_hear the wisdom of_G‹H‹Solomōn/(Shəlmoh)›H›G, and see, one_greater than G‹H‹Solomōn is here.
   43 And whenever the unclean spirit may_come_out from the person, it_is_passing_through through waterless places seeking rest and it_is_ not _finding.
   44 Then it_is_saying, I_will_be_turning_back to the house of_me whence I_came_out.
   And having_come, it_is_finding being_unoccupied having_been_swept and having_been_adorned.
   45 Then it_is_going and is_taking with itself seven other spirits more_evil than itself, and having_come_in it_is_dwelling there, and the last state of_the_ that _person is_becoming worse than the first.
   Thus it_will_be also to_ this evil _generation.
   46 him still speaking to_the crowds, see, the mother and the brothers of_him had_stood outside, seeking to_speak to_him.
   47 And someone said to_him: See the mother of_you and the brothers of_you have_stood outside seeking to_speak to_you.
   48 But he answering said to_the one speaking to_him: Who is the mother of_me and who_all are the brothers of_me.
   49 And having_stretched_out the hand of_him to the apprentices/followers of_him he_said: See the mother of_me and the brothers of_me.
   50 For whoever may_do the will of_the father of_me who is in the_heavens, he is brother, and sister, and mother of_me.
  Mat 13  in that day, G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G having_come_out from_the house, was_sitting by the sea.
   2 And great crowds were_gathered_together to him, so_that him having_boarded into a_boat to_be_sitting, and all the crowd had_stood on the shore.
   3 And he_spoke many things to_them in parables saying: See the one sowing came_out of_the time to_sow.
   4 And in the time to_be_sowing of_him, some on_one_hand fell along the road, and the birds came and devoured them.
   5 On_the_other_hand others fell on the rocky places, where it_was_ not _having much soil, and immediately it_sprang_up because_of the not to_be_having depth of_soil, 6 but the_sun having_risen, it_was_scorched and because_of that to_be_ not _having root it_was_withered.
   7 On_the_other_hand others fell on the thorns, and the thorns went_up and choked_ them _out.
   8 On_the_other_hand others fell on the good soil, and was_giving fruit, some on_one_hand a_hundred, on_the_other_hand some sixty, on_the_other_hand some thirty.
   9 The one having ears, let_him_be_hearing.
   10 And the apprentices/followers having_approached said to_him: for_ Why _reason you_are_speaking to_them in parables.
   11 And he answering said to_them: Because to_you_all has_been_given to_know the mysteries of_the kingdom of_the heavens, but to_those it_has_ not _been_given.
   12 For whoever is_having, will_be_being_given to_him and he_will_be_being_in_abundance, but whoever is_ not _having, even what he_is_having will_be_being_taken_away from him.
   13 Because_of this I_am_speaking in parables to_them, because seeing they_are_ not _seeing, and hearing they_are_ not _hearing, nor are_they_understanding.
   14 And the prophecy of_G‹H‹Ēsaias/(Yəsha'əyāh)›H›G is_being_fulfilled to_them saying: with_hearing you_all_will_be_hearing but by_no_means you_all_may_ not _understand, and seeing you_all_will_be_seeing but by_no_means you_all_may_ not _perceive.
   15 For the heart of_ this _people was_become_dull, and they_ hardly _heard with_the ears, and they_shut the eyes of_them, lest they_may_see with_the eyes, and they_may_hear with_the ears, and they_may_understand with_the heart, and they_may_return and I_will_be_healing them.
   16 But blessed are the eyes of_you_all because they_are_seeing, and the ears of_you_all because they_are_hearing.
   17 For, truly I_am_saying to_you_all that many prophets and righteous men desired to_see what you_all_are_seeing, and they_ not _saw, and to_hear what you_all_are_hearing, and they_ not _heard.
   18 Therefore you_all hear the parable of_the one having_sown.
   19 Everyone hearing the word of_the kingdom and not understanding, the evil one is_coming and is_snatching the one having_been_sown in the heart of_him.
   This is the one having_been_sown by the road.
   20 And the one having_been_sown on the rocky, this is the one hearing the word and immediately receiving it with joy, 21 and is_having no root in himself, but is temporary, but tribulation or persecution having_become because_of the word, immediately he_is_being_stumbled.
   22 And the one having_been_sown among the thorns, this is the one hearing the word, and the worry of_age and the seduction of_riches is_choking the word, and it_is_becoming unfruitful.
   23 And the one having_been_sown on the good soil, this is the one hearing the word and understanding, who indeed is_bearing_fruit and is_producing, some on_one_hand a_hundred, on_the_other_hand some sixty, on_the_other_hand some thirty.
   24 He_set_before to_them another parable saying, the kingdom of_the heavens /Was/_likened, to_a_man having_sown good seed in the field of_him.
   25 But at the time the people to_be_sleeping, the enemy of_him came and sowed darnels among midst of_the wheat and went_away.
   26 But when the grass sprouted and produced fruit, then the darnels was_seen also.
   27 And the slaves of_the home_owner having_approached said to_him: Master, you_ not _sowed good seed in your field.
   Therefore from_where it_is_having darnels.
   28 And he was_saying to_them: An_enemy man did this.
   And the slaves are_saying to_him: Therefore you_are_wanting having_gone_away, may_we_gather them.
   29 But he is_saying: No, lest gathering the darnels, you_all_may_uproot the wheat together_with them.
   30 Allow both to_be_being_grown_together until the harvest, and in the_time of_the harvest I_will_be_saying to_the harvesters: Gather first the darnels and bind them into bundles in_order that to_burn_up them, and gather_together the wheat into the barn of_me.
   31 Another parable he_set_before to_them saying, the kingdom of_the heavens is Similar to_a_seed of_mustard, which a_man having_taken sowed in the field of_him, 32 which on_one_hand it_is smaller of_all the seeds, on_the_other_hand whenever it_may_be_grown is greater than the garden_plants and is_becoming a_tree, so_that the birds of_the sky to_come and to_be_nesting in the branches of_it.
   33 Another parable he_spoke to_them: the kingdom of_the heavens is Similar to_leaven, which a_woman having_taken, hid_in in three satons of_wheat_flour, until of_which all was_leavened.
   34 G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G all these things spoke in parables to_the crowds, and he_was_speaking nothing to_them without a_parable, 35 so_that the word may_be_fulfilled having_been_spoken by the prophet saying: I_will_be_opening_up the mouth of_me in parables, I_will_be_uttering things having_been_hidden from the_foundation of_the_world.
   36 Then having_left the crowds, he_came into the house.
   And the apprentices/followers of_him approached to_him saying: Explain to_us the parable of_the darnels of_the field.
   37 And he answering said: The one sowing the good seed is the son of_Man, 38 and the field is the world, and the good seed, these are the sons of_the kingdom, and the darnels are the sons of_the evil one, 39 and the enemy is, the one having_sown them, is the devil, and the harvest is the_completion of_the_age, and the harvesters are angels.
   40 Therefore as the darnels is_being_gathered and is_being_burned_up in_fire, thus it_will_be in the completion of_the age.
   41 The son of_Man will_be_sending_out the angels of_him, and they_will_be_gathering out_of the kingdom of_him all the temptations and the ones practicing lawlessness, 42 and they_will_be_throwing them into the furnace of_the fire, there will_be weeping and grating of_teeth.
   43 Then the righteous will_be_shining_forth as the sun in the kingdom of_the father of_them.
   The one having ears, let_him_be_hearing.
   44 the kingdom of_the heavens is Similar to_treasure having_been_hidden in the field, which a_man having_found hid, and from the joy of_it is_going and is_selling all as_much_as he_is_having, and is_buying that field.
   45 Again the kingdom of_the heavens is similar to_a_ merchant _man seeking beautiful pearls, 46 and having_found one precious pearl having_gone_away, he_has_sold all things as_many_as he_was_having, and bought it.
   47 Again the kingdom of_the heavens is similar to_a_dragnet having_been_throw into the sea and having_gathered_together of every kind, 48 which when it_was_filled, having_pulled_up on the shore and having_sat_down, they_gathered the good into containers, and the bad they_throw.
   out.
   49 Thus it_will_be in the completion of_the age, the angels will_be_coming_out, and will_be_setting_apart the evil from the_midst of_the righteous, 50 and they_will_be_throwing them into the furnace of_the fire.
   There will_be weeping and grating of_teeth.
   51 You_all_understood all these things.
   They_are_saying to_him: Yes.
   52 And he said to_them: Because_of this, every scribe having_been_apprentice/followerd in_the kingdom of_the heavens is similar to_a_man, a_home_owner, who is_sending_forth new things and old things out_of the treasure of_him.
   53 And it_became when G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G finished these parables, he_withdrew from_there.
   54 And having_come into the hometown of_him, he_was_teaching them in the synagogue of_them, so_that them to_be_being_astonished and to_be_saying: From_where to_this man this wisdom and the miracles received.
   55 Is this not the son of_the carpenter.
   Not the mother of_him is_being_called G‹H‹Maria/(Mirəyām)›H›G, and the brothers of_him, G‹H‹Yakōbos/(Ya'aqov)›H›G, and G‹H‹Yōsēf/(Yōşēf)›H›G, and Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx, and G‹H‹Youdas/(Yəhūdāh)›H›G.
   56 And are not the sisters of_him all with us.
   Therefore from_where to_this man these things all received.
   57 And they_were_being_offended at him.
   But G‹H‹Yēsous said to_them: A_prophet is not dishonorable, except in the hometown and in the house of_him.
   58 And he_ not _did many miracles there, because_of the unbelief of_them.
  Mat 14  That at time Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx the quarter_ruler heard the report of_G‹H‹Yēsous, 2 and he_said to_the servants of_him: This is G‹Yōannēs›G the immerser, he was_raised from the dead, and because_of this the miracles are_working in him.
   3 For Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx having_apprehended G‹Yōannēs›G, bound him and put_away him in prison, because_of G‹Hērōidias›G, the wife of_Rx-G‹Filippos›G-Rx, the brother of_him.
   4 For G‹Yōannēs›G was_saying, to_him It_is_ not _permitting for_you to_be_having her.
   5 And wanting to_kill_ him _off, he_was_afraid the crowd, because they_were_having him as a_prophet.
   6 But for_the_birthday_celebrations of_Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx having_become, the daughter of_G‹Hērōidias›G danced in the midst and brought_pleasure to_Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx, 7 whence with an_oath, he_promised to_give to_her whatever she_may_request.
   8 And having_been_urged_on by the mother of_her: Give to_me, she_is_saying: here on a_platter, the head of_G‹Yōannēs›G the immerser.
   9 And the king was_sorrowed but because_of the oaths and the ones reclining, he_commanded it to_be_given.
   10 And having_sent, he_beheaded G‹Yōannēs›G in the prison.
   11 And the head of_him was_brought on a_platter, and it_was_given to_the little_girl, and she_brought it to_the mother of_her.
   12 And having_approached, the apprentices/followers of_him took_away the corpse and buried him, and having_come, they_reported to_G‹H‹Yēsous.
   13 And G‹H‹Yēsous having_heard, withdrew from_there by boat to a_desolate place by himself.
   And having_heard it, the crowds followed after_him on_foot from the cities.
   14 And having_come_out, he_saw a_ great _crowd, and he_was_feeling_compassion to them and healed the sick of_them.
   15 And evening having_become, the apprentices/followers approached to_him saying: The place is desolate and the hour already passed_by, send_away the crowds, in_order_that having_gone_away into the villages, they_may_buy foods for_themselves.
   16 But G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G said to_them: They_are_having no need to_go_away.
   You_all give something to_them to_eat.
   17 And they are_saying to_him: We_are_ not _having anything here, except five loaves and two fishes.
   18 And he said: Be_bringing them here to_me.
   19 And having_commanded the crowds to_be_sat_down on the grass, and having_taken the five loaves and the two fishes, having_looked_up to the sky, he_blessed and having_broke, gave the loaves to_the apprentices/followers, and the apprentices/followers to_the crowds.
   20 And all ate and were_satisfied, and they_took_up the part being_leftover of_the fragments twelve, baskets full.
   21 And the ones eating were about five_thousand men, apart_from women and little_children.
   22 And immediately he_compelled the apprentices/followers to_board into the boat, and to_be_going_before him to the side across, until of_which he_may_send_away the crowds.
   23 And having_sent_away the crowds, he_went_up on the mountain by himself to_pray.
   And evening having_become, he_was the_only one there.
   24 And the boat was now the_midst the of_the_sea, being_tormented by the waves, for the wind was contrary.
   25 And in_the_fourth watch of_the night, he_came to them walking on the sea.
   26 And the apprentices/followers having_seen, him walking on the sea, were_disturbed saying, It_is a_ghost, and they_cried_out in fear.
   27 But immediately G‹H‹Yēsous spoke to_them saying: Be_having_courage, I am here, be_ not _fearing.
   28 And G‹Petros›G answering to_him, said: master, if you are, command me to_come to you on the waters.
   29 And he said: Come.
   And G‹Petros›G having_come_down from the boat, walked on the waters and came to G‹H‹Yēsous.
   30 But seeing the mighty wind, he_was_afraid and having_begun to_be_being_sunk, he_cried_out saying: master, save me.
   31 And immediately G‹H‹Yēsous having_stretched_out his hand, took_hold of_him and is_saying to_him: Little_faith one, for why you_doubted.
   32 And of_them having_gone_up into the boat, the wind died_down.
   33 And the ones in the boat worshipped before_him saying: Truly you_are the_son of_god.
   34 And having_crossed_over, they_came to the land to Gennesaret.
   35 And having_recognized him, the men of_ that _place sent_out to all that surrounding_region, and brought to_him all the ones being sickly, 36 and they_were_begging him that they_may_ only _touch against_the fringe of_the garment of_him, and as_many_as touched were_cured.
  Mat 15  Then G‹Farisaios_sect›G and scribes from G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G are_approaching to_G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, saying, 2 for_ Why _reason the apprentices/followers of_you are_breaking_from the tradition of_the elders.
   For they_are_ not _washing their hands whenever they_may_be_eating bread.
   3 And he answering said to_them: for_ Why _reason also you_all are_breaking_from the commandment of_god because_of the tradition of_you_all.
   4 For god commanded saying: be_honoring the father and the mother, and: the one speaking_evil of_father or mother, let_be_dying in_death.
   5 But you_all are_saying: Whoever may_say to_the father or the mother, whatever you_may_be_benefited by me: A_gift, 6 by_no_means he will_ not _be_honoring the father of_him.
   And you_all_annulled the word of_god because_of the tradition of_you_all.
   7 Hypocrites.
   G‹H‹Ēsaias/(Yəsha'əyāh)›H›G rightly prophesied concerning you_all saying, 8 this people is_honoring me the lips, and the heart of_them is_being_away far_away from me.
   9 And they_are_worshipping me uselessly, teaching teachings as_the_commandments of_humans.
   10 And having_called_to the crowd, he_said to_them: Be_hearing and be_understanding.
   11 Not the thing coming_in into the mouth is_defiling the person, but the thing going_out out_of the mouth, this is_defiling the person.
   12 Then the apprentices/followers having_approached are_saying to_him: You_have_known that the G‹Farisaios_sect›G having_heard the statement were_offended.
   13 But he answering said: Every plant that the the heavenly father of_me not planted will_be_being_uprooted.
   14 Leave them, they_are blind guides and, if blind may_be_guiding blind, both will_be_falling into a_pit.
   15 And G‹Petros›G answering said to_him: Interpret the parable to_us.
   16 And he said: Are you_all even still unintelligent.
   17 are_you_all_understanding Not_yet that everything entering_in into the mouth, is_entering into the stomach, and is_being_throw_out to the_latrine.
   18 But the things going_out out_of the mouth, is_coming_out out_of the heart, and_those is_defiling the person.
   19 For out_of the heart are_coming_out evil speculations, murders, adulteries, sexual_immorality, thefts, false_witnesses, slander.
   20 These is the things defiling the person, but the one to_eat with_unwashed hands, is_ not _defiling the person.
   21 And G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G having_come_out from_there, withdrew to the districts of_G‹H‹Turos/(Tsor)›H›G and G‹H‹Sidōn/(Tsīdōn)›H›G.
   22 And see, a_ G‹member_of_Kananitēs›G _woman having_come_out from the those regions, was_crying_out saying: Show_mercy to_me, master, son of_G‹H‹Dauid/(Dāvid)›H›G, the daughter of_me is_being_ sickly _demon_possessed.
   23 But he not answered a_word to_her.
   And the apprentices/followers of_him having_approached, were_asking him saying: send_ Her _away, because she_is_crying_out behind us.
   24 But he answering said: I_was_ not _sent_out except to the sheep having_lost of_the_house of_Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx.
   25 But she having_come was_kneeling to_him saying: master, be_giving_help to_me.
   26 And he answering said, it_is Not good to_take the bread of_the children and to_throw it to_the little_dogs.
   27 But she said: Yes, master, for even the little_dogs is_eating of the little_crumbs falling from the table of_the masters of_them.
   28 Then G‹H‹Yēsous answering said to_her: Rx-Oh-Rx woman, great is the faith of_you, let_it_be_become to_you as you_are_wanting.
   And the daughter of_her was_healed from that hour.
   29 And G‹H‹Yēsous having_departed from_there, came along the sea of_G‹H‹Galilaia/(Gālīl)›H›G, and having_gone_up on the mountain, he_was_sitting there.
   30 And great crowds approached to_him, having with themselves lame, maimed, blind, mute, and many others, and they_laid_ them _down before the feet of_him, and he_healed them, 31 so_that the crowds to_marvel, seeing mute speaking, maimed healthy, and lame walking, and blind seeing, and they_glorified the god of_Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx.
   32 And G‹H‹Yēsous having_called_to the apprentices/followers of_him said: I_am_feeling_compassion for the crowd, because already they_are_remaining with_me three days, and they_are_ not _having anything they_may_eat, and I_am_ not _willing to_send_away them hungry, lest they_may_be_exhausted on the way.
   33 And the apprentices/followers are_saying to_him: From_where to_us in a_desert, so_many loaves so_as to_satisfy so_much crowd.
   34 And G‹H‹Yēsous is_saying to_them: How_many loaves are_you_all_having.
   And they said: Seven, and a_few little_fishes.
   35 And having_commanded to_the crowd to_sit_down on the ground, 36 he_took the seven loaves and the fishes, and having_given_thanks he_broke them and was_giving them to_the apprentices/followers, and the apprentices/followers to_the crowds.
   37 And all ate and were_satisfied, and they_took_up seven fragments, the part being_leftover of_the, baskets full.
   38 And the ones eating were four_thousand men, apart_from women and little_children.
   39 And having_sent_away the crowds, he_boarded into the boat and came to the regions of_G‹Magadan›G.
  Mat 16  And the G‹Farisaios_sect›G and G‹Saddoukaios_sect›G having_approached, tempting him they_asked him for_a_sign out_of the sky to_show to_them.
   2 But he answering said to_them, 3  4 a_ evil and adulterous _generation is_seeking_after a_sign, and a_sign will_ not _be_being_given to_it, except the sign of_G‹H‹Yōnas/(Yōnāh)›H›G.
   And having_left them he_went_away.
   5 And the apprentices/followers having_come to the side across, they_forgot to_take loaves.
   6 And G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G said to_them: Be_watching and be_taking_heed of the leaven of_the G‹Farisaios_sect›G and G‹Saddoukaios_sect›G.
   7 And they were_reasoning among themselves saying, we_ not _took Loaves.
   8 But G‹H‹Yēsous having_known, said: Why are_you_all_reasoning among yourselves, little_faith ones, because you_all_are_ not _having loaves.
   9 You_all_are_ not_yet _understanding, neither are_you_all_remembering the five loaves of_the five_thousand, and how_many baskets you_all_took.
   10 Nor the seven loaves of_the four_thousand, and how_many baskets you_all_took.
   11 How you_all_are_ not _understanding that I_spoke to_you_all not concerning the_loaves.
   And be_taking_heed of the leaven of_the G‹Farisaios_sect›G and G‹Saddoukaios_sect›G.
   12 Then they_understood that he_ not _said to_be_taking_heed of the leaven of_the loaves, but of the teaching of_the G‹Farisaios_sect›G and G‹Saddoukaios_sect›G.
   13 And G‹H‹Yēsous having_come into the districts of_G‹Kaisareia›G Rx-G‹Filippou›G-Rx, was_asking the apprentices/followers of_him saying: Whom are_ the people _saying the son of_Man to_be.
   14 And they said: The ones on_one_hand G‹Yōannēs›G the immerser, on_the_other_hand others G‹H‹Ēlias/('Ēliyyāh)›H›G, on_the_other_hand others G‹H‹Yeremias/(Yirəməyāh)›H›G or one of_the prophets.
   15 He_is_saying to_them: But you_all, whom are_saying me to_be.
   16 And Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx G‹Petros›G answering said: You are the chosen_one/messiah, the son of_the living god.
   17 And G‹H‹Yēsous answering said to_him: You_are blessed, Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx Barjonah, because flesh and blood not it_revealed to_you, but the father of_me, who is in the heavens.
   18 And also_I am_saying to_you that you are G‹Petros›G, and on this rock I_will_be_building the assembly of_me, and the_gates of_G‹Hadēs›G will_ not _be_prevailing against_it.
   19 I_will_be_giving the keys of_the kingdom of_the heavens, to_you, and whatever you_may_bind on the earth, will_be having_been_bound in the heavens, and whatever you_may_untie/release on the earth, will_be having_been_untied/released in the heavens.
   20 Then he_instructed to_the apprentices/followers that they_may_say to_no_one that he is the chosen_one.
   21 From then G‹H‹Yēsous chosen_one began to_be_showing to_the apprentices/followers of_him that it_is_fitting him to_go_away to G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G, and to_suffer many things from the elders, and chief_priests, and scribes, and to_be_killed_off and on_the third day to_be_raised.
   22 And G‹Petros›G having_taken_aside him, he_began to_be_giving_rebuke to_him saying: Merciful be to_you, master, by_no_means this will_ not _be to_you.
   23 But he having_been_turned said to_G‹Petros›G: Be_going behind me, G‹H‹Satan/(Sāţān)›H›G.
   You_are a_temptation of_me, because you_are_ not _thinking the things of_god, but the things of_humans.
