   24 Then G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G said to_the apprentices/followers of_him: If anyone is_wanting to_come after me, him_let_renounce himself, and him_let_take_up the cross of_him, and him _let_be_following after_me.
   25 For whoever may_be_wanting to_save the life of_him, will_be_losing it, but whoever may_lose the life of_him on_account me, will_be_finding it.
   26 For what will_ a_person _be_being_benefited, if whole the world he_may_gain, but the soul of_him may_be_lost.
   Or what will_ a_person _be_giving as_an_exchange for_the soul of_him.
   27 For the son of_Man is_going to_be_coming in the glory of_the father of_him with the angels of_him, and then he_will_be_giving_back to_each according_to the practice of_him.
   28 Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all that are some of_the ones having_stood here who by_no_means may_ not _taste of_death, until they_may_see the son of_Man coming in the kingdom of_him.
  Mat 17  And after six days, G‹H‹Yēsous is_taking G‹Petros›G, and G‹H‹Yakōbos/(Ya'aqov)›H›G, and G‹Yōannēs›G, the brother of_him, and he_is_bringing_up them into a_ high _mountain by themselves.
   2 And he_was_transformed before them, and the face of_him shined as the sun, and the clothes of_him became white as the light.
   3 And see, G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G and G‹H‹Ēlias/('Ēliyyāh)›H›G was_seen to_them conversing_with with him.
   4 And G‹Petros›G answering, said to_G‹H‹Yēsous: master, it_is good us to_be here.
   If you_are_wanting, I_will_be_making three tents here, one for_you, and one for_G‹H‹Mōsēs, and one for_G‹H‹Ēlias.
   5 Him still speaking, see, a_ bright _cloud overshadowed them, and see, a_voice out_of the cloud saying: This is the son of_me, the beloved in whom I_took_pleasure, be_hearing from_him.
   6 And having_heard it, the apprentices/followers fell on face of_them and they_were_ exceedingly _afraid.
   7 And G‹H‹Yēsous approached and having_touched against_them he_said: Be_raised and be_ not _fearing.
   8 And having_lifted_up the eyes of_them, they_saw no_one except only G‹H‹Yēsous himself.
   9 And them coming_down from the mountain, G‹H‹Yēsous commanded to_them saying, you_all_may_tell the vision To_no_one, until of_which the son of_Man may_rise_up from the_dead.
   10 And the apprentices/followers of_him asked him saying: Why therefore are_ the scribes _saying that G‹H‹Ēlias to_pass_through first.
   11 And he answering said: G‹H‹Ēlias on_one_hand is_coming and will_be_restoring all things, 12 on_the_other_hand I_am_saying to_you_all that G‹H‹Ēlias already came and they_ not _knew him, but they_did with him as_much_as they_wanted.
   Thus also the son of_Man is_going to_be_suffering by them.
   13 Then the apprentices/followers understood that he_spoke to_them concerning G‹Yōannēs›G the immerser.
   14 And of_having_come to the crowd, a_man approached to_him kneeling before_him 15 and saying: master, show_mercy to_the son of_me, because he_is_being_epileptic and is_having sickly, for often he_is_falling into the fire, and often into the water.
   16 And I_brought him to_the apprentices/followers of_you, and they_were_ not _able to_heal him.
   17 And G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G answering said: Rx-Oh-Rx unbelieving generation and having_been_perverted, until when I_will_be with you_all.
   Until when will_I_be_tolerating of_you_all.
   Be_bringing him here to_me.
   18 And G‹H‹Yēsous gave_rebuke to_it, and the demon came_out from him, and the boy was_healed from that hour.
   19 Then the apprentices/followers having_approached to_G‹H‹Yēsous by themselves said: for_ Why _reason we were_ not _able to_throw_ it _out.
   20 And he is_saying to_them: Because_of the little_faith of_you_all.
   For, truly I_am_saying to_you_all, if you_all_may_be_having faith as a_seed of_mustard, you_all_will_be_saying to_ this _mountain: Move from_here to_there, and it_will_be_moving, and nothing will_be_unattaining for_you_all.
   21  22 And them being_gathered in G‹H‹Galilaia/(Gālīl)›H›G, G‹H‹Yēsous said to_them, the son of_Man Is_going to_be_being_given_over into the_hands of_people, 23 and they_will_be_killing_ him _off, and on_the third day he_will_be_being_raised.
   And they_were_ exceedingly _sorrowed.
   24 And them having_come to G‹Kafarna'oum›G, the ones receiving the G‹didraⱪmon›G approached to_G‹Petros›G and said: The teacher of_you_all is_ not _paying the G‹didraⱪmon›G.
   25 He_is_saying: Yes.
   And having_come into the house, G‹H‹Yēsous preceded him saying: What is_supposing to_you, Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx.
   The kings of_the earth, are_receiving revenues from whom_all or poll_tax.
   From the sons of_them or from strangers.
   26 is_saying to_him G‹Petros›G From the strangers.
   And he_having_said: From the strangers, G‹H‹Yēsous was_saying to_him: Consequently surely the_free ones are the sons.
   27 But in_order_that we_may_ not _offend them, having_been_gone to sea, throw a_fish_hook and take_up the first fish having_gone_up, and having_opened_up the mouth of_it, you_will_be_finding a_stater, having_taken that, give to_them for me and you.
  Mat 18  That in hour the apprentices/followers approached to_G‹H‹Yēsous saying: Who consequently is the_greater in the kingdom of_the heavens.
   2 And having_called_to a_little_child, he_stood it in midst of_them 3 and said: Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all, if you_all _may_ not _be_turned and may_become as the little_children, by_no_means you_all_may_ not _come_in into the kingdom of_the heavens.
   4 Therefore whoever will_be_humbling himself as the this little_child, this one is the greater in the kingdom of_the heavens.
   5 And whoever may_receive one such little_child in the name of_me, is_receiving me.
   6 But whoever may_stumble one of_ these _little ones believing in me, it_is_benefitting for_him that a_ heavy _grinding_stone may_be_hanged around the neck of_him, and may_be_sunk in the depth of_the sea.
   7 Woe to_the world because_of the temptations.
   For it_is necessity the temptations to_come, however woe to_the that person by whom the temptation is_coming.
   8 And if the hand of_you or the foot of_you is_stumbling you, cut_off it and throw it from you, it_is better for_you to_come_in into life maimed or lame, than having two two hands or feet, to_be_throw into the eternal fire.
   9 And if the eye of_you is_stumbling you, pluck_out it and throw it from you, it_is better for_you to_come_in into life one-eyed, than to_be_throw into the G‹geenna›G of_fire having two eyes.
   10 Be_seeing you_all_may_ not _despise of_one of_ these _little ones, for I_am_saying to_you_all that the angels of_them in the_heavens, through all time are_seeing the face of_the father of_me, who is in the_heavens.
   11  12 what is_it_supposing to_you_all.
   If it_may_become to_a_certain man a_hundred sheep, and one of them may_be_strayed, having_ not the ninety nine _left on the mountains, and having_been_gone is_seeking the sheep being_strayed.
   13 And if he_may_become to_find it, truly, I_am_saying to_you_all that he_is_rejoicing over it more than over the ninety nine not having_been_strayed.
   14 Thus not is the_will before the father of_you_all, who is in the_heavens, that may_perish one of_ these _little ones.
   15 And if the brother of_you may_sin, be_going rebuke him between you and him only.
   If he_may_hear from_you, you_gained the brother of_you.
   16 But if he_may_ not _hear, take one or two more, with you, in_order_that on the_mouth of_two or three witnesses, every word may_be_established.
   17 And if he_may_refuse_to_hear from_them, tell to_the assembly.
   And if he_may_ also _refuse_to_hear from_the assembly, him_let_be to_you as the pagan and the tax_collector.
   18 Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all, as_much_as you_all_may_bind on the earth, will_be having_been_bound in heaven, and as_much_as you_all_may_untie/release on the earth, will_be having_been_untied/released in heaven.
   19 Again truly, I_am_saying to_you_all that if two of you_all on the earth may_agree_together concerning any matter, of_whatever they_may_request, it_will_be_becoming for_them by the father of_me, who is in the_heavens.
   20 For where are two or three having_been_gathered_together in the my name, there I_am in the_midst of_them.
   21 Then G‹Petros›G having_approached, said to_him: master, how_often will_ the brother of_me _be_sinning against me, and I_will_be_forgiving to_him.
   Up_to seven_times.
   22 G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G is_saying to_him: I_am_ not _saying to_you up_to seven_times, but up_to seventy_times seven.
   23 Because_of this the kingdom of_the heavens was_likened to_a_man a_king, who wanted to_settle_accounts account with the slaves of_him.
   24 And of_him having_begun to_be_settling_accounts, one of_ten_thousand a_debtor G‹talantons_of_silver›G was_brought.
   to_him.
   25 But of_him not having means to_give_back, the master commanded him to_be_sold, and the wife, and the children, and all things as_many_as was_having, and payment to_be_given_back.
   26 Therefore the slave having_fallen was_kneeling to_him saying: Master, be_patient with me, and I_will_be_giving_ all _back to_you.
   27 And the master having_been_feeling_compassion, of_ that _slave sent_ him _away, and he_forgave the loan to_him.
   28 But that slave having_come_out, found one of_the fellow-slaves of_him, who was_owing a_hundred G‹dēnarion_coins›G to_him, and having_apprehended him he_was_strangling him saying: Give_back if anything you_are_owing.
   29 Therefore the fellow-slave of_him having_fallen, was_imploring him saying: Be_patient with me, and I_will_be_giving_back to_you.
   30 And he_was_ not _willing, but having_gone_away, he_throw him into prison, until he_may_give_back the thing being_owed.
   31 therefore the fellow-slaves of_him Having_seen the things having_become, they_were_ exceedingly _sorrowed, and having_come they_explained to_the master of_themselves all the things having_become.
   32 Then the master of_him having_called_to him is_saying to_him: Evil slave, that all obligation I_forgave to_you, because you_implored me.
   33 Not was_it_fitting you also to_show_mercy to_the fellow-slave of_you, as also_I shown_mercy to_you.
   34 And the master of_him having_been_angered, gave_ him _over to_the tormentors, until of_which he_may_give_back all being_owed.
   To_him.
   35 Thus also the heavenly father of_me will_be_doing to_you_all, if you_all_may_ not _forgive each to_the brother of_him from the hearts of_you_all.
  Mat 19  And it_became, when G‹H‹Yēsous finished these words, he_withdrew from G‹H‹Galilaia/(Gālīl)›H›G and came to the regions of_Rx-G‹Youdaia›G-Rx beyond the G‹H‹Yordanēs/(Yarəddēn)›H›G.
   2 And great crowds followed after_him, and he_healed them there.
   3 And the_G‹Farisaios_sect›G approached to_him, testing him and saying: is_it_permitting to_send_away the wife of_him according_to any cause.
   4 And which answering he_said: You_all_ not _read that he having_made them from beginning: made them male and female,.
   5 And he_said: on_account of_this a_man will_be_leaving his father and his mother, and will_be_being_joined_together with_the wife of_him, and the two will_be into one flesh.
   6 So_that they_ no_longer _are two, but one flesh.
   Therefore what god joined_together, let_ man not _be_separating.
   7 They_are_saying to_him: Therefore why G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G commanded to_give a_scroll of_divorce and to_send_ her _away.
   8 He_is_saying to_them, for the hard_heart of_you_all G‹H‹Mōsēs, permitted to_you_all to_send_away the wives of_you_all, but from the_beginning it_has_ not _become thus.
   9 And I_am_saying to_you_all that whoever may_send_away the wife of_him for sexual_immorality, may_marry another, is_causing_adultery.
   And the one having_been_sent_away marrying is_causing_adultery.
   10 The Disciples are_saying to_him: If thus is the cause of_the husband with the wife, it_is_ not _benefitting to_marry.
   11 But he said to_them: Not all are_accepting this statement, but those to_whom it_has_been_given.
   12 For there_are eunuchs, who were_born thus from womb of_mother, and there_are eunuchs who were_throwrated by people, and there_are eunuchs who throwrated themselves because_of the kingdom of_the heavens.
   The one being_able to_be_accepting it, him _let_be_accepting it.
   13 Then little_children were_brought to_him, in_order_that he_may_lay_on his hands on_them and he_may_pray, and the apprentices/followers gave_rebuke to_them.
   14 But G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G said, to_them: Allow the little_children and not be_forbidding them to_come to me, for the kingdom of_the heavens is of_such children.
   15 And having_laid_on his hands on_them, he_was_gone from_there.
   16 And see, one having_approached to_him said: Teacher, what good may_I_do, in_order_that I_may_have eternal life.
   17 And he said to_him: Why are_you_asking me about the good.
   Rx-one-Rx is good.
   But if you_are_wanting into life to_come_in, be_keeping the commandments.
   18 He_is_saying to_him: Which ones.
   And G‹H‹Yēsous said, you will_ not _be_murdering, you will_ not _be_committing_adultery, you will_ not _be_stealing, you will_ not _be_giving_false_testimony, 19 be_honoring your father and your mother, and: you_will_be_loving the neighbor of_you as yourself.
   20 The Young_man is_saying to_him, I_kept all These things, what am_I_lacking still.
   21 G‹H‹Yēsous /Was/_saying to_him: If you_are_wanting to_be perfect, be_going sell the things possessing of_you, and give to_the_poor, and you_will_be_having treasure in the_heavens, and come, be_following after_me.
   22 But the young_man having_heard, the statement, he_went_away being_sorrowed, for he_was having many properties.
   23 And G‹H‹Yēsous said to_the apprentices/followers of_him: Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all that a_rich one will_be_coming_in into the kingdom of_the heavens difficultly.
   24 And again I_am_telling to_you_all, it_is easier for_a_camel to_pass_through through the_eye of_a_needle than a_rich one to_come_in into the kingdom of_god.
   25 And the apprentices/followers having_heard, were_being_ exceedingly _astonished saying: Who consequently is_able to_be_saved.
   26 And G‹H‹Yēsous having_focused_in said to_them: With humans this is impossible, but with god all things possible.
   27 Then G‹Petros›G answering said to_him: See we left all things and followed after_you, what consequently will_be to_us.
   28 And G‹H‹Yēsous said to_them: Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all that you_all who having_followed after_me in the regeneration, whenever the son of_Man may_sit_down on the_throne of_glory of_him, you_all also will_be_sitting on twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of_Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx.
   29 And everyone who left houses, or brothers, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or farms, on_account the name of_me, will_be_receiving hundred_fold and will_be_inheriting eternal life.
   30 But many the_first will_be, the_last, and the_last first.
  Mat 20  For the kingdom of_the heavens is similar to_a_man, a_home_owner, who came_out together_with in_the_morning to_hire workers for the vineyard of_him.
   2 And having_agreed_together with the workers for a_G‹dēnarion_coin›G for_the day, he_sent_ them _out into the vineyard of_him.
   3 And having_come_out about the_third hour, he_saw others having_stood idle in the marketplace, 4 and to_those he_said: You_all also be_going into the vineyard, and whatever may_be right, I_will_be_giving to_you_all.
   5 And they went_away.
   again having_come_out about the_sixth and ninth hour, he_did likewise.
   6 And having_come_out about the eleventh, he_found others having_stood, and he_is_saying to_them: Why have_you_all_stood here idle all day.
   7 They_are_saying to_him: Because no_one hired us.
   He_is_saying to_them: You_all be_going also into the vineyard.
   8 And having_become evening the master of_the vineyard is_saying to_the manager of_him: Call the workers and give_back to_them the wage, having_begun from the last to the first.
   9 And the ones having_come about the eleventh hour, each received a_G‹dēnarion_coin›G.
   10 And the first ones having_come thought that they_will_be_receiving more, but they each also received a_G‹dēnarion_coin›G.
   11 And having_received, they_were_grumbling against the home_owner 12 saying: These last ones worked one hour, and you_made them equal to_us, to_the ones having_borne the burden of_the day and the scorching_heat.
   13 But he answering of_them said to_one Friend, I_am_ not _doing_wrong to_you.
   Not you_agreed_together for_a_G‹dēnarion_coin›G with_me.
   14 Take_up what is your and Be_going but.
   I_am_wanting to_give to_this last as also to_you.
   15 Or not is_it_permitting for_me, what I_am_willing to_do with mine.
   Or is the eye of_you evil, because I am good.
   16 Thus the last will_be first, and the first last.
   17 And G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G going_up to G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G, took the twelve apprentices/followers by themselves, and on the way he_said to_them, 18 See we_are_going_up to G‹H‹Hierousalēm, and the son of_Man will_be_being_given_over to_the chief_priests and scribes, and they_will_be_condemning him to_death, 19 and they_will_be_giving_ him _over to_the pagans, in_order that to_mock, and to_flog, and to_impale_on_a_stake, and on_the third day he_will_be_rising_up.
   20 Then the mother of_the sons of_G‹Zebedaios›G with the sons of_her approached to_him, kneeling and requesting something from him.
   21 And he said to_her: What are_you_wanting.
   She_is_saying to_him: Say that these two sons of_me may_sit_down, one on the_right and one on the_left of_you in the kingdom of_you.
   22 But G‹H‹Yēsous answering said: You_all_have_ not _known what you_all_are_requesting.
   Are_you_all_being_able to_drink the cup which I am_going to_be_drinking.
   They_are_saying to_him: We_are_being_able.
   23 He_is_saying to_them: On_one_hand you_all_will_be_drinking the cup of_me, on_the_other_hand to_sit_down on the_right of_me and on the_left, is not mine to_give, but for_whom it_has_been_prepared by the father of_me.
   24 And having_heard, the ten resented about the two brothers.
   25 But G‹H‹Yēsous having_called_to them said: You_all_have_known that the rulers of_the pagans are_exercising_mastership over_them, and the great ones are_exercising_authority over_them.
   26 it_will_ not _be thus among you_all, but whoever among you_all may_be_wanting to_become great, he_will_be servant of_you_all, 27 and whoever among you_all may_be_wanting to_be first, he_will_be slave of_you_all, 28 as the son of_Man came not to_be_served, but to_serve and to_give the life of_him a_ransom for many.
   29 And them going_out from G‹H‹Yeriⱪō/(Yərīḩō)›H›G, a_ great _crowd followed after_him.
   30 And see, two blind men sitting beside the road, having_heard that G‹H‹Yēsous is_passing_by, they_cried_out saying, show_mercy to_us, master, son of_G‹H‹Dauid/(Dāvid)›H›G.
   31 And the crowd warned to_them that they_may_keep_silent.
   But they cried_out greater saying: master, show_mercy to_us, son of_G‹H‹Dauid.
   32 And G‹H‹Yēsous having_stopped, called them and said: What are_you_all_wanting I_may_do for_you_all.
   33 They_are_saying to_him: master, that may_be_opening_up the eyes of_us.
   34 And G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G having_been_feeling_compassion, touched against_the eyes of_them, and immediately they_received_sight and they_followed after_him.
  Mat 21  And when they_neared to G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G and came to G‹Bēthfagē›G to the Mount of_Olives, then G‹H‹Yēsous sent_out Two apprentices/followers 2 saying to_them: Be_going into the village, in_front_of of_you_all, and immediately you_all_will_be_finding a_donkey having_been_bound and a_colt with her, having_untied them bring them to_me.
   3 And anyone may_say anything to_you_all, you_all_will_be_saying, The master is_having need of_them, and immediately he_will_be_sending_ them _out.
   4 And this all has_become, in_order_that the word may_be_fulfilled having_been_spoken by the prophet saying, 5 say to_the daughter of_G‹H‹Siōn/(Tsiuōn)›H›G: See the king of_you is_coming to_you, gentle and having_mounted on a_donkey and on a_colt, the_son of_a_donkey.
   6 And the apprentices/followers having_been_gone, and having_done as G‹H‹Yēsous directed to_them, 7 they_brought the donkey and the colt, and they_put_on their coats on them, and he_sat_on on them.
   8 And the very_great crowd spread the coats of_themselves on the road, and others were_cutting_off branches from the trees, and were_spreading them on the road.
   9 And the crowds going_before him and the ones following were_crying_out saying: Blessed_saviour to_the son of_G‹H‹Dauid.
   the one coming in the_name of_the_master Having_been_blessed.
   Blessed_saviour in the highest.
   10 And of_him having_come_in into G‹H‹Hierousalēm, all the city was_shaken saying: Who is this.
   11 And the crowds were_saying: This is the prophet G‹H‹Yēsous, the one from G‹Nazaret›G of_G‹H‹Galilaia/(Gālīl)›H›G.
   12 And G‹H‹Yēsous came_in into the temple, and he_throw_out all the ones selling and buying in the temple, and he_overturned the tables of_the moneychangers, and the seats of_the ones selling the doves.
   13 And he_is_saying to_them: It_has_been_written: the house of_me will_be_being_called a_house of_prayer, but you_all are_making it a_hideout of_robbers.
   14 And blind and lame in the temple approached, to_him, and he_healed them.
   15 But the chief_priests and the scribes having_seen, the wonders that he_did, and the children crying_out in the temple and saying: Blessed_saviour to_the son of_G‹H‹Dauid/(Dāvid)›H›G, they_resented 16 and said to_him: Are_you_hearing what these are_saying.
   And G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G is_saying to_them: Yes, you_all_ never _read, you_prepared praise out_of mouth of_infants and nursing,.
   17 And having_left them, he_came_out out the city to G‹Bēthania›G, and was_lodged there.
   18 And in_the_morning setting_out into the city, he_hungered.
   19 And having_seen one fig_tree on the road, he_came to it and nothing found on it, except only leaves, and he_is_saying to_it: Fruit May_ no_longer _become from you for the age.
   And immediately the fig_tree was_withered.
   20 And the apprentices/followers having_seen it Rx-marvelled-Rx saying: How was_ the fig_tree immediately _withered.
   21 And G‹H‹Yēsous answering, said to_them: Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all, if you_all_may_be_having faith and not may_be_doubted, not only will_you_all_be_doing the miracle of_the fig_tree, but even_if you_all_may_say to_the this mountain: Be_taken_away and be_throw into the sea, it_will_be_becoming.
   22 And all things as_many_as you_all_may_request in prayer believing, you_all_will_be_receiving.
   23 And with_him having_come into the temple, teaching the chief_priests and the elders of_the people approached to_him saying: By what authority are_you_doing these things.
   And who gave this authority to_you.
   24 And G‹H‹Yēsous answering, said to_them: Also_I Will_be_asking you_all one word, which if you_all_may_tell to_me, also_I will_be_saying to_you_all by what authority I_am_doing these things.
   25 The immersion of_G‹Yōannēs›G, from_where was_it.
   From heaven or from humans.
   And they were_reasoning among themselves saying: If we_may_say: From heaven, he_will_be_saying to_us: Therefore for_ why _reason you_all_ not _believed in_him.
   26 But if we_may_say: From humans, we_are_fearing the crowd, for all are_having G‹Yōannēs›G as a_prophet.
   27 And answering to_G‹H‹Yēsous, they_said: We_have_ not _known.
   he was_saying to_them also: Neither I am_telling to_you_all by what authority I_am_doing these things.
   28 But what is_it_supposing to_you_all.
   A_man was_having two children.
   And having_approached to_the_ first _one he_said: Child, be_going today, be_working in the vineyard.
   of_me.
   29 And he answering said: I_am_ not _willing, later having_been_regretful, he_went_away.
   30 And having_approached to_the other child he_said likewise.
   And he answering said: I will, sir, but went_ not _away.
   31 Which of the two did the will of_the father.
   They_are_saying: The first.
   G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G is_saying to_them: Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all that the tax_collectors and the prostitutes are_going_before you_all into the kingdom of_god.
   32 For G‹Yōannēs›G came to you_all in the_way of_righteousness, and you_all_ not _believed in_him, but the tax_collectors and the prostitutes believed in_him, and you_all having_seen, you_all_were_ not _regretful later to_believe in_him.
   33 Hear another parable: a_man was a_home_owner, who planted a_vineyard, and put_ a_fence _around to_it: and dug a_winepress in it, and built a_tower, and rented_ it _out to_tenant_farmers, and Rx-travelled-Rx.
   34 And when the season of_the fruits neared, he_sent_out the slaves of_him to the tenant_farmers, to_receive the fruits of_him.
   35 And the tenant_farmers having_taken the slaves of_him, on_one_hand that they_beat, on_the_other_hand that they_killed_off, on_the_other_hand that they_threw_stones.
   36 Again he_sent_out other slaves, more than the first, and they_did likewise to_them.
   37 But later he_sent_out the son of_him to them saying: They_will_be_being_swayed by_the son of_me.
   38 But the tenant_farmers having_seen the son, said among themselves: This is the heir, come, we_may_kill_ him _off and we_may_have the inheritance of_him.
   39 And having_taken him, they_throw_out him out the vineyard and they_killed_off him.
   40 Therefore whenever the master of_the vineyard may_come, what he_will_be_doing to_ those _tenant_farmers.
   41 They_are_saying to_him: He_will_be_destroying them evil ones miserably, and will_be_renting_out the vineyard to_other tenant_farmers, who will_be_giving_back to_him the fruits in the seasons of_them.
   42 G‹H‹Yēsous is_saying to_them: You_all_ never _read in the scriptures: the_stone which the ones building rejected, this was_become for the_head of_the_corner, this became from the_master, and it_is Rx-marvellous-Rx in the_eyes of_us.
   43 Because_of this I_am_saying to_you_all the kingdom of_god will_be_being_taken_away from you_all, and it_will_be_being_given to_a_people producing the fruits of_it.
   44 And the one having_fallen on this stone, will_be_being_shattered, on but whomever it_may_fall, it_will_be_pulverizing him.
   45 And the chief_priests and the G‹Farisaios_sect›G having_heard the parables of_him, they_knew that he_is_speaking about them.
   46 And seeking to_apprehend him, they_were_afraid the crowds, because they_were_having him for a_prophet.
  Mat 22  And G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G answering again spoke in parables to_them saying, 2 the kingdom of_the heavens /Was/_likened to_a_man, a_king, who made a_wedding_festivities for_the son of_him.
   3 And sent_out the slaves of_him, to_call the ones having_been_invited to the wedding_festivities, and they_were_ not _willing to_come.
   4 Again he_sent_out other slaves saying: Say to_the ones having_been_invited: See I_have_prepared the dinner of_me, the bulls of_me and the grain_fed having_been_sacrificed, and all things are_ready, come to the wedding_festivities.
   5 But they having_neglected went_away, on_one_hand that one to his own field, on_the_other_hand that one to the business of_him.
   6 And the rest having_apprehended the slaves of_him, they_mistreated and they_killed_off them.
   7 But the king was_angered, and having_sent the armies of_him, destroyed those murderers, and inflamed the city of_them.
   8 Then he_is_saying to_the slaves of_him: On_one_hand the wedding is ready, on_the_other_hand the ones having_been_invited were not worthy.
   9 Therefore be_going in the thoroughfares of_the roads, and as_many_as you_all_may_find, invite to the wedding_festivities.
   10 And those slaves having_come_out, into the roads, they_gathered_together all whom they_found, both evil and good, and the wedding was_filled of_reclining ones.
   11 But the king having_come_in to_see the ones reclining, he_saw there a_man not having_dressed_in clothing of_wedding, 12 and he_is_saying to_him: Friend, how you_came_in here not having clothing of_wedding.
   And he was_silenced.
   13 Then the king said to_the servants: Having_bound of_him the_feet and hands, throw_ him _out into the outer darkness, there will_be weeping and grating of_teeth.
   14 For many are called, but few chosen.
   15 Then the G‹Farisaios_sect›G having_been_gone, took counsel so_that they_may_trap him in word.
   16 And they_are_sending_out to_him the apprentices/followers of_them with the G‹supporters_of_Hērōdēs›G saying: Teacher, we_have_known that you_are true, and you_are_teaching the way of_god in truth, and it_is_ not _caring to_you about no_one, for you_are_ not _looking on appearance of_people.
   17 Therefore tell to_us, what is_it_supposing to_you.
   Is_it_permitting to_give poll_tax to_Rx-G‹Kaisar›G-Rx or not.
   18 But G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G having_known the wickedness of_them he_said: Why you_all_are_testing me, hypocrites.
   19 Show to_me the coin of_the poll_tax.
   And they brought a_G‹dēnarion_coin›G to_him.
   20 And he_is_saying to_them, of_whose_ image _is this and the inscription.
   21 They_are_saying: Of_Rx-G‹Kaisar›G-Rx.
   Then he_is_saying to_them: Therefore give_back the things of_Rx-G‹Kaisar›G-Rx to_Rx-G‹Kaisar›G-Rx, and the things of_god to_god.
   22 And having_heard they_Rx-marvelled-Rx, and having_left him they_went_away.
   23 On that day G‹Saddoukaios_sect›G approached to_him saying, not to_be a_resurrection, and they_asked him 24 saying: Teacher, G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G said: if anyone may_die_off not having children, the brother of_him will_be_marrying the wife of_him, and he_will_be_raising_up children for_the brother of_him.
   25 And they_were among us seven brothers, and the first having_married died, and not having seed, left the wife of_him to_the brother of_him.
   26 Likewise also the second, and the third, to the seven, 27 and last of_all, the woman died_off.
   28 The therefore in resurrection, she_will_be the_wife of_which of_the seven.
   For all had her.
   29 And G‹H‹Yēsous answering, said to_them: You_all_are_being_strayed, not having_known the scriptures, nor the power of_god.
   30 For in the resurrection, they_are_ neither _marrying nor are_being_betrothed, but they_are like angels in heaven.
   31 But concerning the resurrection of_the dead, you_all_ not _read the word having_been_spoken to_you_all by god saying, 32 I am the god of_G‹H‹Abra'am/('Avərāhām)›H›G, and the god of_G‹H‹Isa'ak/(Yiʦəḩāq)›H›G, and the god of_G‹H‹Yakōb/(Ya'aqov)›H›G.
   god is not of_the_dead, but of_the_living.
   33 And the crowds having_heard, they_were_being_astonished at the teaching of_him.
   34 But the G‹Farisaios_sect›G having_heard that he_silenced the G‹Saddoukaios_sect›G, were_gathered_together with the same.
   35 And one of them, a_lawyer testing him asked, 36 Teacher, which commandment is great in the law.
   37 And he was_saying to_him: You_will_be_loving the_master the god of_you with all heart of_you, and with all soul of_you, and with all the mind of_you.
   38 This is the great and first commandment.
   39 The_second similar to_it: you_will_be_loving the neighbor of_you as yourself.
   40 all the law and the prophets is_being_hanged.
   On these two commandments.
   41 And the G‹Farisaios_sect›G having_been_gathered_together, G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G asked them 42 saying: What is_supposing to_you_all concerning the chosen_one/messiah.
   Of_whom son is_he.
   They_are_saying to_him: Of_the son of_G‹H‹Dauid/(Dāvid)›H›G.
   43 He_is_saying to_them: Therefore how G‹H‹Dauid in spirit is_calling him master saying, 44 the_master said to_the master of_me: Be_sitting on the_right hand of_me, until I_may_put the enemies of_you beneath for_the feet of_you.
   45 Therefore if G‹H‹Dauid is_calling him: master, how is_he the_son of_him.
   46 And no_one was_able to_answer a_word to_him, nor dared anyone from that day to_ask him no_longer.
  Mat 23  Then G‹H‹Yēsous spoke to_the crowds and to_the apprentices/followers of_him 2 saying, the scribes and the G‹Farisaios_sect›G sat_down On the seat of_G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G.
   3 Therefore all things as_much_as they_may_tell to_you_all, do and be_keeping, but be_ not _doing according_to the works of_them, for they_are_speaking and they_are_ not _doing.
   4 And they_are_binding heavy and unbearable burdens, and they_are_laying_on them on the shoulders of_people, but they with_the finger of_them not are_willing to_move them.
   5 But all the works of_them, they_are_doing in_order that to_be_seen by_the people.
   For they_are_widening the phylacteries of_them and they_are_magnifying their tassels.
   6 And they_are_loving the best_place at the suppers, and the best_seats in the synagogues, 7 and the greetings in the marketplaces, and to_be_being_called , My_great_one by the people.
   8 But you_all may_ not _be_called , My_great_one, for one is the instructor, of_you_all.
   and you_all are all brothers.
   9 And you_all_may_ not _call of_you_all on the earth father, for one is the heavenly father of_you_all.
   10 Nor may_you_all_be_called instructors, because one is the_instructor of_you_all, the chosen_one.
   11 And the greater of_you_all will_be servant of_you_all.
   12 And whoever will_be_exalting himself, will_be_being_humbled, and whoever will_be_humbling himself, will_be_being_exalted.
   13 But woe to_you_all, scribes and G‹Farisaios_sect›G, hypocrites.
   Because you_all_are_shutting the kingdom of_the heavens before the people, for you_all neither are_coming_in, nor are_you_all_allowing the ones coming_in to_come_in.
   14  15 Woe to_you_all, scribes and G‹Farisaios_sect›G, hypocrites.
   Because you_all_are_going_around the sea and the dry land to_make one convert, and whenever he_may_become, you_all_are_making him a_son of_G‹geenna›G twice_more than you_all.
   16 Woe to_you_all, blind guides, you_all saying: Whoever may_swear by the temple, it_is nothing, but whoever may_swear by the gold of_the temple is_owing.
   17 Foolish and blind.
   For which is greater, the gold or the temple which having_sanctified the gold.
   18 And: Whoever may_swear by the altar, it_is nothing, but whoever may_swear by the gift on it is_owing.
   19 Foolish and blind.
   For which greater, the gift, or the altar sanctifying the gift.
   20 Therefore the one having_swore by the altar, is_swearing by it and by all the things on it.
   21 And the one having_swore by the temple, is_swearing by it and by the one dwelling_in it.
   22 And the one having_swore by heaven, is_swearing by the throne of_god and by the one sitting on it.
   23 Woe to_you_all, scribes and G‹Farisaios_sect›G, hypocrites.
   Because you_all_are_tithing mint, and dill, and cummin, and you_all_left the heavier of_the law: justice, and mercy, and faith.
   But it_was_fitting to_do these things, and_those not to_leave.
   24 Blind guides.
   You_all straining_out the gnat and swallowing_up the camel.
   25 Woe to_you_all, scribes and G‹Farisaios_sect›G, hypocrites.
   Because you_all_are_cleansing the part outside of_the cup and of_the dish, but inside they_are_being_full of theft and intemperance.
   26 Blind G‹Farisaios_sect_member›G.
   Cleanse first the part inside of_the cup and of_the dish, in_order_that the part outside of_them may_ also _become clean.
   27 Woe to_you_all, scribes and G‹Farisaios_sect›G, hypocrites.
   Because you_all_are_being_like to_tombs having_been_whitewashed, which on_one_hand are_appearing beautiful outwardly, on_the_other_hand inside they_are_being_full of_bones of_the_dead and of_all impurity.
   28 Thus also on_one_hand you_all are_being_seen righteous outwardly by_the people, on_the_other_hand inside you_all_are full of_hypocrisy and lawlessness.
   29 Woe to_you_all, scribes and G‹Farisaios_sect›G, hypocrites.
   Because you_all_are_building the tombs of_the prophets, and you_all_are_adorning the tombs of_the righteous 30 and you_all_are_saying: If we_were in the days of_the fathers of_us, we_were not would partners with_them in the blood of_the prophets.
   31 So_then you_all_are_testifying to_yourselves that you_all_are sons of_the ones having_murdered the prophets.
   32 Also you_all fill the measure of_the fathers of_you_all.
   33 Serpents, brood of_vipers, how may_you_all_escape from the judgment of_G‹geenna›G.
   34 Because_of this, see, I am_sending_out prophets and wise ones, and scribes to you_all.
   you_all_will_be_killing_off and you_all_will_be_impale_on_a_stakeing Of them, and you_all_will_be_flogging of them in the synagogues of_you_all, and you_all_will_be_persecuting from city to city, 35 so_that all righteous blood being_poured_out on the earth may_come on you_all, from the blood of_G‹H‹Abel/(Hevel)›H›G the righteous, to the blood of_G‹Zaⱪarias›G son of_G‹H‹Baraⱪias/(Berekəyāh)›H›G, whom you_all_murdered between the temple and the altar.
   36 Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all, all these things will_be_coming on this generation.
   37 G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G, G‹H‹Hierousalēm, the city killing_off the prophets and throwing_stones, the ones having_been_sent_out to her.
   How_often I_wanted to_gather_together the children of_you, which manner a_hen is_gathering_together the chicks of_her under her wings, and you_all_ not _willed.
   38 See the house of_you_all is_being_left desolate to_you_all.
   39 For I_am_saying to_you_all, by_no_means you_all_may_ not _see me from now until you_all_may_say, the one coming in name of_the_master having_been_blessed.
   Mat 24  And G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G having_come_out from the temple was_going, and approached the apprentices/followers of_him, to_show to_him the buildings of_the temple.
   2 And he answering said to_them: You_all_are_ not _seeing all these things.
   Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all, by_no_means may_ not _be_left here stone on stone, which will_ not _be_being_torn_down.
   3 And him sitting on the Mount of_Olives, the apprentices/followers approached to_him by themselves saying: Tell to_us when these things will_be, and what is the sign of_the your coming and the_completion of_the age.
   4 And G‹H‹Yēsous answering said to_them: Be_watching_out, lest anyone may_mislead you_all.
   5 For many will_be_coming in the name of_me saying: I am the chosen_one/messiah, and they_will_be_misleading many.
   6 And you_all_will_be_going to_be_hearing wars, and reports of_wars.
   Be_watching, not be_being_alarmed, for it_is_fitting to_become, but the end is not_yet.
   7 For nation will_be_being_raised against nation, and kingdom against kingdom, and will_be famines and earthquakes in places.
   8 But all these are the_beginning of_birth_pains.
   9 Then they_will_be_giving_ you_all _over to tribulation, and they_will_be_killing_ you_all _off.
   And you_all_will_be being_hated by all the nations, because_of the name of_me.
   10 And then many will_be_being_stumbled, and they_will_be_giving_over one_another and they_will_be_hating one_another.
   11 And many false_prophets will_be_being_raised and will_be_misleading many.
   12 And because_of that lawlessness to_be_multiplied, the love of_the many will_be_being_cooled.
   13 But the one having_endured to end, this one will_be_being_saved.
   14 And this gospel of_the kingdom will_be_being_proclaimed in all the inhabited_world, for a_testimony to_all the nations, and then the end will_be_coming.
   15 Therefore whenever you_all_may_see the abomination of_desolation, which having_been_spoken by G‹H‹Daniēl/(Dāniyyē'l)›H›G the prophet, having_stood in the_ holy _place (the one reading let_be_understanding), 16 then the ones in Rx-G‹Youdaia›G-Rx, let_them_be_fleeing to the mountains, 17 the one on the housetop, let_ not _come_down to_take_away the things out_of the house of_him, 18 and the one in the field, let_ not _return back to_take_away the coat of_him.
   19 But woe to_the women in womb having child, and to_the women nursing in those days.
   20 But be_praying that the flight of_you_all may_ not _become in_winter, nor on_a_sabbath.
   21 For then will_be great tribulation, such_as has_ not _become from beginning of_the_world until the time now, nor by_no_means may_ not _become.
   22 And except those days were_shortened, not any flesh would was_saved, but because_of the chosen, those days will_be_being_shortened.
   23 Then if anyone may_say to_you_all: See here is the chosen_one, or Here he_is, you_all_may_ not _believe it.
   24 For false_messiahs will_be_being_raised and false_prophets, and they_will_be_giving great signs and wonders, so_as to_mislead even the chosen if possible.
   25 See I_have_previously_spoken to_you_all.
   26 Therefore if they_may_say to_you_all: See he_is in the desert, you_all_may_ not _come_out.
   ˱Or˲_see, in the private_rooms, you_all_may_ not _believe it.
   27 For as the lightning is_coming_out from the_east and is_shining as_far_as the_west, thus will_be the coming of_the son of_Man.
   28 Wherever the corpse may_be, there the vultures will_be_being_gathered_together.
   29 But immediately after the tribulation of_ those _days: the sun will_be_being_darkened and the moon will_ not _be_giving the radiance of_it: and the stars will_be_falling from the sky, and the powers of_the heavens will_be_being_shaken.
   30 And then the sign of_the son of_Man will_be_being_seen in the_sky, and then all the tribes of_the earth will_be_mourning, and they_will_be_seeing the son of_Man, coming on the clouds of_the sky with power and great glory.
   31 And he_will_be_sending_out the angels of_him with a_ great _trumpet cry, and they_will_be_gathering_together the chosen of_him from the four winds, from the_extremities of_the_heavens to the_extremities of_them.
   32 And learn the parable of the fig_tree: whenever the branch of_it may_ already _become tender and the leaves may_be_sprouting_out, you_all_are_knowing that the summer is near.
   33 Thus also you_all whenever you_all_may_see all these things, you_all_are_knowing that it_is near at the_doors.
   34 Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all that by_no_means this generation may_ not _pass_away, until all these things may_become.
   35 The heaven and the earth will_be_passing_away, but the_words of_me by_no_means may_ not _pass_away.
   36 But no_one has_known concerning of_ that _day and hour, not_even the angels of_the heavens, nor the son, except only the father.
   37 As were for the days of_G‹H‹Nōe/(Noḩa)›H›G, thus the coming of_the son of_Man will_be.
   38 For as they_were in the days before the flood eating and drinking, marrying and betrothing, until that day G‹H‹Nōe came_in, into the ark.
   39 And they_ not _knew, until the flood came and took_ all _away, thus the coming of_the son of_Man will_be.
   40 Then two will_be in the field, one is_being_taken, and one is_being_left.
   41 Two grinding at the grinding_stone, one is_being_taken, and one is_being_left.
   42 Therefore be_watching, because you_all_have_ not _known on_what day the master of_you_all is_coming.
   43 But that you_all_are_knowing that if the home_owner had_known, in_what watch the thief is_coming, he_ would _watched, and would not allowed the house of_him to_be_dug_through.
   44 Because_of this also, you_all be_becoming ready, because you_all_are_ not _supposing in_that hour, the son of_Man is_coming.
   45 Who consequently is the faithful and prudent slave, whom the master appointed over the household of_him, to_give to_them the food in season.
   46 Blessed is that slave, whom the master of_him having_come will_be_finding doing thus.
   47 Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all that he_will_be_appointing him over all the things possessing of_him.
   48 But if the that evil slave may_say in the heart of_him: The master of_me is_delaying, 49 and he_may_begin to_be_striking the fellow-slaves of_him, and may_be_eating also may_be_drinking with the ones being_drunk, 50 the master of_ that _slave will_be_coming in a_day which he_is_ not _expecting, and in an_hour which he_is_ not _knowing, 51 and will_be_dismembering him, and he_will_be_appointing the portion of_him with the hypocrites, there will_be weeping and grating of_teeth.
  Mat 25  Then the kingdom of_the to_Ten will_be_being_likened heavens virgins, who having_taken the lamps of_them came_out in meeting of_the bridegroom.
   2 And five of them were foolish, and five were prudent.
   3 For the foolish having_taken the lamps of_them, they_ not _took olive_oil, with themselves, 4 but the prudent took olive_oil in their containers, with the lamps of_themselves.
   5 And the bridegroom delaying, all nodding_off and were_sleeping.
   6 But in_the_middle of_the_night, a_clamor has_become: See the bridegroom.
   Be_coming_out to the_meeting.
   7 Then all those virgins were_raised, and they_trimmed the lamps of_themselves.
   8 And the foolish said to_the prudent: Give to_us of the olive_oil of_you_all, because the lamps of_us are_being_extinguished.
   9 But the prudent answered saying: Lest by_no_means may_ not _suffice for_us and you_all, rather be_going to the ones selling, and buy for_yourselves.
   10 And them going_away to_buy, the bridegroom came, and the ready ones came_in with him to the wedding_festivities, and the door was_shut.
   11 And later the other virgins are_ also _coming saying: Sir, sir, open_up to_us.
   12 But he answering said: Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all, I_have_ not _known you_all.
   13 Therefore be_watching, because you_all_have_ neither _known the day, nor the hour.
   14 For as a_man Rx-travelling-Rx, called his own slaves, and gave_over the things possessing of_him to_them.
   15 And on_one_hand he_gave five G‹talantons_of_silver›G to_one, on_the_other_hand two to_one, on_the_other_hand one to_one, to_each according_to his own ability, and he_Rx-travelled-Rx immediately.
   16 Having_been_gone, the one having_received the five G‹talantons_›G, worked with them and gained other five G‹talantons_›G.
   17 Likewise also the one with_the two, gained another two.
   18 But the one having_received the one, having_gone_away dug the_ground and hid the silver of_the master of_him.
   19 And after much time, the master of_ those _slaves is_coming, and he_is_settling_accounts the_account with them.
   20 And having_approached the one, having_received the five G‹talantons_›G, brought the_other five G‹talantons_›G saying: Five, G‹talantons_›G Master you_gave_over to_me, see, I_gained.
   another five G‹talantons_›G.
   21 the master of_him was_saying to_him: Well done, good and faithful slave.
   You_were faithful over a_few things, I_will_be_appointing you over many things, come_in into the joy of_the master of_you.
   22 the one with_the two G‹talantons_›G having_ also _approached said: Two, G‹talantons_›G Master you_gave_over to_me.
   See I_gained.
   another two G‹talantons_›G.
   23 the master of_him /Was/_saying to_him: Well done, good and faithful slave.
   You_were faithful over a_few things, I_will_be_appointing you over many things, come_in into the joy of_the master of_you.
   24 And the one having_received with_the one G‹talanton_of_silver›G having_ also _approached said: Master, I_knew you, that you_are a_hard, man, reaping where you_ not _sowed, and gathering_together whence you_ not _scattered.
   25 And having_been_afraid having_gone_away, I_hid the G‹talanton_›G of_you in the ground.
   See you_are_having your own.
   26 But the master of_him answering said to_him: Evil and reluctant Slave.
   You_had_known that I_am_reaping where I_ not _sowed, and I_am_gathering_together whence I_ not _scattered.
   27 Therefore it_was_fitting you to_put the silver_coins of_me to_the bankers, and having_come, I would received_back mine with interest.
   28 Therefore take_ the G‹talanton_›G _away from him, and give it to_the one having the ten G‹talantons_›G.
   29 For to_everyone having will_be_being_given and will_be_being_in_abundance, but the one not having, even what he_is_having will_be_being_taken_away from him.
   30 And throw_out the useless slave, into the outer darkness.
   There will_be weeping and grating of_teeth.
   31 But whenever the son of_Man may_come in the glory of_him, and all the angels with him, then he_will_be_sitting_down on throne of_glory of_him.
   32 And all the nations will_be_being_gathered_together before him, and will_be_setting_apart them from one_another, as the shepherd is_setting_apart the sheep from the goats.
   33 And the will_be_standing on_one_hand sheep on the_right of_him, on_the_other_hand the goats on the_left.
   34 Then the king will_be_saying to_the ones on the_right of_him: Come you_all having_been_blessed of_the father of_me, inherit the kingdom having_been_prepared for_you_all from the_foundation of_the_world.
   35 For I_hungered and you_all_gave to_me to_eat, I_thirsted and you_all_gave_ me _to_drink, I_was a_stranger and you_all_brought_ me _in, 36 naked and you_all_clothed me, I_ailed and you_all_visited me, I_was in prison and you_came to me.
   37 Then the righteous will_be_answering to_him saying: master, when we_saw you hungering and we_fed, or thirsting and we_gave_to_drink.
   38 And when we_saw you a_stranger and we_brought_in, or naked and we_clothed.
   39 And when we_saw you sick or in prison, and we_came to you.
   40 And the king answering, will_be_saying to_them: Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all, for as_much_as you_all_did it to_ the least _one of_these brothers of_me, you_all_did it to_me.
   41 Then he will_ also _be_saying to_the ones on the_left: Be_going from me having_been_cursed ones into the eternal fire, having_been_prepared for_the devil and the angels of_him.
   42 For I_hungered and you_all_ not _gave to_me to_eat, and I_thirsted and not you_all_gave_ me _to_drink, 43 I_was a_stranger and you_all_ not _brought_in me, naked and you_all_ not _clothed me, sick and in prison and you_all_ not _visited me.
   44 Then they will_ also _be_answering saying: master, when we_saw you hungering, or thirsting, or a_stranger, or naked, or sick, or in prison, and we_ not _served unto_you.
   45 Then he_will_be_answering to_them saying: Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all, for as_much_as you_all_ not _did it to_ of_these the _one least, neither you_all_did it to_me.
   46 And these will_be_going_away into eternal punishment, but the the_righteous into eternal life.
  Mat 26  And it_became when G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G finished all the words these, he_said to_the apprentices/followers of_him, 2 You_all_have_known that after two days the passover_feast is_becoming, and the son of_Man is_being_given_over in_order that to_be_impaled_on_a_stake.
   3 Then the chief_priests and the elders of_the people were_gathered_together in the courtyard of_the chief_priest, who being_called G‹Kaiafas›G, 4 and they_plotted_together that they_may_apprehend G‹H‹Yēsous by_deceit and they_may_kill_off him.
   5 But they_were_saying: Not at the feast, in_order_that a_commotion may_ not _become among the people.
   6 And of_G‹H‹Yēsous having_become in G‹Bēthania›G in house of_Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx the leprous, 7 a_woman having an_alabaster_flask of_ heavily_valued _ointment approached to_him, and she_poured_down it on the head of_him reclining.
   8 But the apprentices/followers having_seen, resented saying: For why this destruction.
   9 For this was_able to_be_sold for_much and to_be_given to_the_poor.
   10 But G‹H‹Yēsous having_known, said to_them: Why are_you_all_bringing_about troubles to_the women.
   For she_did a_ beautiful _work to me.
   11 For you_all_are_ always _having the poor with yourselves, but you_all_are_ not always _having me.
   12 For this woman having_put on_ this _ointment on the body of_me, for did it that to_bury me.
   13 Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all, wherever this gospel may_be_proclaimed in all the world, will_ also _be_being_spoken what this woman did for a_memorial of_her.
   14 Then one of_the twelve, who being_called G‹H‹Youdas/(Yəhūdāh)›H›G G‹Iskariōtēs›G having_been_gone to the chief_priests 15 he_said: What are_you_all_willing to_give to_me, and_I will_be_giving_ him _over to_you_all.
   And they they_set to_him thirty silver_coins.
   16 And from then he_was_seeking an_opportunity, in_order_that he_may_give_ him _over.
   17 And on_the first day of_non-fermented bread, the apprentices/followers approached to_G‹H‹Yēsous saying: Where are_you_wanting that we_may_prepare for_you to_eat the passover_.
   18 And he said: Be_going into the city to somebody and say to_him: The teacher is_saying: The time of_me is near, with you I_am_making the passover_ with the apprentices/followers of_me.
   19 And the apprentices/followers did as G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G directed to_them, and they_prepared the passover_.
   20 And having_become evening, he_was_reclining with the twelve, 21 and to_them eating he_said: Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all that one of you_all will_be_giving_ me _over.
   22 And being_ exceedingly _sorrowed, they_began to_be_saying to_him each one, of_them: Surely_not I am, master.
   23 And he answering said: The one having_dipped_in his hand with me, in the bowl, this one will_be_giving_ me _over.
   24 On_one_hand the son of_Man is_going as it_has_been_written about him, on_the_other_hand woe to_the_ that _man by whom the son of_Man is_being_given_over.
   It_was better for_him, if that man was_ not _born.
   25 And G‹H‹Youdas, who giving_over him answering said: Surely_not I am, my_great_one.
   He_is_saying to_him: You said it.
   26 And of_them eating, G‹H‹Yēsous having_taken bread, and having_blessed he_broke it and having_given to_the apprentices/followers said: Take, eat, this is the body of_me.
   27 And having_taken a_cup and having_given_thanks, he_gave it to_them saying: All drink of it, 28 for this is the blood of_me of_the covenant, the blood for many being_poured_out for forgiveness of_sins.
   29 But I_am_saying to_you_all, by_no_means I_may_ not _drink of this fruit of_the vine from now until that day, whenever I_may_be_drinking it with you_all new in the kingdom of_the father of_me.
   30 And having_sung_hymns, they_came_out to the Mount of_Olives.
   31 Then G‹H‹Yēsous is_saying to_them: All of_you_all will_be_being_stumbled in me at this night, for it_has_been_written: I_will_be_striking the shepherd, and the sheep of_the flock.
   will_be_being_scattered.
   32 But after me to_be_raised, will_be_going_before you_all into G‹H‹Galilaia/(Gālīl)›H›G.
   33 But G‹Petros›G answering said to_him: If all will_be_being_stumbled in you, I never will_be_being_stumbled.
   34 G‹H‹Yēsous was_saying to_him: Truly, I_am_saying to_you that at this night before the_rooster to_crow, thrice you_will_be_renouncing me.
   35 G‹Petros›G is_saying to_him: Even_if it_may_be_fitting me to_die_off with you, by_no_means I will_ not _be_renouncing you.
   all the apprentices/followers also said Likewise.
   36 Then G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G is_coming with them to a_property being_called G‹Gethsēmanē›G, and he_is_saying to_the apprentices/followers, of_him: Sit_down here until of_which having_gone_away there I_may_pray.
   37 And having_taken G‹Petros›G and the two sons of_G‹Zebedaios›G, he_began to_be_being_sorrowed and to_be_distressing.
   38 Then he_is_saying to_them: The soul of_me is very_sorrowful to death, remain here and be_watching with me.
   39 And having_approached a_little, he_fell on the_face of_him praying and saying: father of_me, if it_is possible, let_ this cup _pass_by from me.
   However not as I am_wanting, but as you.
   40 And he_is_coming to the apprentices/followers and is_finding them sleeping, and he_is_saying to_G‹Petros›G: Thus you_all_were_ not _able to_watch one hour with me.
   41 Be_watching and be_praying, in_order_that you_all_may_ not _come_in into temptation.
   On_one_hand the spirit is eager, on_the_other_hand the the_flesh is weak.
   42 Again having_gone_away for a_second he_prayed saying: father of_me, if this is_ not _able to_pass_by, if not I_may_drink it, let_ the will of_you _be_become.
   43 And having_come again, he_found them sleeping, for the eyes of_them were having_been_weighed_down.
   44 And having_left them again having_gone_away, he_prayed for the_third time having_said the same statement again.
   45 Then he_is_coming to the apprentices/followers and is_saying to_them: You_all_are_sleeping for_the rest and you_all_are_resting.
   see, the hour has_neared, and the son of_Man is_being_given_over into the_hands of_sinners.
   46 Be_being_raised, we_may_be_going.
   See the one giving_ me _over has_neared.
   47 And of_him still speaking, see, G‹H‹Youdas/(Yəhūdāh)›H›G one of_the twelve came, and with him a_ great _crowd with swords and clubs from the chief_priests and elders of_the people.
   48 And the one giving_over him, gave to_them a_sign saying: Whomever I_may_kiss, it_is he, apprehend him.
   49 And immediately having_approached to_G‹H‹Yēsous he_said: Greetings, my_great_one, and he_kissed him.
   50 And G‹H‹Yēsous said to_him: Friend, For what are_you_coming.
   Then having_approached, they_laid_on their hands on G‹H‹Yēsous, and they_apprehended him.
   51 And see, one of_the ones with G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, having_stretched_out his hand, drew_out the sword of_him and having_struck the slave of_the chief_priest, cut_off the ear of_him.
   52 Then G‹H‹Yēsous is_saying to_him: Turn_away the sword of_you into the place of_it, for all the ones having_taken the_sword, will_be_perishing by the_sword.
   53 Or are_you_supposing that I_am_ not _being_able now to_appeal the father of_me, and he_will_be_standing_before more twelve of_army_divisions of_angels before_me.
   54 Therefore how may_ The scriptures _be_fulfilled, that thus it_is_fitting to_become.
   55 In that hour, G‹H‹Yēsous said to_the crowds, you_all_came_out with swords and clubs to_capture me As against a_robber.
   In_every day in the temple, I_was_sitting teaching, and you_all_ not _apprehended me.
   56 But this all has_become, in_order_that the things scriptures of_the prophets may_be_fulfilled.
   Then all the apprentices/followers, having_left him fled.
   57 And the ones having_apprehended G‹H‹Yēsous, led_away him to G‹Kaiafas›G the chief_priest, where the scribes and the elders were_gathered_together.
   58 But G‹Petros›G was_following after_him from afar to the courtyard of_the chief_priest, and having_come_in inside, he_was_sitting with the attendants to_see the outcome.
   59 And the chief_priests and the whole council were_seeking false_witness against G‹H‹Yēsous, so_that they_may_put_ him _to_death, 60 but of_many having_approached false_witnesses.
   they_ not _found, But later having_approached two 61 said: This man was_saying: I_am_being_able to_tear_down the temple of_god, and to_build it it by of_three days.
   62 And the chief_priest having_stood_up, said to_him: Are_you_answering nothing, what these men are_testifying against_you.
   63 But G‹H‹Yēsous was_keeping_silent.
   And the chief_priest said to_him: I_am_adjuring you by the living god that you_may_tell to_us if you are the chosen_one/messiah, the son of_the god.
   64 G‹H‹Yēsous is_saying to_him: You said it.
   However I_am_saying to_you_all, from now you_all_will_be_seeing the son of_Man: sitting on the_right hand of_power, and coming in the clouds of_the sky.
   65 Then the chief_priest tore the robes of_him saying: He_slandered, why are_we_having anymore need of_witnesses.
   See now you_all_heard the slander.
   66 What is_it_supposing to_you_all.
   And answering they_said: He_is liable of_death.
   67 Then they_spat in the face of_him and they_beat him, and they slapped him 68 saying: Prophesy to_us, chosen_one, who is the one having_struck you.
   69 And G‹Petros›G was_sitting outside in the courtyard, and one servant_girl approached to_him saying: You also were_were with G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G the Rx-G‹Galilaios›G-Rx.
   70 But he disowned him before all saying: I_have_ not _known what you_are_saying.
   71 And having_come_out to the gate, another saw him and she_is_saying to_the ones there: This man was with G‹H‹Yēsous the G‹from_Nazaret›G.
   72 And again he_disowned with an_oath, I_have_ not _known the man.
   73 And after a_little the ones having_stood having_approached said to_G‹Petros›G: Truly also you are of them, for even the speech of_you is_making you evident.
   74 Then he_began to_be_cursing and to_be_swearing, I_have_ not _known the man.
   And immediately a_rooster crowed.
   75 And G‹Petros›G was_reminded of_the word of_G‹H‹Yēsous having_said, before the_rooster to_crow, you_will_be_renouncing me thrice.
   And having_come_out out, he_wept bitterly.
  Mat 27  And having_become in_the_morning, all the chief_priests and the elders of_the people took counsel against G‹H‹Yēsous, so_that to_put_ him _to_death, 2 and having_bound him they_led_away and gave_over him to_Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx the governor.
   3 Then G‹H‹Youdas/(Yəhūdāh)›H›G the one giving_ him _over having_seen, that he_was_condemned, having_been_regretful he_returned the thirty silver_coins to_the chief_priests and elders 4 saying: I_sinned having_given_over innocent blood.
   But they said: What is_it to us.
   You will_be_seeing to_it.
   5 And having_thrown_down the silver_coins into the temple, he_withdrew and having_gone_away hanged himself.
   6 And the chief_priests having_taken the silver_coins said: It_is_ not _permitting to_put them into the temple_treasury, because it_is the_price of_blood.
   7 And having_taken counsel, they_bought with them the field of_the potter, for a_burial_place for_the strangers.
   8 Therefore that field was_called, the_field of_blood to the day today.
   9 Then the word having_been_spoken by G‹H‹Yeremias/(Yirəməyāh)›H›G the prophet was_fulfilled saying: and they_took the thirty silver_coins, the price of_the one having_been_priced, whom they_priced by the_sons of_Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx, 10 and they_gave them for the field of_the potter, as the_master directed to_me.
   11 And G‹H‹Yēsous was_stood before the governor, and the governor asked him saying: Are you the king of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G.
   And G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G was_saying to_him: You are_saying it.
   12 And in that to_ him _be_being_accused by the chief_priests and the elders, he_answered nothing.
   13 Then Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx is_saying to_him: Not are_you_hearing how_many things against_you they_are_testifying.
   14 And he_ not _answered to_him to not_even one word, so_as to_be_Rx-marvelling-Rx the governor exceedingly.
   15 And concerning the_feast, the governor had_been_accustomed to_be_sending_away one prisoner to_the crowd, whom they_were_wanting.
   16 And they_were_having then the_ notable _prisoner, being_called G‹Barabbas›G.
   17 Therefore of_them having_been_gathered_together, Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx said to_them: Whom are_you_all_willing I_may_send_away to_you_all, G‹Barabbas›G or G‹H‹Yēsous, who is being_called the_chosen_one/messiah.
   18 For he_had_known that they_gave_ him _over because_of envy.
   19 But him sitting on the tribunal, the wife of_him sent_out to him saying: Let_be nothing to_you and that righteous man, for I_suffered many things today in a_dream because_of him.
   20 But the chief_priests and the elders persuaded the crowds, that they_may_request G‹Barabbas›G, and they_may_destroy G‹H‹Yēsous.
   21 And the governor answering said to_them: Which are_you_all_wanting of the two, I_may_send_away to_you_all.
   And they said, G‹Barabbas›G.
   22 Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx is_saying to_them: Therefore what may_I_do to_G‹H‹Yēsous, who is being_called the_chosen_one.
   All are_saying: Let_him_be_impaled_on_a_stake.
   23 And he was_saying: For what evil he_did.
   And they were_ exceedingly _crying_out saying: Let_him_be_impaled_on_a_stake.
   24 And Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx having_seen that it_is_benefiting nothing, but rather is_becoming a_commotion, having_taken water, he_washed_off his hands in_front_of the crowd saying: I_am innocent of the blood this righteous one, .
   You_all will_be_seeing to_it.
   25 And all the people answering said: The blood of_him is on us and on the children of_us.
   26 Then he_sent_ G‹Barabbas›G _away to_them, but having_flogged G‹H‹Yēsous, he_gave_over him, in_order_that he_may_be_impaled_on_a_stake.
   27 Then the soldiers of_the governor, having_taken G‹H‹Yēsous to the residence_of_the_governor, gathered_together all the cohort before him.
   28 And having_stripped_ him _off, they_put_around a_ scarlet _robe to_him, 29 and having_twisted_together a_crown of thorns, they_put_on it on the head of_him, and a_staff in the right hand of_him, and having_kneeled before him, they_mocked at_him saying: Greetings, the king of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G.
   30 And having_spat on him, they_took the reed, and they_were_striking him on the head of_him.
   31 And when they_mocked at_him, they_stripped_ the robe _off him and they_dressed_ him _in the clothes of_him, and they_led_ him _away into the place to_impale_on_a_stake him.
   32 And coming_out, they_found a_man a_G‹from_Kurēnē›G, by_the_name Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx.
   This one they_compelled that he_may_carry the cross of_him.
   33 And having_come to a_place being_called G‹H‹Golgotha/(Guləggolet)›H›G, which is being_called place of_the_skull.
   34 They_gave to_him wine having_been_mixed with gall to_drink, and having_tasted it, he_ not _willed to_drink it.
   35 And having_impaled_ him _on_a_stake, they_divided the clothes of_him throwing a_lot, 36 and sitting they_were_guarding him there.
   37 And they_put_on over the head of_him the charge of_him having_been_written: this is G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, the king of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G.
   38 Then two robbers are_being_impaled_on_a_stake with him, one on the_right, and one on the_left.
   39 And the ones passing_through were_slandering him, shaking the heads of_them 40 and saying: You tearing_down the temple and building it in three days, save yourself, if you_are the_son, of_god, come_down from the cross.
   41 Likewise the chief_priests with the scribes and elders mocking were_saying, 42 He_saved others, he_is_ not _able to_save himself.
   He_Is king of_Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx, let_him_come_down now from the cross, and we_will_be_believing in him.
   43 He_has_trusted in god, let_him_rescue now if he_is_wanting him.
   For he_said, I_am the_son of_god.
   44 And the same also the robbers, the ones having_been_impaled_on_a_stake_with with him, were_deriding him.
   45 And from the_sixth hour, darkness became over all the land until the_hour ninth.
   46 And about the ninth hour, G‹H‹Yēsous shouted with_a_voice loud saying: Eloi, Eloi, lema sabachthani.
   This is: god of_me, god of_me, for_ why _reason you_abandoned me.
   47 And some of_the ones having_stood there having_heard were_saying, This man is_calling G‹H‹Ēlias/('Ēliyyāh)›H›G.
   48 And immediately one of them having_run and having_taken a_sponge, and having_filled it with_wine_vinegar and having_put_around it around_a_reed, was_giving_ him _to_drink.
   49 But the rest were_saying: Leave it, we_may_see whether G‹H‹Ēlias is_coming going_to_save him.
   and another having_taken a_spear pierced the side of_him and water and blood came_out.
   50 And G‹H‹Yēsous again having_cried_out with_a_ loud _voice, left his spirit.
   51 And see, the curtain of_the temple was_torn into two from top to bottom, and the earth was_shaken, and the rocks were_divided, 52 and the tombs were_opened_up, and many bodies of_the holy ones having_been_fallen_asleep was_raised, 53 and having_come_out out_of the tombs after the resurrection of_him, they_came_in into the holy city and were_manifested to_many.
   54 And the centurion and the ones with him guarding G‹H‹Yēsous, having_seen the earthquake and the things having_become, were_ exceedingly _afraid saying: Truly this one was son of_god.
   55 And there were many women observing from afar, who followed after_G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G from G‹H‹Galilaia/(Gālīl)›H›G serving unto_him, 56 among whom was G‹H‹Maria/(Mirəyām)›H›G the G‹from_Magdala›G, and G‹H‹Maria the mother of_G‹H‹Yakōbos/(Ya'aqov)›H›G and of_G‹H‹Yōsēs/(Yōşēf?)›H›G, and the mother of_the sons of_G‹Zebedaios›G.
   57 And having_become evening, a_ rich _man from G‹Arimathaia›G, namely G‹H‹Yōsēf/(Yōşēf)›H›G, who also himself apprentice/followerd to_G‹H‹Yēsous came.
   58 This one having_approached to_Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx, requested the body of_G‹H‹Yēsous.
   Then Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx commanded it to_be_given_back.
   59 and having_taken the body, G‹H‹Yōsēf wrapped it in_a_ clean _linen_cloth, 60 and put it in the new tomb of_him, which he_hewn in the rock, and having_rolled a_ great _stone to_the door of_the tomb, he_went_away.
   61 And G‹H‹Maria the G‹from_Magdala›G was there and the other G‹H‹Maria, sitting in_front_of the tomb.
   62 And on_the day of_next, which is after the preparation day, the chief_priests and the G‹Farisaios_sect›G were_gathered_together to Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx 63 saying: Sir, we_were_reminded that that deceiver still living said: I_am_being_raised after three days.
   64 Therefore command the tomb to_be_secured until the third day, lest the apprentices/followers having_come may_steal him and they_may_say to_the people: He_was_raised from the dead, and the last deception will_be worse than the first.
   65 And Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx was_saying to_them: You_all_are_having a_guard, be_going to_secure it as you_all_have_known.
   66 And they having_been_gone secured the tomb, having_sealed the stone with the guard.
  Mat 28  And after the_sabbaths, at_the time dawning toward the_first day of_the_week, G‹H‹Maria the G‹from_Magdala›G and the other G‹H‹Maria came, to_observe the tomb.
   2 And see, an_ great _earthquake became, for an_angel of_the_master having_come_down from heaven and having_approached, rolled_away the stone and was_sitting on it.
   3 And the appearance of_him was as lightning, and the clothing of_him white as snow.
   4 And the ones guarding were_shaken from the fear of_him, and were_become as dead men.
   5 And the angel answering said to_the women: Be_ not _fearing you_all, for I_have_known that you_all_are_seeking G‹H‹Yēsous, the one having_been_impaled_on_a_stake.
   6 He_is not here, for he_was_raised as he_said.
   Come see the place where he_was_lying.
   7 And having_been_gone quickly, say to_the apprentices/followers of_him that he_was_raised from the dead, and see, he_is_going_before you_all into G‹H‹Galilaia/(Gālīl)›H›G, you_all_will_be_seeing him there.
   See I_told to_you_all.
   8 And having_gone_away quickly from the tomb, with fear and great joy, they_ran to_report to_the apprentices/followers of_him.
   9 And see, G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G met with_them saying: Greetings.
   And the women having_approached, took_hold_of the feet of_him and they_worshipped before_him.
   10 Then G‹H‹Yēsous is_saying to_them: Be_ not _fearing.
   Be_going report to_the brothers of_me that they_may_go_away into G‹H‹Galilaia, and they_will_be_seeing me there.
   11 And them going, see, some of_the guard having_come into the city, reported to_the chief_priests all the things having_become.
   12 And having_been_gathered_together with the elders, and having_taken counsel, they_gave many silver_coins to_the soldiers 13 saying: Say : The apprentices/followers of_him having_come by_night stole him, of_us falling_asleep.
   14 And if this may_be_heard by the governor, we will_be_persuading him and we_will_be_making you_all unanxious.
   15 And having_taken the_silver_coins they did as they_were_taught.
   And this word was_spread_abroad among the_G‹Youdaiōns›G until the today 16 But the the_eleven apprentices/followers were_gone into G‹H‹Galilaia, to the mountain where G‹H‹Yēsous determined for_them.
   17 And having_seen him they_worshipped, but they doubted.
   18 And G‹H‹Yēsous having_approached, spoke to_them saying, all authority in heaven and on earth /Was/_given to_me.
   19 Therefore having_been_gone, apprentice/follower all the nations, immersing them in the name of_the father, and of_the son, and of_the holy spirit, 20 teaching them to_be_keeping all things as_much_as I_commanded to_you_all.
   And see, I am with you_all all the days, until the completion of_the age.

USFM file edited 2022-09-24 17:40 by ScriptedBibleEditor v0.14

Rx-G‹Markos›G-Rx

1  The_beginning of_the gospel of_G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G chosen_one/messiah, son of_god.
   2 As it_has_been_written in G‹H‹Ēsaias/(Yəsha'əyāh)›H›G the prophet: see, I_am_sending_out the messenger of_me before the_face of_you, who will_be_preparing the way of_you.
   3 The_voice of_a_shouting one in the desert: Prepare the way of_the_master, be_making the paths of_him straight.
   4 G‹Yōannēs›G, the one immersing in the desert Became, and proclaiming a_immersion of_repentance for forgiveness of_sins.
   5 And all the Rx-G‹Youdaia›G-Rx region and all of_the G‹H‹ones_from_Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G was_going_out to him, and they_were_being_immersed by him in the G‹H‹Yordanēs/(Yarəddēn)›H›G river, confessing the sins of_them.
   6 And G‹Yōannēs›G was having_dressed_in hairs of_a_camel, and a_ leather _belt around the waist of_him, and eating locusts and wild honey.
   7 And he_was_proclaiming saying, the one mightier than me Is_coming after me, of_whom I_am not worthy, having_bent_down to_untie the strap of_the sandals of_him.
   8 I immersed you_all with_water, but he will_be_immersing you_all the_ holy _spirit.
   9 And it_became in those days, G‹H‹Yēsous came from G‹Nazaret›G of_G‹H‹Galilaia/(Gālīl)›H›G, and he_was_immersed in the G‹H‹Yordanēs by G‹Yōannēs›G.
   10 And immediately going_up from the water, he_saw the heavens being_divided, and the spirit as a_dove coming_down on him.
   11 And a_voice became out_of the heavens: You are the beloved son of_me, I_took_pleasure in you.
   12 And immediately the spirit is_sending_ him _forth into the desert.
   13 And he_was in the desert forty days, being_tempted by G‹H‹Satan/(Sāţān)›H›G, and he_was with the wild_beasts, and the angels were_serving unto_him.
   14 And After G‹Yōannēs›G to_be_given_over, G‹H‹Yēsous came into G‹H‹Galilaia, proclaiming the gospel of_god 15 saying, The time has_been_fulfilled and the kingdom of_god has_neared, be_repenting and be_believing in the gospel.
   16 And passing_by by the sea of_G‹H‹Galilaia, he_saw Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx and G‹Andreas›G, the brother of_Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx, throwing a_net in the sea, for they_were fishermen.
   17 And G‹H‹Yēsous said to_them: Come after me, and I_will_be_making you_all to_become fishermen of_people.
   18 And immediately having_left their nets, they_followed after_him.
   19 And having_advanced little, he_saw G‹H‹Yakōbos/(Ya'aqov)›H›G the son of_G‹Zebedaios›G, and G‹Yōannēs›G the brother of_him, also them in the boat preparing the nets.
   20 And immediately he_called them.
   And having_left G‹Zebedaios›G the father of_them in the boat with the hired_hands, they_went_away after him.
   21 And they_are_entering_in into G‹Kafarna'oum›G.
   And immediately on_the sabbaths, having_come_in into the synagogue, he_was_teaching.
   22 And they_were_being_astonished at the teaching of_him, for he_was teaching them as one having authority, and not as the scribes.
   23 And immediately a_man with a_ unclean _spirit was in the synagogue of_them, and he_cried_out 24 saying: What to_us and you, G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G G‹Nazarēnos›G.
   You_came to_destroy us.
   I_have_known who you are, the holy Rx-one-Rx of_god.
   25 And G‹H‹Yēsous gave_rebuke to_him saying: Be_silenced and come_out out_of him.
   26 And the unclean spirit having_convulsed him, and having_called with_a_ loud _voice, it_came_out from him.
   27 And all were_amazed, so_as to_be_debating them saying: What is this.
   a_teaching new, with authority he_is_commanding even to_the unclean spirits, and they_are_submitting to_him.
   28 And the report of_him came_out immediately everywhere into all the surrounding_region of_G‹H‹Galilaia/(Gālīl)›H›G.
   29 And immediately having_come_out out_of the synagogue, he_came into the house of_Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx and G‹Andreas›G, with G‹H‹Yakōbos and G‹Yōannēs›G.
   30 And the mother_in_law of_Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx was_lying being_feverish, and immediately they_are_speaking to_him about her.
   31 And having_approached, he_raised her, having_taken_hold of_her hand.
   And the fever left her, and she_was_serving unto_them.
   32 And having_become evening, when the sun set, they_were_bringing all the ones being sickly and the ones being_demon_possessed to him.
   33 And all the city was having_been_gathered_together at the door.
   34 And he_healed many being sickly of_various diseases, and many demons he_throw_out, and he_was_ not _allowing the demons, to_be_speaking because they_had_known him.
   to_be chosen_one/messiah.
   35 And exceedingly early in_the_night, having_risen_up he_came_out and went_away into a_ desolate _place, and_there he_was_praying.
   36 And Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx and the ones with him searched_for him, 37 and they_found him and they_are_saying to_him, All are_seeking you.
   38 And he_is_saying to_them: We_may_be_going elsewhere into the neighboring villages, in_order_that also there I_may_proclaim, for for this reason I_came_out.
   39 And he_came proclaiming, in the synagogues of_them in all G‹H‹Galilaia, and throwing_out demons.
   40 And a_leper is_coming to him, imploring him saying to_him, If you_may_be_willing, you_are_being_able to_cleanse me.
   41 And having_been_feeling_compassion, having_stretched_out his hand of_him, he_touched and is_saying to_him: I_am_willing, be_cleansed.
   42 And immediately the leprosy went_away from him, and he_was_cleansed.
   43 And having_admonished to_him, immediately sent_ him _forth, 44 and he_is_saying to_him: Be_seeing, you_may_speak to_no_one, but be_going, show yourself to_the priest, and offer for the cleansing of_you which G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G commanded, for a_testimony to_them.
   45 But he having_come_out began to_be_proclaiming much and to_be_spreading_abroad the word, so_that no_longer him to_be_able to_come_ openly _in into the_city, but he_was outside in desolate places, and they_were_coming to him on_every_side.
  Mrk 2  And having_come_in again into G‹Kafarna'oum›G through days, it_was_heard that he_is in the_house.
   2 And many were_gathered_together, so_that no_longer to_be_having_room, not even at the door, and he_was_speaking the word to_them.
   3 And they_are_coming bringing a_paralytic to him, being_carried by four.
   4 And not being_able to_bring to_him because_of the crowd, they_unroofed the roof where he_was, and having_dug_out it, they_are_lowering the pallet where the paralytic was_lying.
   5 And G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G having_seen the faith of_them, he_is_saying to_the paralytic: Child, the sins of_you have_been_forgiven.
   6 But some of_the scribes were there, sitting and reasoning in the hearts of_them, 7 Why is_ this man _speaking thus.
   He_is_slandering.
   Who is_able to_be_forgiving sins, except one god.
   8 And G‹H‹Yēsous immediately having_known in_the spirit of_him that they_are_reasoning thus in themselves, he_is_saying to_them: Why these things to_be_reasoning in the hearts of_you_all.
   9 Which is easier, to_say to_the paralytic: The sins have_been_forgiven to_you.
   or to_say: Be_raising and take_up the pallet of_you and be_walking.
   10 But in_order_that you_all_may_have_known that the son of_Man is_having authority on the earth to_be_forgiving sins, (he_is_saying to_the paralytic), 11 To_you I_am_saying, be_raising take_up the pallet of_you, and be_going to the home of_you.
