   12 And he_was_raised, and immediately having_taken_up the pallet, he_came_out before all, so_as all to_be_marvelling, and to_be_glorifying god saying, we_ never _saw.
   Thus 13 And he_came_out again beside the sea, and all the crowd was_coming to him, and he_was_teaching them.
   14 And passing_by he_saw Rx-G‹H‹Leui/(Lēvī)›H›G-Rx the son of_G‹Alfaios›G, sitting at the tax_office, and is_saying to_him: Be_following after_me.
   And having_risen_up, he_followed after_him.
   15 And is_becoming him to_be_reclining in the house of_him, and many tax_collectors and sinners were_reclining with_G‹H‹Yēsous and the apprentices/followers of_him, for they_were many, and they_were_following after_him.
   16 And the scribes of_the G‹Farisaios_sect›G, having_seen that he_is_eating with the sinners and the tax_collectors, they_were_saying to_the apprentices/followers of_him, sinners the he_is_eating with the tax_collectors and.
   17 And having_heard, G‹H‹Yēsous is_saying to_them: The ones being_strong are_ not _having need of_a_physician, but the ones being sickly.
   I_came not to_call the_righteous, but sinners.
   18 And the apprentices/followers of_G‹Yōannēs›G and the G‹Farisaios_sect›G were fasting.
   And they_are_coming and they_are_saying to_him: for_ Why _reason the apprentices/followers of_G‹Yōannēs›G and the apprentices/followers of_the G‹Farisaios_sect›G are_fasting, but the your apprentices/followers are_ not _fasting.
   19 And G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G said to_them, the sons of_the bridal_chamber in which the bridegroom with them is Not are_being_able to_be_fasting.
   As_long_as time they_are_having the bridegroom with them, are_ not _being_able to_be_fasting.
   20 But days will_be_coming whenever the bridegroom may_be_taken_away from them, and then they_will_be_fasting in that day.
   21 No_one is_sewing_on a_patch of_ unshrunken _cloth on a_ old _garment, and if not the patch is_tearing_away from it new from_the old, and is_becoming a_worse tear.
   22 And no_one is_putting new wine into old wineskins, and if not the wine will_be_bursting the wineskins, and the wine and the wineskins.
   is_being_destroyed But new wine into new wineskins.
   placeable is.
   23 And it_became, him on the sabbaths to_be_passing_through through the grainfields, and the apprentices/followers of_him began to_be_making way, plucking the heads_of_grain.
   24 And the G‹Farisaios_sect›G were_saying to_him: See why they_are_doing on_the sabbaths what it_is_ not _permitting.
   25 And he_is_saying to_them: You_all_ never _read what G‹H‹Dauid/(Dāvid)›H›G did, when he_had need and he and the ones with him hungered.
   26 How he_came_in into the house of_god during G‹H‹Abiathar/('Evəyātār)›H›G the_chief_priest, and ate the bread of_the presence, which it_is_ not _permitting to_eat, except the priests, and he_gave even to_the ones being with him.
   , 27 And he_was_saying to_them: The sabbath became because_of the person, and not the person because_of the sabbath.
   28 So_then the son of_Man is master also of_the sabbath.
  Mrk 3  And he_came_in again into the_synagogue, and a_man was there, having the hand having_been_withered.
   2 And they_were_watching_ him _closely, whether he_will_be_healing him on_the sabbaths, in_order_that they_may_accuse against_him.
   3 And he_is_saying to_the man having the withered, hand Be_raising in the midst.
   4 And he_is_saying to_them: Is_it_permitting on_the sabbaths to_do_good or to_do_evil, to_save life or to_kill_off.
   But they were_keeping_silent.
   5 And having_looked_around them with anger, grieving at the to_hardening of_the heart of_them, he_is_saying to_the man: Stretch_out the hand of_you.
   And he_stretched_out it, and the hand of_him was_restored.
   6 And the G‹Farisaios_sect›G having_come_out, immediately with the G‹supporters_of_Hērōdēs›G they_produced counsel against him, so_that they_may_destroy him.
   7 And G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G with the apprentices/followers of_him, withdrew to the sea, and a_great multitude from G‹H‹Galilaia/(Gālīl)›H›G and from Rx-G‹Youdaia›G-Rx followed, 8 and from G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G, and from G‹Idoumaia›G, and beyond the G‹H‹Yordanēs/(Yarəddēn)›H›G, and around G‹H‹Turos/(Tsor)›H›G and G‹H‹Sidōn/(Tsīdōn)›H›G, a_ great _multitude hearing as_much_as he_was_doing, came to him.
   9 And he_told to_the apprentices/followers of_him that a_little_boat may_be_continuing with_him because_of the crowd, in_order_that they _may_ not _be_crowding him.
   10 For he_healed many, so_that as_many_as were_having afflictions to_be_pressing_on on_him, in_order_that may_touch against_him.
   11 And the unclean spirits, whenever they_were_observing him, they_were_falling_before to_him and were_crying_out saying, You are the son of_god.
   12 And he_was_warning much to_them that they_may_ not _make him manifest.
   13 And he_is_going_up on the mountain, and is_calling_to whom he was_wanting, and they_went_away to him.
   14 And he_established twelve, which also he_named ambassadors, in_order_that they_may_be with him, and in_order_that he_may_be_sending_ them _out to_be_proclaiming 15 and to_be_having authority to_be_throwing_out demons.
   16 And he_established the twelve: and /he/_added_on the_name G‹Petros›G to_Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx, 17 and G‹H‹Yakōbos/(Ya'aqov)›H›G the son of_the G‹Zebedaios›G, and G‹Yōannēs›G the brother of_G‹H‹Yakōbos, and he_added_on to_them the_names Boanerges, which is sons of_thunder, 18 and G‹Andreas›G, and Rx-G‹Filippos›G-Rx, and G‹Bartholomaios›G, and G‹Matthaios›G, and G‹Thōmas›G, and G‹H‹Yakōbos the son of_G‹Alfaios›G, and G‹Thaddaios›G, and Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx the G‹member_of_Kananitēs›G, 19 and G‹H‹Youdas/(Yəhūdāh)›H›G G‹Iskariōtēs›G, who also gave_ him _over.
   20 And he_is_coming to a_house, and the crowd is_coming_together again, so_that them to_ not _be_able to_ not _eat bread.
   21 And the ones with him having_heard it, they_came_out to_apprehend him, for they_were_saying He_flipped_out.
   22 And the scribes, having_come_down from G‹H‹Hierousalēm were_saying, he_is_having G‹Be'elzeboul›G, and, He_is_throwing_out the demons by the ruler of_the demons.
   23 And having_called_to them, he_was_saying to_them in parables: How is_ G‹H‹Satan/(Sāţān)›H›G _able to_be_throwing_out G‹H‹Satan.
   24 And if a_kingdom may_be_divided against itself, that kingdom is_ not _able to_be_established.
   25 And if a_house may_be_divided against itself, that house will_ not _be_able to_be_established.
   26 And if G‹H‹Satan rose_up against himself and was_divided, he_is_ not _able to_stand, but is_having an_end.
   27 But no_one is_ not _able having_come_in into the house of_the strong man to_thoroughly_plunder the goods of_him, if not first he_may_bind the strong man, and then he_will_be_thoroughly_plundering the house of_him.
   28 Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all that all the sins will_be_being_forgiven to_the sons of_men and as_many_as the slander, they_may_slander.
   29 But whoever may_slander against the holy spirit, is_ not _having forgiveness to eternity, but is liable of_eternal sin, 30 because they_were_saying: He_is_having a_ unclean _spirit.
   31 And the mother of_him and the brothers of_him, are_coming, and standing outside, they_sent_out to him calling him.
   32 And the_crowd was_sitting around him, and, they_are_saying to_him: See the mother of_you and the brothers of_you, are_seeking you outside.
   33 And answering to_them he_is_saying: Who is the mother of_me, and the brothers of_me.
   34 And having_looked_around the ones around him, sitting around he_is_saying: See the mother of_me and the brothers of_me.
   35 For whoever may_do the will of_god, this one is the_brother of_me and the_sister and the_mother.
  Mrk 4  And again he_began to_be_teaching beside the sea.
   And a_ very_great _crowd is_being_gathered_together to him, so_that him having_boarded into the boat, to_be_sitting in the sea, and all the crowd were on the land to the sea.
   2 And he_was_teaching them many things in parables, and was_saying to_them in the teaching of_him, 3 Be_hearing.
   See the one sowing came_out to_sow.
   4 And it_became at the time to_be_sowing, some indeed fell along the road, and the birds came and devoured it.
   5 And other fell on the rocky place, and where it_was_ not _having much soil, and immediately sprang_up because_of the to_ not _be_having depth of_soil, 6 and when the sun rose it_was_scorched, and because_of the depth to_be_having no root it_was_withered.
   7 And other fell among the thorns, and the thorns went_up and choked it, and it_ not _gave fruit.
   8 And others fell on the good soil, and it_was_giving fruit, going_up and being_grown, and it_was_bearing in thirty, and in sixty, and in a_hundred.
   9 And he_was_saying: Who is_having ears to_be_hearing, let_him_be_hearing.
   10 And when he_became with only them, they with the twelve about him were_asking him the parables.
   11 And he_was_saying to_them: To_you_all the mystery of_the kingdom of_god, has_been_given, but to_those who are outside, all the things is_becoming in parables, 12 in_order_that seeing, they_may_be_seeing and may_ not _perceive, and hearing, they_may_be_hearing and may_ not _be_understanding, lest they_may_turn_back and it_may_be_forgiven to_them.
   13 And he_is_saying to_them: You_all_have_ not _known this parable, and how all the parables you_all_will_be_knowing.
   14 The one sowing is_sowing the word.
   15 And these are the ones along the road, where the word is_being_sown, and whenever they_may_hear, G‹H‹Satan/(Sāţān)›H›G immediately is_coming, and is_carrying the word having_been_sown in them.
   16 And these are likewise the ones being_sown on the rocky places, who whenever they_may_hear the word, are_receiving it immediately with joy, 17 and they_are_ not _having root in themselves, but are temporary, thereafter tribulation or persecution having_become because_of the word, immediately they_are_being_stumbled.
   18 And others are the ones being_sown among the thorns, these are the ones having_heard the word, 19 and the worries of_the age, and the seduction of_the riches, and the desires for other things entering_in, are_choking the word, and it_is_becoming unfruitful.
   20 And those are the ones having_been_sown on the the good soil, who are_hearing the word and are_accepting it and are_bearing_fruit, in thirty, and in sixty, and in a_hundred.
   21 And he_was_saying to_them: Surely_not the lamp is_coming, in_order_that it_may_be_put under the basket, or under the bed.
   Not in_order_that it_may_be_put on the lampstand.
   22 For there_is not hidden, if not in_order_that it_may_be_revealed, and_not it_became a_secret, but in_order_that it_may_come to manifest.
   23 If anyone is_having ears to_be_hearing, let_him_be_hearing.
   24 And he_was_saying to_them: Be_watching_out what you_all_are_hearing.
   With what measure you_all_are_measuring it_will_be_being_measured to_you_all, and it_will_be_being_added to_you_all.
   25 For whoever is_having, it_will_be_being_given to_him, and who is_ not _having, even what he_is_having will_be_being_taken_away from him.
   26 And he_was_saying: Thus is the kingdom of_god: as a_man may_throw the seed on the earth, 27 and he_may_be_sleeping and may_be_being_raised night and he day, and the seed may_be_sprouting and may_be_growing, has_ not _known how.
   28 the earth is_bearing_fruit Automatic: first a_blade, thereafter a_head_of_grain, thereafter full grain in the head_of_grain.
   29 But whenever may_give_over the fruit, immediately he_is_sending_out the sickle, because the harvest has_presented.
   30 And he_was_saying: How may_we_liken the kingdom of_god, or with what parable we_may_present.
   it 31 As to_a_seed of_mustard, which whenever it_may_be_sown on the earth, being smaller than all the seeds which on the earth, 32 and whenever it_may_be_sown, is_going_up and is_becoming greater than all the garden_plants, and is_producing great branches, so_that the birds of_the sky to_be_able to_be_nesting under the shadow of_it.
   33 And with_ many _such parables, he_was_speaking the word to_them, as they_were_able to_be_hearing, 34 and he_was_ not _speaking without parable to_them, by but himself to_his own apprentices/followers, he_was_explaining all things.
   35 And he_is_saying to_them on that day having_become evening: We_may_pass_through to the side across.
   36 And having_left the crowd, they_are_taking him as he_was in the boat.
   And other boats was with him.
   37 And a_storm of_ great _wind is_becoming, and the waves was_breaking_down into the boat, so_that already the boat to_be_being_filled.
   38 And he was in the stern, sleeping on the cushion.
   And they_are_awaking him and are_saying to_him: Teacher, is_ not _caring to_you that we_are_perishing.
   39 And having_been_awoke, he_gave_rebuke to_the wind and said to_the sea: Be_keeping_silent, be_silenced.
   And the wind died_down, and became a_ great _calm.
   40 And he_said to_them: Why are_you_all fearful.
   You_all_are_ not_yet _having faith.
   41 And they_were_afraid with_ great _fear, and they_were_saying to one_another: Who consequently is this, that both the wind and the sea is_submitting to_him.
   Mrk 5  And they_came to the side across the sea, to the region of_the G‹Gerasēnōn›G.
   2 And him having_come_out out_of the boat, a_man out_of the tombs with a_ unclean _spirit met, with_him, 3 who was_having his dwelling in the tombs, and no_one was_able to_bind him no_longer not_even, with_chain, 4 because_of that him often to_have_bound with_shackles and chains, and the chains and the shackles to_have_torn_apart by him to_have_broken, and no_one was_able to_tame him.
   5 And through all night and day in the tombs and in the mountains, he_was crying_out and bruising himself with_stones.
   6 And having_seen G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G from afar, he_ran and worshipped him, 7 and having_cried_out with_a_voice loud he_is_saying: What to_me and to_you G‹H‹Yēsous, son of_ The highest _god.
   I_am_imploring you by_god, you_may_ not _torment me.
   8 For he_was_saying to_him: Come_out, out_of the man you unclean spirit.
   9 And he_was_asking him: What is the_name of_you.
   And he_is_saying to_him: Many_thousands is the_name to_me, because we_are many.
   10 And he_was_imploring him much that he_may_ not _send_out them out the country.
   11 And was there near the mountain, a_ great _herd of_pigs being_fed, 12 and they_implored him saying: Send us into the pigs, in_order_that we_may_come_in into them.
   13 And he_permitted to_them.
   And the unclean spirits having_come_out, came_in into the pigs, and the herd about two_thousand rushed down the steep_bank into the sea, and they_were_being_drowned in the sea.
   14 And the ones feeding them fled, and they_reported to the city and to the country.
   And came_out to_see what is the thing having_become.
   15 And they_are_coming to G‹H‹Yēsous, and they_are_observing the man being_demon_possessed sitting, having_been_clothed and being_sensible, the one having_had the Many_thousands, and they_were_afraid.
   16 And the ones having_seen it described to_them, how it_became to_the one being_demon_possessed, and concerning the pigs.
   17 And they_began to_be_imploring him to_go_away from the regions of_them.
   18 And him boarding into the boat, the one having_been_demon_possessed was_begging him that he_may_be with him.
   19 And he_ not _allowed him, but he_is_saying to_him: Be_going to the home of_you, to your people, and report to_them as_much_as the master has_done for_you, and he_showed_mercy to_you.
   20 And he_went_away and began to_be_proclaiming in the G‹Dekapolis›G, as_much_as G‹H‹Yēsous did for_him, and all were_Rx-marvelling-Rx.
   21 And G‹H‹Yēsous having_crossed_over in the boat again to the side across, a_ great _crowd was_gathered_together to him, and he_was beside the sea.
   22 And see, one of_the synagogue_leaders by_the_name G‹Yaeiros›G is_coming, and having_seen him, is_falling at the feet of_him, 23 and he_is_imploring him much saying, The little_daughter of_me is_holding to_the_end, in_order_that having_come, you_may_lay_on the hands on_her, in_order_that she_may_be_healed and may_live.
   24 And he_went_away with him.
   And a_ great _crowd was_following after_him, and they_were_pressing_on him.
   25 And a_woman being twelve years with a_hemorrhage of_blood, 26 and much having_suffered under many physicians, and having_spent all the things by herself, and having_been_benefited nothing, but rather having_come to the worse, 27 having_heard the things concerning G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, having_come behind in the crowd, she_touched against_the garment of_him.
   28 For she_was_saying If I_may_touch even_if against_the garments of_him, I_will_be_being_healed.
   29 And immediately the flow of_the blood of_her was_dried_up, and she_knew in_her body that she_has_been_healed from the affliction.
   30 And immediately G‹H‹Yēsous, having_known in himself the power having_come_out out_of him, having_been_turned_back in the crowd he_was_saying: Who touched against_the clothes of_me.
   31 And the apprentices/followers of_him were_saying to_him: You_are_seeing the crowd pressing_on you, and you_are_saying: Who touched against_me.
   32 And he_was_looking_around to_see the woman having_done this.
   33 And the woman, having_been_afraid and trembling, having_known what has_become to_her, came and fell_before to_him, and told all the truth to_him.
   34 And he said to_her: Daughter, the faith of_you has_healed you, be_going in peace, and be healthy from the affliction of_you.
   35 Still of_him speaking, they_are_coming from the synagogue_leader saying, The daughter of_you died_off, why you_are_ still _troubling the teacher.
   36 But G‹H‹Yēsous having_overheard the word being_spoken is_saying to_the the_synagogue_leader: Be_ not _fearing, only be_believing.
   37 And he_ not _allowed no_one with him to_accompany, except G‹Petros›G, and G‹H‹Yakōbos/(Ya'aqov)›H›G, and G‹Yōannēs›G the brother of_G‹H‹Yakōbos.
   38 And they_are_coming to the house of_the the_synagogue_leader, and he_is_observing a_commotion, and weeping and much screaming.
   39 And having_come_in he_is_saying to_them: Why you_all_are_being_distressed and you_all_are_weeping.
   The little_child not died_off, but is_sleeping.
   40 And they_were_ridiculing of_him.
   But he having_throw_ all _out, is_taking the father of_the little_child, and the mother, and the ones with him, and he_is_entering_in where the little_child was.
   41 And having_taken_hold of_the hand of_the little_child, he_is_saying to_her: Talitha, koum.
   Which is being_translated little_girl, I_am_saying to_you, be_raising.
   42 And immediately the little_girl rose_up and she_was_walking, for she_was twelve of_years.
   And they_marvelled immediately with_ great _amazement.
   43 And he_ much _instructed to_them that no_one may_know this, and he_said to_be_given to_her something to_eat.
  Mrk 6  And he_came_out from_there, and he_is_coming into the hometown of_him, and the apprentices/followers of_him are_following after_him.
   2 And of_the_sabbath having_become, he_began to_be_teaching in the synagogue, and many hearing were_being_astonished saying: From_where these things, to_this man, and what is the wisdom having_been_given to_this one, and the such miracles becoming by the hands of_him.
   3 Is not this the carpenter, the son of_G‹H‹Maria/(Mirəyām)›H›G, and brother of_G‹H‹Yakōbos, and G‹H‹Yōsēs/(Yōşēf?)›H›G, and G‹H‹Youdas/(Yəhūdāh)›H›G, and Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx.
   And are not.
   the sisters of_him here with us.
   And they_were_being_offended at him.
   4 And G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G was_saying to_them, A_prophet is not dishonorable, except in the hometown of_him, and among the relatives of_him, and in the house of_him.
   5 And he_was_ not _able there to_do not_one miracle, except for_a_few sick, having_laid_on the hands, he_healed them.
   6 And he_marvelled because_of the unbelief of_them.
   And he_was_going_around the villages, around teaching.
   7 And he_is_calling_to the twelve, and began to_be_sending_ them _out two by_two, and was_giving authority to_them over_the unclean spirits.
   8 And he_commanded to_them that they_may_be_taking_away nothing for journey, except only a_staff, not bread, not a_knapsack, not in the belt money, 9 but having_tied_on sandals, and you_all_may_ not _dress_in two tunics.
   10 And he_was_saying to_them: Wherever you_all_may_come_in into a_house, be_remaining there until you_all_may_come_out from_there.
   11 And whatever place may_ not _receive you_all, nor may_they_hear from_you_all, going_out from_there, shake_off the dust which beneath the feet of_you_all, for a_testimony to_them.
   12 And having_come_out, they_proclaimed that they_may_be_repenting.
   13 And they_were_throwing_out many demons, and they_were_anointing many sick with_olive_oil and they_were_healing them.
   14 And king Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx heard, for the name of_him became manifest, and he_was_saying, G‹Yōannēs›G the one immersing has_been_raised from the_dead, and because_of this the miracles are_working in in_him.
   15 But others were_saying, He_is G‹H‹Ēlias/('Ēliyyāh)›H›G, and others were_saying, A_prophet, like one of_the prophets.
   16 But having_heard, Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx was_saying, G‹Yōannēs›G whom I beheaded, this was_raised.
   17 For himself Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx, having_sent_out apprehended G‹Yōannēs›G, and bound him in prison because_of G‹Hērōidias›G, the wife of_Rx-G‹Filippos›G-Rx, the brother of_him, because he_married her.
   18 For G‹Yōannēs›G was_saying to_Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx, It_is_ not _permitting for_you to_be_having the wife of_the brother of_you.
   19 And G‹Hērōidias›G was_resenting him, and was_wanting to_kill_ him _off, and he_was_ not _able, 20 for Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx was_fearing G‹Yōannēs›G, having_known him as_a_ righteous and holy _man, and was_preserving him, and having_heard from_him, he_was_perplexing much, and he_was_hearing gladly from_him.
   21 And having_become a_ opportune _day, when Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx on_the birthday_celebrations of_him made a_supper, to_the magnates of_him, and to_the commanders, and to_the leaders of_G‹H‹Galilaia/(Gālīl)›H›G.
   22 And of_G‹Hērōidias›G the daughter for_him, having_come_in, and having_danced she_brought_pleasure to_Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx and the ones reclining.
   And the king said to_the little_girl: Ask me whatever you_may_be_wanting, and I_will_be_giving it to_you.
   23 And he_swore to_her, Whatever If you_may_ask me, I_will_be_giving to_you, up_to half of_the kingdom of_me.
   24 And having_come_out, she_said to_the mother of_her: What may_I_request.
   And she said: The head of_G‹Yōannēs›G the one immersing.
   25 And having_come_in immediately with earnestness to the king, she_requested saying: I_am_wanting that immediately you_may_give the head of_G‹Yōannēs›G the immerser to_me on a_platter.
   26 And the king having_become very_sorrowful, because_of the oaths and the ones reclining he_ not _wanted to_reject her.
   27 And immediately the king having_sent_out an_executioner, commanded to_bring the head of_him.
   And having_gone_away, he_beheaded him in the prison, 28 and brought the head of_him on a_platter, and gave it to_the little_girl, and the little_girl gave it to_the mother of_her.
   29 And having_heard it, the apprentices/followers of_him came, and took_up the corpse of_him, and they_laid it in a_tomb.
   30 And the ambassadors are_being_gathered_together to G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G and they_reported to_him, all things as_much_as they_did and as_much_as they_taught.
   31 And he_is_saying to_them: Come you_all yourselves by yourselves to a_desolate place, and rest a_little.
   For the ones coming and the ones going were many, and they_were_ not_even _having_opportunity.
   to_eat.
   32 And they_went_away by the boat into a_ desolate _place by themselves.
   33 And many they_saw them going, and recognized them, and from all the the_cities they_ran_together there on_foot, and they_went_ahead of_them.
   34 And having_come_out, he_saw a_great crowd and he_was_feeling_compassion to them, because they_were as sheep not having a_shepherd, and he_began to_be_teaching them many things.
   35 And the_hour already it_having_become late, the apprentices/followers of_him having_approached to_him, were_saying, The place is desolate, and it_is already an_ late _hour, 36 send_away them, in_order_that having_gone_away to the surrounding country and villages, they_may_buy something for_themselves they_may_eat.
   37 But answering he said to_them: You_all give something to_them to_eat.
   And they_are_saying to_him: Having_gone_away, may_we_buy two_hundred of_G‹dēnarion_coins›G loaves, and we_will_be_giving something to_them to_eat.
   38 And he is_saying to_them: How_many loaves are_you_all_having.
   Be_going, see.
   And having_known they_are_saying: Five and two fishes.
   39 And he_commanded to_them to_sit_down all, groups by_groups on the green grass.
   40 And sat_down groups by_groups, by hundred and by fifty.
   41 And having_taken the five loaves and the two fishes, having_looked_up to the sky, he_blessed and broke_up the loaves, and was_giving to_the apprentices/followers of_him, in_order_that they_may_be_setting_before to_them, and he_divided the two fishes to_all.
   42 And they_ate all and were_satisfied.
   43 And they_took_up fragments of_twelve baskets fillings, and of the fishes.
   44 And the ones having_eaten the loaves were, five_thousand men.
   45 And immediately he_compelled the apprentices/followers of_him to_board into the boat, and to_be_going_before to the side across to G‹Bēthsaida›G, until he is_sending_away the crowd.
   46 And having_bid_goodbye to_them, he_went_away into the mountain to_pray.
   47 And having_become evening, the boat was in the_midst of_the sea, and only he on the land.
   48 And having_seen them being_tormented in the time to_be_rowing, for the wind was contrary to_them, about the_fourth watch of_the night, he_is_coming to them, walking on the sea, and was_wanting to_pass_by them.
   49 And, they having_seen him on the sea walking, supposed that he_is a_ghost, and they_cried_out.
   50 For all saw him, and were_disturbed.
   And he immediately spoke with them, and is_saying to_them: Be_having_courage, I am he, be_ not _fearing.
   51 And he_went_up to them into the boat, and the wind died_down.
   And they_were_Rx-marvelling-Rx exceedingly in themselves, 52 for they_ not _understood concerning the loaves, but the heart of_them was having_been_hardened.
   53 And having_crossed_over to land they_came to Gennesaret, and were_anchored.
   54 And of_them on_having_come_out out_of the boat, immediately having_recognized him, 55 ran_around all that country, and they_began to_be_carrying_about on the pallets the ones having sickly, where they_were_hearing that he_is.
   56 And wherever he_was_entering_in into villages, or into cities, or into fields, in the marketplaces they_were_laying the ones ailing, and they_were_imploring him that they_may_touch even_if against_the fringe of_the garment of_him, and as_many_as touched against_him were_being_healed.
  Mrk 7  And the G‹Farisaios_sect›G and some of_the scribes, having_come from G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G are_being_gathered_together to him, 2 and having_seen some of_the apprentices/followers of_him, that they_are_eating the loaves with_unclean hands, this is with_unwashed.
   3 (For the the_G‹Farisaios_sect›G and all the G‹Youdaiōns›G, are_ not _eating if they_may_ not _wash the hands with_the_fist, taking_hold_of the tradition of_the elders, 4 and from the_marketplace they_are_ not _eating if they_may_ not _wash, and many other things there_is which they_received to_be_taking_hold_of, washings of_cups and pitchers and copper_kettles.
  ) 5 And the G‹Farisaios_sect›G are_asking him and the scribes: for_ Why _reason the apprentices/followers of_you are_ not _walking according_to the tradition of_the elders, but they_are_eating the bread with_common hands.
   6 And he answering said to_them: G‹H‹Ēsaias/(Yəsha'əyāh)›H›G rightly prophesied concerning you_all hypocrites, as it_has_been_written, this people is_honoring me with_the lips, but the heart of_them is_being_away far_away from me.
   7 And they_are_worshipping me uselessly, teaching the_commandments of_humans as_teachings.
   8 Having_left the commandment of_god, you_all_are_taking_hold_of the tradition of_humans.
   9 And he_was_saying to_them: You_all_are_rejecting well the commandment of_god, in_order_that you_all_may_keep the tradition of_you_all.
   10 For G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G said: be_honoring the father of_you and the mother of_you, and: the one speaking_evil father or mother in_death let_be_dying.
   11 But you_all are_saying: If a_person may_say to_the father or the mother: whatever you_may_be_benefited from me It_is korban (that is a_gift, 12 you_all_are_ no_longer _allowing him to_do nothing for_the father or the mother, 13 annulling the word of_god for_the tradition of_you_all to_which you_all_gave_over.
   And many similar such things you_all_are_doing.
   14 And having_called_to again the crowd, he_was_saying to_them: All be_hearing from_me and be_understanding: 15 there_is nothing outside the person entering_in into him, which is_able to_defile him but the things going_out out_of the person, is the things defiling the person.
   16  17 And when he_came_in into the_house from the crowd, the apprentices/followers of_him were_asking him the parable.
   18 And he_is_saying to_them: Are you_all thus also unintelligent.
   You_all_are_ not _understanding that everything entering_in the part outside into the person, is_ not _able to_defile him, 19 because it_is_ not _entering_in into the heart of_him, but into the belly, and it_is_going_out into the latrine.
   (Purifying all the foods.
  ) 20 And he_was_saying The thing going_out out_of the person, that is_defiling the person.
   21 For from inside the heart of_people are_going_out the evil speculations, sexual_immoralities, thefts, murders, adulteries, 22 greediness, wickedness, deceit, wantonness, eyeing evil, slander, pride, foolishness.
   23 All these evil things inside is_going_out and is_defiling the person.
   24 And from_there having_risen_up, he_went_away into the regions of_G‹H‹Turos/(Tsor)›H›G and G‹H‹Sidōn/(Tsīdōn)›H›G.
   And having_come_in into the_house, he_was_wanting no_one to_know, but was_ not _able to_escape_notice.
   25 But immediately a_woman having_heard about him, of_whom the little_daughter was_having of_her a_ unclean _spirit having_come, fell_before at the feet of_him.
   26 And the woman was Rx-G‹Hellēn›G-Rx, G‹from_Foinikē_in_Suria›G by_descent, and she_was_asking him that he_may_throw_out the demon out_of the daughter of_her.
   27 And he_was_saying to_her: Allow the children to_be_satisfied first, for it_is not good to_take the bread of_the children, and to_throw it to_the little_dogs.
   28 And she answered and is_saying to_him: Yes, master, even the little_dogs beneath the table are_eating of the little_crumbs of_the little_children.
   29 And he_said to_her: Because_of this word be_going, the demon, has_come_out.
   out_of the daughter of_you.
   30 And having_gone_away to the home of_her, she_found the demon having_come_out.
   and the little_child having_been_laid on the bed, 31 And again having_come_out from the regions of_G‹H‹Turos, he_came through G‹H‹Sidōn to the sea of_G‹H‹Galilaia/(Gālīl)›H›G, among the_midst of_the regions of_G‹Dekapolis›G.
   32 And they_are_bringing a_deaf and speech_impaired man to_him, and they_are_imploring him that he_may_lay_on his hand.
   on_him.
   33 And having_taken_ him _back from the crowd by himself, he_put the fingers of_him to the ears of_him, and having_spat, touched against_the tongue of_him, 34 and having_looked_up to the sky he_groaned, and is_saying to_him: G‹H‹Effatha/(Fətaḩ)›H›G, that is: be_opened_up.
   35 And the ears of_him were_opened_up, and the bond of_the tongue of_him was_untied/released, and he_was_speaking correctly.
   36 And he_instructed to_them that they_may_be_telling to_no_one.
   But as_much_as was_instructing to_them, they were_proclaiming it more more_abundantly.
   37 And they_were_being_ exceedingly _astonished saying: He_has_done all things well, he_is_making both the deaf to_be_hearing, and the_mute to_be_speaking.
  Mrk 8  In those days again, the_crowd of_being great, and not having anything they_may_eat, having_called_to the apprentices/followers of_him, he_is_saying to_them, 2 I_am_feeling_compassion for the crowd, because they_are_ already _remaining with_me three days, and they_are_ not _having anything they_may_eat.
   3 And if I_may_send_ them _away hungry to home of_them, they_will_be_being_exhausted on the way.
   And some of_them have_come from afar.
   4 And the apprentices/followers of_him answered to_him: From_where will_ anyone _be_able to_satisfy these with_loaves here in desert.
   5 And he_was_asking them: How_many loaves are_you_all_having.
   And they said: Seven.
   6 And he_is_commanding to_the crowd to_sit_down on the ground.
   And having_taken the seven loaves, having_given_thanks he_broke and he_was_giving to_the apprentices/followers of_him, in_order_that they_may_be_setting_before them, and they_set_before it to_the crowd.
   7 And were_having a_few little_fishes, and having_blessed them them, he_told also these things to_be_setting_before them.
   8 And they_ate and were_satisfied, and they_took_up the_excess of_fragments seven baskets.
   9 And they_were they having_eaten about four_thousand.
   And he_sent_ them _away.
   10 And immediately having_boarded into the boat with the apprentices/followers of_him, he_came into the districts of_Dalmanutha.
   11 And the G‹Farisaios_sect›G came_out and, they_began to_be_debating against_him, seeking a_sign from the sky from him, testing him.
   12 And having_sighed_deeply in_the spirit of_him he_is_saying: Why is_ this generation _seeking a_sign.
   Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all, this will_ never _be_being_given to_ a_sign _generation.
   13 And having_left them, again having_boarded he_went_away to the side across.
   14 And they_forgot to_take loaves, and except one loaf they_were_ not _having with themselves in the boat.
   15 And he_was_instructing to_them saying: Be_seeing, be_watching_out for the leaven of_the G‹Farisaios_sect›G and of_the leaven of_Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx.
   16 And they_were_reasoning with one_another, Because they_are_ not _having loaves.
   17 And having_known it, G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G he_is_saying to_them: Why are_you_all_reasoning because you_all_are_ not _having loaves.
   You_all_are_ not_yet _understanding, nor you_all_are_understanding.
   are_you_all_having the heart of_you_all Having_been_hardened.
   18 Having eyes, you_all_are_ not _seeing.
   And having ears, you_all_are_ not _hearing.
   And you_all_are_ not _remembering.
   19 When I_broke the five loaves for the five_thousand, how_many baskets full of_fragments.
   you_all_took_up.
   They_are_saying to_him: Twelve.
   20 When and the seven loaves for the four_thousand, of_how_many baskets the_fillings of_fragments you_all_took_up.
   and they_are_saying Seven.
   21 And he_was_saying to_them: How you_all_are_ not_yet _understanding.
   22 And they_are_coming to G‹Bēthsaida›G, and they_are_bringing a_blind man to_him, and they_are_imploring him that he_may_touch against_him.
   23 And having_taken_hold of_the hand of_the blind man, he_brought_ him _out out of_the village, and having_spat in the eyes of_him, having_laid_on the hands on_him, he_was_asking him: are_you_seeing anything.
   24 And having_looked_up he_said: I_am_seeing the people, because I_am_seeing them walking as trees.
   25 Thereafter again he_laid_on the hands on the eyes of_him, and he_saw_clearly and he_restored him and he_was_looking_at all things clearly.
   26 And he_sent_out him to the_home of_him saying: You_may_ not _come_in into the village.
   27 And G‹H‹Yēsous and the apprentices/followers of_him came_out into the villages of_G‹Kaisareia›G Rx-G‹Filippou›G-Rx.
   And on the way he_was_asking the apprentices/followers of_him saying to_them: Whom are_ the people _saying me to_be.
   28 And they spoke to_him saying, G‹Yōannēs›G the immerser, and others G‹H‹Ēlias/('Ēliyyāh)›H›G, but others one of_the prophets.
   29 And he was_asking them: But whom you_all are_saying me to_be.
   And G‹Petros›G answering is_saying to_him: You are the chosen_one/messiah.
   30 And he_warned to_them that they_may_be_telling no_one concerning him.
   31 And he_began to_be_teaching them that it_is_fitting the son of_Man to_suffer many things, and to_be_rejected by the elders and the chief_priests and the scribes, and to_be_killed_off, and to_rise_up after three days.
   32 And he_was_speaking the word with_plainness.
   And having_taken_ him _aside, G‹Petros›G began to_be_giving_rebuke to_him.
   33 And he, having_been_turned_back and having_seen the apprentices/followers of_him, gave_rebuke to_G‹Petros›G and is_saying: Be_going behind me, G‹H‹Satan/(Sāţān)›H›G, because you_are_ not _thinking the things of_god, but the things of_humans.
   34 And having_called_to the crowd with the apprentices/followers of_him, he_said to_them: If anyone is_wanting to_be_following after me let_him_renounce himself, and let_him_take_up the cross of_him, and let_him_be_following after_me.
   35 For whoever may_be_wanting to_save the life of_him, will_be_losing it, but whoever will_be_losing the life of_him on_account me and of_the gospel, will_be_saving it.
   36 For what is_it_benefiting a_person, he_may_gain the world whole and the soul of_him to_be_lost.
   37 For what will_ a_person _be_giving as_an_exchange for_the soul of_him.
   38 For whoever may_be_ashamed_of me and my words in this adulterous and sinful generation, the son of_Man will_ also _be_being_ashamed of_him whenever he_may_come in the glory of_the father of_him, with the holy angels.
  Mrk 9  And he_was_saying to_them: Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all that are some of_the ones having_stood here, who by_no_means may_ not _taste of_death, until they_may_see the kingdom of_god having_come with power.
   2 And after six days, G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G is_taking G‹Petros›G, and G‹H‹Yakōbos/(Ya'aqov)›H›G, and G‹Yōannēs›G, and is_bringing_up them into a_ high _mountain by themselves only.
   And he_was_transformed before them, 3 and the clothes of_him became shining exceedingly white, such_as a_launderer on the earth is_ not _able to_whiten thus.
   4 And G‹H‹Ēlias with G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G was_seen to_them, and they_were conversing_with with_G‹H‹Yēsous.
   5 And G‹Petros›G answering is_saying to_G‹H‹Yēsous: , My_great_one, it_is good for_us to_be here, and we_may_make three tents, one for_you, and one for_G‹H‹Mōsēs, and one for_G‹H‹Ēlias/('Ēliyyāh)›H›G.
   6 For he_had_ not _known what he_may_answer, for they_became terrified.
   7 And a_cloud became overshadowing on_them, and a_voice became: out_of the cloud: This is the the beloved son of_me, be_hearing from_him.
   8 And suddenly having_looked_around, they_ no_longer _saw no_one, except only G‹H‹Yēsous with themselves.
   9 And them coming_down from the mountain, he_instructed to_them that they_may_describe to_no_one what they_saw, except whenever the son of_Man may_rise_up from the_dead.
   10 And they_took_hold_of the statement to themselves, debating what is the meaning of the_dead to_rise_up.
   11 And they_were_asking him saying, The scribes are_saying that it_is_fitting G‹H‹Ēlias to_come first.
   12 And he was_saying to_them: G‹H‹Ēlias indeed having_come first is_restoring all things, but how has_it_been_written concerning the son of_Man, that he_may_suffer many things and may_be_scorned.
   13 But I_am_saying to_you_all that G‹H‹Ēlias has_ also _come, and they_did to_him as_much_as they_were_wanting, as it_has_been_written concerning him.
   14 And having_come to the apprentices/followers, he_saw a_ great _crowd around them, and the_scribes debating with with_them.
   15 And immediately all the crowd having_seen him were_greatly_amazed, and running_up they_were_greeting him.
   16 And he_asked them: What are_you_all_debating with them.
   17 And one out_of the crowd answered to_him: Teacher, I_brought the son of_me to you, having a_ mute _spirit.
   18 And wherever it_may_grasp him, it_is_attacking him, and he_is_foaming and is_grating his teeth, and is_being_paralyzed.
   And I_told to_the apprentices/followers of_you that they_may_throw_ it _out, and they_ not _prevailed.
   19 And he answering to_them is_saying: Rx-Oh-Rx unbelieving generation.
   Until when I_will_be with you_all.
   Until when I_will_be_tolerating of_you_all.
   Be_bringing him to me.
   20 And they_brought him to him.
   And having_seen him, the spirit immediately threw_ him _into_convulsions, and having_fallen on the ground, he_was_rolling foaming.
   21 And he_asked the father of_him: How_much time it_is, until this has_become with_him.
   And he said: From from_childhood.
   22 And often him it_throw both into fire and into waters, in_order_that it_may_destroy him.
   But if anything you_are_being_able, give_help to_us, having_been_feeling_compassion on us.
   23 And G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G said to_him, If you_are_being_able.
   All things possible to_the one believing.
   24 And immediately having_cried_out, the father of_the little_child was_saying: I_am_believing, be_giving_help of_me for_the unbelief.
   25 And G‹H‹Yēsous having_seen that a_crowd is_running_together, he_gave_rebuke to_the unclean spirit saying to_it: mute and deaf spirit, I am_commanding to_you, come_out out_of him, and no_longer you_may_come_in into him.
   26 And having_cried_out, and having_convulsed much, it_came_out, and he_became as_if dead, so_that many to_be_saying that he_died_off.
   27 And G‹H‹Yēsous having_taken_hold of_the hand of_him, raised him, and he_rose_up.
   28 And him having_come_in into a_house, the apprentices/followers of_him by themselves were_asking him, We were_ not _able to_throw_out it.
   29 And he_said to_them: This kind is_able to_come_out by nothing, except by prayer and fasting.
   30 And_from_there having_come_out, they_were_passing_through through G‹H‹Galilaia/(Gālīl)›H›G, and he_was_ not _wanting that anyone may_know, 31 for he_was_teaching the apprentices/followers of_him, and was_saying to_them, The son of_Man is_being_given_over into the_hands of_men, and they_will_be_killing_ him _off, and having_been_killed_off, after three days he_will_be_rising_up.
   32 And they were_not_knowing of_the saying, and they_were_fearing to_ask him.
   33 And they_came to G‹Kafarna'oum›G.
   And having_become in the house, he_was_asking them: What were_you_all_reasoning on the way.
   34 And they were_keeping_silent, for they_were_discussing with one_another on the road, who was greater.
   35 And having_sat_down, he_called the twelve and is_saying to_them: If anyone is_wanting to_be first, he_will_be last of_all and servant of_all.
   36 And having_taken a_little_child, he_stood him in the_midst of_them, and having_embraced him, he_said to_them, 37 Whoever may_receive one of_such little_children in the name of_me, is_receiving me, and whoever may_receive me, is_ not _receiving me, but the one having_sent_ me _out.
   38 G‹Yōannēs›G was_saying to_him: Teacher, we_saw someone throwing_out demons in the name of_you, and we_were_forbidding him, because he_was_ not _following with_us.
   39 And G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G said: Be_ not _forbidding him, for is no_one who will_be_doing a_miracle in the name of_me, will_be_able also quickly to_speak_evil_of me.
   40 For whoever is not against us, is for us.
   41 For whoever may_give_ you_all _to_drink a_cup of_water in my_name, because you_all_are of_the_chosen_one/messiah, truly, I_am_saying to_you_all that by_no_means he_may_ not _lose the reward of_him.
   42 And whoever may_stumble one of_little ones these believing in me, better it_is for_him rather if a_ heavy _grinding_stone is_hung_around around the neck of_him, and he_has_been_throw into the sea.
   43 And if the hand of_you may_stumble you, cut_ it _off, it_is better for_you to_come_in into life maimed, than to_go_away into G‹geenna›G having two hands, into the inextinguishable fire.
   44  45 And if the foot of_you may_be_stumbling you, cut_ it _off, it_is better for_you to_come_in into life lame, than having two feet to_be_throw into G‹geenna›G.
   46  47 And if the eye of_you may_be_stumbling you, throw_ it _out, it_is better you to_come_in into the kingdom of_god one-eyed, than to_be_throw into G‹geenna›G, having two eyes 48 where the worm of_them is_ not _dying, and the fire is_ not _being_extinguished.
   49 For everyone will_be_being_salted with_fire.
   50 The Salt is good, but if the salt may_become unsalty, with what you_all_will_be_seasoning it.
   Be_having salt in yourselves, and be_being_at_peace with one_another.
  Mrk 10  And from_there having_risen_up, he_is_coming into the regions of_Rx-G‹Youdaia›G-Rx, and beyond the G‹H‹Yordanēs/(Yarəddēn)›H›G, and crowds are_going_with again to him, and he_was_teaching them again as he_had_been_accustomed.
   2 And the_G‹Farisaios_sect›G having_approached, were_asking him: it_is_permitting for_a_husband to_send_away a_wife.
   Testing him.
   3 And he answering said to_them: What commanded G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G to_you_all.
   4 And they said, G‹H‹Mōsēs permitted to_write a_scroll of_divorce and to_send_away.
   5 And G‹H‹Yēsous said to_them: He_wrote this commandment for_you_all for the hard_heart of_you_all, 6 but from the_beginning of_creation, he_made them male and female.
   7 On_account of_this a_man will_be_leaving the father of_him and the mother, and will_be_being_joined wife of_him 8 and the two will_be into one flesh.
   So_that they_are no_longer two, but one.
   flesh.
   9 Therefore what god joined_together, a_person let_ not _be_separating.
   10 And in the house again, the apprentices/followers were_asking him concerning this.
   11 And he_is_saying to_them: Whoever may_send_away the wife of_him, and may_marry another, is_causing_adultery against her.
   12 And if she having_sent_away the husband of_her, may_marry another, she_is_causing_adultery.
   13 And they_were_bringing little_children to_him, in_order_that he_may_touch against_them, but the apprentices/followers gave_rebuke to_them.
   14 But G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G having_seen, resented and said to_them: Allow the little_children to_be_coming to me, and be_ not _forbidding them, for the kingdom of_god is of_such.
   15 Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all, whoever may_ not _receive the kingdom of_god as a_little_child, by_no_means may_ not _come_in into it.
   16 And having_embraced them, he_was_blessing them laying his hands on them.
   17 And of_him going_out on the_journey, one having_run_up and having_knelt to_him, was_asking him: Good Teacher, what may_I_do, in_order_that I_may_inherit eternal life.
   18 And G‹H‹Yēsous said to_him: Why are_you_calling me good.
   No_one is good, except one god.
   19 You_have_known the commandments: you_may_ not _murder, you_may_ not _commit_adultery, you_may_ not _steal, you_may_ not _give_false_testimony, you_may_ not _defraud: be_honoring the father and the mother of_you.
   20 And he was_saying to_him: Teacher, I_kept all these from the_youth of_me.
   21 And G‹H‹Yēsous having_focused_in on_him, loved him and said to_him: Rx-one-Rx thing you is_lacking: be_going, sell as_much_as you_are_having, and give poor, and you_will_be_having treasure in heaven, and come, be_following after_me.
   22 But he, having_saddened at the word, went_away being_sorrowed, for he_was having many properties.
   23 And G‹H‹Yēsous having_looked_around, is_saying to_the apprentices/followers of_him: How difficultly the ones having wealth, will_be_coming_in into the kingdom of_god.
   24 And the apprentices/followers were_being_amazed at the words of_him.
   But G‹H‹Yēsous again answering is_saying to_them: Children, how difficult it_is to_come_in into the kingdom of_god.
   25 it_is easier for_a_camel to_pass_through through eye needle, than a_rich one to_come_in into the kingdom of_god.
   26 But they were_being_ exceedingly _astonished, saying to him: And who is_able to_be_saved.
   27 G‹H‹Yēsous having_focused_in on_them, is_saying: With humans it_is impossible, but not with god, for all things are possible with god.
   28 G‹Petros›G began to_be_saying to_him: See we left all and have_followed after_you.
   29 G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G /Was/_saying: Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all, there_is no_one who left house, or brothers, or sisters, or mother, or father, or children, or farms, on_account of_me and of_the gospel, 30 if may_ not _receive hundred_fold now in this time, houses, and brothers, and sisters, and mother, and children, and farms, with persecutions, and in the age which coming, eternal life.
   31 But many first will_be last, and last first.
   32 And they_were on the way going_up to G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G, and G‹H‹Yēsous was going_before them, and they_were_being_amazed, and they following were_fearing.
   And having_taken the twelve again, he_began to_be_telling to_them the things going to_be_happening to_him.
   33 See we_are_going_up to G‹H‹Hierousalēm, and the son of_Man will_be_being_given_over to_the chief_priests and the scribes, and they_will_be_condemning him to_death, and they_will_be_giving_ him _over to_the pagans.
   34 And they_will_be_mocking at_him, and they_will_be_spitting on_him, and they_will_be_flogging him, and they_will_be_killing_off, and after three days he_will_be_rising_up.
   35 And G‹H‹Yakōbos/(Ya'aqov)›H›G and G‹Yōannēs›G the two sons of_G‹Zebedaios›G are_approaching to_him, saying to_him: Teacher, we_are_wanting that whatever we_may_request you, you_may_do for_us.
   36 And he said to_them: What are_you_all_wanting me I_may_do for_you_all.
   37 And they said to_him: Give to_us, that we_may_sit_down in with_the glory of_you one on the_right and one.
   on.
   the_left of_you.
   38 And G‹H‹Yēsous said to_them: You_all_have_ not _known what you_all_are_requesting.
   Are_you_all_being_able to_drink the cup which I am_drinking, or to_be_immersed the immersion which I am_being_immersed.
   39 And they said to_him: We_are_being_able.
   And G‹H‹Yēsous said to_them: The cup which I am_drinking, you_all_will_be_drinking, and the immersion which I am_being_immersed, you_all_will_be_being_immersed, 40 but to_sit_down on the_right or on the_left of_me, is not mine to_give, but for_whom it_has_been_prepared.
   41 And having_heard, the ten began to_be_resenting about G‹H‹Yakōbos and G‹Yōannēs›G.
   42 And having_called_to them G‹H‹Yēsous is_saying to_them: You_all_have_known that the ones supposing to_be_ruling over_the pagans are_exercising_mastership over_them, and the great ones of_them are_exercising_authority over_them.
   43 But it_is not thus among you_all, but whoever may_be_wanting to_become great, among you_all, will_be servant of_you_all, 44 and whoever may_be_wanting to_be first among you_all, will_be slave of_all.
   45 For even the son of_Man came not to_be_served, but to_serve, and to_give the life of_him as_a_ransom for many.
   46 And they_are_coming to G‹H‹Yeriⱪō/(Yərīḩō)›H›G.
   And him and the apprentices/followers of_him and a_ large _crowd going_out from G‹H‹Yeriⱪō, G‹Bartimaios›G blind beggar a_son of_G‹Timaios›G.
   was_sitting beside the road.
   47 And having_heard that it_is G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G the G‹from_Nazaret›G, he_began to_be_crying_out and to_be_saying: son of_G‹H‹Dauid/(Dāvid)›H›G, G‹H‹Yēsous, show_mercy to_me.
   48 And were_warning to_him many that he_may_keep_silent, but he was_crying_out by_much more: son of_G‹H‹Dauid, show_mercy to_me.
   49 And G‹H‹Yēsous having_stopped, said: Call him.
   And they_are_calling the blind man, saying to_him: Be_having_courage, be_raising, he_is_calling you.
   50 And he, having_thrown_away the coat of_him having_jumped_up, came to G‹H‹Yēsous.
   51 And G‹H‹Yēsous answering to_him said: What are_you_wanting I_may_do for_you.
   And the blind man said to_him: My_teacher, that I_may_receive_sight.
   52 And G‹H‹Yēsous said to_him: Be_going, the faith of_you has_saved you.
   And immediately he_received_sight, and was_following after_him on the way.
  Mrk 11  And when they_are_nearing to G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G, to G‹Bēthfagē›G and G‹Bēthania›G near the Mount of_Olives, he_is_sending_out two of_the apprentices/followers of_him, 2 and is_saying to_them: Be_going into the village in_front_of you_all, and immediately entering_in into it, you_all_will_be_finding a_colt having_been_bound on which no_one of_the_people not_yet sat_down, untie it and be_bringing it.
   3 And if anyone may_say to_you_all: Why are_you_all_doing this.
   Say, The master is_having need of_it, and immediately he_is_sending_ it _out again here.
   4 And they_went_away, and they_found the_colt having_been_bound at the door outside by the street, and they_are_untying it.
   5 And some of_the ones having_stood there were_saying to_them: What are_you_all_doing releasing the colt.
   6 And they they_spoke to_them as G‹H‹Yēsous told, and they_allowed them.
   7 And they_are_bringing the colt to G‹H‹Yēsous, and they_are_laying_on the coats of_them, to_it, and he_sat_down on it.
   8 And many spread the coats of_them on the road, and others leafy_branches having_cut_off from the fields.
   9 And the ones going_before and the ones following were_crying_out: Blessed_saviour.
   Having_been_blessed is the one coming in name of_the_master.
   10 Having_been_blessed is the coming kingdom of_the father of_us, G‹H‹Dauid.
   Blessed_saviour in the highest.
   11 And he_came_in into G‹H‹Hierousalēm, into the temple, and having_looked_around all things, already being the evening hour, he_came_out to G‹Bēthania›G with the twelve.
   12 And on_the day of_next, of_them having_come_out from G‹Bēthania›G, he_hungered.
   13 And having_seen afar a_fig_tree from having leaves, he_came if perhaps anything he_will_be_finding on it, and having_come to it, he_found nothing except leaves, for was not the season of_figs.
   14 And answering he_said to_it: No_longer for the age, of you no_one might_eat fruit.
   And the apprentices/followers of_him were_hearing.
   15 And they_are_coming to G‹H‹Hierousalēm, and having_come_in into the temple, he_began to_be_throwing_out the ones selling and the ones buying in the temple, and the tables of_the moneychangers and he_overturned the seats of_the ones selling the doves.
   16 And was_ not _allowing that anyone may_carry_ an_object _through through the temple.
   17 And he_was_teaching and was_saying to_them: Not it_has_been_written, the house of_me, will_be_being_called a_house of_prayer for_all the nations.
   But you_all made it a_hideout of_robbers.
   18 And the chief_priests and the scribes heard it, and they_were_seeking how they_may_destroy him, for they_were_fearing him, for all the crowd was_being_astonished at the teaching of_him.
   19 And whenever evening became, they_were_going_out outside the city.
   20 And passing_through in_the_morning, they_saw the fig_tree having_been_withered from roots.
   21 And G‹Petros›G having_been_reminded is_saying to_him: , My_great_one, see, the fig_tree which you_cursed has_been_withered.
   22 And G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G answering is_saying to_them: Be_having faith of_god.
   23 Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all that whoever may_say to_ this _mountain: Be_taken_away and be_throw into the sea, and it _may_ not _be_doubted in the heart of_him, but may_be_believing that whatever he_is_speaking is_becoming, will_be done for_him.
   24 Because_of this I_am_saying to_you_all, all things as_much_as you_all_are_praying and are_requesting, be_believing that you_all_received, and it_will_be done for_you_all.
   25 And whenever you_all_may_be_standing praying, be_forgiving if you_all_are_having anything against anyone, in_order_that the father of_you_all, who is in the heavens may_ also, _forgive to_you_all the transgressions of_you_all.
   26  27 And they_are_coming again to G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G, and him walking in the temple, the chief_priests, and the scribes, and the elders.
   are_coming to him.
   28 And they_were_saying to_him: By what authority are_you_doing these things.
   Or who gave this authority to_you, in_order_that you_may_be_doing these things.
   29 And G‹H‹Yēsous said to_them: Also_I I_will_be_asking you_all one word, and answer to_me, and I_will_be_telling to_you_all by what authority I_am_doing these things.
   30 The immersion of_G‹Yōannēs›G, was_it from heaven or from humans.
   Answer to_me.
   31 And they_were_reasoning with themselves saying, if we_may_say: From heaven, he_will_be_saying: for_ Why _reason therefore you_all_ not _believed in_him.
   32 But we_may_say: From humans.
   (They_were_fearing the crowd, for all were_having that G‹Yōannēs›G he_ really _was a_prophet.
  ) 33 And answering to_G‹H‹Yēsous they_are_saying: We_have_ not _known.
   And G‹H‹Yēsous is_saying to_them: Neither I am_telling to_you_all by what authority I_am_doing these things.
  Mrk 12  And he_began to_be_speaking to_them in parables: a_man planted A_vineyard, and put_ a_fence _around, and dug a_trough, and built a_tower, and rented_out it to_the_tenant_farmers, and Rx-travelled-Rx.
   2 And he_sent_out a_slave to the tenant_farmers at_the season, in_order_that he_may_receive from the tenant_farmers from the fruits of_the vineyard.
   3 But having_taken him, they_beat him and they_sent_out him empty-handed.
   4 And again he_sent_out another slave to them, and_that one they_struck_on_the_head and dishonored.
   5 And he_sent_out another, and_that one they_killed_off, and many others, on_one_hand beating some, on_the_other_hand killing_off some.
   6 he_was_having Still one beloved son, he_sent_ him _out last to them saying, They_will_be_being_swayed by_the son of_me.
   7 But those the tenant_farmers said to themselves, This is the heir, come, we_may_kill_ him _off, and the inheritance will_be of_us.
   8 And having_taken, they_killed_ him _off, and they_throw_ him _out outside the vineyard.
   9 Therefore what the master of_the vineyard will_be_doing.
   He_will_be_coming and will_be_destroying the tenant_farmers, and will_be_giving the vineyard to_others.
   10 You_all_ not_even _read the this scripture: the_stone which the ones building rejected, this was_become for the_head of_the_corner, 11 this became from the_master, and it_is Rx-marvellous-Rx in eyes of_us.
   12 And they_were_seeking to_apprehend him, and they_were_afraid the crowd, for they_knew that he_spoke the parable against them.
   And having_left him, they_went_away.
   13 And they_are_sending_out some of_the G‹Farisaios_sect›G and of_the G‹supporters_of_Hērōdēs›G to him, in_order_that they_may_catch him in_a_statement.
   14 And having_come, they_are_saying to_him: Teacher, we_have_known that you_are true, and is_ not _caring to_you about no_one, for you_are_ not _looking on appearance of_people, but you_are_teaching the way of_god with the_truth.
   Is_it_permitting to_give a_poll_tax to_Rx-G‹Kaisar›G-Rx or not.
   We_may_give or we_may_ not _give.
   15 And he having_known the hypocrisy of_them, said to_them: Why are_you_all_testing me.
   Be_bringing to_me a_G‹dēnarion_coin›G, in_order_that I_may_have_known.
   16 And they brought it.
   And he_is_saying to_them: Of_whose is the this image and the inscription.
   And they said to_him: Of_Rx-G‹Kaisar›G-Rx.
   17 And G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G said to_them: The things of_Rx-G‹Kaisar›G-Rx give_back to_Rx-G‹Kaisar›G-Rx, and the things of_god to_god.
   And they_were_begrudgingly_amazed at him.
   18 And the_G‹Saddoukaios_sect›G are_coming, to him, who are_saying to_ not _be a_resurrection, and they_were_asking him saying, 19 Teacher, G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G wrote to_us, if a_brother of_anyone may_die_off, and may_leave a_wife and may_ not _leave children, in_order_that the brother of_him may_take the wife, and may_raise_up seed for_the brother of_him.
   20 there_were seven brothers, and the first took a_wife, and dying_off, not left seed, 21 and the second took her, and died_off, not having_left seed, and the third likewise.
   22 Also the seven, not left seed.
   Lastly of_all the woman also, died_off.
   23 In the resurrection, of_which of_them will_be_she the_wife.
   For the seven had her as_a_wife.
   24 G‹H‹Yēsous /Was/_saying to_them: Not are_you_all_being_strayed because_of this, not having_known the scriptures, nor the power of_god.
   25 For whenever they_may_rise_up from the_dead, they_are_ neither _marrying nor are_being_betrothed, but they_are like angels in the heavens.
   26 But concerning the dead, that they_are_being_raised, not you_all_read in the scroll of_G‹H‹Mōsēs concerning the thorn_bush, how god spoke to_him saying: I am the god of_G‹H‹Abra'am/('Avərāhām)›H›G, and god of_G‹H‹Isa'ak/(Yiʦəḩāq)›H›G, and the god of_G‹H‹Yakōb/(Ya'aqov)›H›G.
   27 Not is god of_the_dead, but of_the_living.
   You_all_are_being_ much _strayed.
   28 And one of_the scribes having_approached, having_heard of_them debating, having_seen that he_answered well to_them, asked him: Which commandment is.
   the_first of_all.
   29 G‹H‹Yēsous answered, The_first is: Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx be_hearing, the_master the god of_us is Rx-one-Rx master, 30 and you_will_be_loving the_master the god of_you, with all the heart of_you, and with all the soul of_you, and with all the mind of_you, and with all the strength of_you.
   31 The_second is this: you_will_be_loving the neighbor of_you as yourself.
   Another commandment is not greater than these.
   32 And the scribe said to_him: Rightly, Teacher, in truth having_said, one he_is, and there_is not another except him, 33 and, to_be_loving him with all the heart, and with all the intelligence, and with all the strength, and, to_be_loving his neighbor as yourself, is more_important all the whole_burnt_offerings and sacrifices.
   34 And G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, having_seen him, that he_answered intelligently, said to_him: You_are not far from the kingdom of_god.
   And no_one no_longer was_daring to_ask him.
   35 And G‹H‹Yēsous answering teaching in the temple was_saying: How are_ the scribes _saying that the chosen_one/messiah, is the_son of_G‹H‹Dauid/(Dāvid)›H›G.
   36 himself G‹H‹Dauid said by the holy spirit: the master said to_the master of_me: Be_sitting on the_right hand of_me, until I_may_put the enemies of_you beneath of_the feet of_you.
   37 G‹H‹Dauid himself is_calling him: master, and from_where is_he son of_him.
   And the a_great crowd was_ gladly _hearing from_him.
   38 And in the teaching of_him, he_was_saying: Be_watching_out of the scribes, the ones wanting to_be_walking in robes, and greetings in the marketplaces, 39 and best_seats in the synagogues, and best_places at the suppers, 40 the ones devouring the houses of_the widows, and praying long for_a_under_pretense.
   These will_be_receiving more_excessive judgment.
   41 And having_sat_down in_front_of the treasury, he_was_observing how the crowd is_throwing money into the treasury, and many rich were_throwing much.
   42 And having_come poor widow one throw two G‹lepton_coin›Gs, which is a_quadran.
   43 And having_called_to the apprentices/followers of_him, he_said to_them: Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all that this poor widow, throw more than all of_the ones throwing into the treasury.
   44 For all throw from the wealth abounding to_them, but this woman she_was_having throw all out_of the poverty of_her as_much_as, all the living of_her.
  Mrk 13  And him going_out out_of the temple, one of_the apprentices/followers of_him is_saying to_him: Teacher, see, what_kind_of stones and what_kind_of buildings.
   2 And G‹H‹Yēsous said to_him: Are_you_seeing these great buildings.
   Stone on stone by_no_means may_ not _be_left here, which by_no_means may_ not _be_torn_down.
   3 And of_him sitting on the Mount of_Olives in_front_of the temple, G‹Petros›G, and G‹H‹Yakōbos/(Ya'aqov)›H›G, and G‹Yōannēs›G, and G‹Andreas›G was_asking, him by themselves, 4 Tell to_us when these things will_be, and what is the sign whenever all these things may_be_going to_be_being_completed.
   5 And G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G began to_be_saying to_them: Be_watching_out, lest anyone may_mislead you_all.
   6 Many will_be_coming in the name of_me saying, I am he, and they_will_be_misleading many.
   7 And whenever you_all_may_hear of_wars and reports of_wars, be_ not _being_alarmed, it_is_fitting to_become, but is not_yet the end.
   8 For nation will_be_being_raised against nation, and kingdom against kingdom.
   ˱There˲_will_be earthquakes in places, there_will_be famines, these are the_beginning of_birth_pains.
   9 But be_watching_out you_all yourselves, they_will_be_giving_ you_all _over to councils and you_all_will_be_being_beat in synagogues, and will_be_being_stood before governors and kings on_account of_me, for a_testimony to_them.
   10 And it_is_fitting the gospel to_ first _be_proclaimed to all the nations.
   11 But whenever they_may_be_bringing you_all giving_over, be_ not _worrying_beforehand what you_all_may_speak, but whatever may_be_given to_you_all in that hour, this be_speaking, for you_all are not the ones speaking, but the holy spirit.
   12 And brother will_be_giving_over brother to death, and father child, and they_will_be_raising_up children against parents and they_will_be_putting_ them _to_death.
   13 And you_all_will_be being_hated by all because_of the name of_me.
   But the one having_endured to the_end, this one will_be_being_saved.
   14 But whenever you_all_may_see the abomination of_the desolation, having_stood where it_is_ not _fitting, let_ the one reading _be_understanding, then the ones in Rx-G‹Youdaia›G-Rx, let_them_be_fleeing to the mountains, 15 and the one on the housetop, let_ not _come_down, nor let_come_in to_take_away anything out_of the house of_him, 16 and the one in the field, him_let_ not _return back to the things, to_take_away the garment of_him.
   17 But woe to_the women having child in womb and to_the women nursing in those days.
   18 But be_praying that it_may_ not _become in_the_winter.
   19 For those days will_be tribulation, such_as has_ not _become such, from the_beginning of_creation which god created, until the time now, and by_no_means may_ not _become.
   20 And except the_master shortened the days, no any flesh would was_saved.
   But because_of the chosen, whom he_chose, he_shortened the days.
   21 And then if anyone may_say to_you_all: See here is the chosen_one/messiah, or ˱Or˲_see, there, be_ not _believing it.
   22 For false_messiahs and false_prophets will_be_being_raised, and they_will_be_giving signs and wonders, for that the chosen ones if possible to_be_wandering_away.
   23 But you_all be_watching_out, see, I_have_previously_spoken all things to_you_all.
   24 But in those days, after that tribulation: the sun will_be_being_darkened, and the moon will_ not _be_giving the radiance of_it, 25 and the stars will_be falling out_of of_the sky, and the powers in the heavens will_be_being_shaken.
   26 And then they_will_be_seeing the son of_Man coming in the_clouds, with great power.
   and glory.
   27 And then he_will_be_sending_out the angels and he_will_be_gathering_together the chosen ones of_him, from the four winds, from extremity of_the_earth to extremity of_heaven.
   28 And learn the parable of the fig_tree: whenever the branch of_it may_become already tender, and may_be_sprouting_out the leaves, you_all_are_knowing that the summer is near.
   29 Thus also you_all, whenever you_all_may_see these things becoming, you_all_are_knowing that it_is near at doors.
   30 Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all that by_no_means the this generation may_ not _pass_away, until that all these things may_become.
   31 The heaven and the earth will_be_passing_away, but the the_words of_me by_no_means will_ not _be_passing_away.
   32 But concerning that day or hour, no_one has_known, not_even the angels in heaven, nor the son, except the father.
   33 Be_watching_out, be_watching, and be_praying, for you_all_have_ not _known when the time is.
   34 Like a_man Rx-travelling-Rx it_is, having_left the house of_him, and having_given the authority to_the slaves of_him, to_each the work of_him, and to_the doorkeeper he_commanded that he_may_be_watching.
   35 Therefore be_watching, for you_all_have_ not _known, when the master of_the house is_coming, either evening, or midnight, or of_the_crockcrow, or in_the_morning, 36 lest having_come suddenly, he_may_find you_all sleeping.
   37 and What I_am_saying to_you_all, I_am_saying to_all, be_watching.
   Mrk 14  And it_was the passover_feast and non-fermented bread after two days.
   And the chief_priests and the scribes were_seeking, how having_apprehended him by deceit, they_may_kill_off him.
   2 For they_were_saying: Not at the feast, lest will_be a_commotion of_the people.
   3 And him being in G‹Bēthania›G, in the house of_Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx the leprous, reclining of_him, a_woman came having an_alabaster_flask of_ointment, of_ genuine expensive _nard.
  , having_broken the alabaster_flask, she_poured_down it on_the head of_him.
   4 But some were resenting to themselves: For why this destruction of_the ointment has_become.
   5 For this ointment was_able to_be_sold for_over three_hundred G‹dēnarion_coins›G, and to_be_given to_the poor.
   And they_were_admonishing to_her.
   6 But G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G said: Leave her, why are_you_all_bringing_about troubles to_her.
   she_did a_good work in me.
   7 For you_all_are_ always _having the poor with yourselves, and whenever you_all_may_be_wanting, you_all_are_being_able to_do well to_them, but you_all_are_ not always _having me.
   8 What she_had she_did, she_anticipated to_anoint the body of_me for my burial.
   9 And, truly I_am_saying to_you_all, wherever the gospel may_be_proclaimed in all the world, what this woman did will_ also, _be_being_spoken for a_memorial of_her.
   10 And G‹H‹Youdas/(Yəhūdāh)›H›G G‹Iskariōtēs›G, one of_the twelve, went_away to the chief_priests, in_order_that he_may_give_ him _over to_them.
   11 And they having_heard were_elated, and they_promised to_give silver to_him.
   And he_was_seeking how he_may_give_ him _over conveniently.
   12 And on_the first day of_non-fermented bread, when they_were_sacrificing the passover_, the apprentices/followers of_him are_saying to_him: Where are_you_wanting having_gone_away we_may_prepare, in_order_that you_may_eat the passover_.
   13 And he_is_sending_out two of_the apprentices/followers of_him, and he_is_saying to_them: Be_going into the city, and a_man will_be_meeting with_you_all, bearing a_pitcher of_water, follow after_him.
   14 And wherever he_may_come_in, say to_the the_home_owner, The teacher is_saying: Where is the guest_room of_me, where I_may_eat the passover_ with the apprentices/followers of_me.
   15 And he will_be_showing to_you_all an_ large _upper_room having_been_furnished ready, there prepare for_us.
   16 And the apprentices/followers came_out, and came into the city, and they_found it as he_said to_them, and they_prepared the passover_feast.
   17 And of_evening having_become, he_is_coming with the twelve.
   18 And them reclining and eating, G‹H‹Yēsous said: Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all that one of you_all will_be_giving_ me _over, the one eating with me.
   19 They_began to_be_being_sorrowed, and to_be_saying to_him one by one: Surely_not I.
   20 And he said to_them: Rx-one-Rx of_the twelve it_is, the one dipping_in with me in the bowl.
   21 because On_one_hand the the_son of_Man is_going, as it_has_been_written concerning him, on_the_other_hand woe to_the man that by whom the son of_Man is_being_given_over, better it_was for_him if that man was_ not _born.
   22 And of_them eating, having_taken bread, having_blessed it, broke it and gave to_them, and said: Take, this is the body of_me.
   23 And having_taken the_cup, having_given_thanks, he_gave it to_them, and all drank of it.
   24 And he_said to_them: This is the blood of_the covenant of_me, being_poured_out for many.
   25 Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all that by_no_means I_may_ not _drink of the fruit of_the vine, until that day whenever I_may_be_drinking it new, in the kingdom of_god.
   26 And having_sung_hymns, they_came_out to the Mount of_Olives.
   27 And G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G is_saying to_them, All you_all_will_be_being_stumbled, because it_has_been_written: I_will_be_striking the shepherd and the sheep will_be_being_scattered.
   28 But after the time me to_be_raised, I_will_be_going_before you_all into G‹H‹Galilaia/(Gālīl)›H›G.
   29 And G‹Petros›G was_saying to_him, even if all will_be_being_stumbled, but not I.
   30 And G‹H‹Yēsous is_saying to_him: Truly, I_am_saying to_you that you today, on_this on_night, before the_rooster to_crow twice, will_be_renouncing me thrice.
   31 But he was_saying exceedingly: If it_may_be_fitting me to_die_together with_you, by_no_means I will_ not _be_renouncing you.
   And all were_ also _speaking likewise.
   32 And they_are_coming to a_property, of_which the name is G‹Gethsēmanē›G, and he_is_saying to_the apprentices/followers of_him: Sit_down here, until I_may_pray.
   33 And he_is_taking G‹Petros›G, and G‹H‹Yakōbos/(Ya'aqov)›H›G, and G‹Yōannēs›G, with him, and began to_be_being_greatly_amazed and to_be_distressing.
   34 And he_is_saying to_them: The soul of_me is very_sorrowful to death, remain here and be_watching.
   35 And having_gone_ahead a_little, he_was_falling on the ground and he_was_praying that if possible it_is, the hour may_pass_by from him.
   36 And he_was_saying: father, father, all things are_possible to_you.
   Take_away this cup, from me, but not what I am_wanting, but what you want.
   37 And he_is_coming and is_finding them sleeping, and he_is_saying to_G‹Petros›G: Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx, you_are_sleeping.
   Not were_able_you to_watch one hour.
   38 Be_watching and be_praying that you_all_may_ not _come into temptation.
   On_one_hand the spirit is eager, on_the_other_hand the flesh is weak.
   39 And again having_gone_away, he_prayed having_said the same statement.
   40 And having_come again, he_found them sleeping, for the eyes of_them were being_weighed_down, and they_had_ not _known what they_may_be_answer to_him.
   41 And he_is_coming the third time, and is_saying to_them: Are_you_all_sleeping for_the rest and are_resting.
   It_is_receiving_fully, the hour came.
   See the son of_Man is_being_given_over into the hands of_sinners.
   42 Be_being_raised, we_may_be_going.
   See the one giving_ me _over has_neared.
   43 And immediately still of_him speaking, G‹H‹Youdas/(Yəhūdāh)›H›G is_arriving, one of_the twelve, and with him a_crowd with swords and clubs, from the chief_priests, and the scribes, and the elders.
   44 And the one giving_ him _over had_given a_signal to_them saying: Whomever I_may_kiss, it_is he, apprehend him, and be_leading_away securely.
   45 And having_come immediately having_approached to_him, he_is_saying: , My_great_one, and he_kissed him.
   46 And they laid_on the hands of_them and apprehended him.
   47 But a_certain one of_the ones having_stood_by, having_drawn the sword, fell the slave of_the chief_priest, and he_cut_off the ear of_him.
   48 And G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G answering said to_them, you_all_came_out with swords and clubs to_capture me As against a_robber.
   49 In_every day I_was with you_all teaching in the temple, and you_all_ not _apprehended me, but it_is in_order_that may_be_fulfilled the scriptures.
   50 And having_left him, all fled.
   51 And a_ certain _young_man was_accompanying with_him, having_been_clothed a_linen_cloth over his_naked body.
   And they_are_apprehending him, 52 and the one having_left the linen_cloth, fled naked.
   53 And they_led_away G‹H‹Yēsous to the chief_priest, and all the chief_priests, and the elders, and the scribes.
   are_coming_together.
   to_him.
   54 And G‹Petros›G followed after_him from afar, as_far_as inside to the courtyard of_the chief_priest, and he_was sitting_with with the attendants, and warming himself at the light of_the_fire.
   55 And the the_chief_priests and all the council were_seeking testimony against G‹H‹Yēsous, in_order that to_put_ him _to_death, but they_were_ not _finding.
   56 For many were_giving_false_testimony against him, but the testimonies were not same.
   57 And some having_stood_up, were_giving_false_testimony against him saying, 58 We heard from_him saying, I will_be_tearing_down the this handmade temple, and by three days I_will_be_building another not_hand_made.
   59 And neither thus the testimony of_them was same.
   60 And having_stood_up the chief_priest in the_midst, asked G‹H‹Yēsous saying: Not are_you_answering nothing.
   What is_it these men are_testifying against_you.
   61 But he was_keeping_silent, and not answered nothing.
   Again the chief_priest was_asking him, and is_saying to_him: You are the chosen_one/messiah, the son the blessed one.
   62 And G‹H‹Yēsous said: I am.
   And you_all_will_be_seeing the son of_Man on the_right hand sitting of_the power, and coming with the clouds of_the sky.
   63 And the chief_priest having_torn the clothes of_him is_saying: What need anymore are_we_having of_witnesses.
   64 You_all_heard of_the slander.
   What is_it_appearing to_you_all.
   And the ones all condemned him, liable to_be of_death.
   65 And some began to_be_spitting on_him, and to_be_blindfolding the face of_him, and to_be_beating him, and to_be_saying to_him: Prophesy.
   And the attendants received him with_slaps.
   66 And G‹Petros›G being below in the courtyard, one of_the servant_girls of_the chief_priest is_coming, 67 and having_seen G‹Petros›G warming himself, having_focused_in to_him she_is_saying: You also were with G‹Nazarēnos›G the G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G.
   68 But he disowned it saying: I_have_ neither _known, nor I_am_understanding you what are_saying.
   And he_came_out out into the forecourt.
   69 And the servant_girl having_seen him, began again to_be_saying to_the ones having_stood_by, He is of them.
   70 But again he was_disowning him.
   And after a_little, again the ones having_stood_by were_saying to_G‹Petros›G: Truly you_are from them, for you_are also a_Rx-G‹Galilaios›G-Rx, 71 but he began to_be_cursing and to_be_swearing, I_have_ not _known this man, whom you_all_are_speaking.
   72 And immediately for the_second time a_rooster crowed.
   And G‹Petros›G was_reminded the word as G‹H‹Yēsous said to_him, before the_rooster to_crow thrice you_will_be_renouncing me, and having_broken_down, he_was_weeping.
  Mrk 15  And immediately in_the_morning, the chief_priests having_established a_counsel, with the elders and scribes, and all the council, having_bound G‹H‹Yēsous, they_carried_away him and they_gave_over him to_Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx.
   2 And Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx asked him: Are you the king of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G.
   And he answering to_him is_saying: You are_saying it.
   3 And the chief_priests were_accusing many things against_him.
   4 And Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx again asked him saying: Not you_are_answering nothing.
   See how_many things they_are_accusing against_you.
   5 But G‹H‹Yēsous no_longer answered nothing, so_as Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx to_be_Rx-marvelling-Rx.
   6 And on the_feast, he_was_sending_away to_them one prisoner, whom they_were_excusing.
