   30 G‹H‹Yēsous having_replied said: A_ certain _man was_coming_down from G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G to G‹H‹Yeriⱪō/(Yərīḩō)›H›G, and he_fell_among ˱among˲_robbers, who both having_stripped_ him _off, and having_inflicted wounds, they_went_away having_left him half_dead.
   31 And by coincidence a_ certain _priest was_coming_down on that road, and having_seen him passed_by_opposite.
   32 And likewise also a_G‹H‹Leuitēs/(from_tribe_of_Lēvī)›H›G having_become to the place, having_come and having_seen passed_by_opposite.
   33 But a_ certain _Rx-G‹H‹from_Samareia/(Shomərōn)›H›G-Rx journeying came to him, and having_seen he_was_feeling_compassion 34 and having_approached, he_bound_up the wounds of_him, pouring_on olive_oil and wine, and having_mounted him on his own mount, he_brought him to an_inn and was_taken_care of_him.
   35 And on next the day having_throw_out, he_gave two G‹dēnarion_coins›G to_the innkeeper, and said: Be_taking_care of_him, and whatever anything you_may_additionally_spend, I on the way me to_be_returning I_will_be_giving_back to_you.
   36 Which of_these three is_supposing to_you to_have_become a_neighbor, of_the one having_fallen_in among the robbers.
   37 And he said: The one having_done mercy with him.
   And G‹H‹Yēsous said to_him: Be_going and you be_doing likewise.
   38 And at the time them to_be_going, he came_in into a_ certain _village, and a_ a_certain _woman by_the_name G‹Martha›G welcomed him, 39 and to_this woman she_was a_sister being_called G‹H‹Maria/(Mirəyām)›H›G, who also having_been_seated_beside at the feet the of_G‹H‹Yēsous, was_hearing the word of_him.
   40 But G‹Martha›G was_being_pulled_away about much service, and having_approached said: master, not is_it_mattering to_you that the sister of_me left only me to_be_serving.
   Therefore tell to_her that she_may_help with_me.
   41 But the master answering said to_her: G‹Martha›G, G‹Martha›G, you_are_worrying and you_are_being_troubled about many things, 42 but there_is need of_one, G‹H‹Maria chose for the good portion, which will_ not _be_being_taken_away from her.
  Luk 11  And it_became at the time him to_be in a_ certain _place praying, when he_ceased, someone of_the apprentices/followers of_him said to him: master, teach us to_be_praying, as also G‹Yōannēs›G taught the apprentices/followers of_him.
   2 And he_said to_them: Whenever be_praying, be_saying: father, let_ the name of_you _be_sanctified.
   let_ the kingdom of_you.
   _Come.
   3 Be_giving the to_us daily_needed bread of_us, in_every day.
   4 And forgive to_us the sins of_us, for also we_ ourselves _are_forgiving to_everyone owing to_us.
   And not may_you_carry_in us into temptation.
   5 And he_said to them: Who of you_all will_be_having a_friend, and will_be_going to him at_midnight, and may_say to_him: Friend, lend three loaves to_me, 6 since a_friend of_me arrived from a_journey to me, and I_am_ not _having what I_will_be_setting_before to_him.
   7 And_that one inside answering may_say: Be_ not _bringing_about to_me troubles, the door has_been_shut already, and the little_children of_me are with me in the bed, I_am_ not _being_able having_risen_up to_give anything to_you.
   8 I_am_saying to_you_all, even if will_ not _be_giving to_him having_risen_up, because_of that to_be friend of_him, surely because_of the persistence of_him having_been_raised, will_be_giving to_him of_as_much_as he_is_needing.
   9 And_I am_saying to_you_all: Be_requesting, and it_will_be_being_given to_you_all, be_seeking, and you_all_will_be_finding, be_knocking, and it_will_be_being_opened_up to_you_all.
   10 For everyone requesting is_receiving, and the one seeking is_finding, and to_the one knocking it_is_opening_up.
   11 and who of of_you_all the son will_be_requesting the father, a_fish, and instead_of a_fish, will_be_handing_out a_serpent.
   to_him 12 or also will_be_requesting an_egg, will_be_handing_out a_scorpion to_him.
   13 Therefore if you_all being evil, have_known good gifts to_be_giving to_the children of_you_all, for_how_much more the father who is of heaven will_be_giving the_ holy _spirit to_the ones requesting him.
   14 And he_was throwing_out a_ mute _demon.
   And it_became the demon having_come_out, the mute man spoke.
   And the crowds Rx-marvelled-Rx.
   15 But some of them said: He_is_throwing_out the demons by G‹Be'elzeboul›G the ruler of_the demons.
   16 And others testing, were_seeking a_sign from the_sky from him.
   17 But he having_known the thoughts of_them said to_them: Every kingdom having_been_divided against itself is_being_desolated, and a_house against a_house is_falling.
   18 And if G‹H‹Satan/(Sāţān)›H›G also was_divided against himself, how will_ the kingdom of_him _be_being_stood.
   Because you_all_are_saying, by G‹Be'elzeboul›G me to_be_throwing_out the demons.
   19 And if I am_throwing_out the demons by G‹Be'elzeboul›G, by whom are_ the sons of_you_all _throwing_out.
   Because_of this, they will_be judges of_you_all.
   20 But if I am_throwing_out the demons by the_finger of_god, consequently the kingdom of_god came on you_all.
   21 Whenever the strong one having_been_armed, may_be_guarding the palace of_himself, the things possessing of_him is, in peace, 22 but when stronger than him having_come_over, may_overcome him, he_is_taking_away the whole_armor of_him in which he_had_trusted, and is_distributing the plunder of_him.
   23 The one being not with me, is against me, and the one not gathering_together with me, is_scattering.
   24 whenever the unclean spirit may_come_out from the person, it_is_passing_through through waterless places seeking rest, and not finding, it_is_saying: I_will_be_returning to the house of_me, whence I_came_out.
   25 And having_come, it_is_finding it having_been_swept and having_been_adorned.
   26 Then it_is_going and is_taking seven other spirits more_evil than itself, and having_come_in, is_dwelling there, and the last of_ that _person is_becoming, worse than the first.
   27 And it_became at the time him to_be_saying these things, a_certain woman from the crowd having_lifted_up a_voice, said to_him: Blessed is the womb having_borne you, and the_breasts which you_nursed.
   28 But he said: Indeed_rather, blessed are the ones hearing the word of_god and keeping it.
   29 And the crowds being_increased, he_began to_be_saying: this generation is evil generation, it_is_seeking a_sign and a_sign will_ not _be_being_given to_it, except the sign of_G‹H‹Yōnas/(Yōnāh)›H›G.
   30 For as G‹H‹Yōnas became a_sign to_the G‹H‹Nineuitēs/(ones_from_Nīnəvēh)›H›G, thus the son of_Man also will_be to_ this _generation.
   31 The_queen of_the_south will_be_being_raised at the judgment with the men this generation, and will_be_condemning them, because she_came from the ends of_the earth to_hear the wisdom of_G‹H‹Solomōn/(Shəlmoh)›H›G, and see, ˱one˲_greater than G‹H‹Solomōn is here.
   32 G‹H‹Nineuitēs men will_be_standing_up at the judgment with this generation, and they_will_be_condemning it, because they_repented at the proclamation of_G‹H‹Yōnas, and see, ˱one˲_greater than G‹H‹Yōnas is here.
   33 no_one having_lit a_lamp is_putting it in a_hidden_place, nor under the basket, but on the lampstand, in_order_that the ones entering_in may_be_seeing the light.
   34 The lamp of_the body is the eye of_you.
   Whenever the eye of_you may_be healthy, all the body of_you is also bright, but when evil may_be, the body of_you is also dark.
   35 Therefore be_looking_out, lest the light in you is darkness.
   36 Therefore if the whole body of_you is bright, not having any dark part, it_will_ all _be bright, as whenever the lamp may_be_illuminating you with_shining.
   37 And at the time to_speak, a_G‹Farisaios_sect_member›G is_asking him so_that he_may_eat_breakfast with him, and having_come_in, he_sat_down.
   38 And the G‹Farisaios_sect_member›G having_seen it, Rx-marvelled-Rx that he_was_ not first _washed before the dinner.
   39 But the master said to him: Now you_all G‹Farisaios_sect›G are_cleansing the part outside of_the cup and of_the platter, and inside of_you_all is_being_full of_theft and wickedness.
   40 Foolish.
   Not the one having_made the_ outside _part, also made the_ inside _part.
   41 However give as_alms the things being_within, and see, all things is clean to_you_all.
   42 But woe to_you_all G‹Farisaios_sect›G, because you_all_are_tithing mint, and rue, and every garden_plant, and you_all_are_passing_by the justice and the love of_god.
   And these things it_was_fitting to_do, and_those things to_ not _neglect.
   43 Woe to_you_all G‹Farisaios_sect›G, because you_all_are_loving the best_seat in the synagogues, and the greetings in the marketplaces.
   44 Woe to_you_all, because you_all_are as unseen tombs, and the people walking over they_have_ not _known it.
   45 And someone of_the lawyers answering is_saying to_him: Teacher, saying these things, you_are_insulting us also.
   46 But he said, woe also to_you_all the lawyers.
   Because you_all_are_burdening the people with_ unbearable _burdens, and you_all yourselves you_all_are_ not _touching ˱upon˲_the burdens with_one of_the fingers of_you_all.
   47 Woe to_you_all, because you_all_are_building the tombs of_the prophets, but the fathers of_you_all killed_ them _off.
   48 Consequently you_all_are_testifying and you_all_are_consenting to_the works of_the fathers of_you_all, because they on_one_hand killed_ them _off, on_the_other_hand you_all are_building their_tombs.
   49 Because_of this the wisdom of_god also said: I_will_be_sending_out prophets and ambassadors to them, and they_will_be_killing_off and they_will_be_persecuting of them, 50 in_order_that the blood of_all the prophets, being_poured_out from the_foundation of_the_world may_be_sought_out, from this generation, 51 from the_blood of_G‹H‹Abel/(Hevel)›H›G to the_blood of_G‹Zaⱪarias›G, of_the one having_destroyed between the altar and the house.
   Yes, I_am_saying to_you_all, it_will_be_being_sought_out from this generation.
   52 Woe to_you_all lawyers, because you_all_took_away the key of_the knowledge, yourselves you_all_ not _came_in, and you_all_forbade the ones coming_in.
   53 And_from_there of_him of_having_come_out, the scribes and the G‹Farisaios_sect›G began to_be_resenting him terribly, and to_be_interrogating him about more things, 54 lying_in_wait him to_catch something out_of the mouth of_him.
  Luk 12  In which things the myriads of_the crowd, having_been_gathered_together, so_as to_be_trampling one_another, he_began to_be_saying to the apprentices/followers of_him first: Be_taking_heed to_yourselves of the leaven, of_the G‹Farisaios_sect›G, which is hypocrisy.
   2 But there_is nothing having_been_covered_up, which will_ not _be_being_revealed, and hidden which will_ not _be_being_known.
   3 Instead_of that as_much_as you_all_said in the darkness, will_be_being_heard in the light, and what you_all_spoke to the ear in the private_rooms, will_be_being_proclaimed on the housetops.
   4 And I_am_saying to_you_all, the friends of_me, be_ not _afraid of of_the ones killing_off the body, and after these things not having anything more_abundant to_do.
   5 But I_will_be_showing to_you_all whom you_may_be_afraid: be_afraid of_the one after the time to_kill_off, having authority to_throw_in him into G‹geenna›G, yes, I_am_saying to_you_all, be_fearing this one.
   6 are_ not five sparrows _being_sold for_ two _G‹assarion_coin›Gs.
   And not one of them is having_been_forgotten before god.
   7 But even the hairs of_the head of_you_all all have_been_numbered.
   Be_ not _fearing, you_all_are_carrying_value than many sparrows.
   8 And I_am_saying to_you_all, everyone who may_confess in me before people, also the son of_Man will_be_confessing, in him before the angels of_god, 9 but the one having_disowned me before people, will_be_being_renounced before the angels of_god.
   10 And everyone who will_be_saying a_word against the son of_Man, will_be_being_forgiven to_him, but to_the one having_slandered against the holy spirit, will_ not _be_being_forgiven.
   11 And whenever they_may_be_carrying_in you_all before the synagogues, and the rulers, and the authorities, you_all_may_ not _worry how or what you_all_may_defend or what you_all_may_say, 12 for the holy spirit will_be_teaching you_all in the_same hour what it_is_fitting to_say.
   13 And someone from the crowd said to_him: Teacher, tell to_the brother of_me to_divide the inheritance with me.
   14 But he he_said to_him: Man, who me appointed a_judge or arbitrator over you_all.
   15 And he_said to them: Be_watching and be_keeping from all greediness, because the life of_him is not in the thing to_be_abounding to_anyone, of the things possessing to_him.
   16 And he_spoke a_parable to them saying: The land of_a_ certain rich _man yielded_well.
   17 And he_was_reasoning by himself saying: What I_may_do, because I_am_ not _having where I_will_be_gathering_together the fruits of_me.
   18 And he_said: This I_will_be_doing: I_will_be_taking_down the barns and greater barns of_me and I_will_be_building, I_will_be_gathering_together there all the grain and the good things of_me.
   19 And I_will_be_saying to_the soul of_me: Soul, you_are_having many good things lying for many years, be_resting, eat, drink, be_being_gladdened.
   20 But god said to_him: Foolish, on_this night, requesting of you the soul of_you, and what you_prepared, to_whom it_will_be.
   21 Thus the one storing_up for_himself and not being_rich toward god.
   22 And he_said to the apprentices/followers Because_of this I_am_saying to_you_all, be_ not _worrying for_your life, what you_all_may_eat nor for_the body what you_all_may_dress_in.
   23 For your life is more than the food, and the body than the clothing.
   24 Observe the ravens, because they_are_ not _sowing nor are_they_reaping, to_which not is a_storeroom nor barn, and god is_feeding them.
   For_how_much more you_all are_carrying_value than the birds.
   25 And which of you_all worrying, is_able to_add an_hour to the lifespan of_him.
   26 Therefore if you_all_are_ not_even _being_able the_least, why are_you_all_worrying about the rest.
   27 Observe the lilies how it_is_growing, neither it_is_laboring nor it_is_spinning, but I_am_saying to_you_all, not_even G‹H‹Solomōn/(Shəlmoh)›H›G in all the glory of_him, clothed as one of_these.
   28 But if god is_ thus _dressing the grass in the_field being here today, and tomorrow being_throw into a_furnace, for_how_much rather you_all, little_faith ones.
   29 Also you_all be_ not _seeking what you_all_may_eat, or what you_all_may_drink, and be_ not _being_worried.
   30 For all the nations of_the world are_seeking_after these things, but the father of_you_all has_known that you_all_are_needing of_these things.
   31 However be_seeking the kingdom of_him, and these things will_be_being_added to_you_all.
   32 Be_ not _fearing, little flock, because the father of_you_all took_pleasure, to_give to_you_all the kingdom.
   33 Sell the things possessing of_you_all, and give alms.
   Make to_yourselves purses not being_grown_old, a_treasure inexhaustible in the heavens, where thief is_ not _nearing nor moth is_ruining.
   34 For where is the treasure of_you_all, there also the heart of_you_all will_be.
   35 Let_be the loins of_you_all having_been_girded_about, and the lamps being_burned, 36 and you_all similar to_people waiting_for the master of_themselves, when he_may_depart from the wedding_festivities, in_order_that having_come and having_knocked, they_may_open_up to_him.
   immediately.
   37 Blessed are those slaves, whom the master having_come, will_be_finding watching.
   Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all that he_will_be_girding_about himself and will_be_reclining them, and having_come_up, he_will_be_serving unto_them.
   38 And_if he_may_come in the second even_if in the third watch, and may_find them thus, blessed are those.
   39 But be_knowing this, that if the home_owner had_known in_what hour the thief is_coming, he_watched would and he_ would not _allowed the house of_him to_be_dug_through.
   40 Also you_all be_becoming ready, because you_all_are_ not _supposing in_what hour, the son of_Man is_coming.
   41 And G‹Petros›G said: master, are_you_telling the this parable to us, or also to all.
   42 And the master said: Who consequently is the faithful prudent manager , whom the master will_be_appointing over the service of_him, to_be_giving ration in season.
   43 Blessed is the that slave, whom the master of_him having_come, will_be_finding doing thus.
   44 Truly I_am_saying to_you_all that he_will_be_appointing him over all the things possessing of_him.
   45 But if that slave may_say in the heart of_him, the master of_me Is_delaying to_be_coming, and may_begin to_be_striking the servant_boys and the servant_girls, to_be_eating jointly and to_be_drinking and to_be_being_drunk, 46 the master of_ that _slave will_be_coming in a_day which he_is_ not _expecting, and in an_hour which he_is_ not _knowing, and will_be_dismembering him, and will_be_appointing the portion of_him with the unbelievers.
   47 And that slave, having_known the will of_the master of_him, and not having_prepared or having_done for the will of_him, will_be_being_beat many blows, 48 but the one not having_known, but having_done things worthy of_beatings, will_be_being_beat few blows.
   And to_everyone to_whom was_given much, much will_be_being_sought from him, and to_whom they_entrusted they_will_be_requesting him much, more_abundantly.
   49 I_came to_throw Fire on the earth, and how I_am_wanting if it_was_ already _kindled.
   50 But I_am_having to_be_immersed immersion, and how I_am_being_pressed until of_which it_may_be_accomplished.
   51 You_all_are_supposing that I_arrived to_give peace on the earth.
   No, I_am_saying to_you_all, but rather division.
   52 For from the time now will_be, five in one house having_been_divided, three against two, and two against three.
   53 father will_be_being_divided against son, and son against father, mother against daughter, and daughter against mother, mother_in_law against the daughter-in-law of_her, and daughter-in-law against mother_in_law.
   54 And he_was_saying also to_the crowds: Whenever you_all_may_see a_cloud rising from the_west, immediately you_all_are_saying, A_rainstorm is_coming, and it_is_becoming thus.
   55 And whenever a_south_wind is blowing, you_all_are_saying, will_be scorching_heat, and it_is_becoming.
   56 Hypocrites.
   You_all_have_known how to_be_approving the appearance of_the sky and of_the earth but how you_all_have_ not _known to_be_scrutinizing this time.
   57 And why even for yourselves, you_all_are_ not _judging what is right.
   58 For as you_are_going with the opponent of_you before a_ruler in the way, give effort to_have_released from him, lest he_may_be_dragging_ you _away to the judge, and the judge will_be_giving_ you _over to_the constable, and the constable will_be_throwing you into prison.
   59 I_am_saying to_you, by_no_means you_may_ not _come_out from_there until you_may_give_back even the last G‹lepton_coin›G.
  Luk 13  And some were_being_present at the_same time, reporting to_him about the G‹Galilaios›G, of_whom the blood Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx mixed with the sacrifices of_them.
   2 And answering he_said to_them: You_all_are_supposing that these G‹Galilaios›G, became sinners beyond all the G‹Galilaios›G, because such they_have_suffered.
   3 No, I_am_saying to_you_all, but if you_all _may_ not _be_repenting, all will_be_perishing likewise.
   4 Or those eighteen on whom the tower in G‹Silōam›G fell and killed_ them _off, are_you_all_supposing that they became debtors beyond all the people dwelling_in G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G.
   5 No, I_am_saying to_you_all, but if you_all _may_ not _be_repenting, all will_be_perishing likewise.
   6 And he_was_speaking this parable: Someone was_having a_fig_tree having_been_planted in the vineyard of_him, and he_came seeking fruit on it, and he_ not _found any.
   7 And he_said to the Vinedresser, see three, years from that I_am_coming seeking fruit on this fig_tree, and I_am_ not _finding any.
   cut_ it _off, for_ why _reason it_is_ even _wasting the ground.
   8 And he answering is_saying to_him: Sir, allow it also this year, until of_which I_may_dig around it and I_may_put manure, 9 and_if on_one_hand it_may_produce fruit in the time coming, on_the_other_hand if not surely you_will_be_cutting_ it _off.
   10 And he_was teaching in one of_the synagogues on the sabbaths.
   11 And see, a_woman having a_spirit of_sickness eighteen years, and she_was bending_over and not being_able to_straighten_up to the full_extent.
   12 And having_seen her, G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G calling_out and said to_her: Woman, you_have_been_sent_away from_the sickness of_you.
   13 And he_laid_on his hands on_her, and immediately she_was_restored and was_glorifying god.
   14 But the synagogue_leader answering, resenting because G‹H‹Yēsous healed on_the sabbath, he_was_saying to_the crowd, because Six days are in which it_is_fitting to_be_working, therefore coming in them be_being_healed, and not on_the day of_the sabbath.
   15 And the master answered to_him and said: Hypocrites.
   Is_ not _untying each of_you_all the ox of_him, on_the sabbath, or the donkey from the manger, and having_led_away it is_giving_to_drink it.
   16 And this being daughter of_G‹H‹Abra'am/('Avərāhām)›H›G, whom G‹H‹Satan/(Sāţān)›H›G bound, see, ten and eight years, it_was_ not _fitting to_be_untied/released from this bond on_the day of_the sabbath.
   17 And saying of_him these things, all the ones opposing to_him were_being_disgraced, and all the crowd was_rejoicing at all the glorious things becoming by him.
   18 Therefore he_was_saying: To_what is the kingdom of_god similar, and to_what I_will_be_likening it.
   19 It_is similar to_a_seed of_mustard, which a_man having_taken, throw into garden of_himself, and it_grew and became into a_tree, and the birds of_the sky nested in the branches of_it.
   20 And again he_said: To_what I_will_be_likening the kingdom of_god.
   21 It_is similar to_leaven, which a_woman having_taken, hid_in in three satons of_wheat_flour, until all of_which was_leavened.
   22 And he_was_passing_ by _through cities and villages teaching, and making journey toward G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G.
   23 And someone said to_him: master, if the ones being_saved are few.
   And he said to them, 24 Be_striving to_come_in through the narrow door, because I_am_saying to_you_all many, will_be_seeking to_come_in and they will_ not _be_able.
   25 From what time the the_home_owner may_be_raised and may_shut the door, and you_all_may_begin to_have_stood outside and to_be_knocking the door saying: Sir, open_up to_us, and answering he_will_be_saying to_you_all: I_have_ not _known you_all, from_where you_all_are.
   26 Then you_will_be_beginning to_be_saying: We_ate and we_drank before of_you, and you_taught in the roads of_us.
   27 And he_will_be_speaking, saying to_you_all: I_have_ not _known from_where you_all_are, withdraw from me, all workers of_unrighteousness.
   28 There will_be weeping and grating of_teeth, whenever you_all_may_see G‹H‹Abra'am, and G‹H‹Isa'ak/(Yiʦəḩāq)›H›G, and G‹H‹Yakōb/(Ya'aqov)›H›G, and all the prophets, in the kingdom of_god, but you_all being_throw_out out.
   29 And they_will_be_coming from the_east and the_west from the_north and the_south, and they_will_be_being_reclined in the kingdom of_god.
   30 And see, there_are last ones who will_be first ones, and there_are first ones who will_be last ones.
   31 In same the hour some G‹Farisaios_sect›G approached saying to_him: Come_out and be_going from_here, because Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx is_wanting to_kill_ you _off.
   32 And he_said to_them: Having_been_gone say to_the this fox: See I_am_throwing_out demons, and I_am_finishing_out healings today and tomorrow, and on_the third day I_am_being_perfected.
   33 However it_is_fitting me, to_be_going today and tomorrow and on_the day coming, because it_is_ not _permitting a_prophet to_perish outside G‹H‹Hierousalēm.
   34 G‹H‹Hierousalēm, G‹H‹Hierousalēm, the city killing_off the prophets, and throwing_stones at_the ones having_been_sent_out to her, how_often I_wanted to_gather_together the children of_you, that manner a_hen gathers the brood of_herself under her wings, and you_all_ not _wanted.
   35 See the house of_you_all is_being_left desolate to_you_all.
   And I_am_saying to_you_all, by_no_means you_all_may_ not _see me until you_all_may_say: having_been_blessed is the one coming in the_name of_the_master.
  Luk 14  And it_became at the time him to_come into a_house of_one of_the rulers G‹Farisaios_sect›G, on_a_sabbath to_eat bread, and they were watching_ him _closely.
   2 And see, a_ certain _man was dropsical before him.
   3 And G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G answering spoke to the lawyers and to_the_G‹Farisaios_sect›G saying: Is_it_permitting on_the sabbath to_heal or not.
   4 But they kept_quiet.
   And having_taken_hold of_him, he_healed him and sent_away him.
   5 And he_said to them: Of_which of_you_all a_son or an_ox into a_pit will_be_falling, and not immediately he_will_be_pulling_ him _up on the_day of_the sabbath.
   6 And they_were_ not _able to_be_answered_back to these things.
   7 And he_was_speaking a_parable to the ones having_been_invited, noticing how they_were_choosing the best_places, saying to them, 8 Whenever you_may_be_called by anyone to wedding_festivities, you _may_ not _be_reclining in the best_place, lest one more_honored than you may_be having_been_called by him, 9 and having_come, the one having_invited you and him he_will_be_saying to_you: Give to_this one your_place, and then you_may_begin to_be_keeping the last place with shame.
   10 But whenever you_may_be_called, having_been_gone sit_down in the last place, in_order_that whenever the one having_invited you may_come he_will_be_saying to_you: Friend, move_up higher.
   Then glory will_be to_you before all the ones reclining with_you.
   11 Because everyone the one exalting himself will_be_being_humbled, and the one humbling himself will_be_being_exalted.
   12 And he_was_ also _saying to_the one having_invited him: Whenever you_may_be_making a_dinner or a_supper, be_ not _calling the friends of_you, nor the brothers of_you, nor the relatives of_you, nor ˱your˲_ rich _neighbors, lest also they may_invite_back you and a_repayment may_become to_you.
   13 But whenever you_may_be_making a_banquet be_calling the_poor, the_crippled, the_lame, the_blind, 14 and you_will_be blessed, because they_are_ not _having to_repay to_you, for will_be_being_repaid to_you in the resurrection of_the righteous.
   15 And one of_the ones reclining having_heard these things, said to_him: Blessed is_he who will_be_eating bread in the kingdom of_god.
   16 But he said to_him: A_man certain was_making a_ great _supper, and invited many.
   17 And he_sent_out the slave of_him at_the hour of_the supper to_say to_the ones having_been_invited: Be_coming, because it_is now ready.
   18 And all began of one to_be_excusing themselves.
   The first said to_him: I_bought a_field and I_am_having necessity having_come_out to_see it, I_am_asking you be_holding me having_been_excused.
   19 And another one said: I_bought five pairs of_oxen and I_am_going to_approve them, I_am_asking you be_holding me having_been_excused.
   20 And another said, I_married a_wife and because_of this I_am_ not _being_able to_come.
   21 And having_arrived, the slave reported these things to_the master of_him.
   Then having_been_angered, the the_home_owner said to_the slave of_him: Come_out quickly into the roads and streets of_the city, and bring_in here the poor, and crippled, and blind, and lame.
   22 And the slave said: Master, it_has_become what you_commanded, and still there_is place.
   23 And the master said to the slave: Come_out into the roads and fences, and compel them to_come_in, in_order_that the house of_me may_be_filled, 24 for I_am_saying to_you_all that no_one of_ those _men having_been_invited, will_be_tasting of_the supper of_me.
   25 And great crowds were_going_with to_him, and having_been_turned, he_said to them, 26 If anyone is_coming to me, and is_ not _hating the father of_himself, and the mother, and the wife, and the children, and the brothers, and the sisters, and still also the life of_himself, is_ not _able to_be a_apprentice/follower of_me.
   27 Whoever not is_bearing the cross of_him and is_coming after me, is_ not _able to_be a_apprentice/follower of_me.
   28 For which of you_all wanting to_build a_tower, not first having_sat_down, is_counting the cost, whether he_is_having enough for the_completion.
   29 In_order_that lest having_laid a_foundation of_it and not being_able to_finish it, all observing it may_begin to_be_mocking at_him 30 saying, This man began to_be_building, and was_ not _able to_finish it.
   31 Or what king going to_encounter with_another king in war, not having_sat_down first will_be_counselling whether he_is powerful with ten thousands to_meet with_the one with twenty thousands coming against him.
   32 And if not surely still of_him being far_away, having_sent_out a_delegation is_asking peace.
   33 Therefore thus everyone of you_all who is_ not _bidding_goodbye to_all the things possessing of_himself, is_ not _able to_be a_apprentice/follower of_me.
   34 Therefore the salt is good, but if the salt may_be_made_tasteless, with what it_will_be_being_seasoned.
   35 It_is neither suitable for soil nor for manure, they_are_throwing it out.
   The one having ears to_be_hearing, let_him_be_hearing.
  Luk 15  And all the tax_collectors and the sinners were nearing to_him to_be_hearing from_him.
   2 And both the G‹Farisaios_sect›G and the scribes were_grumbling saying, This man is_accepting sinners and is_eating_with with_them.
   3 And he_said to them this parable saying, 4 What person of you_all, having a_hundred sheep and having_lost one of them, is_ not _leaving the ninety nine in the desert, and is_going after the sheep having_lost, until he_may_find it.
   5 And having_found it, he_is_laying_on it on the shoulders of_him rejoicing.
   6 And having_come to the the_house, he_is_calling_together his friends and his neighbors, saying to_them: Be_rejoicing_with with_me, because I_found the sheep of_me having_been_lost.
   7 I_am_saying to_you_all that thus joy in heaven will_be over one sinner repenting, than over ninety nine righteous ones, who are_having no need of_repentance.
   8 Or what woman having ten drachmas, if she_may_lose one drachma, is_ not _lighting a_lamp, and is_sweeping the house, and is_seeking carefully, until of_which she_may_find it.
   9 And having_found it, is_calling_together her friends and neighbors saying: Be_rejoicing_with with_me, because I_found the drachma that I_lost.
   10 Thus I_am_saying to_you_all, there_is_becoming joy before the angels of_god over one sinner repenting.
   11 And he_said: A_ certain _man was_having two sons.
   12 And the younger of_them said to_the father: father, give to_me the breaking_down portion of_the estate.
   he and he_divided the living to_them.
   13 And after not many days having_gathered_together all, the younger son Rx-travelled-Rx into a_ distant _country, and there scattered the estate of_him, living intemperately.
   14 But having_spent all things of_him, there_became a_ mighty _famine throughout that country, and he began to_be_being_deficient.
   15 And having_been_gone, he_was_joined_together to_one of_the citizens of_ that _country, and he_sent him into the fields of_him to_be_feeding pigs.
   16 And he_was_desiring to_be_satisfied from the carob_pods which the pigs were_eating, and no_one was_giving to_him.
   17 To but himself having_come he_was_saying: How_many hired ones of_the father of_me are_abounding of_bread, but I am_perishing with_famine here.
   18 Having_risen_up, I_will_be_going to the father of_me, and I_will_be_saying to_him: father, I_sinned against heaven and before you, 19 I_am no_longer worthy to_be_called the_son of_you.
   Make me as one of_the hired ones of_you.
   20 And having_risen_up, he_came to the father of_himself.
   But still being_ far _away from_him, the father of_him saw him, and was_feeling_compassion, and having_run, embraced on the neck of_him and kissed him.
   21 And the son said to_him: father, I_sinned against heaven and before you, I_am no_longer worthy to_be_called a_son of_you.
   22 But the father said to the slaves of_him: Quickly bring_out first robe, and dress_ him _in, and give a_ring for the hand of_him, and sandals for his feet, 23 and be_bringing the grain_fed calf, sacrifice it, and having_eaten we_may_be_gladdened.
   24 Because this son of_me was dead and revived, was having_been_lost and was_found.
   And they_began to_be_being_gladdened.
   25 And the elder son of_him was in the_field, and while coming, he_neared to_the house, he_heard of_music and dancing.
   26 And having_called_to one of_the servants, he_was_inquiring what might_be these things.
   27 And he said to_him, The brother of_you is_coming, and the father of_you sacrificed the grain_fed calf, because he_took_back being_sound him.
   28 But he_was_angered and he_was_ not _wanting to_come_in.
   And the father of_him having_come_out, was_imploring him.
   29 And he answering said to_the father of_him: See so_many years I_am_serving for_you, and I_ never _passed_by a_commandment of_you, and you_ never _gave a_young_goat to_me, in_order_that I_may_be_gladdened with the friends of_me.
   30 But when this son of_you, he_came having_devoured the living of_you with prostitutes, you_sacrificed grain_fed calf for_him.
   31 And he said to_him: Child, you are always with me, and all the things mine is is yours.
   32 But it_was_fitting to_be_gladdened also to_be_elated, because this brother of_you, was dead and lived again, and having_lost and he_was_found.
  Luk 16  And he_was_saying also to the apprentices/followers: A_ certain _man was rich, who was_having a_manager, and this one was_accused to_him as scattering the things possessing of_him.
   2 And having_called him, he_said to_him: What is this I_am_hearing concerning you.
   Give_back the account of_the management of_you, for you_are_ not _being_able anymore to_be_managing.
   3 And the manager said by himself: What may_I_do, because the master of_me is_taking_away the management from me.
   I_am_ not _able To_be_digging, and I_am_being_ashamed to_be_begging.
   4 I_knew what I_may_do, in_order_that whenever I_may_be_removed from the management, they_may_receive me into the homes of_them.
   5 And having_called_to each one of_the debtors of_the master of_himself, he_was_saying to_the first: How_much you_are_owing to_the master of_me.
   6 And he said: A_hundred Rx-G‹H‹batos/(bat)_dd measuresdd*›H›G-Rx of_olive_oil.
   And he said to_him: Receive of_you the bills and having_sat_down quickly write fifty.
   7 Then to_another he_said: And how_much are_ you _owing.
   And he said: A_hundred Rx-G‹H‹koros/(kor)_dd measuresdd*›H›G-Rx of_wheat.
   He_is_saying to_him: Receive of_you the bills and write eighty.
   8 And the master praised the manager of_unrighteousness, because he_performed prudently.
   Because the sons of_ this _age are more_prudently beyond the sons of_the light in the generation of_themselves.
   9 And I am_saying to_you_all, make friends for_yourselves by the money of_unrighteousness, in_order_that whenever it_may_fail, they_may_receive you_all into the eternal dwellings.
   10 The one faithful with the_least, is also faithful with much, and the one unrighteous with the_least, is also unrighteous with much.
   11 Therefore if you_all_became not faithful with unrighteous money, who will_be_entrusting true wealth to_you_all.
   12 And if you_all_became not faithful with the stranger, who will_be_giving the_ your _things to_you_all.
   13 Not_one house_servant is_able to_be_serving for_two masters, for either he_will_be_hating the one, and the other he_will_be_loving, or of_the_one he_will_be_upholding, and of_the other he_will_be_despising.
   You_all_are_ not _being_able to_be_serving for_god and money.
   14 And all the G‹Farisaios_sect›G were_hearing these things, being money_lovers, and they_were_sneering_at him.
   15 And he_said to_them: You_all are the ones justifying yourselves before the people, but god is_knowing the hearts of_you_all, because the thing exalted among people, an_abomination is before god.
   16 The law and the prophets were until G‹Yōannēs›G, from then the kingdom of_god is_being_gospel_preached, and everyone is_forcing into it.
   17 But it_is easier for_heaven and earth to_pass_away, than one serif of_the law to_fall.
   18 Everyone sending_away the wife of_him and marrying another, is_committing_adultery, and every the one marrying having_been_sent_away from a_husband, is_committing_adultery.
   19 And a_ certain _man was rich, and was_dressing_in purple and linen, being_gladdened splendidly in_every day.
   20 And a_ certain _poor man by_the_name G‹Lazaros›G, had_been_laid at the gate of_him, having_been_ulcerated 21 and desiring to_be_satisfied from falling from the table of_the rich man, but even the dogs coming were_licking_up the ulcers of_him.
   22 And it_became the poor man to_die_off, and him to_be_carried_away by the angels into the bosom of_G‹H‹Abra'am/('Avərāhām)›H›G.
   And the rich man died_off also and was_buried.
   23 And in G‹Hadēs›G having_lifted_up the eyes of_him, being in torments, he_is_seeing G‹H‹Abra'am from afar, and G‹Lazaros›G in the bosoms of_him.
   24 And he having_called said, father G‹H‹Abra'am, show_mercy to_me and send G‹Lazaros›G, in_order_that he_may_dip the extremity of_the finger of_him in_water, and may_cool_down the tongue of_me, because I_am_being_distressed in this flame.
   25 But G‹H‹Abra'am said: Child, be_reminded that you_took_back the good of_you in the life of_you, and G‹Lazaros›G likewise the evil.
   But now here he_is_being_comforted, and you are_being_distressed.
   26 And among all these things, between us and you_all a_chasm great has_been_established, so_that the ones wanting to_pass_through here to you_all may_ not _be_able, nor may_be_crossing_over from_there to us.
   27 And, he_said, therefore I_am_asking you father, that you_may_send him to the house of_the father of_me, 28 for I_am_having five brothers, so_that he_may_be_testifying to_them, in_order_that they may_ not also _come to this place of_torment.
   29 But G‹H‹Abra'am is_saying: They_are_having G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G and the prophets, them_let_hear from_them.
   30 And he said: No, father G‹H‹Abra'am, but if someone from the_dead may_be_gone to them, they_will_be_repenting.
   31 But he_said to_him: If they_are_ not _hearing from_G‹H‹Mōsēs and the prophets, not_even if someone from the_dead may_rise_up, they_will_be_being_persuaded.
  Luk 17  And he_said to the apprentices/followers of_him: It_is impossible of_which the temptations to_ not _come, however woe to_him by whom it_is_coming.
   2 It_is_improving for_him if a_ milling _stone is_hung_around around the neck of_him, and he_has_been_thrown_down into the sea, than that he_may_stumble of_ one these _little ones.
   3 Be_taking_heed to_yourselves.
   If the brother of_you may_sin, give_rebuke to_him, and if he_may_repent, forgive to_him.
   4 And if he_may_sin against you seven_times in_the day, and seven_times he_may_return to you, saying I_am_repenting, you_will_be_forgiving to_him.
   5 And the ambassadors said to_the master: Add faith to_us.
   6 And the master said: If you_all_are_having faith as a_seed of_mustard, you_all_ would _were_saying to_mulberry_tree this: Be_uprooted and be_planted in the sea, and it_ would _submitted to_you_all.
   7 And which of you_all having a_slave, plowing or shepherding, who having_come_in out_of the field will_be_saying to_him: Having_come_up immediately sit_down to_eat.
   8 But not he_will_be_saying to_him: Prepare what I_may_dine, and having_girded_about be_serving unto_me, until I_may_eat and I_may_drink, and after these things you will_be_eating and will_be_drinking.
   9 Is_ not _having thankfulness to_the slave, because he_did the things having_been_directed.
   10 Thus also you_all whenever you_all_may_do all the things having_been_directed to_you_all, be_saying, we_are Useless slaves, we_have_done what we_were_ought to_do.
   11 And it_became at the time to_be_going to G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G, and because_of he was_passing_through the_midst of_G‹H‹Samareia/(Shomərōn)›H›G and G‹H‹Galilaia/(Gālīl)›H›G.
   12 And on_coming_in of_him into a_certain village, met ten leprous men, who stood from_afar.
   13 And they lifted_up their_voice saying: G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, master, show_mercy to_us.
   14 And having_seen them, he_said to_them: Having_been_gone show yourselves to_the priests.
   And it_became at the time to_be_going to_them, they_were_cleansed.
   15 And one of them having_seen that he_was_healed, returned with a_ loud _voice glorifying god, 16 and he_fell on his_face before the feet of_him, giving_thanks to_him, and he was a_Rx-G‹H‹from_Samareia/(Shomərōn)›H›G-Rx.
   17 And G‹H‹Yēsous answering said: /Were/_ not _cleansed the ten.
   But where are the nine.
   18 Not were_they_found having_returned to_give glory to_god, except this foreigner.
   19 And he_said to_him: Having_stood_up, be_going, the faith of_you has_healed you.
   20 And having_been_asked by the G‹Farisaios_sect›G when the kingdom of_god is_coming, he_answered to_them and said, the kingdom of_god Is_ not _coming with observation, 21 nor will_they_be_saying: See here it_is, or: There it_is.
   For see, the kingdom of_god is inside of_you_all.
   22 And he_said to the apprentices/followers: Days will_be_coming when you_all_will_be_desiring to_see one of_the days of_the son of_Man, and you_all will_ not _be_seeing it.
   23 And they_will_be_saying to_you_all: See there he_is, or: See here he_is, you_all_may_ not _pursue.
   24 For as the lightning flashing from the one_part under the sky is_shining to the one_part under sky, thus the son of_Man will_be.
   25 But first it_is_fitting him to_suffer many things, and to_be_rejected by this generation.
   26 And as it_became in the days of_G‹H‹Nōe/(Noḩa)›H›G, thus it_will_be also in the days of_the son of_Man: 27 they_were_eating, they_were_drinking, they_were_marrying, they_were_being_betrothed, until that day G‹H‹Nōe came_in into the ark, and the flood came and destroyed all.
   28 Likewise as it_became in the days of_Rx-G‹H‹Lōt/(Lōţ)›H›G-Rx: they_were_eating, they_were_drinking, they_were_buying, they_were_selling, they_were_planting, they_were_building, 29 but in_that day Rx-G‹H‹Lōt/(Lōţ)›H›G-Rx came_out from G‹H‹Sodoma/(Şədom)›H›G, fire and brimstone rained from the_sky and destroyed all.
   30 So it_will_be according_to in_that day, the son of_Man is_being_revealed.
   31 In that day, who will_be on the housetop, and the goods of_him in his house, him_let_ not _come_down to_take_away them, and the one in the_field, likewise him_let_ not _return to the things back.
   32 Be_remembering about_the wife of_Rx-G‹H‹Lōt/(Lōţ)›H›G-Rx.
   33 Whoever may_seek to_procure the life of_him, will_be_losing it, and whoever may_lose it, will_be_keeping_ it _alive.
   34 I_am_saying to_you_all, in_this night will_be two on one bed, the one will_be_being_taken, and the other will_be_being_left.
   35 Two will_be grinding at the same place, the one will_be_being_taken, and the the_other will_be_being_left.
   36  37 And answering they_are_saying to_him: Where, master.
   And he said to_them: Where the body is, there also the vultures will_be_being_gathered_together.
  Luk 18  And he_was_speaking a_parable to_them, for the way it_to_be_fitting always them to_be_praying and to_be_ not _losing_heart 2 saying: A_ certain _judge was in a_certain city, not revering god and not being_swayed by_a_person.
   3 And a_widow was in that city, and she_was_coming to him saying: Avenge me of the opponent of_me.
   4 And he_was_ not _willing for a_time, but after these things he_said to himself: Even if I_am_ not _revering god nor I_am_being_swayed a_person, 5 because_of this widow surely to_be_bringing_about trouble to_me, I_will_be_avenging her, in_order_that not coming to the_end she_may_be_harassing me.
   6 And the master said: Hear what the judge of_unrighteousness is_saying.
   7 And god by_no_means may_ not _execute the vengeance of_the chosen of_him, shouting to_him day and night, and is_being_patient over them.
   8 I_am_saying to_you_all that he_will_be_executing the vengeance of_them in quickness.
   However the son of_Man having_come, will_he_be_finding faith on the earth.
   9 And he_ also _spoke this parable to some having_trusted in themselves that they_are righteous and scorning the others: 10 Two men went_up into the temple to_pray, one was a_G‹Farisaios_sect_member›G, and the other was a_tax_collector.
   11 The G‹Farisaios_sect_member›G having_been_stood was_praying these things to himself: god, I_am_giving_thanks to_you that I_am not as the rest of_the people, swindling, unrighteous, adulterers, or even as this tax_collector.
   12 I_am_fasting twice of_a_week, I_am_tithing all things, as_many_as I_am_acquiring.
   13 But the tax_collector having_stood afar, was_ not _willing not_even his eyes to_lift_up to the sky, but was_striking the chest of_him saying: god, be_made_atonement for_me, the sinner.
   14 I_am_saying to_you_all, this one came_down to the house of_himself having_been_justified, contrary_to that one.
   Because everyone exalting himself will_be_being_humbled, but the one humbling himself will_be_being_exalted.
   15 And they_were_ also _bringing the babies to_him, in_order_that he_may_be_touching against_them, but the apprentices/followers having_seen, were_giving_rebuke to_them.
   16 But G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G called_to saying: Allow the little_children to_be_coming to me, and be_ not _forbidding them, for the kingdom of_god is of_such.
   17 Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all, whoever may_ not _receive the kingdom of_god as a_little_child, by_no_means may_ not _come_in into it.
   18 And a_certain ruler asked him saying: Good Teacher, having_done what, I_will_be_inheriting life eternal.
   19 And G‹H‹Yēsous said to_him: Why are_you_calling me good.
   No_one is good, except one god.
   20 You_have_known the commandments: you_may_ not _commit_adultery, you_may_ not _murder, you_may_ not _steal, you_may_ not _give_false_testimony: be_honoring the father and the mother of_you.
   21 And he said, I_kept all these things from the_youth of_me.
   22 And G‹H‹Yēsous having_heard, said to_him: Still one thing is_lacking to_you, all as_much_as you_are_having, sell and distribute to_the_poor, and you_will_be_having treasure in the_heavens, and come, be_following after_me.
   23 But he having_heard these things, was_become very_sorrowful, for he_was exceedingly rich.
   24 And G‹H‹Yēsous having_seen him, said: How difficultly the ones having wealth, will_be_coming_in into the kingdom of_god.
   25 For is easier a_camel to_come_in through an_eye of_a_needle, than a_rich man to_come_in into the kingdom of_god.
   26 And they having_heard said: And who is_able to_be_saved.
   27 But he said: The things impossible with humans, is possible with god.
   28 And G‹Petros›G said: See we left all and followed after_you.
   29 And he said to_them: Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all that there_is no_one who left house, or wife, or brothers, or parents, or children, on_account the kingdom of_god, 30 who by_no_means may_ not _take_back many_times_more in this time, and in the coming age, eternal life.
   31 And having_taken the twelve, he_said to them: See we_are_going_up to G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G, and all the things having_been_written by the prophets about_the son of_Man will_be_being_accomplished.
   32 For he_will_be_being_given_over to_the pagans, and he_will_be_being_mocked, and he_will_be_being_insulted, and he_will_be_being_spat_on.
   33 And having_flogged him, they_will_be_killing_ him _off, and on_the third day, he_will_be_rising_up.
   34 And they understood nothing of_these things, and this word was having_been_hidden from them, and they_were_ not _knowing the things being_spoken.
   35 And it_became at the time him to_be_nearing, to G‹H‹Yeriⱪō/(Yərīḩō)›H›G, a_ certain _blind man was_sitting beside the road begging.
   36 And having_heard of_a_crowd passing_through, he_was_inquiring what this might_be.
   37 And they_reported to_him, G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G the G‹from_Nazaret›G is_passing_by.
   38 And he_shouted saying: G‹H‹Yēsous, son of_G‹H‹Dauid/(Dāvid)›H›G, show_mercy to_me.
   39 And the ones going_before were_warning to_him that he_may_keep_silent.
   But he was_crying_out by_much more: son of_G‹H‹Dauid, show_mercy to_me.
   40 And G‹H‹Yēsous having_been_stopped, commanded him to_be_brought to him.
   And having_neared him, he_asked him, 41 What you_are_wanting I_may_do for_you.
   And he said: master, that I_may_receive_sight.
   42 And G‹H‹Yēsous said to_him: Receive_sight, the faith of_you has_healed you.
   43 And immediately he_received_sight, and was_following after_him, glorifying god.
   And all the people having_seen it, gave praise to_god.
  Luk 19  And having_come_in, he_was_passing_through G‹H‹Yeriⱪō.
   2 And see, a_man being_called by_the_name G‹Zakⱪaios›G, and he was a_chief_tax_collector, and he was rich.
   3 And he_was_seeking to_see who G‹H‹Yēsous is, and was_ not _able because_of the crowd, because he_was small in_stature.
   4 And having_run_ahead ahead, he_went_up in a_sycamore_tree, in_order_that he_may_see him, because he_was_going to_be_passing_through of_that way.
   5 And as he_came to the place, G‹H‹Yēsous having_looked_up, said to him: G‹Zakⱪaios›G, having_hurried come_down, for today it_is_fitting me to_remain in the house of_you.
   6 And having_hurried, he_came_down and welcomed him rejoicing.
   7 And all having_seen it, were_grumbling saying, He_came_in to_lodge with a_sinful man.
   8 And G‹Zakⱪaios›G having_been_stood, said to the master: See half of_the things of_me possessing, master, I_am_giving to_the poor, and if I_defrauded anything of_anyone, I_am_giving_back quadruple.
   9 And G‹H‹Yēsous said to him, Today salvation this to_house became, as_much_as he also is a_son of_G‹H‹Abra'am/('Avərāhām)›H›G.
   10 For the son of_Man came to_seek and to_save the thing having_been_lost.
   11 And from_them hearing these things having_proceeded, he_said a_parable because_of that him to_be near of_G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G, and them to_be_supposing that the kingdom of_god is_ immediately _going to_be_being_appeared.
   12 Therefore, he_said, a_ certain noble _man was_gone to a_country distant, to_receive for_himself a_kingdom and to_return.
   13 And having_called ten slaves of_himself, he_gave ten minas to_them, and told to them: To_do_business at the time I_am_coming.
   14 But the citizens of_him were_hating him, and they_sent_out a_delegation after him saying: We_are_ not _willing this man to_reign over us.
   15 And it_became on the way of_him to_return, having_received the kingdom, and he_said these slaves to_be_called to_him to_whom he_had_given the silver, in_order_that he_may_know what they_bartered.
   16 And the first arrived saying: Master, the Rx-G‹dd silverdd*_mna›G-Rx of_you, additionally_earned ten.
   minas.
   17 And he_said to_him: Well done good slave.
   Because you_became faithful in least, be having authority over ten cities.
   18 And the second came saying: The Rx-G‹dd silverdd*_mna›G-Rx of_you, master, made five minas.
   19 And he_said also to_this one: Also you be_becoming over five cities.
   20 And another came saying: Master, see, the Rx-G‹dd silverdd*_mna›G-Rx of_you, which I_was_having lying_away in a_handkerchief.
   21 For I_was_fearing you, because you_are a_ austere _man, you_are_taking_up what you_ not _laid, and you_are_reaping what you_ not _sowed.
   22 He_is_saying to_him: I_will_be_judging you out_of the mouth of_you, evil slave.
   You_had_known that I am a_ austere _man, taking_up what I_ not _laid, and reaping what I_ not _sowed.
   23 And for_ why _reason you_ not _gave the silver of_me to the_bank, and_I having_come, I_collected it with interest.
   24 And to_the ones having_stood_by he_said: Take_away the Rx-G‹dd silverdd*_mna›G-Rx from him, and give it to_the one, having the ten minas.
   25 And they_said to_him, master he_is_having Ten, minas already.
   26 I_am_saying to_you_all that to_everyone the one having, will_be_being_given, but from the one not having, even what he_is_having will_be_being_taken_away.
   27 However these enemies of_me, the ones not having_wanted me to_reign over them, bring here and strike_ them _down before me.
   28 And having_said these things he_was_going ahead going_up to G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G.
   29 And it_became as he_neared to G‹Bēthfagē›G and G‹Bēthania›G, toward the mountain being_called of_Olives, he_sent_out two of_the apprentices/followers 30 saying: Be_going into the village ahead, in which entering_in you_all_will_be_finding a_colt having_been_bound, on which no_one ever of_people sat_down, and having_untied it, bring it.
   31 And if anyone may_be_asking you_all: for_ Why _reason you_all_are_untying it.
   Thus you_all_will_be_saying, The master is_having need of_it.
   32 And having_gone_away they having_been_sent_out found it as he_said to_them.
   33 And of_them releasing the colt, the masters of_it said to them: Why are_you_all_untying the colt.
   34 And they said, The master is_having need of_it.
   35 And they_led it to G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, and having_throw_on the clothes of_them on the colt, they_mounted_ G‹H‹Yēsous _on_it.
   36 And of_him going, they_were_spreading_under the clothes of_themselves on the road.
   37 And of_him nearing already at the down_grade of_the Mount of_Olives, all the multitude of_the apprentices/followers began rejoicing to_be_praising god with_a_ loud _voice for all the_miracles which they_saw 38 saying: Having_been_blessed is the king the one coming, in the_name of_the_master, in heaven peace and glory in the_highest.
   39 And some of_the G‹Farisaios_sect›G from the crowd said to him: Teacher, give_rebuke to_the apprentices/followers of_you.
   40 And answering he_said: I_am_saying to_you_all that if these will_be_keeping_silent, the stones will_be_crying_out.
   41 And as he_neared, having_seen the city, he_wept over it 42 saying, If you_knew in this day, even you, the things for peace, but now it_was_hidden from the_eyes of_you.
   43 Because days will_be_coming on you, and the enemies of_you will_be_throwing_around a_palisade to_you, and they_will_be_surrounding you and they_will_be_pressing you on_every_side, 44 and they_will_be_leveling you and the children of_you with you, and they will_ not _be_leaving a_stone on a_stone with you, instead_of which you_ not _knew the season of_the visitation of_you.
   45 And having_come_in into the temple, he_began to_be_throwing_out the ones selling, 46 saying to_them: It_has_been_written: the house of_me will_be a_house of_prayer, but you_all made it a_hideout of_robbers.
   47 And he_was teaching in_every day in the temple, but the chief_priests and the scribes and the leaders of_the people were_seeking, to_destroy him, 48 and they_were_ not _finding what they_may_do, for the all the_people was_hanging_on hearing of_him.
  Luk 20  And it_became on one of_the days, of_ him _teaching the people in the temple, and gospel_preaching, the chief_priests and the scribes with the elders approached, 2 and they_spoke saying to him: Tell to_us by what authority you_are_doing these things, or who is the one having_given this authority to_you.
   3 And answering he_said to them: Also_I Will_be_asking you_all a_word and tell to_me: 4 the immersion of_G‹Yōannēs›G, was_it from heaven or from humans.
   5 And they were_reasoning_together to themselves saying, If we_may_say: From heaven, he_will_be_saying: for_ Why _reason you_all_ not _believed in_him.
   6 But if we_may_say: From humans, all the people will_be_stoning us, for having_been_persuaded G‹Yōannēs›G he_is to_be a_prophet.
   7 And they_answered, to_have_ not _known from_where.
   8 And G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G said to_them: Neither am_ I _telling to_you_all by what authority I_am_doing these things.
   9 And he_began to_be_speaking this parable to the people: A_man planted a_vineyard, and rented_out it to_tenant_farmers, and Rx-travelled-Rx many times.
   10 And in_the_season he_sent_out a_slave to the tenant_farmers, in_order_that they_will_be_giving to_him from the fruit of_the vineyard.
   But the tenant_farmers having_beat him sent_ him _away, empty-handed.
   11 And he_proceeded to_send another slave, but they, having_beat and having_dishonored also_that one, they_sent_away him empty-handed.
   12 And he_proceeded to_send a_third, and they also having_wounded this one, throw_out him.
   13 And the master of_the vineyard said: What may_I_do.
   I_will_be_sending the beloved son of_me, perhaps they_will_be_being_swayed by_this one.
   14 But having_seen him, the tenant_farmers were_reasoning to one_another saying: This is the heir, we_may_kill_ him _off, in_order_that the inheritance may_become of_us.
   15 And having_throw_ him _out outside the vineyard, they_killed_off him.
   Therefore what will_ the master of_the vineyard _be_doing to_them.
   16 He_will_be_coming and will_be_destroying these tenant_farmers, and will_be_giving the vineyard to_others.
   And having_heard they_said: Never might_it_become.
   17 But he having_focused_in on_them said: Therefore what is this the word having_been_written: the_stone which the ones building rejected, this was_become for the_head of_the_corner.
   18 Everyone having_fallen on that stone, will_be_being_shattered, but on whomever it_may_fall, it_will_be_pulverizing him.
   19 And the scribes and the chief_priests sought to_lay_on their hands on him, in the_same hour, and they_were_afraid the people, for they_knew that he_spoke this parable against them.
   20 And having_watched_closely, they_sent_out spies pretending themselves to_be righteous, in_order_that they_may_catch of_him of_a_statement, so_that to_give_ him _over to_the rule and authority of_the governor.
   21 And they_asked him saying: Teacher, we_have_known that you_are_saying correctly, and you_are_teaching, and you_are_ not _receiving any_person, but you_are_teaching the way of_god in truth.
   22 Is_it_permitting for_us to_give tax to_Rx-G‹Kaisar›G-Rx or not.
   23 But having_observed the craftiness of_them, he_said to them, 24 Show to_me the_G‹dēnarion_coin›G, of_whose image and inscription is_it_having.
   and they said: Of_Rx-G‹Kaisar›G-Rx.
   25 And he he_said to them: So_now give_back the things of_Rx-G‹Kaisar›G-Rx to_Rx-G‹Kaisar›G-Rx, and the things of_god to_god.
   26 And they_were_ not _able to_catch of_the one in_a_word before the people, and having_Rx-marvelled-Rx at the answer of_him, they_kept_silent.
   27 And some of_the G‹Saddoukaios_sect›G, the ones saying there_ not _to_be a_resurrection having_approached, asked him 28 saying: Teacher, G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G wrote to_us: if brother of_anyone may_die_off having a_wife, and this one childless in_order_that the brother of_him may_take his wife, and may_raise_up seed to_the brother of_him.
   29 Therefore there_were seven brothers, and the first, having_taken a_wife, died_off childless, 30 and the second, 31 and the third took her, and likewise also the seven, not left children, and they_died_off.
   32 Last the woman also died_off.
   33 Therefore in the resurrection, of_which of_them is_she_becoming wife.
   For the seven had her as_wife.
   34 And G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G said to_them: The sons this of_age are_marrying and are_being_betrothed, 35 but the ones having_been_considered_worthy that of_age, to_obtain and of_the resurrection which is from the_dead, are_ neither _marrying nor are_being_betrothed, 36 for they_are_ not _being_able to_die_off anymore, for they_are angel-like, and they_are sons of_god, being sons of_the resurrection.
   37 But that the dead are_being_raised, even G‹H‹Mōsēs divulged at the thorn_bush, when he_is_calling the_master: the god of_G‹H‹Abra'am/('Avərāhām)›H›G, and the_god of_G‹H‹Isa'ak/(Yiʦəḩāq)›H›G, and the_god of_G‹H‹Yakōb/(Ya'aqov)›H›G.
   38 And god is not of_the_dead, but of_the_living, for to_him all are_living.
   39 And some of_the scribes answering said: Teacher, you_spoke well.
   40 for They_were_ no_longer _daring to_be_asking him nothing.
   41 And he_said to them: How are_they_saying the chosen_one/messiah to_be son of_G‹H‹Dauid/(Dāvid)›H›G.
   42 For G‹H‹Dauid himself is_saying in the_scroll of_psalms: the master said to_the master of_me: Be_sitting on the_right hand of_me, 43 until I_may_put the enemies of_you as_a_footstool of_the feet of_you.
   44 Therefore G‹H‹Dauid, is_calling him master, and how is_he son of_him.
   45 And all the people hearing, he_said to_the apprentices/followers of_him, 46 Be_taking_heed of the scribes wanting to_be_walking in robes, and loving greetings in the marketplaces, and the_best_seats in the synagogues, and the_best_places at the suppers, 47 who are_devouring the houses of_the widows, and they_are_praying long for_a_under_pretense.
   These will_be_receiving more_abundant judgment.
  Luk 21  And having_looked_up, he_saw the_rich the ones throwing the gifts of_them into the treasury.
   2 And he_saw a_certain poor widow, throwing two G‹lepton_coin›Gs.
   there.
   3 And he_said: Truly I_am_saying to_you_all that this poor widow, throw more than all, 4 for all these throw in their gifts out_of the wealth abounding to_them, but this woman throw out_of the need of_her, all the living which she_was_having.
   5 And as_some speaking about the temple that has_been_adorned with_ good _stones and with_curses, he_said, 6 These things which you_all_are_observing, days will_be_coming in which stone will_ not _be_being_left on stone, here, which will_ not _be_being_torn_down.
   7 And they_asked him saying: Teacher, therefore when things these will_be, and what the sign whenever these things may_be_going to_be_becoming.
   8 And he said: Be_watching_out, lest you_all_may_be_strayed, for many will_be_coming in the name of_me saying: I am he, and: The time has_neared.
   You_all _may_ not _be_gone after them.
   9 And whenever you_all_may_hear wars and disturbances, you_all _may_ not _be_terrified, for it_is_fitting these things to_become first, but the end not is immediately.
   10 Then he_was_saying to_them: Nation will_be_being_raised against nation, and kingdom against kingdom, 11 both great earthquakes, and in different places, will_be famines and pestilences, and fearful_sights and from the_sky will_be great signs 12 But before all these things, they_will_be_laying_on on you_all the hands of_them, and they_will_be_persecuting, giving_over to the synagogues and prisons, being_led_away before kings and governors, on_account the name of_me.
   13 it_will_be_turning_out a_testimony for to_you_all.
   14 Therefore purpose in the hearts of_you_all not to_be_premeditating to_be_defended, 15 for I will_be_giving a_mouth and wisdom to_you_all, to_which they will_ not _be_able to_resist or to_speak_against all the ones opposing to_you_all.
   16 But you_all_will_be_being_given_over even by parents, and brothers, and relatives, and friends, and they_will_be_putting_to_death some from you_all.
   17 And you_all_will_be being_hated by all because_of the name of_me.
   18 But a_hair of the head of_you_all, by_no_means may_ not _perish.
   19 By the endurance of_you_all, you_all_will_be_acquiring the lives of_you_all.
   20 But whenever you_all_may_see G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G being_surrounded by armies, then know that the desolation of_her has_neared.
   21 Then the ones in Rx-G‹Youdaia›G-Rx, let_them_be_fleeing to the mountains, and the ones in midst of_her, let_them_be_departing_out, and the ones in the countries, them _let_ not _be_coming_in into her.
   22 Because these are days of_vengeance to_be_fulfilled all the things having_been_written.
   23 And woe to_the women having child in womb and to_the women nursing in those days, for will_be great distress on the land, and severe_anger on_ this _people.
   24 And they_will_be_falling by_the_edge of_the_sword, and they_will_be_being_made_captive into all the nations, and G‹H‹Hierousalēm will_be being_trodden by the_pagans, until of_which the_times of_the_pagans may_be_fulfilled.
   25 And there_will_be signs in the_sun, and moon, and stars, and anguish of_nations on the earth, with perplexity of_the_sound of_the_sea and surf, 26 people fainting from fear and expectation of_the things coming_over to_the inhabited_world, for the powers of_the heavens will_be_being_shaken.
   27 And then they_will_be_seeing the son of_Man, coming in a_cloud with power and great glory.
   28 But these things beginning to_be_becoming, straighten_up and lift_up the heads of_you_all, because the redemption of_you_all is_nearing.
   29 And he_said parable to_them: Watch the fig_tree and all the trees, 30 whenever they_may_put_forward already, seeing them for yourselves, you_all_are_knowing that already the summer is near.
   31 Thus also you_all, whenever you_all_may_see these things becoming, it_is_being_known that the kingdom of_god is near.
   32 Truly, I_am_saying to_you_all that by_no_means may_ not _pass_away this generation, until all things may_become.
   33 The heaven and the earth will_be_passing_away, but the words of_me by_no_means will_ not _be_passing_away.
   34 And be_taking_heed to_yourselves, lest the hearts of_you_all may_be_weighed_down with dissipation, and drunkenness, and worries of_living, and that sudden day may_approach on you_all 35 as a_snare, for it_will_be_coming_in on all the ones sitting on the_face of_all the earth.
   36 Be_watching and at every season, beseeching that you_all_may_prevail to_escape all these things going to_be_becoming, and to_be_stood before the son of_Man.
   37 And he_was teaching in the temple in_the days, but the in_the_nights coming_out, he_was_lodging on the mountain being_called of_Olives.
   38 And all the people was_coming_at_dawn to him in the temple to_be_hearing from_him.
  Luk 22  And the feast of_non-fermented bread, being_called the_passover_feast was_nearing.
   2 And the chief_priests and the scribes were_seeking, the way how they_may_kill him, for they_were_fearing the people.
   3 And G‹H‹Satan/(Sāţān)›H›G came_in into G‹H‹Youdas/(Yəhūdāh)›H›G, the one being_called G‹Iskariōtēs›G, being of the number of_the twelve.
   4 And having_gone_away, he_conversed_with with_the chief_priests and officers, the way how he_may_give_ him _over to_them.
   5 And they_were_elated and they_decided to_give to_him silver.
   6 And he_consented, and was_seeking opportunity to_give_ him _over to_them without a_crowd.
   7 And the day of_non-fermented bread came, in_which it_was_fitting the passover_ to_be_being_sacrificed.
   8 And he_sent_out G‹Petros›G and G‹Yōannēs›G having_said: Having_been_gone, prepare the passover_ for_us, in_order_that we_may_eat it.
   9 And they said to_him: Where are_you_willing we_may_prepare.
   10 And he said to_them: See of_you_all having_come_in into the city, a_man, bearing a_pitcher of_water, will_be_meeting with_you_all, follow after_him into the house into which he_is_entering_in.
   11 And you_all_will_be_saying to_the home_owner of_the house: The teacher is_saying to_you: Where is the guest_room, where I_may_eat the passover_ with the apprentices/followers of_me.
   12 And_that one will_be_showing to_you_all an_ large _upper_room, having_been_furnished, prepare there.
   13 And having_gone_away, they_found it as he_had_said to_them, and they_prepared the passover_.
   14 And when the hour became, he_sat_down and the ambassadors with him.
   15 And he_said to them: ˱With˲_desire I_desired to_eat this passover_ with you_all, before the time for_me to_suffer.
   16 For I_am_saying to_you_all that by_no_means I_may_ not _eat it, until of_which it_may_be_fulfilled in the kingdom of_god.
   17 And having_received the_cup, having_given_thanks he_said: Take this, and divide it among themselves.
   18 For I_am_saying to_you_all, by_no_means I_may_ not _drink of the fruit of_the vine from the time now, until of_which the kingdom of_god may_come.
   19 And having_taken the_bread, having_given_thanks, he_broke and gave it to_them saying: This is the body of_me, which being_given for you_all, be_doing this in my remembrance.
   20 Also the cup likewise after which to_dine saying: This cup is the new covenant in the blood of_me, which being_poured_out for you_all is.
   21 However see, the hand of_the one giving_over me is with me on the table.
   22 Because on_one_hand the son of_Man is_going according_to the place having_been_designated, on_the_other_hand woe to_ that _man by whom he_is_being_given_over.
   23 And they began to_be_debating to themselves, who consequently it_might_be of them, who going to_be_doing this.
   24 And it_ also _became a_contention among them, that which of_them is_supposing to_be the_greater.
   25 And he said to_them: The kings of_the pagans are_mastering of_them, and the ones having_authority over_them: are_being_called benefactors.
   26 But you_all not thus, but the greater among you_all, him _let_be_becoming as the younger, and the one leading, as the one serving.
   27 For who is greater, the one reclining or the one serving.
   Not the one reclining.
   But in the_midst of_you_all I am as the one serving.
   28 And you_all are the ones having_continued with me, in the trials of_me.
   29 And_I am_covenanting to_you_all as the father of_me covenanted a_kingdom to_me, 30 in_order_that you_all_may_be_eating and you_all_may_be_drinking at the table of_me in the kingdom of_me, and you_all_are_sitting on thrones, judging the twelve tribes of_Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx.
   31 Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx, Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx, see, G‹H‹Satan/(Sāţān)›H›G requested to_sift you_all as wheat, 32 but I was_besought for you that the faith of_you may_ not _fail, and you once having_turned_back, strengthen the brothers of_you.
   33 And he he_said to_him: master, I_am ready to_be_going with you both to prison and to death.
   34 And he said: I_am_telling to_you, G‹Petros›G, the_rooster will_ by_no_means _be_crowing today, until thrice you_will_be_renouncing to_have_known me.
   35 And he_said to_them: When I_sent_ you_all _out without purse, and knapsack, and sandals, not you_all_lacked of_anything.
   And they said: Of_nothing.
   36 and He_said to_them: But now the one having a_purse let_him_take_up it, likewise also a_knapsack, and the one not having, a_sword let_him_sell the coat of_him, and let_him_buy.
   37 For I_am_saying to_you_all that this which having_been_written, it_is_fitting to_be_accomplished in me, and he_was_reckoned with the_lawless, for also the thing concerning me is_having an_end.
   38 And they said: master, see, two swords here are.
   And he said to_them, it_is Much.
   39 And having_come_out, he_was_gone according_to the custom to the Mount of_Olives, and the apprentices/followers also followed after_him.
   40 And having_become to the place, he_said to_them: Be_praying to_ not _come_in into temptation.
   41 And he was_withdrawn from them about a_stone throw, and having_knelt the knees, he_was_praying 42 saying: father, if you_are_wishing, take_away this cup from me, however not the will of_me, but let_ your will _be_becoming.
   43  44  45 And having_risen_up from the prayer, having_come to the apprentices/followers, he_found them being_fallen_asleep from the sorrow, 46 and he_said to_them: Why are_you_all_sleeping.
   Having_risen_up be_praying that you_all_may_ not _come_in into temptation.
   47 Still of_him speaking, see, a_crowd and the one being_called G‹H‹Youdas/(Yəhūdāh)›H›G, one of_the twelve, was_going_ahead them, and he_neared to_G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G to_kiss him.
   48 But G‹H‹Yēsous said to_him: G‹H‹Youdas, are_you_giving_over the son of_Man with_a_kiss.
   49 And the ones around him having_seen what going_to be, they_said: master, will_we_be_striking with the_sword.
   50 And a_certain one of them he_struck the slave of_the chief_priest, and he_cut_off the right ear of_him.
   51 But G‹H‹Yēsous answering said: Be_allowing as_far_as this.
   And having_touched against_the ear, he_healed him.
   52 And G‹H‹Yēsous said to the ones having_come against him, chief_priests, and officers of_the temple, and elders, you_all_came_out with swords and clubs As against a_robber.
   53 In_every day of_me being with you_all in the temple, you_all_ not _stretched_out your hands against me.
   But this is the hour of_you_all, and the power of_the darkness.
   54 And having_captured him, they_led him and brought_in him into the house of_the chief_priest.
   But G‹Petros›G was_following afar.
   55 And having_kindled a_fire in the_midst of_the courtyard, and having_sat_together, G‹Petros›G was_sitting in_the_midst of_them.
   56 And having_seen him, a_ certain _servant_girl sitting near the light, and having_looked_intently at_him said: This one was also with him.
   57 But he disowned him saying: I_have_ not _known him, woman.
   58 And after a_little, another having_seen him was_saying: You are also of them.
   But G‹Petros›G was_saying: Man, I_am not.
   59 And one hour having_passed_by about, a_certain other was_insisting saying: In truth also this one was with him, for he_is also a_Rx-G‹Galilaios›G-Rx.
   60 But G‹Petros›G said: Man, I_have_ not _known what you_are_saying.
   And immediately of_him still speaking, the_rooster crowed.
   61 And the master having_been_turned, focused_in on_G‹Petros›G, and G‹Petros›G was_reminded of_the word of_the master, how he_said to_him, before the_rooster to_crow today, you_will_be_renouncing me thrice.
   62 And having_come_out outside, he_wept bitterly.
   63 And the men holding him, were_mocking at_him beating.
   64 And having_blindfolded him, they_were_asking saying: Prophesy, who is the one having_struck you.
   65 And they_were_saying many other things slandering, to him.
   66 And when it_became day, the council_of_elders of_the people, both chief_priests and scribes was_gathered_together, and they_led_away him into the council of_them 67 saying: If you are the chosen_one/messiah, tell to_us.
   But he_said to_them: If I_may_tell to_you_all, by_no_means you_all_may_ not _believe, 68 and if I_may_ask, by_no_means you_all_may_ not _answer.
   69 And from the time now the son of_Man will_be sitting on the_right hand of_the power of_god.
   70 and said all: Therefore are you the son of_god.
   And he was_saying to them: You_all are_saying that I am.
   71 And they said: What are_we_having need of_testimony anymore.
   For we we_heard it from the mouth of_him.
  Luk 23  And all the multitude of_them having_risen_up, they_led him to Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx.
   2 And they_began to_be_accusing against_him saying: We_found this man perverting the nation of_us, and forbidding to_be_giving taxes to_Rx-G‹Kaisar›G-Rx, and saying himself the_chosen_one, a_king to_be.
   3 And Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx asked him saying: Are you the king of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G.
   And he answering to_him he_was_saying: You are_saying it.
   4 And Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx said to the chief_priests and the crowds: I_am_finding not_one guilty in this man.
   5 But they were_insisting saying, He_is_stirring_up the people, teaching throughout all the Rx-G‹Youdaia›G-Rx, having_begun from G‹H‹Galilaia/(Gālīl)›H›G as_far_as here.
   6 And Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx having_heard, he_asked whether the man is a_Rx-G‹Galilaios›G-Rx.
   7 And having_known that he_is from the domain of_Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx, he_sent_ him _up to Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx, himself being also at G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G in these days.
   8 And Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx having_seen G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, was_elated exceedingly, for he_was of much times wanting to_see him, because_of the thing to_be_hearing concerning him, and he_was_hoping to_see a_certain sign becoming by him.
   9 And he_was_asking him in many words, but he he_answered nothing to_him.
   10 And the chief_priests and the scribes had_stood vigorously accusing against_him.
   11 And Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx with the armies of_him having_ also _scorned him, and having_mocked him having_thrown_ splendid clothing _around him, he_sent_up him to_Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx.
   12 And on same day both Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx and Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx became friends with one_another, for they_were_previously_starting being at enmity with themselves.
   13 And Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx having_called_together the chief_priests, and the rulers, and the people, 14 said to them: You_all_brought this man to_me, as turning_away the people, but see, I having_examined him before you_all, I_found nothing in this man guilty of_which you_all_are_accusing against him.
   15 But not_even Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx did, for he_sent_ him _up.
   to us.
   And see, nothing worthy of_death is having_been_done by_him.
   16 Therefore having_disciplined him, I_will_be_sending_away him.
   17  18 But they_cried_out all_together saying: Be_taking_away this man, and send_ G‹Barabbas›G _away to_us.
   19 Who was, having_been_throw in the prison because_of a_certain insurrection having_become in the city and murder.
   20 And again Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx called_out to_them, wanting to_send_ G‹H‹Yēsous _away.
   21 But they were_crying_out saying: Be_impale_on_a_stakeing, be_impale_on_a_stakeing him.
   22 And thirdly he said to them: For what evil did this man.
   I_found not_one cause of_death in him.
   Therefore having_disciplined him, I_will_be_sending_away him.
   23 And they were_imposing with_ loud _voices, requesting him to_be_impaled_on_a_stake, and the voices of_them.
   were_prevailing.
   24 And Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx sentenced the request of_them to_become.
   25 And sent_away the one having_been_throw into because_of insurrection and murder prison, whom they_were_requesting, but he_gave_ G‹H‹Yēsous _over to_the will of_them.
   26 And as they_led_away him, having_taken_hold_of Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx, a_certain G‹from_Kurēnē›G coming from the_country, they_put_ the cross _on to_him, to_be_carrying behind G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G.
   27 And a_great multitude of_the people was_following with_him, and of_women who were_mourning and were_lamenting him.
   28 But G‹H‹Yēsous having_been_turned to them, said: Daughters of_G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G, be_ not _weeping for me, however be_weeping for yourselves, and for the children of_you_all.
   29 Because see, days are_coming in which they_will_be_saying: Blessed are the barren, and wombs that not bore, and breasts that not nursed.
   30 Then they_will_be_beginning to_be_saying to_the mountains: Fall on us, and to_the hills: Cover us.
   31 Because if they_are_doing these things in the green tree, what may_become in the dry.
   32 And two other criminals /were_ also _being_led with him to_be_killed.
   33 And when they_came to the place being_called the_skull, there they_impaled_ him _on_a_stake and the criminals, one on_one_hand on the_right, one on_the_other_hand on the_left.
   34 But dividing the clothes of_him, they_throw a_lot.
   35 And the people observing had_stood.
