   57 And had_given the chief_priests and the G‹Farisaios_sect›G commandments, that if anyone may_know where he_is, he_may_divulge it, so_that they_may_arrest him.
  Jhn 12  Therefore Six days before the passover_ G‹H‹Yēsous, came to G‹Bēthania›G, where G‹Lazaros›G was, whom G‹H‹Yēsous raised from the_dead.
   2 Therefore they_made a_supper for_him there, and G‹Martha›G was_serving, and G‹Lazaros›G was one of the ones reclining with him.
   3 Therefore G‹H‹Maria having_taken a_pound of_ointment of_ precious genuine _nard, anointed the feet of_G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, and wiped_off the feet of_him with_the hairs of_her, and the house was_filled with the aroma of_the ointment.
   4 But G‹H‹Youdas/(Yəhūdāh)›H›G G‹Iskariōtēs›G, one of_the apprentices/followers of_him, the one going to_be_giving_ him _over, is_saying, 5 for_ Why _reason this ointment was_ not _sold for_three_hundred G‹dēnarion_coins›G, and was_given to_the_poor.
   6 But he_said this, not that was_caring to_him for the poor, but because he_was a_thief, and having the moneybag was_bearing the money being_throw in.
   7 Therefore G‹H‹Yēsous said: Allow her, in_order_that she_may_keep it for the day of_the burial of_me.
   8 For you_all_are_ always _having the poor with yourselves, but you_all_are_ not always _having me.
   9 Therefore a_ great _crowd of the G‹Youdaiōns›G knew that he_is there, and they_came, not only because_of G‹H‹Yēsous, but in_order_that they_may_ also _see G‹Lazaros›G, whom he_raised from the_dead.
   10 But the chief_priests counselled that they_may_kill_off G‹Lazaros›G also, 11 because many of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G were_going_away because_of him, and they_were_believing in G‹H‹Yēsous.
   12 On_the day of_next the great crowd, the one having_come to the feast, having_heard that G‹H‹Yēsous is_coming into G‹H‹Hierousalēm, 13 they_took palm_branches of_the palm_trees and came_out in meeting to_him, and they_were_crying_out: Blessed_saviour.
   Having_been_blessed is the one coming in the_name of_the_master, and the king of_Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx.
   14 And G‹H‹Yēsous having_found a_little_donkey, sat_down on it, as is having_been_written, 15 be_ not _fearing, daughter of_G‹H‹Siōn/(Tsiuōn)›H›G, see, the king of_you is_coming, sitting on a_colt of_a_donkey.
   16 The Disciples of_him not knew these things from_the first, but when G‹H‹Yēsous was_glorified, then they_were_reminded that these things was having_been_written concerning him, and they_did these things to_him.
   17 Therefore the crowd was_testifying being with him, when he_called G‹Lazaros›G out_of the tomb, and raised him from the_dead.
   18 Because_of this the crowd also met with_him, because they_heard about_him to_have_done this sign.
   19 Therefore the G‹Farisaios_sect›G said to themselves: You_all_are_observing that you_all_are_ not _benefiting nothing, see, the world went_away after him.
   20 And G‹Hellēns›G were some of the ones going_up, in_order_that they_may_worship at the feast, 21 therefore these approached to_Rx-G‹Filippos›G-Rx, who from G‹Bēthsaida›G of_G‹H‹Galilaia/(Gālīl)›H›G, and they_were_asking him saying: Sir, we_are_wanting to_see G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G.
   22 Rx-G‹Filippos›G-Rx is_coming and he_is_telling to_G‹Andreas›G, G‹Andreas›G and Rx-G‹Filippos›G-Rx is_coming and they_are_telling to_G‹H‹Yēsous.
   23 And G‹H‹Yēsous is_answering to_them saying: The hour has_come, in_order_that the son of_Man may_be_glorified.
   24 Truly, truly, I_am_saying to_you_all, if the seed of_wheat may_ not _die_off having_fallen into the ground, only it is_remaining, but if it_may_die_off, it_is_bearing much fruit.
   25 The one loving the life of_him, is_losing it, and the one hating the life of_him in this world, will_be_keeping it to eternal life.
   26 If anyone may_be_serving unto_me, him _let_be_following after_me, and where am I, there also my servant will_be.
   If anyone may_be_serving unto_me, the father will_be_honoring him.
   27 Now the soul of_me has_been_disturbed, and what may_I_say: father, save me from this hour.
   But because_of this, I_came to this hour.
   28 father, glorify the name of_you.
   Therefore a_voice came out_of heaven: Both I_glorified it, and I_will_be_glorifying it again.
   29 Therefore the crowd having_stood and having_heard, was_saying thunder to_have_become.
   Others were_saying: An_angel has_spoken to_him.
   30 G‹H‹Yēsous answered and said, this voice has_become not because_of me, but because_of you_all.
   31 Now is the_judgment of_ this _world, now the ruler of_ this _world will_be_being_throw_out out.
   32 And_I if may_be_exalted from the earth, I_will_be_drawing all to myself.
   33 But he_was_saying this, signifying by_what death he_was_going to_be_dying_off.
   34 Therefore the crowd answered to_him: We heard out_of the law that the chosen_one/messiah is_remaining to the age, and how are_saying you that it_is_fitting the son of_Man to_be_exalted.
   Who is this son of_Man.
   35 Therefore G‹H‹Yēsous said to_them: The light is with you_all still a_little time.
   be_walking while you_all_are_having the light, in_order_that you_all may_ not _grasp darkness, and the one walking in the darkness, has_ not _known where he_is_going.
   36 While you_all_are_having the light, be_believing in the light, in_order_that you_all_may_become sons of_light.
   G‹H‹Yēsous spoke these things, and having_gone_away, was_hidden from them.
   37 But having_done so_many signs of_him before them, they_were_ not _believing in him, 38 in_order_that the word of_G‹H‹Ēsaias/(Yəsha'əyāh)›H›G the prophet may_be_fulfilled that he_said: master, who believed in_the report of_us.
   And to_whom was_revealed the arm of_the_master.
   39 Because_of this they_were_ not _able to_be_believing, because again G‹H‹Ēsaias said, 40 he_has_blinded the eyes of_them and he_maimed the heart of_them, in_order_that they_may_ not _see with_their eyes and they_may_understand with_their heart, and they_may_be_turned and I_will_be_healing them.
   41 G‹H‹Ēsaias said these things, because he_saw the glory of_him, and spoke concerning him.
   42 Likewise however even many from of_the rulers believed in him, but because_of the G‹Farisaios_sect›G they_were_ not _confessing, in_order_that they_ not _may_become excommunicated.
   43 For they_loved the glory of_humans more than the glory of_god.
   44 and G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G cried_out and said: The one believing in me, is_ not _believing in me, but in the one having_sent me, 45 and the one observing me, is_observing the one having_sent me.
   46 I have_come into the world as_a_light, in_order_that everyone believing in me, in the darkness may_ not _remain.
   47 And if anyone may_hear of_the words of_me, and not may_keep them, I am_ not _judging him, for I_came not, in_order_that I_may_judge the world, but in_order_that I_may_save the world.
   48 The one rejecting me and not receiving the words of_me, is_having the one judging him, the word which I_spoke, that will_be_judging him at the last day.
   49 Because I spoke not from myself, but the father himself having_sent me to_me has_given a_commandment, what I_may_say, and what I_may_speak.
   50 And I_have_known that the commandment of_him is eternal life.
   Therefore what I am_speaking, as the father has_said to_me, thus I_am_speaking.
  Jhn 13  And before the feast of_the passover_feast, G‹H‹Yēsous having_known that the hour of_him came, that he_may_depart out_of this world to the father, having_loved his own who were in the world, he_loved them to the_end.
   2 And becoming, supper, the devil already having_put into the heart G‹H‹Youdas/(Yəhūdāh)›H›G of_Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx G‹Iskariōtēs›G that may_give_ him _over, 3 having_known that the father has_given all things to_him, into his hands, and that he_came_out from god and he_is_going to god, 4 he_is_being_raised from the supper and is_laying aside his clothes, and having_taken a_linen_towel he_girded himself.
   5 Thereafter he_is_putting water into the wash_basin, and began to_be_washing the feet of_the apprentices/followers, and to_be_wiping_off them with_the linen_towel with_which he_was having_been_girded.
   6 Therefore he_is_coming to Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx G‹Petros›G.
   He_is_saying to_him: master, are_ you _washing the feet of_me.
   7 G‹H‹Yēsous answered and said to_him: What I am_doing, you you_have_ not _known now, but you_will_be_knowing after these things.
   8 G‹Petros›G is_saying to_him: By_no_means you_may_ not _wash the feet of_me to the age.
   G‹H‹Yēsous answered to_him: If I_may_ not _wash you, are_ not _having part with me.
   9 Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx G‹Petros›G is_saying to_him: master, not only the feet of_me, but also my hands and my head.
   10 G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G is_saying to_him: The one having_been_washed is_ not _having need, except to_wash the feet, but he_is all clean, and you_all are clean, but not all.
   11 For he_had_known the one giving_ him _over, because_of this he_said, You_all_are not all clean.
   12 Therefore when he_washed the feet of_them, took the clothes of_him, and sat_down, again he_said to_them: Are_you_all_knowing what I_have_done to_you_all.
   13 You_all are_calling me Teacher and, master, and you_all_are_saying rightly, for I_am.
   14 Therefore if I the master and the Teacher washed the feet of_you_all, you_all also are_ought to_be_washing the feet of_one_another.
   15 For I_have_given to_you_all an_example that as I did to_you_all, you_all also may_be_doing.
   16 Truly, truly, I_am_saying to_you_all, is not a_slave greater than the master of_him, nor an_ambassador greater than the one having_sent him.
   17 If you_all_have_known these things, you_all_are blessed if you_all_may_be_doing them.
   18 I_am_speaking not about all of_you_all.
   I have_known whom_all I_chose, but in_order_that the scripture may_be_fulfilled: the one eating the bread with me, lifted_up the heel of_him against me.
   19 From now I_am_telling to_you_all before the time to_become, in_order_that you_all_may_believe whenever it_may_become that I am he.
   20 Truly, truly, I_am_saying to_you_all, the one receiving anyone I_may_send, is_receiving me, and the one receiving me, is_receiving the one having_sent me.
   21 Having_said these things, G‹H‹Yēsous was_disturbed in_spirit and testified and said: Truly, truly, I_am_saying to_you_all that one of you_all will_be_giving_ me _over.
   22 Therefore the apprentices/followers were_looking among one_another, perplexing about whom he_is_speaking.
   23 And one out_of the apprentices/followers whom G‹H‹Yēsous was_loving was reclining in the bosom of_him of_G‹H‹Yēsous.
   24 Therefore Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx G‹Petros›G is_nodding to_this one, to_inquire who it_might_be about whom he_is_speaking.
   25 therefore that one Having_leaned_back thus on the chest of_G‹H‹Yēsous, is_saying to_him: master, who is_it.
   26 G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G is_answering: That one is to_whom I, having_dipped the piece_of_bread will_be_handing_out it.
   And having_dipped the piece_of_bread, he_is_giving to_G‹H‹Youdas/(Yəhūdāh)›H›G of_Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx G‹Iskariōtēs›G.
   27 And after the piece_of_bread, then G‹H‹Satan/(Sāţān)›H›G came_in into that one.
   Therefore G‹H‹Yēsous is_saying to_him: What you_are_doing, do more_quickly.
   28 And no_one of_the ones reclining knew, to what he_said this to_him.
   29 For some were_supposing, from G‹H‹Youdas was_having the moneybag, that G‹H‹Yēsous is_saying to_him: Buy of_what things we_are_having need for the feast, or in_order_that something may_give to_the poor.
   30 Therefore having_received the piece_of_bread, that one came_out immediately.
   And it_was night.
   31 Therefore when he_came_out, G‹H‹Yēsous is_saying: Now the son of_Man was_glorified, and god was_glorified in him.
   32 Also god will_be_glorifying him in himself, and immediately will_be_glorifying him.
   33 Little_children, I_am still a_little time with you_all.
   You_all_will_be_seeking me, and as I_said to_the G‹Youdaiōns›G, Where I am_going, you_all are_ not _being_able to_come, now I_am_ also _saying to_you_all.
   34 I_am_giving to_you_all a_ new _commandment, that you_all_may_be_loving one_another, as I_loved you_all, that also you_all may_be_loving one_another.
   35 By this all will_be_knowing that you_all_are my apprentices/followers, if you_all_may_be_having love among one_another.
   36 Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx G‹Petros›G is_saying to_him: master, where you_are_going.
   G‹H‹Yēsous answered to_him: Where I_am_going, you_are_ not _being_able to_follow after_me now, but you_will_be_following later.
   37 G‹Petros›G is_saying to_him: master, for_ why _reason I_am_ not _being_able to_follow after_you now.
   I_will_be_laying down the life of_me for you.
   38 G‹H‹Yēsous Is_answering: Will_you_be_laying the life of_you for me.
   Truly, truly, I_am_saying to_you, by_no_means the_rooster may_ not _crow, until of_which you_will_be_disowning me thrice.
  Jhn 14  Not let_be_being_disturbed the heart of_you_all, you_are_believing in god, also you_are_believing in me.
   2 Many dwellings are in the house of_the father of_me, and if not, I_ would _told to_you_all, because I_am_going to_prepare a_place for_you_all.
   3 And if I_may_be_gone and I_may_prepare you_all a_place I_am_coming again and I_will_be_receiving you_all to myself, in_order_that where am I, you_all may_be also.
   4 And you_all_have_known the way where I am_going.
   5 G‹Thōmas›G is_saying to_him: master, we_have_ not _known where you_are_going, how are_we_being_able to_have_known the way.
   6 G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G is_saying to_him: I am the way, and the truth, and the life.
   No_one is_coming to the father, except by me.
   7 If you_all_had_known me, you_all_ also _will_be_knowing the father of_me, and from now you_all_are_knowing him and you_all_have_seen him.
   8 Rx-G‹Filippos›G-Rx is_saying to_him: master, show the father to_us, and it_is_sufficing for_us.
   9 G‹H‹Yēsous is_saying to_him: So_much time I_am with you_all, and you_have_ not _known me, Rx-G‹Filippos›G-Rx.
   The one having_seen me, has_seen the father, how are_ you _saying: Show the father to_us.
   10 You_are_ not _believing that I in the father, and the father is in me.
   The words which I am_speaking to_you_all, I_am_ not _speaking from myself, but the the_father remaining in me, is_doing the works of_him.
   11 Be_believing in_me that I in the father, and the father in me, but if not, be_believing because_of the works of_him.
   12 Truly, truly, I_am_saying to_you_all, the one believing in me, the works that I am_doing, also_that one will_be_doing, and he_will_be_doing greater than these, because I am_going to the father.
   13 And whatever anything may_be_requested in the name of_me, this I_will_be_doing, in_order_that the father may_be_glorified in the son.
   14 If you_all_may_request me anything in the name of_me, this will_be_doing it.
   15 If you_all_are_loving me, you_all_will_be_keeping my commandments.
   16 And_I will_be_asking the father, and he_will_be_giving another advocate to_you_all, in_order_that he_may_be with you_all to the age 17 the spirit of_truth, whom the world is_ not _able to_receive, because it_is_ not _observing nor is_knowing him.
   You_all are_knowing him, because he_is_remaining with you_all, and is in you_all.
   18 I will_ not _be_leaving you_all orphans, I_am_coming to you_all.
   19 Still a_little time and the world is_ no_longer _observing me, but you_all are_observing me, because I am_living, also you_all will_be_living.
   20 In that day will_be_knowing you_all that I in the father of_me, and you_all in me, and_I in you_all.
   21 The one having the commandments of_me and keeping them, that one is the one loving me, and the one loving me, will_be_being_loved by the father of_me, and_I will_be_loving him, and will_be_manifesting myself to_him.
   22 G‹H‹Youdas/(Yəhūdāh)›H›G not to_him the G‹Iskariōtēs›G is_saying: master, what has_become, that you_are_going to_be_manifesting yourself to_us, and not to_the world.
   23 G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G answered and said to_him: If anyone may_be_loving me, he_will_be_keeping the word of_me, and the father of_me will_be_loving him, and we_will_be_coming to him, and we_will_be_making a_dwelling with him.
   24 The one not loving me, is_ not _keeping the words of_me, and word that you_all_are_hearing, is not mine, but of_the father having_sent me.
   25 I_have_spoken these things to_you_all remaining with you_all.
   26 But the advocate, the holy spirit, whom the father will_be_sending in the name of_me, that one will_be_teaching you_all all things, and will_be_reminding you_all all things which I_said to_you_all.
   27 I_am_leaving peace with_you_all, I_am_giving my peace to_you_all, not as the world is_giving, I am_giving to_you_all.
   Let_ not _be_being_disturbed the heart of_you_all, nor it _let_be_fearing.
   28 You_all_heard that I said to_you_all: I_am_going_away and I_am_coming to you_all.
   If you_all_were_loving me, you_all_ would _were_elated that I_am_going to the father, of_me because the father is greater than of_me.
   29 And now I_have_told to_you_all before it to_become, in_order_that whenever it_may_become, you_all_may_believe.
   30 I_will_be_speaking no_ much _longer with you_all, for the ruler of_the world is_coming, and he_is_ not _having nothing in me, 31 but in_order_that the world may_know that I_am_loving the father, and as the father he_gave commandment to_me, thus I_am_doing.
   Be_raising, we_may_be_going from_here.
  Jhn 15  I am the true vine, and the father of_me is the farmer.
   2 Every branch in me not bearing fruit, he_is_taking_ it _away, and every_ fruit bearing _branch, he_is_pruning it, in_order_that it_may_be_bearing more.
   fruit.
   3 You_all are already clean, because_of the word which I_have_spoken to_you_all.
   4 Remain in me, and_I in you_all.
   As the branch is_ not _able to_be_bearing fruit of itself, if it_may_ not _remain in the vine, thus neither you_all, if you_all _may_ not _be_remaining in me.
   5 I am the vine, you_all are the branches.
   The one remaining in me and_I in him, this one is_bearing much fruit, because apart_from me, you_all_are_ not _being_able to_be_doing not one thing.
   6 If anyone may_ not _be_remaining in me, he_was_throw out as the branch and was_withered, and they_are_gathering_ them _together and they_are_throwing into the fire, and it_is_being_burned.
   7 If you_all_may_remain in me, and the words of_me may_remain in you_all, whatever you_all_may_be_wanting, request and it_will_be_becoming to_you_all.
   8 In this the father of_me was_glorified, that you_all_may_be_bearing much fruit and you_all_may_become to_my apprentices/followers.
   9 As the father loved me, also_I loved you_all, remain in my love.
   10 If you_all_may_keep the commandments of_me, you_all_will_be_remaining in the love of_me, as I have_kept the commandments of_the father, and I_am_remaining in the love of_him.
   11 I_have_spoken these things to_you_all, in_order_that my joy may_be in you_all, and the joy of_you_all may_be_fulfilled.
   12 This is my commandment, that may_be_loving one_another as I_loved you_all.
   13 No_one is_having love greater than this: that may_lay the life of_himself for the friends of_him.
   14 You_all are friends of_me, if you_all_may_be_doing what I am_commanding to_you_all.
   15 I_am_ no_longer _calling you_all slaves, because the slave has_ not _known what the master of_him is_doing.
   But you_all I_have_called friends, because I_made_known to_you_all all things what I_heard from the father of_me.
   16 You_all not chose me, but I chose you_all, and I_appointed you_all in_order_that you_all may_be_going and may_be_bearing fruit, and the fruit of_you_all may_be_remaining, in_order_that whatever anything you_all_may_request the father in the name of_me, he_may_give to_you_all.
   17 I_am_commanding these things to_you_all, that you_all_may_be_loving one_another.
   18 If the world is_hating you_all, you_all_are_knowing that it_has_hated me before of_you_all.
   19 If you_all_were of the world, the world would was_loving its own, but because you_all_are not of the world, but I chose you_all out_of the world, because_of this the world is_hating you_all.
   20 Be_remembering about_the word which I said to_you_all: a_slave is not greater than the master of_him.
   If they_persecuted me, they will_ also _be_persecuting you_all, if they_kept the word of_me, they will_ also _be_keeping your word.
   21 But they_will_be_doing all these things against you_all because_of the name of_me, because they_have_ not _known the one having_sent me.
   22 They_were_ not _having sin except I_came and spoke to_them, but now they_are_ not _having excuse for the sin of_them.
   23 The one hating me, is_ also _hating the father of_me.
   24 If not I_did the works among them that not_one other did, they_were_ not _having, sin, but now both they_have_seen and they_have_hated, both me and the father of_me.
   25 But in_order_that the word having_been_written in the law of_them may_be_fulfilled, they_hated me undeservedly.
   26 Whenever the advocate may_come, whom I will_be_sending to_you_all from the father, the spirit of_truth, who is_going_out from the father, that one will_be_testifying concerning me.
   27 Also and you_all are_testifying, because you_all_are with me from the_beginning.
  Jhn 16  I_have_spoken these things to_you_all, in_order_that you_all _may_ not _be_stumbled.
   2 they_will_be_making you_all excommunicated, but an_hour is_coming, that everyone having_killed_ you_all _off, may_suppose it_is a_sacred_service to_be_offering to_god.
   3 And they_will_be_doing these things, because they_ not _knew the father nor me.
   4 But I_have_spoken these things to_you_all, in_order_that whenever the hour of_them may_come, you_all_may_be_remembering that I told to_you_all about_them.
   But these things I_ not _said to_you_all from the_beginning, because I_was with you_all.
   5 But now I_am_going to the one having_sent me, and no_one of you_all is_asking me: Where are_you_going.
   6 But because I_have_spoken these things to_you_all, sorrow has_filled the heart of_you_all.
   7 But I am_saying the truth to_you_all, it_is_benefitting for_you_all that I may_go_away.
   For if I_may_ not _go_away, the advocate he will_ not _be_coming to you_all, but if I_may_be_gone, I_will_be_sending him to you_all.
   8 And having_come, that one will_be_rebuking the world concerning sin, and concerning righteousness, and concerning judgment, 9 concerning sin on_one_hand, because they_are_ not _believing in me, 10 concerning righteousness on_the_other_hand, because I_am_going to the father, and you_all_are_ no_longer _observing me, 11 and concerning judgment, because the ruler of_ this _world has_been_judged.
   12 I_am_ still _having many things to_be_saying to_you_all, but you_all_are_ not _being_able to_be_bearing them now.
   13 But whenever that one may_come, the spirit of_truth, he_will_be_guiding you_all in all truth, for he will_ not _be_speaking from himself, but as_much_as he_will_be_hearing, he_will_be_speaking, and he_will_be_declaring to_you_all the things coming.
   14 That one will_be_glorifying me, because he_will_be_taking of what is mine, and will_be_declaring to_you_all.
   15 All things as_much_as the father is_having, is mine, because_of this I_said that of the thing of_mine he_is_taking, and will_be_declaring to_you_all.
   16 A_little time and you_all_are_ no_longer _observing me, and again a_little time and you_all_will_be_seeing me.
   17 Therefore the apprentices/followers of of_him said to one_another: What is this that he_is_saying to_us: A_little time and you_all_are_ not _observing me, and again a_little time and you_all_will_be_seeing me, and Because I_am_going to the father.
   18 Therefore they_were_saying: What is this: A_little time.
   We_have_ not _known what he_is_speaking.
   19 G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G knew that they_were_wanting to_be_asking him, and he_said to_them: You_all_are_seeking concerning this with one_another, because I_said: A_little time and you_all_are_ not _observing me, and again a_little time and you_all_will_be_seeing me.
   20 Truly, truly, I_am_saying to_you_all that you_all will_be_weeping and will_be_lamenting, but the world will_be_being_elated, you_all will_be_being_sorrowed, but the sorrow of_you_all will_be_becoming to joy.
   21 The woman whenever she_may_be_bearing, is_having sorrow, because the hour of_her came, but whenever she_may_bear the little_child, she_is_ no_longer _remembering about_the tribulation because_of the joy that a_person was_born into the world.
   22 Therefore you_all also now on_one_hand you_all_are_having sorrow, on_the_other_hand I_will_be_seeing you_all again, and the heart of_you_all will_be_being_elated, and no_one is_taking_away the joy of_you_all, from you_all.
   23 And in that day you_all will_ not _be_asking me nothing.
   Truly, truly, I_am_saying to_you_all, anything you_all_may_request from_the father, in the name of_me.
   Will_be_giving to_you_all.
   24 Until now you_all_ not _requested nothing in the name of_me.
   Be_requesting and you_all_will_be_receiving, in_order_that the joy of_you_all may_be having_been_fulfilled.
   25 These things I_have_spoken to_you_all in allegories, an_hour is_coming when I will_ no_longer _be_speaking in allegories to_you_all, but I_will_be_reporting concerning the father with_plainness to_you_all.
   26 In that day you_all_will_be_requesting in the name of_me, and I_am_ not _saying to_you_all that I will_be_asking the father for you_all, 27 for the father himself is_loving you_all, because you_all have_loved me, and you_all_have_believed that I came_out from god.
   28 I_came_out from the father, and I_have_come into the world, again I_am_leaving the world, and I_am_going to the father.
   29 The Disciples of_him are_saying: See now you_are_speaking with plainness, and you_are_speaking not_one allegory.
   30 Now we_have_known that you_have_known all things, and you_are_ not _having need that anyone you may_be_asking.
   By this we_are_believing that you_came_out from god.
   31 G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G answered to_them, are_you_all_believing Now.
   32 See an_hour is_coming and has_come, that you_all_may_be_scattered each to his own, and_ you_all_may_leave _me only, and_yet I_ not _am alone, because the father is with me.
   33 I_have_spoken these things to_you_all, in_order_that you_all_may_be_having peace in me.
   You_all_are_having tribulation in the world, but be_having_courage, I have_overcome the world.
  Jhn 17  G‹H‹Yēsous spoke these things, and having_lifted_up the eyes of_him to the sky said: father, the hour has_come, glorify the son of_you, in_order_that the son may_glorify you.
   2 As you_gave authority of_all flesh to_him, in_order_that everyone whom you_have_given to_him, you_may_give eternal life to_him.
   3 And this is eternal life, that they_may_be_knowing you, the only true god, and G‹H‹Yēsous chosen_one/messiah whom you_sent_out.
   4 I you glorified on the earth, having_completed the work, that you_have_given to_me that I_may_do.
   5 And now you father glorify me, with yourself, with_the glory which I_was_having with you before the time the world to_be.
   6 I_revealed the name of_you to_the men whom you_gave to_me out_of the world.
   they_were Yours, for_and_me you_gave them, and they_have_kept the word of_you.
   7 Now they_have_known that all things as_much_as you_have_given to_me, are from you, 8 because the words that you_gave to_me, I_have_given to_them, and they received them, that truly I_came_out from you, and they_believed that you me sent_out.
   9 I am_asking concerning them, not concerning the world I_am_asking, but concerning whom you_have_given to_me, because they_are for_you.
   10 And all things what is mine, is yours, and what is yours, is mine, and I_have_been_glorified in them.
   11 And I_am no_longer, in the world, and_yet they in the world are, and_I am_coming to you.
   holy father, keep them in the name of_you, to_which you_gave to_me, in_order_that they_may_be one, as we are.
   12 When I_was with them, I was_keeping them to_me in the name of_you, to_which you_have_given, and I_guarded them, and no_one of them perished, except the son of_destruction, in_order_that the scripture may_be_fulfilled.
   13 But now I_am_coming to you, and I_am_speaking these things in the world, in_order_that they_may_be_having my joy, having_been_fulfilled in themselves.
   14 I have_given the word of_you to_them, and the world hated them, because they_are not of the world, as I am not.
   of the world.
   15 I_am_ not _asking that you_may_take_ them _away out_of the world, but that you_may_keep them from evil.
   16 They_are not of the world, as I am not.
   of the world.
   17 Sanctify them by the truth, your word is truth.
   18 As you_sent_ me _out into the world, also_I sent_ them _out into the world.
   19 And for them am_sanctifying myself, in_order_that they also may_be having_been_sanctified in truth.
   20 But I_am_ not _asking for these only, but also for the ones believing in me through the word of_them, 21 in_order_that they_may_be all one, as you, father, in me are, and_I am in you, in_order_that they also may_be in us, in_order_that the world may_be_believing that you sent_ me _out.
   22 And_I I_have_given to_them the glory which you_have_given to_me, in_order_that they_may_be one, as we one, 23 I in them, and you in me, in_order_that they_may_be having_been_perfected in one, and the world may_be_knowing that you sent_ me _out, and you_loved them as you_loved me.
   24 father, I_am_wanting those whom you_have_given to_me, in_order_that where am I, also_those may_be with me, in_order_that they_may_be_observing my glory, that you_gave to_me, because you_loved me before the_foundation of_the_world.
   25 righteous father, also the world not knew you, but I knew you, and these knew that you sent_ me _out.
   26 And I_made_known to_them the name of_you, and I_will_be_making_known it, in_order_that the love which you_loved me, may_be in them, and_I in them.
  Jhn 18  Having_said these things, G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G came_out with the apprentices/followers of_him beyond the winter_stream of_the G‹H‹Kedrōn/(Qidərōn)›H›G, where was a_garden, into which he and the apprentices/followers of_him came_in.
   2 And G‹H‹Youdas/(Yəhūdāh)›H›G who giving_ him _over had_ also _known, the place, because often G‹H‹Yēsous was_gathered_together There with the apprentices/followers of_him.
   3 therefore G‹H‹Youdas having_received the cohort, and attendants from the chief_priests and G‹Farisaios_sect›G, is_coming there with lanterns, and torches, and weapons.
   4 G‹H‹Yēsous and having_known all the things coming on him, having_come_out he_said to_them: Whom are_you_all_seeking.
   5 They_answered to_him: G‹H‹Yēsous the G‹from_Nazaret›G.
   G‹H‹Yēsous he_is_saying to_them: I am he.
   and also G‹H‹Youdas, who giving_ him _over had_stood, with them.
   6 Therefore when he_said to_them: I am he, they_went_away back to the things and they_fell on_the_ground.
   7 Therefore again he_asked them: Whom are_you_all_seeking.
   And they said: G‹H‹Yēsous the G‹from_Nazaret›G.
   8 Answered G‹H‹Yēsous: I_told to_you_all that I am he.
   Therefore if you_all_are_seeking me, allow these to_be_going_away, 9 in_order_that the word may_be_fulfilled that he_said, whom you_have_given to_me, I_ not _lost no_one of them.
   10 Therefore Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx G‹Petros›G having a_sword, drew it and struck the slave of_the chief_priest, and cut_off the right ear of_him.
   And was G‹Malⱪos›G the_name to_the slave.
   11 Therefore G‹H‹Yēsous said to_G‹Petros›G: Put the sword into the sheath, the cup which the father has_given to_me, by_no_means I_may_ not _drink it.
   12 Therefore the cohort, and the commander, and the attendants of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G, captured G‹H‹Yēsous and bound him.
   13 And they_led him to G‹Annas›G first, for he_was father_in_law of_G‹Kaiafas›G, who was chief_priest of_ that _year.
   14 And G‹Kaiafas›G was the one having_counselled to_the G‹Youdaiōns›G that it_is_benefitting for_one man to_die_off for the people.
   15 And Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx G‹Petros›G and the_other apprentice/follower was_following.
   with_G‹H‹Yēsous.
   And that apprentice/follower was known to_the chief_priest, and he_entered_with with_G‹H‹Yēsous into the courtyard of_the chief_priest.
   16 But G‹Petros›G had_stood at the door outside.
   Therefore the other apprentice/follower came_out which was known of_the chief_priest, and he_spoke to_the doorkeeper and brought_in G‹Petros›G.
   17 The servant_girl the doorkeeper is_saying therefore, to_G‹Petros›G: Are you not also of the apprentices/followers of_ this _man.
   That one he_is_saying: I_am not.
   18 And the slaves and the attendants had_stood, having_made a_charcoal_fire, because it_was cold, and they_were_warming themselves, and G‹Petros›G was also with them having_stood and warming himself.
   19 Therefore the chief_priest asked G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G concerning the apprentices/followers of_him, and concerning the teaching of_him.
   20 G‹H‹Yēsous answered to_him: I have_spoken with_plainness to_the world, I always taught in the_synagogue and in the temple, where all the G‹Youdaiōns›G are_coming_together, and I_spoke nothing in secret.
   21 Why are_you_asking me.
   Ask the ones having_heard what I_spoke to_them, see, these have_known what I said.
   22 And these things of_him having_said, one of_the ones attendants having_stood_by gave a_slap to_G‹H‹Yēsous having_said: Are_you_answering thus to_the chief_priest.
   23 G‹H‹Yēsous answered to_him: If I_spoke wrongly, testify concerning the evil, but if rightly, why are_you_beating me.
   24 Therefore G‹Annas›G sent_ him _out, having_been_bound to G‹Kaiafas›G the chief_priest.
   25 And Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx G‹Petros›G was having_stood and warming himself.
   Therefore they_said to_him: Are not you also of the apprentices/followers of_him.
   That one he_disowned and said: I_am not.
   26 one of the slaves of_the chief_priest, being a_relative of_whom G‹Petros›G cut_off his ear Is_saying: Not I saw you in the garden with him.
   27 Therefore again G‹Petros›G disowned, and immediately a_rooster crowed.
   28 Therefore they_are_leading G‹H‹Yēsous from G‹Kaiafas›G into the residence_of_the_governor, and it_was early.
   And they not came_in into the residence_of_the_governor, in_order_that they _may_ not _be_defiled, but they_may_eat the passover_feast.
   29 Therefore Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx came_out outside to them and is_saying: What accusation are_you_all_bringing against this man.
   30 They_answered and said to_him: Except this one was doing evil, we_ would not _gave_over him to_you 31 Therefore Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx said to_them: You_all take him, and judge according_to the law of_you_all, him.
   The G‹Youdaiōns›G said to_him, is_ not _permitting To_us to_kill_off no_one, 32 in_order_that the word of_G‹H‹Yēsous may_be_fulfilled, that he_spoke, signifying by_what death he_was_going to_be_dying_off.
   33 Therefore Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx came_in again into the residence_of_the_governor, and he_called G‹H‹Yēsous and said to_him: Are you the king of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G.
   34 G‹H‹Yēsous answered Are_ you _saying this of yourself, or others said it to_you concerning me.
   35 Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx answered: Surely_not am I a_Rx-G‹Youdaios›G-Rx.
   Your nation and the chief_priests gave_ you _over to_me.
   What did_you.
   36 G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G answered: my kingdom is not of world this, if my kingdom was of this world, my attendants would were_fighting, in_order_that I _may_ not _be_given_over to_the G‹Youdaiōns›G.
   But now my kingdom is not from_here.
   37 Therefore Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx said to_him: Are you not_then a_king.
   G‹H‹Yēsous answered: You are_saying that I am a_king.
   for this I_have_been_born, and for this I_have_come into the world, in_order_that I_may_testify to_the truth.
   Everyone being of the truth, is_hearing of_the voice of_me.
   38 Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx is_saying to_him: What is truth.
   And having_said this, he_came_out again to the G‹Youdaiōns›G, and is_saying to_them: I am_finding not_one Guilt in him.
   39 But it_is a_custom with_you_all, that I_may_send_away one to_you_all at the passover_, therefore are_you_all_wishing I_may_send_away to_you_all the king of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G.
   40 Therefore they_cried_out again saying: Not this one, but G‹Barabbas›G.
   And G‹Barabbas›G was a_robber.
  Jhn 19  Therefore Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx then took G‹H‹Yēsous and flogged him.
   2 And the soldiers having_twisted_together a_crown of thorns, they_put_on it on_the head of_him, and they_clothed him in_a_ purple _robe, 3 and they_were_coming to him and they_were_saying: Greetings, the king of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G.
   And they_were_giving slaps to_him.
   4 And Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx came_out again outside, and is_saying to_them: See I_am_bringing him out to_you_all, in_order_that you_all_may_know that I_am_ not _finding guilt in him.
   5 Therefore G‹H‹Yēsous came_out outside, wearing the thorny crown and the purple robe.
   And he_is_saying to_them: See the man.
   6 Therefore when the chief_priests and the attendants saw him, they_cried_out saying: Impale_on_a_stake.
   Impale_on_a_stake.
   Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx is_saying to_them: You_all take him and impale_on_a_stake him, for I am_ not _finding guilt in him.
   7 The G‹Youdaiōns›G answered: We are_having a_law, and according_to the law he_ought to_die_off, because he_made himself the_son of_god.
   8 Therefore when Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx heard this word, he_was_ more _afraid.
   9 And he_came_in into the residence_of_the_governor again, and is_saying to_G‹H‹Yēsous: From_where are you.
   But G‹H‹Yēsous not gave an_answer to_him.
   10 Therefore Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx is_saying to_him, you_are_ not _speaking To_me.
   You_have_ not _known that I_am_having authority to_send_ you _away, and I_am_having authority to_impale_on_a_stake you.
   11 G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G answered to_him: You_were_ not _having authority against me not_one, except was having_been_given to_you from_above.
   Because_of this the one having_given_ me _over to_you, is_having greater sin.
   12 Out_of this Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx was_seeking to_send_away him.
   But the G‹Youdaiōns›G cried_out saying: If you_may_send_away this man, you_are not a_friend of_Rx-G‹Kaisar›G-Rx.
   Everyone making himself a_king, is_speaking_against against_Rx-G‹Kaisar›G-Rx.
   13 Therefore Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx, having_heard of_words these, brought outside G‹H‹Yēsous, and he_sat_down on the_tribunal, at a_place being_called the_stone_pavement, But in_G‹Hebraios›G, G‹Gabbatha›G.
   14 And it_was the_preparation day of_the passover_feast, the_hour was about the_sixth.
   And he_is_saying to_the G‹Youdaiōns›G: See the king of_you_all.
   15 And they cried_out: Take_away.
   Take_away.
   Impale_ him _on_a_stake.
   Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx is_saying to_them: May_I_impale_on_a_stake the king of_you_all.
   The Chief_priests answered: We_are_ not _having a_king, except Rx-G‹Kaisar›G-Rx.
   16 Therefore then he_gave_ him _over, to_them, in_order_that he_may_be_impaled_on_a_stake.
   They_took And G‹H‹Yēsous, led_ him _away 17 And bearing the cross to_himself, he_came_out to the place being_called: place of_the_skull, which is_being_called In_G‹Hebraios›G, G‹H‹Golgotha/(Guləggolet)›H›G, 18 where they_impaled_ him _on_a_stake, and with him two others, on_this_side and on_that_side, and G‹H‹Yēsous in_the_middle.
   19 And Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx wrote also a_title, and put on the cross.
   And it_was having_been_written: G‹H‹Yēsous the G‹from_Nazaret›G, the king of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G.
   20 Therefore this title many of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G read, because the place was near of_the city, where G‹H‹Yēsous was_impaled_on_a_stake, and it_was having_been_written In_G‹Hebraios›G, In_Latin, In_Rx-G‹Hellēn›G-Rx.
   21 Therefore the chief_priests of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G were_saying to_Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx: Be_ not _writing: The king of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G, but that that one said: I_am king.
   of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G.
   22 Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx answered: What I_have_written, I_have_written.
   23 Therefore the soldiers when they_impaled_on_a_stake G‹H‹Yēsous, took the clothes of_him, and they_made four parts, a_part to_each soldier, and the tunic.
   And the tunic was seamless, from the_ top _parts woven through all.
   24 Therefore they_said to one_another: We_may_ not _tear it, but we_may_choose_by_lot for it, whose it_will_be, in_order_that the scripture may_be_fulfilled saying: they_divided the clothes of_me to_themselves, and they_throw a_lot for the clothing of_me.
   The therefore on_one_hand soldiers did these things.
   25 On_the_other_hand the mother of_him had_stood by the cross of_G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, and the sister of_the mother of_him, G‹H‹Maria/(Mirəyām)›H›G the wife of_Clopas, and G‹H‹Maria the G‹from_Magdala›G.
   26 G‹H‹Yēsous therefore having_seen his mother, and the apprentice/follower having_stood_by whom he_was_loving, is_saying to_the mother: Woman, see, the son of_you.
   27 Thereafter he_is_saying to_the apprentice/follower: See the mother of_you.
   And from that hour took the apprentice/follower her to his own.
   28 After this having_known G‹H‹Yēsous that all things now has_been_accomplished, in_order_that the scripture may_be_completed, he_is_saying: I_am_thirsting.
   29 A_vessel was_lying full of_wine_vinegar, therefore a_sponge full of_the wine_vinegar having_put_around around_a_hyssop stalk, they_brought over_it to_his mouth.
   30 Therefore when G‹H‹Yēsous took the wine_vinegar, he_said: It_has_been_finished.
   And having_bowed the head, he_gave_over his spirit.
   31 Therefore the G‹Youdaiōns›G, because it_was the_preparation day, in_order_that the bodies may_ not _remain on the cross on the sabbath (for it_was great day of_that sabbath), they_asked Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx that the legs of_them may_be_broken, and they_may_be_taken_away.
   32 Therefore the soldiers came, and they_broke the legs of_the first on_one_hand, and of_the other having_been_impaled_on_a_stake_with with_him, 33 on_the_other_hand having_come to G‹H‹Yēsous, when they_saw him having_died already, they_ not _broke the legs of_him.
   34 But one of_the soldiers pierced the side of_him with_a_spear, and immediately blood and water came_out.
   35 And the one having_seen has_testified, and the testimony of_him is true, and that one has_known that he_is_speaking true, in_order_that also you_all you_all_may_be_believing.
   36 For these things became, in_order_that the scripture may_be_fulfilled: bone of_him will_ not _be_being_broken.
   37 And again another scripture is_saying: they_will_be_looking on whom they_pierced.
   38 And after these things, G‹H‹Yōsēf/(Yōşēf)›H›G from G‹Arimathaia›G being a_apprentice/follower of_G‹H‹Yēsous, but having_been_hidden because_of the fear of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G asked Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx, that he_may_take_away the body of_G‹H‹Yēsous, and Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx permitted it.
   Therefore came and they_took_ him.
   _away.
   39 And G‹Nikodēmos›G also came, the one having_come to him at_the first by_night, bringing a_wrapping of_myrrh and aloe, about a_hundred pounds.
   40 Therefore they_took the body of_G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, and they_bound it in_linen_cloths with the spices, as the_custom of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G is to_be_burying.
   41 And there_was a_garden in the place where he_was_impaled_on_a_stake, and in the garden a_ new _tomb, in which not_yet no_one was having_been_laid.
   42 Therefore because_of the preparation day of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G, because near was the tomb, they_laid G‹H‹Yēsous there.
  Jhn 20  And on_the first day of_the week, G‹H‹Maria/(Mirəyām)›H›G the G‹from_Magdala›G is_coming early, to the tomb still being darkness, and is_seeing the stone having_been_taken_away from the tomb.
   2 Therefore she_is_running and is_coming to Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx G‹Petros›G, and to the other apprentice/follower whom was_loving G‹H‹Yēsous, and she_is_saying to_them: They_took_away the master out_of the tomb, and we_have_ not _known where they_laid him.
   3 Therefore G‹Petros›G and the other apprentice/follower came_out, and they_were_coming to the tomb.
   4 And the two were_running together, and the other apprentice/follower ran_ahead more_quickly than G‹Petros›G, and came to the tomb first.
   5 And having_stooped_down, he_is_seeing lying there the linen_cloths, however he_ not _came_in.
   6 Therefore Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx G‹Petros›G is_ also _coming following after_him, and came_in into the tomb, and is_observing the linen_cloths lying there, 7 and the handkerchief, which was on the head of_him, lying there not with the linen_cloths, but separately having_been_wrapped in one place.
   8 Therefore then the other apprentice/follower also came_in, having_come first to the tomb, and he_saw and believed, 9 for they_had_ not_yet _known the scripture that it_is_fitting him to_rise_up from the_dead.
   10 Therefore the apprentices/followers they_went_away again to themselves.
   11 But G‹H‹Maria had_stood at the tomb outside weeping.
   Therefore as she_was_weeping, she_stooped_down into the tomb, 12 and is_observing two angels in white sitting, one at the head, and one at the feet, where the body of_G‹H‹Yēsous was_lying.
   13 And those are_saying to_her: Woman, why are_you_weeping.
   She_is_saying to_them: Because they_took_away the master of_me, and I_have_ not _known where they_laid him.
   14 Having_said these things, she_was_turned back to the things, and is_observing G‹H‹Yēsous having_stood, and had_ not _known that it_is G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G.
   15 G‹H‹Yēsous is_saying to_her: Woman, why are_you_weeping.
   Whom are_you_seeking.
   That woman supposing that he_is the gardener, is_saying to_him: Sir, if you bore him, tell to_me where you_laid him, and_I will_be_taking_ him _away.
   16 G‹H‹Yēsous is_saying to_her: G‹H‹Maria.
   that woman Having_been_turned is_saying to_him In_G‹Hebraios›G: Rabboni (that is_being_called: Teacher).
   17 G‹H‹Yēsous is_saying to_her: Be_ not _touching against_me, for I_have_ not_yet _gone_up to the father, but be_going to the brothers of_me, and say to_them: I_am_going_up to the father of_me, and the_father of_you_all, and god of_me, and god of_you_all.
   18 G‹H‹Maria/(Mirəyām)›H›G the G‹from_Magdala›G Is_coming announcing to_the apprentices/followers, I_have_seen the master, and he_said these things to_her.
   19 Therefore being evening on_ that _day first of_the_week, and the doors having_been_shut where the apprentices/followers were because_of the fear of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G, G‹H‹Yēsous came and stood in the midst, and is_saying to_them: Peace to_you_all.
   20 And having_said this, he_showed his hands and his side to_them.
   Therefore the apprentices/followers were_elated, having_seen the master.
   21 Therefore G‹H‹Yēsous he_said to_them again: Peace to_you_all, as the father has_sent_ me _out, also_I am_sending you_all.
   22 And having_said this, he_breathed_on them and is_saying to_them: Receive holy the_spirit.
   23 If of_any you_all_may_forgive the sins, they_have_been_forgiven to_them, if of_any you_all_may_be_restraining, they_have_been_restrained.
   24 But G‹Thōmas›G, one of the twelve, the one being_called G‹Didumos/[twin]›G, was not with them when G‹H‹Yēsous came.
   25 Therefore the other apprentices/followers were_saying to_him: We_have_seen the master.
   But he said to_them: If I _may_ not _see the mark of_the nails in the hands of_him, and I_may_put the finger of_me into the mark of_the nails, and I_may_put the hand of_me into the side of_him, by_no_means I will_ not _be_believing.
   26 And after eight days the apprentices/followers of_him were again inside, and G‹Thōmas›G with them.
   G‹H‹Yēsous Is_coming, the doors having_been_shut, and stood in the midst, and said: Peace to_you_all.
   27 Thereafter he_is_saying to_G‹Thōmas›G: Be_bringing the finger of_you here, and see the hands of_me, and be_bringing the hand of_you, and put it into the side of_me, and be_ not _becoming unbelieving, but believing.
   28 G‹Thōmas›G answered and said to_him: The master of_me and the god of_me.
   29 G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G is_saying to_him: Because you_have_seen me, have_believed, blessed are the ones not having_seen, and_yet having_believed.
   30 Many therefore on_one_hand other signs G‹H‹Yēsous also did before of_the apprentices/followers of_him, which is not having_been_written in the this scroll.
   31 On_the_other_hand these things has_been_written, in_order_that you_all_may_be_believing that G‹H‹Yēsous is the chosen_one/messiah, the son of_god, and in_order_that believing, you_all_may_be_having life in the name of_him.
  Jhn 21  After these things, G‹H‹Yēsous revealed himself again to_the apprentices/followers at the sea of_G‹Tiberios›G, and he_revealed himself thus: 2 Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx G‹Petros›G, and G‹Thōmas›G being_called G‹Didumos/[twin]›G, and G‹Nathanaēl›G the one from Rx-G‹Kana›G-Rx of_G‹H‹Galilaia/(Gālīl)›H›G, and the sons of_G‹Zebedaios›G, and two others of the apprentices/followers of_him.
   were together.
   3 Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx G‹Petros›G is_saying to_them: I_am_going to_be_fishing.
   They_are_saying to_him: We are_ also _coming with you.
   They_came_out and they_boarded into the boat, and at that night they_caught nothing.
   4 But in_the_morning already becoming, G‹H‹Yēsous stood on the shore, however the apprentices/followers had_ not _known that it_is G‹H‹Yēsous.
   5 therefore G‹H‹Yēsous is_saying to_them: Little_children, you_all_are_ not _having any fish.
   They_answered to_him: No.
   6 And he said to_them: Cast the net to the right side of_the boat, and you_all_will_be_finding them.
   Therefore they_throw, and was_ no_longer _able to_drag it because_of the multitude of_the fishes.
   7 Therefore apprentice/follower that whom G‹H‹Yēsous was_loving is_saying to_G‹Petros›G: It_is the master.
   Therefore Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx G‹Petros›G having_heard that it_is the master, girded his outer_garment, for he_was naked, and threw himself into the sea.
   8 And the other apprentices/followers in_the little_boat came, for they_were not far from the land, but from about two_hundred cubits dragging the net with_the fishes.
   9 Therefore when they_got_out on the land, they_are_seeing a_charcoal_fire lying, and fish laying_on it, and bread.
   10 G‹H‹Yēsous is_saying to_them: Bring from the fish which you_all_caught now.
   11 Therefore Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx G‹Petros›G went_up, and dragged the net to land full of_ large _fishes a_hundred fifty three, but being so_many, the net was_ not _torn.
   12 G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G is_saying to_them: Come, eat_breakfast.
   But no_one of_the apprentices/followers was_daring to_question him, who are You.
   Having_known that it_is the master.
   13 G‹H‹Yēsous is_coming, and is_taking the bread and is_giving to_them, and the fish likewise.
   14 This now the_third time G‹H‹Yēsous was_revealed to_the apprentices/followers, having_been_raised from the_dead.
   15 Therefore when they_ate_lunch, G‹H‹Yēsous is_saying to_Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx G‹Petros›G: Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx son of_G‹Yōannēs›G, are_you_loving me more than these.
   He_is_saying to_him: Yes, master, you have_known that I_am_loving you.
   He_is_saying to_him: Be_feeding the lambs of_me.
   16 He_is_saying to_him again secondly: Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx son of_G‹Yōannēs›G, are_you_loving me.
   He_is_saying to_him: Yes, master, you have_known that I_am_loving you.
   He_is_saying to_him: Be_shepherding the sheep of_me.
   17 He_is_saying to_him the third time: Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx son of_G‹Yōannēs›G, are_you_loving me.
   G‹Petros›G was_sorrowed because he_said to_him the third time: Are_you_loving me.
   And he_is_saying to_him: master, you have_known all things, you are_knowing that I_am_loving you.
   G‹H‹Yēsous is_saying to_him: Be_feeding the sheep of_me.
   18 Truly, truly, I_am_saying to_you, when you_were younger, you_were_girding yourself, and you_were_walking where you_were_wanting, but whenever you_may_age, you_will_be_stretching_out the hands of_you, and others will_be_girding you, and will_be_bringing where you_are_ not _wanting.
   19 And he_said this, signifying by_what death he_will_be_glorifying god.
   And having_said this, he_is_saying to_him: Be_following after_me.
   20 Having_been_turned_back, G‹Petros›G is_seeing the apprentice/follower whom G‹H‹Yēsous was_loving who also sat_down at the supper on the chest of_him following, and said, to_him: master, who is, the one giving_ you _over.
   21 Therefore having_seen this one, G‹Petros›G is_saying to_G‹H‹Yēsous: master, and what about this one.
   22 G‹H‹Yēsous is_saying to_him: If I_may_be_wanting him to_be_remaining until I_am_coming, what is_it to you.
   You be_following after_me.
   23 Therefore this statement came_out among the brothers, that that apprentice/follower is_dying_off.
   Not but G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G not said to_him that He_is_ not _dying_off, but only: If I_may_be_wanting him to_be_remaining until I_am_coming, what is_it to you.
   24 This one is the apprentice/follower testifying concerning these things, and the one having_written these things, and we_have_known that the testimony of_him is true.
   25 And is also many other things that G‹H‹Yēsous did, which if in_every one may_be_being_written, I_am_supposing not_even the world itself going_to_be_having_room for_the scrolls being_written.

USFM file edited 2022-09-24 17:40 by ScriptedBibleEditor v0.14

Acts

1  Indeed the first account I_made concerning all things, Rx-Oh-Rx G‹Theofilos›G, of_which G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G began both to_be_doing and to_be_teaching, 2 until which day having_commanded by the_ holy _spirit to_the ambassadors, whom he_chose, he_was_taken_up, 3 to_whom also after the time him to_suffer he_presented himself living, with many proofs through forty days, appearing to_them, and speaking the things concerning the kingdom of_god.
   4 And assembling_together, he_commanded to_them: From G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G not to_be_being_departed, but to_be_awaiting the promise of_the father, which you_all_heard from_me.
   5 Because G‹Yōannēs›G on_one_hand immersed with_water, on_the_other_hand you_all will_be_being_immersed with the_ holy _spirit, after many not these days.
   6 Therefore indeed the ones having_come_together, were_asking him saying: master, at this time, are_you_restoring the kingdom to_Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx.
   7 And he_said to them: It_is not of_you_all to_know times or seasons, which the father set by his own authority.
   8 But you_all_will_be_receiving power, having_ The holy spirit _come_over on you_all, and you_all_will_be witnesses for_me, in both G‹H‹Hierousalēm, and in all Rx-G‹Youdaia›G-Rx, and G‹H‹Samareia/(Shomərōn)›H›G, and to the_last part of_the earth.
   9 And having_said these things, seeing them, he_was_lifted_up and a_cloud took_ him _up from the eyes of_them.
   10 And as they_were looking_intently into the sky, him going, also see two men in white clothing, had_stood_by to_them, 11 who also said: Men, G‹Galilaios›G, why you_all_have_stood looking at the sky.
   This G‹H‹Yēsous having_been_taken_up from you_all into heaven, thus will_be_coming which manner you_all_saw him going into heaven.
   12 Then they_returned to G‹H‹Hierousalēm from the_mountain being_called of_Olivet, which is near G‹H‹Hierousalēm, having journey of_a_sabbath.
   13 And when they_came_in, into the upper_room, they_went_up where they_were staying, jointly G‹Petros›G and G‹Yōannēs›G and G‹H‹Yakōbos/(Ya'aqov)›H›G and G‹Andreas›G, Rx-G‹Filippos›G-Rx and G‹Thōmas›G, G‹Bartholomaios›G and G‹Matthaios›G, G‹H‹Yakōbos of_G‹Alfaios›G, and Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx the G‹Farisaios_zēlōtēs_group_member›G, and G‹H‹Youdas/(Yəhūdāh)›H›G of_G‹H‹Yakōbos.
   14 These all were persevering in_prayer with_one_accord, with the_women and G‹H‹Maria/(Mirəyām)›H›G the mother of_G‹H‹Yēsous, and the brothers of_him.
   15 And in these days, G‹Petros›G having_stood_up in the_midst of_the brothers said (and the_crowd of_names with the same was about a_hundred twenty), 16 Men, brothers, it_was_fitting the scripture to_be_fulfilled, which the holy spirit previously_said by the_mouth of_G‹H‹Dauid/(Dāvid)›H›G concerning G‹H‹Youdas, the one having_become guide to_the ones having_captured G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G.
   17 Because he_was having_been_numbered with us, and obtained a_lot of_ this _service.
   18 (Therefore indeed this man acquired a_field out_of the_reward of_unrighteousness, and having_become headlong, he_burst_open in_the_middle, and all the intestines of_him was_poured_out.
   19 And it_became known to_all the ones dwelling_in G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G, so_that that field to_be_called in_their language of_them, G‹Akeldama›G, this is: field of_blood.
  ) 20 For it_has_been_written in scroll of_psalms, the the_homestead of_him let_be_become desolate, and let_ not _be the one dwelling in it, and: let_ another _take the overseeing of_him.
   21 Therefore it_is_fitting of_the men having_come_together with_us, at all the_time that the master G‹H‹Yēsous came_in and came_out with us, 22 having_begun from the immersion of_G‹Yōannēs›G until the day in_which he_was_taken_up from us, a_witness of_the resurrection of_him with us, to_become one of_these.
   23 And they_set two, G‹H‹Yōsēf/(Yōşēf)›H›G being_called G‹Barsabbas›G, who was_called G‹Youstos›G, and G‹Matthias›G.
   24 And having_prayed, they_said: You master, heart_knower of_all, reveal which one you_chose of these two, 25 to_take the this place of_service and commission, from which G‹H‹Youdas broke_from, to_be_gone to his own place.
   26 And they_gave lots to_them, and the lot fell on G‹Matthias›G, and he_was_chosen_together_with with the eleven ambassadors.
  Act 2  And at the time the day of_pentecost to_be_being_fulfilled, they_were all together in the same place.
   2 And suddenly a_sound became out_of heaven, as being_carried of_a_ forceful _wind, and it_filled all the house where they_were sitting.
   3 And dividing tongues as_if of_fire were_seen to_them, and sat_down on each one of_them.
   4 And they_were_ all _filled with_the_ holy _spirit, and they_began to_be_speaking with_other tongues, as the spirit was_giving to_them to_be_speaking_out.
   5 And G‹Youdaiōns›G were dwelling in G‹H‹Hierousalēm, devout men from every nation of_the nations under heaven.
   6 And of_ this _sound having_become, the multitude came_together and was_confounded, because each one heard speaking of_them in_his.
   own language.
   7 And they_were_amazed and they_were_Rx-marvelling-Rx saying: Behold are not, all these who are speaking G‹Galilaios›G.
   8 And how are_ we _hearing each in_the own language of_us, in which we_were_born.
   9 G‹ones_from_Parthia›G, and G‹ones_from_Mēdia›G, and G‹ones_from_Elam›G, and the ones dwelling_in G‹Mesopotamia›G, Rx-G‹Youdaia›G-Rx and jointly G‹Kappadokia›G, Rx-G‹Pontos›G-Rx and G‹Asia›G, 10 G‹Frugia›G and jointly G‹Pamfulia›G, G‹H‹Aiguptos/(Miʦərayim)›H›G, and the parts of_G‹Libuē›G along G‹Kurēnē›G, and the ones G‹Ɽōmaios›G visiting, 11 both G‹Youdaiōns›G and converts, G‹ones_from_Krētē›G and G‹ones_from_G‹Arabia›G›G, we_are_hearing them speaking, the great things of_god in_our tongues.
   12 And all were_Rx-marvelling-Rx and were_thoroughly_perplexed, another saying to another: What is_wanting this to_be.
   13 But others mocking were_saying, They_are having_been_filled of_sweet_wine.
   14 But G‹Petros›G having_been_stood with the eleven, lifted_up the voice of_him and spoke_out to_them: Men, G‹ones_from_Youdaia›G, and all you_all dwelling_in G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G, let_ this _be known to_you_all and give_ear to_the words of_me.
   15 For these are_ not _being_drunk as you_all are_supposing, for it_is the_ third _hour, of_the day, 16 but this is the word having_been_spoken by the prophet G‹H‹Yōēl/(Yō'ēl)›H›G: 17 and it_will_be with these things in the last days, god is_saying: I_will_be_pouring_out of the spirit of_me on all flesh, and the sons of_you_all will_be_prophesying, and the daughters of_you_all, and the young_men of_you_all will_be_seeing visions, and the elders of_you_all in_dreams will_be_being_dreamt, 18 and surely I_will_be_pouring_out of the spirit of_me on the slaves of_me, and on the handmaidens of_me, in those days, and they_will_be_prophesying.
   19 And I_will_be_giving wonders in the sky above, and signs on the earth below, blood, and fire, and vapor of_smoke.
   20 The sun will_be_being_altered into darkness and the moon into blood, before the_ great and glorious _day of_the_master to_come.
   21 And it_will_be, everyone who may_call on_the name of_the_master will_be_being_saved.
   22 Men, G‹H‹ones_from_Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G, hear words these: G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G the G‹from_Nazaret›G, a_man having_been_demonstrated by god to you_all by_miracles, and wonders, and signs, which god did by him in the_midst of_you_all, as you_all_ yourselves _have_known.
   23 This man by_the, having_been_designated counsel and foreknowledge of_god, delivered_up by the_hand of_the_lawless ones, you_all_killed having_impaled_on_a_stake.
   24 Whom god raised_up, having_untied/released the agonies of_the death, as_much_as was not possible him to_be_being_restrained by it.
   25 For G‹H‹Dauid/(Dāvid)›H›G is_saying to him: I_was_foreseeing the master before me through all time, because he_is on the_right hand of_me, in_order_that I _may_ not _be_shaken.
   26 Because_of this the heart of_me was_gladdened, and the tongue of_me exulted, and still also the flesh of_me will_be_nesting in hope, 27 because you will_ not _be_abandoning the soul of_me into G‹Hadēs›G, nor will_you_be_giving the devout Rx-one-Rx of_you to_see decay.
   28 You_made_known to_me the_ways of_life, you_will_be_filling me with_gladness with the presence of_you.
   29 Men, brothers, it_is_permitting to_speak with confidence to you_all concerning the patriarch G‹H‹Dauid that he_ both _died and was_buried, and the tomb of_him is among us until this day.
   30 Therefore being a_prophet, and having_known that god swore to_him with_an_oath: of the_fruit of_the loin of_him, to_sit_down on the throne of_him.
   31 Having_foreseen, he_spoke concerning the resurrection of_the chosen_one/messiah that neither was_abandoned into G‹Hadēs›G, nor the flesh of_him saw decay.
   32 This G‹H‹Yēsous god raised_up, of_which all we are witnesses.
   33 Therefore having_been_exalted by_the right hand of_god, and having_received the promise of_the holy spirit, from the father, he_poured_ this _out which you_all are_seeing and are_hearing.
   34 For G‹H‹Dauid not went_up into the heavens, but himself is_saying, the_master said to_the master of_me: Be_sitting on the_right hand of_me, 35 until I_may_put the enemies of_you a_footstool of_the feet of_you.
   36 Assuredly therefore let_ All the_house of_Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx _be_knowing that god made him both the_master and the_chosen_one, this G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G whom you_all impaled_on_a_stake.
   37 And having_heard, they_were_pierced to_the heart, and they_said to G‹Petros›G and the other ambassadors: What may_we_do, men, brothers.
   38 And G‹Petros›G is_saying to them: Repent: and let_ each of_you_all _be_immersed in the name of_G‹H‹Yēsous chosen_one, for forgiveness of_the sins of_you_all, and you_all_will_be_receiving the gift of_the holy spirit.
   39 For the promise is to_you_all, and to_the children of_you_all, and to_all the ones at far, as_many_as may_call_to the_master, the god of_us.
   40 Both with_ more _other words he_testified, and was_exhorting them saying: Be_saved from this crooked generation.
   41 Therefore indeed the ones having_welcomed the word of_him were_immersed, and were_added on that day, about three_thousand souls.
   42 And they_were persevering in_the teaching of_the ambassadors, and in_fellowship, the breaking of_the bread, and in_prayers.
   43 And reverence was_becoming on_every soul, and many wonders and signs was_becoming through the ambassadors.
   in G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G.
   and great fear was with all.
   44 and And all the ones having_believed were with the same purpose, and they_were_having all common things, 45 and they_were_selling their properties and their possessions, and they_were_dividing them to_all, anyone was_having as_much_as would need.
   46 And in_every day persevering with_one_accord in the temple, and breaking bread in_every house, they_were_partaking of_food with exultation and simplicity of_heart, 47 praising god and having favour with all the people.
   And the master was_adding the ones being_saved with the same.
   in_every day.
  Act 3  And G‹Petros›G also G‹Yōannēs›G were_going_up into the temple at the hour of_prayer the ninth hour.
   2 And a_certain man, being lame from the_womb of_the_mother of_him, was_being_born, whom they_were_putting in_every day at the door of_the temple, being_called Beautiful, to_be_requesting alms from the ones entering_in into the temple.
   3 Who having_seen G‹Petros›G and G‹Yōannēs›G going to_be_entering into the temple, was_asking to_receive alms.
   4 But G‹Petros›G having_looked_intently at him with G‹Yōannēs›G said: Look to us.
   5 And he was_holding_on to_them, expecting to_receive something from them.
   6 But G‹Petros›G said: Silver and gold is_ not _being to_me, but this what I_am_having, I_am_giving to_you, in the name of_G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G chosen_one/messiah of_the G‹from_Nazaret›G, be_walking.
   7 And having_grabbed him by_the right hand, he_raised him, and immediately the feet of_him and the ankles were_strengthened.
   8 And leaping_up, he_stood and was_walking, and came_in with them into the temple, walking, and springing_up, and praising god.
   9 And all the people saw him walking and praising the god.
   10 And they_were_recognizing him that he was the one sitting at the Beautiful gate of_the temple for the alms, and they_were_filled with_amazement and amazement at the thing having_been_happened to_him.
   11 And of_him taking_hold_of G‹Petros›G and G‹Yōannēs›G, all the people ran_together to them in the portico being_called of_G‹H‹Solomōn/(Shəlmoh)›H›G, greatly_amazed.
   12 But G‹Petros›G having_seen it, answered to the people: Men, G‹H‹ones_from_Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G, why you_all_are_wondering at this, or why you_all_are_looking_intently at_us, as_though by_our_own power or devoutness having_made him to_be_walking.
   13 The god of_G‹H‹Abra'am/('Avərāhām)›H›G, and the the_god of_G‹H‹Isa'ak/(Yiʦəḩāq)›H›G, and the the_god of_G‹H‹Yakōb/(Ya'aqov)›H›G, the god of_the fathers of_us, glorified the servant of_him, G‹H‹Yēsous, whom you_all indeed gave_over, and disowned in the_presence of_Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx, that one having_judged to_be_sending_away him.
   14 But you_all disowned the holy Rx-one-Rx and righteous Rx-one-Rx, and you_all_requested a_man a_murderer to_be_granted to_you_all, 15 but you_all_killed_off the originator of_life, whom god raised from the_dead, of_which we are witnesses.
   16 And faith in_the name of_him, this man whom you_all_are_observing and you_all_have_known, strengthened the name of_him, and the faith which is by him, gave complete_healing to_him this in_front_of all of_you_all.
   17 And now, brothers, I_have_known that you_all_did in ignorance, as also the rulers of_you_all.
   18 But what things god foretold by the_mouth of_all the prophets, the chosen_one of_him to_suffer, he_fulfilled thus.
   19 Therefore repent and turn_back, for the time of_you_all sins to_be_wiped_out, 20 so_that times of_refreshment may_come from the_presence of_the master, and he_may_send_out the one having_been_appointed to_you_all the_chosen_one G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, 21 whom indeed it_is_fitting heaven to_receive, until the_times of_restoration of_all things, which god spoke from the_age by the_mouth of_the holy prophets of_him.
   22 Indeed G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G said, the_master, the god of_us will_be_raising_up a_prophet to_you_all like of_you_all me from the brothers, you_all_will_be_hearing from_him in all things, as_many_as he_may_speak to you_all.
   23 And it_will_be that every soul, whoever may_ not _hear from_ that _prophet, will_be_being_wholly_destroyed from the people.
   24 And also all the prophets from G‹H‹Samouēl/(Shəmū'ēl)›H›G and the ones consecutively, as_many_as spoke, also proclaimed these days.
   25 You_all are the sons of_the prophets, and of_the covenant which god covenanted with the fathers of_you_all, saying to G‹H‹Abra'am: and in the seed of_you all the families of_the earth will_be_being_blessed.
   26 god having_raised_up the servant of_him, sent_ him _out To_you_all first, blessing you_all in that to_be_turning_away each from the wickedness of_you_all.
  Act 4  And of_them speaking to the people, the chief_priests, and the officer of_the temple, and the G‹Saddoukaios_sect›G approached to_them, 2 being_thoroughly_disturbing because_of the thing them to_be_teaching to_the people, and to_be_proclaiming the resurrection in G‹H‹Yēsous, which is from the_dead.
   3 And they_laid_ their _on on_them hands, and they_put them in jail to the_ next _day, for it_was already evening.
   4 But many the ones having_heard the word, believed and number of_the men was_become about five thousands.
   5 And it_became on the_ next _day the rulers of_them, and the elders, and the scribes to_be_gathered_together in G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G, 6 and G‹Annas›G the chief_priest, and G‹Kaiafas›G, and G‹Yōannēs›G, and G‹Alexandros›G, and as_many_as were of chief_priestly descent.
   7 And having_stood them in the midst, they_were_inquiring: In what power or in what name you_all did this.
   8 Then G‹Petros›G having_been_filled with_the_ holy _spirit, said to them: Rulers of_the people and elders, 9 if we today are_being_examined on a_good_work to_the_ sick _man, by what this one has_been_healed, 10 it_let_be known to_all you_all and to_all the people of_Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx, that in the name of_G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G chosen_one/messiah the G‹from_Nazaret›G, whom you_all impaled_on_a_stake, whom god raised from the_dead, by this name this man has_stood_by before you_all healthy.
   11 This one is the stone having_been_scorned by you_all, the builders, which having_become to the_head of_the_corner.
   12 And not_one the is not in other salvation, for there_is not another name under heaven having_been_given among people, by which it_is_fitting us to_be_saved.
   13 And observing the boldness of_G‹Petros›G and of_G‹Yōannēs›G, and having_grasped that they_are illiterate and ordinary men, they_were_Rx-marvelling-Rx, and they_were_recognizing them that they_were with G‹H‹Yēsous.
   14 And seeing the man having_stood with them, the one having_been_healed, they_were_having nothing to_speak_against them.
   15 But having_commanded them to_go_away outside the council, they_were_conferring with one_another 16 saying: What we_may_do to_ these _men.
   For indeed that has_become a_known sign through them, to_all the ones dwelling_in G‹H‹Hierousalēm is manifest, and we_are_ not _being_able to_be_disowning it.
   17 But in_order_that may_ not _be_spread on more among the people, we_may_threaten to_them to_ no_longer _be_speaking in this name to_no_one of_the_people.
   18 And having_called them, they_commanded them not to_be_speaking nor to_be_teaching in the name of_G‹H‹Yēsous at_all.
   19 But G‹Petros›G and G‹Yōannēs›G answering said to them: Judge whether it_is right before god, to_be_hearing from_you_all rather than from_god.
   20 For we are_ not _being_able to_be_ not _speaking what we_saw and we_heard.
   21 And they having_further_threatened them sent_ them _away, finding nothing how they_may_punish them, because_of the people, because all were_glorifying god for the thing having_become.
   22 For the man on whom this sign of_the healing had_become was more years than forty.
   23 And having_been_sent_away, they_came to their own, and they_reported as_much_as the chief_priests and the elders said to them.
   24 And which having_heard, with_one_accord lifted_up their_voice to god and said: Master, you having_made the heaven, and the earth, and the sea, and all the things in them, 25 the one of_the father of_us, by the_ holy _spirit of_the_mouth G‹H‹Dauid/(Dāvid)›H›G servant of_you having_said: for_ why _reason the_pagans raged, and peoples pondered new things.
   26 Standing_before the kings of_the earth and the rulers were_gathered_together with themselves against the master, and against the chosen_one/messiah of_him.
   27 For both Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx and G‹Pontios›G Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx were_gathered_together in truth in this city with the_pagans and peoples of_Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx against the holy servant of_you G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, whom you_anointed, 28 to_do as_much_as the hand of_you, and the counsel of_you predetermined to_become.
   29 And the things now, master, look_upon on the threats of_them, and give to_the slaves of_you, all to_be_speaking the of_you word with boldness, 30 in that the hand to_be_stretching_out to_you for healing, and signs, and wonders, to_be_becoming through the name of_the holy servant of_you, G‹H‹Yēsous.
   31 And having_been_besought of_them, the place in which they_were having_been_gathered_together was_shaken, and all were_filled the holy spirit, and they_were_speaking the word of_god with boldness.
   32 And the multitude of_the ones having_believed, was one in_heart and soul, and not_even one anything of_the things possessing to_him was_saying to_be his_own, but was all things in_common to_them.
   33 And with_ great _power, the ambassadors of_the master G‹H‹Yēsous were_giving_back , testimony, of_the resurrection, and great grace was on them all.
   34 For not_even any impoverished was among them, for as_many_as were_being owners of_properties or houses, selling them they_were_bringing the values of_the things being_sold, 35 and they_were_laying them before the feet of_the ambassadors, and it_was_being_distributed to_each, as_much_as anyone was_having need.
   36 And G‹H‹Yōsēf/(Yōşēf)›H›G the one having_been_called G‹Barnabas›G, by the ambassadors, which is being_translated: son of_exhortation, a_G‹H‹Leuitēs/(from_tribe_of_Lēvī)›H›G, a_G‹from_Kupros›G by_descent, 37 possessing by_him of_a_field, having_sold it brought the money and laid it before the feet of_the ambassadors.
  Act 5  But a_certain man by_the_name Rx-G‹Ananias›G-Rx, with G‹Sapfeirē›G the wife of_him, sold a_property 2 and embezzled from the value, the wife also having_become_aware, and having_brought a_certain portion, he_laid it before the feet of_the ambassadors.
   3 But G‹Petros›G said: Rx-G‹Ananias›G-Rx, for_ Why _reason G‹H‹Satan/(Sāţān)›H›G filled the heart of_you, for_you to_lie to_the holy spirit, and to_embezzle from the value of_the property.
   4 Not remaining unsold it_was_remaining to_you, and having_been_sold it_was_being in your authority.
   Why that you_purposed in the heart of_you this matter.
   You_lied not to_people, but to_god.
   5 And Rx-G‹Ananias›G-Rx hearing these words, having_fallen he_stopped_breathing.
   And great fear became on all the ones hearing.
   6 And having_risen_up, the younger men covered him, and having_brought_out him, they_buried him.
   7 And it_became a_period about three hours, and the wife of_him, not having_known the thing having_become, came_in.
   8 And G‹Petros›G answered to her: Tell to_me if for_so_much the property and.
   you_all_gave_back she said: Yes, for_so_much.
   9 But G‹Petros›G said to her: Why is_it that it_was_agreed_together by_you_all to_test the spirit of_the_master.
   See the feet of_the ones having_buried the husband of_you are at the door, and they_will_be_bringing_ you _out.
   10 And immediately she_fell before the feet of_him, and stopped_breathing.
   And having_come_in, the young_men found her dead, and having_brought_out her, they_buried her with the husband of_her.
   11 And great reverence became on all the assembly, and on all the ones hearing these things.
   12 And by the hands of_the ambassadors, many signs and wonders was_becoming, among the people, and all were with_one_accord in the Veranda of_G‹H‹Solomōn/(Shəlmoh)›H›G.
   13 But of_the rest no_one was_daring to_be_being_joined_together to_them, but the people was_magnifying them, 14 and more believing ones were_being_added in_the master, multitudes of_ both _men and women, 15 so_as even to_be_bringing_out the sick on the roads, and to_be_putting them on cots and pallets, in_order_that coming of_G‹Petros›G, even_if the shadow may_overshadow on_someone of_them.
   16 And the multitude was_coming_together also from_the surrounding the_cities of_G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G, bringing the_sick and being_being_tormented ones by unclean spirits, who /were_ all _being_healed.
   17 But the chief_priest and all the ones with him, being the sect of_the G‹Saddoukaios_sect›G having_risen_up, were_filled with_jealousy, 18 and they_laid_on their hands on the ambassadors, and they_put them in public jail.
   19 But an_angel of_the_master opened_up the doors of_the prison through, the_night, and having_led_ them _out said, 20 Be_going, and having_been_stood, in the temple be_speaking to_the people all the words of_ this _life.
   21 And having_heard, they_came_in by dawn into the temple, and they_were_teaching.
   And having_arrived the chief_priest and the ones with him, they_called_together the council and all the council of_the sons of_Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx, and they_sent_out to the prison for_them to_be_brought.
   22 But they having_arrived attendants, not found them in the prison, and having_returned, they_reported 23 saying, We_found the the_prison having_been_shut with all security, and the guards having_stood before the doors, but having_opened_up, we_found no_one inside.
   24 And when they_heard these words, both the officer of_the temple and the chief_priests were_thoroughly_perplexing concerning them, what this might_become.
   25 But having_arrived, someone reported to_them, See the men whom you_all_put in the prison are in the temple, having_stood and teaching the people.
   26 Then having_gone_away, the officer with the attendants was_bringing them, not with force, for they_were_fearing the people, lest they_may_be_stoned.
   27 And having_brought them, they_set them in the council.
   And the chief_priest asked them 28 saying, we_commanded to_you_all ˱By˲_a_charge not to_be_teaching in this name, and see, you_all_have_filled G‹H‹Hierousalēm with_the teaching of_you_all, and you_all_are_wishing to_bring_upon on us the blood of_ this _man.
   29 But G‹Petros›G and the ambassadors answering said: To_be_yielding it_is_fitting to_god, rather than people.
   30 The god of_the fathers of_us raised G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, whom you_all handed_over, having_hanged him on a_cross.
   31 god exalted This one originator and Rx-saviour-Rx, by_the right hand of_him, to_give repentance to_Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx and forgiveness of_sins.
   32 And we are witnesses of_ these _words, and the holy spirit, whom god gave to_the ones yielding to_him.
   33 And they having_heard were_being_cut_through, and they_were_wishing to_kill them.
   34 But a_certain G‹Farisaios_sect_member›G by_the_name G‹H‹Gamaliēl/(Gaməlī'ēl)›H›G having_risen_up in the council, a_law_teacher honored by_all the people, he_commanded them to_make the men.
   outside a_little time.
   35 And he_said to them: Men, G‹H‹ones_from_Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G, be_taking_heed to_yourselves what you_all_are_going to_be_doing with these men.
