   36 For before these days G‹Theudas›G rose_up, saying himself to_be someone, to_whom was_joined_up of_men a_number of_ about _four_hundred, who was_killed and all as_many_as were_being_persuaded by_him were_dispersed and became to nothing.
   37 After this, G‹H‹Youdas/(Yəhūdāh)›H›G the Rx-G‹Galilaios›G-Rx rose_up in the days of_the registration, and drew_away people after him, and_that one perished, and all as_many_as were_being_persuaded by_him were_scattered.
   38 And now I_am_saying the things to_you_all, withdraw from these men and allow them, because if this counsel or this work it_may_be from humans, will_be_being_torn_down, 39 but if it_is from god, you_all will_ not _be_able to_tear_down them, lest also you_all_may_be_found god-opposers.
   And they_were_persuaded by_him, 40 and having_called_to the ambassadors, having_beat they_commanded them not to_be_speaking in the name of_G‹H‹Yēsous, and they_sent_away them.
   41 Therefore they indeed were_going, rejoicing from the_presence of_the council that they_were_considered_worthy to_be_dishonored for his name.
   42 And every day in the temple and in /each/_house, they_were_ not _ceasing teaching and gospel_preaching the chosen_one/messiah, G‹H‹Yēsous.
  Act 6  And in these days multiplying the apprentices/followers, became a_grumbling of_the G‹Hellēnistēs›G against the G‹Hebraios›G, because the widows of_them were_being_overlooked in the daily service.
   2 And the twelve having_called_to the multitude of_the apprentices/followers said: It_is not pleasing us, having_left the word of_god, to_be_serving unto_tables.
   3 but brothers examine, men from of_you_all being_attested, seven full of_the_spirit and wisdom, whom we_will_be_appointing over this need.
   4 But we will_be_persevering in_prayer and service of_the word.
   5 And the statement brought_pleasure before all the multitude, and they_chose G‹Stefanos›G, a_man full of_faith and of_the_ holy _spirit, and Rx-G‹Filippos›G-Rx, and G‹Proⱪoros›G, and G‹Nikanōr›G, and G‹Timōn›G, and G‹Parmenas›G, and G‹Nikolaos›G a_ G‹from_Antioⱪeia›G _convert, 6 whom they_stood before the ambassadors, and having_prayed, they_laid_on their hands on_them.
   7 And the word of_the of_god was_growing, and the number of_the apprentices/followers in G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G was_being_multiplied exceedingly, and a_great crowd of_the priests were_submitting in_the faith.
   8 And G‹Stefanos›G full of_grace and power, was_doing wonders and great signs among the people.
   9 But some of_the of the synagogue, being_called Freedmen, and of_G‹onesfrom_Kurēnē›G, and of_G‹from_Alexandria›Gs, and of_the ones from G‹Kilikia›G, and G‹Asia›G rose_up, debating with_the G‹Stefanos›G.
   10 And they_were_were_ not _able to_resist against_the wisdom and the spirit, by_whom he_was_speaking.
   11 Then they_instigated men saying, We_have_heard him speaking slanderous words against G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G and god.
   12 And they_stirred_up the people, and the elders, and the scribes, and having_approached, they_seized him and brought him to the council, 13 and they_set false witnesses saying: this man is_ not _ceasing speaking words against this the holy place and the law, 14 for we_have_heard him saying that this G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G the G‹from_Nazaret›G will_be_tearing_down this place, and will_be_changing the customs that G‹H‹Mōsēs gave_over to_us.
   15 And having_looked_intently at him, all the ones sitting in the council saw the face of_him, as_if the_face of_an_angel.
  Act 7  And the chief_priest said: these things is_having thus.
   2 And he was_saying: Men, brothers and fathers, hear me.
   The god of_glory was_seen by_ G‹H‹Abra'am/('Avərāhām)›H›G _the father of_us, him being in G‹Mesopotamia›G before to_dwell in G‹H‹Ⱪarran/(Ḩārān)›H›G, 3 and he_said to him: come_out from the land of_you and from the relatives of_you, and come into the land whichever I_will_be_showing to_you.
   4 Then having_come_out from the_land of_G‹H‹ones_from_Ⱪaldia/(Kasəddiy)›H›G, he_dwelt in G‹H‹Ⱪarran.
   And_from_there after the time the father of_him to_die_off, he_removed him into this land, in which you_all are_ now _dwelling.
   5 And not gave to_him an_inheritance in it, nor the_tribunal of_a_foot, but he_promised to_give to_him for a_possession it, and to_the descendants of_him after him, not being to_him a_child.
   6 But god spoke thus that will_be the descendants of_him: a_sojourner in another's land, and they_will_be_enslaving it and they_will_be_mistreating it four_hundred years.
   7 But I god will_be_judging the nation for_whichever they_may_serve, said: and after these things, they_will_be_coming_out and will_be_serving unto_me in this place.
   8 And he_gave to_him the_covenant of_circumcision, and thus he_bore G‹H‹Isa'ak/(Yiʦəḩāq)›H›G, and circumcised him on_the eighth day, and G‹H‹Isa'ak bore G‹H‹Yakōb/(Ya'aqov)›H›G, and Twelve the G‹H‹Yakōb patriarchs.
   9 And the patriarchs having_been_jealous of_G‹H‹Yōsēf/(Yōşēf)›H›G, gave_back him into G‹H‹Aiguptos/(Miʦərayim)›H›G, but god was with him, 10 and he_rescued him out_of all the tribulations of_him, and gave to_him favour and wisdom before G‹H‹Faraō/(Farə'oh)›H›G, king of_G‹H‹Aiguptos, and he_appointed him leading one over G‹H‹Aiguptos, and over all the house of_him.
   11 And a_famine came on all the G‹H‹Aiguptos and Rx-G‹H‹Ⱪana'an/(Kina'an)›H›G-Rx, and great tribulation, and the fathers of_us were_ not _finding food.
   12 But G‹H‹Yakōb having_heard, being grain in G‹H‹Aiguptos, sent_away the fathers of_us first.
   13 And on the second time, G‹H‹Yōsēf was_made_known by_the brothers of_him, and the descent of_G‹H‹Yōsēf it_became manifest to_G‹H‹Faraō.
   14 And G‹H‹Yōsēf having_sent_out, summoned G‹H‹Yakōb, the father of_him, and all the relatives, in seventy five souls.
   15 And G‹H‹Yakōb came_down into G‹H‹Aiguptos, and he and the fathers of_us died, 16 and they_were_replaced to G‹H‹Suⱪem/(Shəkem)›H›G, and they_were_put in the tomb, which G‹H‹Abra'am purchased for_a_value of_silver from the sons of_G‹H‹Emmor/(Ḩamōr)›H›G in G‹H‹Suⱪem.
   17 But as the time of_the promise, which god promised to_G‹H‹Abra'am was_nearing, the people grew and was_multiplied in G‹H‹Aiguptos, 18 until of_which another king rose_up over G‹H‹Aiguptos, who had_ not _known G‹H‹Yōsēf.
   19 He, having_taken_advantage of_the race of_us, mistreated the fathers to_be_making the babies of_them abandoned, in_order that to_ not _be_being_kept_alive.
   20 In that time G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G was_born, and he_was beautiful to_god, who was_brought_up three months in the house of_the father.
   21 And, having_been_set_out of_him the daughter of_G‹H‹Faraō took_ him _away, and brought_ him _up for_herself for a_son.
   22 And G‹H‹Mōsēs was_instructed in in_all the_wisdom of_the_G‹H‹from_Aiguptos/(Miʦərayim)›H›Gs, and was powerful in the_words and the_works of_him.
   23 But when a_ forty_year _time was_being_fulfilled to_him, went_up in the heart of_him to_visit the brothers of_him, the sons of_Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx.
   24 And having_seen one being_wronged, he_retaliated and did vengeance for_the one being_distressed, having_struck the G‹H‹from_Aiguptos.
   25 And he_was_thinking the brothers to_be_understanding that god by the_hand of_him is_giving salvation to_them, but they not understood.
   26 And on_the following day, he_was_seen to_them quarrelling, and he_was_reconciling them to peace, having_said: Men, you_all_are brothers.
   for_ Why _reason are_you_all_injuring one_another.
   27 But the one injuring your neighbor pushed_ him _away having_said: who appointed you ruler and judge over us.
   28 You are_ not _wanting to_kill me, which manner you_killed the G‹H‹from_Aiguptos yesterday.
   29 And G‹H‹Mōsēs fled at this statement: and became a_sojourner in the_land of_G‹H‹Madiam/(Midəyān)›H›G, where he_bore two sons.
   30 And forty years having_been_fulfilled: an_angel was_seen to_him in the desert of_Mount G‹H‹Sina/(Şīnay)›H›G, in a_flame of_fire of_a_thorn_bush.
   31 And G‹H‹Mōsēs having_seen it, Rx-marvelled-Rx at_the vision.
   And him approaching to_observe it, there_became the_voice of_the_master: 32 I am the god of_the fathers of_you, the god of_G‹H‹Abra'am/('Avərāhām)›H›G, and of_G‹H‹Isa'ak/(Yiʦəḩāq)›H›G, and of_G‹H‹Yakōb/(Ya'aqov)›H›G.
   And G‹H‹Mōsēs having_become trembling, was_ not _daring to_observe.
   33 And the master said to_him: untie the sandal of_the feet of_you, for the place on which you_have_stood ground is holy.
   34 Having_seen, I_saw the mistreatment of_the people of_me in G‹H‹Aiguptos/(Miʦərayim)›H›G, and I_heard of_the groaning of_them, and I_came_down to_rescue them, and now come, I_may_send_ you _out to G‹H‹Aiguptos.
   35 This G‹H‹Mōsēs, whom they_disowned having_said: who you appointed ruler and judge.
   This man god has_sent_out ruler and redeemer, with the_hand of_the_angel having_been_seen by_him in the thorn_bush.
   36 This man led_ them _out, having_done wonders and signs in the G‹H‹Aiguptos, and in the_Red Sea, and in the desert, forty years.
   37 This is G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G the man having_said to_the sons of_Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx: god will_be_raising_up a_prophet to_you_all, from the brothers of_you_all, like me.
   38 This is the man having_become in the assembly in the desert, with the angel speaking to_him on Mount G‹H‹Sina, and of_the fathers of_us, who received the_ living _oracles to_give to_you_all, 39 to_whom the fathers of_us willed not to_become obedient, but they_pushed_away him and they_were_turned in the hearts of_them to G‹H‹Aiguptos, 40 having_said to_G‹H‹A'arōn/('Aharon)›H›G: make for_us gods who will_be_going_before before_us.
   For this G‹H‹Mōsēs, who led_out us from the_land of_G‹H‹Aiguptos, we_have_ not _known what became to_him.
   41 And they_made_a_calf in those days, and they_brought_up a_sacrifice to_the idol, and they_were_being_gladdened in the works of_the hands of_them.
   42 But god turned, and gave_ them _over to_be_serving unto_the army of_heaven, as it_has_been_written in scroll of_the prophets: you_all_ not _offered victims and sacrifices to_me, forty years.
   in the desert, house of_Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx.
   43 And you_all_took_up the tabernacle of_G‹H‹Moloⱪ/(Molekə)›H›G, and the star of_ G‹Ɽemfan›G _the god of_you_all, the images which you_all_made to_be_worshipping before_them.
   And I_will_be_removing you_all beyond G‹H‹Babulōn/(Bāvel?)›H›G.
   44 The tabernacle of_the testimony was with_the fathers of_us in the desert, as directed the one speaking to_G‹H‹Mōsēs, to_make it according_to the pattern that he_had_seen, 45 which also the fathers of_us they_brought_in, having_inherited with G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G in the possession of_the nations, whom god drove_out from the_face of_the fathers of_us, until the days of_G‹H‹Dauid/(Dāvid)›H›G, 46 who found favour before god, and requested to_find a_tent for_the house of_G‹H‹Yakōb/(Ya'aqov)›H›G.
   47 But G‹H‹Solomōn/(Shəlmoh)›H›G built the_house for_him.
   48 But the highest is_ not _dwelling in handmade houses, as the prophet is_saying, 49 heaven is a_throne to_me, and the the_earth is a_footstool of_the feet of_me.
   What house you_all_will_be_building for_me.
   The_master is_saying, or what place is of_the rest of_me.
   50 Not the hand of_me made all these things.
   51 Stiff-necked and uncircumcised in_hearts and the ears, you_all are_ always _opposing against_the holy spirit, as are the fathers of_you_all, you_all also.
   52 Which of_the prophets the fathers of_you_all not persecuted.
   And they_killed_off the ones having_foretold concerning the advent of_the righteous Rx-one-Rx, of_whom now you_all became betrayers and murderers.
   53 Who received the law in the_ordinance of_angels, and not kept it.
   54 And hearing these things, they_were_being_cut_through in_the hearts of_them, and they_were_grating their teeth at him.
   55 But being full of_the_ holy _spirit, having_looked_intently into heaven, he_saw the_glory of_god, and G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G having_stood by the_right hand of_god, 56 and said: See I_am_observing the heavens having_been_opened_up, and the son of_Man having_stood by the_right hand of_god.
   57 But having_cried_out with_a_ loud _voice, they_held the ears of_them, and they_rushed with_one_accord on him.
   58 And having_throw_out him out the city, they_were_stoning.
   And the witnesses put_away the robes of_them, before the feet of_a_young_man being_named G‹H‹Saulos/(Shā'ūl)›H›G.
   59 And they_were_stoning G‹Stefanos›G, ˱who˲_calling and saying: master G‹H‹Yēsous, receive the spirit of_me.
   60 And having_knelt on_his knees, he_cried_out with_a_ loud _voice: master, you_may_ not _set this sin to_them.
   And having_said this, he_was_fallen_asleep.
  Act 8  And G‹H‹Saulos was consenting to_the killing of_him.
   And a_ great _persecution became on that day, against the assembly, which was in G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G.
   And all were_dispersed throughout the regions of_Rx-G‹Youdaia›G-Rx and G‹H‹Samareia/(Shomərōn)›H›G, except the ambassadors.
   2 And devout men buried G‹Stefanos›G, and they_made great lamentation over him.
   3 But G‹H‹Saulos was_ravaging the assembly, by entering_in the houses, dragging both men and women, he_was_giving_over them to prison.
   4 The ones therefore on_one_hand having_been_dispersed, passed_through gospel_preaching the word.
   5 On_the_other_hand Rx-G‹Filippos›G-Rx having_come_down to a_city of_G‹H‹Samareia, was_proclaiming the chosen_one/messiah to_them.
   6 and the crowds /Were/_taking_heed to_the things being_spoken by Rx-G‹Filippos›G-Rx with_one_accord, in the time to_be_hearing them and to_be_seeing the signs that he_was_doing.
   7 For many of_the ones having unclean spirits, shouting with_a_ loud _voice, they_were_coming_out, and many having_been_paralyzed and lame were_healed.
   8 and great joy became in that city.
   9 And a_man certain by_the_name Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx, was_previously_starting in the city practicing_magic, and amazing the people of_G‹H‹Samareia, saying himself to_be someone great.
   10 To_whom all from small to great were_giving_heed saying: This is the power of_god, being_called great.
   11 And they_were_giving_heed to_him, because_of that to_have_amazed them with_the magic for_much time.
   12 But when they_believed in_Rx-G‹Filippos›G-Rx, gospel_preaching concerning the kingdom the of_god and the name of_G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G chosen_one, they_were_being_immersed both men and women.
   13 And Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx himself also believed, and having_been_immersed, was continuing with_Rx-G‹Filippos›G-Rx, observing both signs and great miracles becoming, he_was_Rx-marvelling-Rx.
   14 And the ambassadors in G‹H‹Hierousalēm having_heard that G‹H‹Samareia has_received the word of_god, they_sent_out G‹Petros›G and G‹Yōannēs›G to them, 15 who having_come_down, they_prayed for them, so_that they_may_receive the_ holy _spirit.
   16 For it_was not_yet having_fallen_on on no_one of_them, but they_were_ only _being having_been_immersed into the name of_the master G‹H‹Yēsous.
   17 Then they_were_laying_on their hands on them, and they_were_receiving the_ holy _spirit.
   18 And Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx having_seen that the spirit is_being_given by the laying_on of_the hands of_the ambassadors, he_offered money to_them 19 saying: Give to_also_me this authority, in_order_that on_whom I_may_lay_on my hands, he_may_be_receiving the_ holy _spirit.
   20 But G‹Petros›G said to him: The silver of_you, it_might_be to destruction with you, because you_thought to_be_acquiring the gift of_god by money.
   21 ˱There˲_is no portion nor lot to_you in this matter.
   For the heart of_you not is right before god.
   22 Therefore repent of this evil of_you, and be_besought of_the master if perhaps the intention of_the heart of_you will_be_being_forgiven to_you.
   23 For I_am_seeing you being in the_gall of_bitterness and the_bond of_unrighteousness.
   24 But Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx answering said: You_all Be_besought for me to the master, so_that nothing of_which you_all_have_spoken may_come_over on me.
   25 Therefore they indeed, having_testified and having_spoken the word of_the master, were_returning to G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G, and they_were_evangelizing many villages of_the G‹H‹Samareitēs/(Shomərōn)›H›G.
   26 But an_angel of_the_master spoke to Rx-G‹Filippos›G-Rx saying: Rise_up and be_going to the_south, to the road coming_down from G‹H‹Hierousalēm to G‹H‹Gaza/('Azzāh)›H›G, this is the_desert road.
   27 And having_risen_up, he_was_gone, and see, a_man, an_G‹H‹Aithiops/(Kūshiy)›H›G eunuch, official of_G‹Kandakē›G queen of_the_G‹H‹Aithiopss, who was over all the treasure of_her, had_come going_to_worship in G‹H‹Hierousalēm, 28 and he_was returning and sitting in the chariot of_him, and was_reading the prophet G‹H‹Ēsaias/(Yəsha'əyāh)›H›G.
   29 And the spirit said to_Rx-G‹Filippos›G-Rx: Approach and be_joined_together to_ this _chariot.
   30 And Rx-G‹Filippos›G-Rx having_run_up, heard of_him reading G‹H‹Ēsaias the prophet, and said: Then surely you_are_knowing what you_are_reading.
   31 And he said: For how I_might_be_able if not someone will_be_guiding me.
   And he_appealed to_Rx-G‹Filippos›G-Rx having_gone_up to_sit_down with him.
   32 And the passage of_scripture which he_was_reading was this: he_was_led as a_sheep to the_slaughter, and silent as a_lamb before the one having_shaved him, thus he_is_ not _opening_up the mouth of_him.
   33 In humiliation, the justice of_him was_taken_away, who will_be_describing the generation of_him.
   Because the life of_him is_being_taken_away from the earth.
   34 And the eunuch answering to_Rx-G‹Filippos›G-Rx said: I_am_beseeching of_you concerning whom the prophet is_saying this.
   Concerning himself or concerning someone other.
   35 And Rx-G‹Filippos›G-Rx having_opened_up the mouth of_him, and having_begun from this scripture, he_gospel_preached G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G to_him.
   36 And as they_were_going along the road, they_came to some water, and the eunuch is_saying: See water, what is_forbidding me to_be_immersed.
   37  38 And he_commanded the chariot to_stop, and they_ both _came_down, to the water, both Rx-G‹Filippos›G-Rx and the eunuch, and he_immersed him.
   39 But when they_went_up out_of the water, the_spirit of_the_master snatched Rx-G‹Filippos›G-Rx, and the eunuch not saw him no_longer, for he_was_going the way of_him rejoicing.
   40 But Rx-G‹Filippos›G-Rx was_found at G‹H‹Azōtos/('Ashədōd)›H›G, and passing_through he_was_gospel_preaching to_ all _the cities, until the time him to_come to G‹Kaisareia›G.
  Act 9  But G‹H‹Saulos/(Shā'ūl)›H›G, still breathing of_threat and murder toward the apprentices/followers of_the master, having_approached to_the chief_priest, 2 he_requested letters from him to the synagogues into G‹H‹Damaskos/(Dammeseq)›H›G, so_that if he_may_find any of_the way, being both men and women, having_been_bound he_may_bring them to G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G.
   3 And in the time to_be_going, it_became him to_be_nearing to_G‹H‹Damaskos, and suddenly a_light from the sky.
   flashed_around.
   him.
   4 And having_fallen on the ground, he_heard a_voice saying to_him: G‹H‹Saulos, G‹H‹Saulos, why are_you_persecuting me.
   5 And he_said: Who are_you, master.
   and_ He _said: I am G‹H‹Yēsous, whom you are_persecuting, 6 but rise_up and come_in into the city, and it_will_be_being_spoken to_you what something it_is_fitting you to_be_doing.
   7 And the men who travelling_with with_him had_stood speechless, hearing on_one_hand of_the voice, on_the_other_hand observing no_one.
   8 And G‹H‹Saulos was_raised from the ground, and the eyes of_him having_been_opened_up, he_was_seeing nothing.
   And leading_ him _by_hand, they_brought_in him to G‹H‹Damaskos.
   9 And he_was three days not seeing, and neither he_ate nor he_drank.
   10 And was a_certain apprentice/follower in G‹H‹Damaskos by_the_name Rx-G‹Ananias›G-Rx, and the master said to him in a_vision: Rx-G‹Ananias›G-Rx.
   And he said: See it_is I, master.
   11 And the master to him: Having_risen_up, be_gone in the street being_called Straight, and seek G‹H‹Saulos by_the_name G‹from_Tarsos›G in the_house of_G‹H‹Youdas/(Yəhūdāh)›H›G, for see, he_is_praying 12 and he_saw a_man in a_vision, by_the_name Rx-G‹Ananias›G-Rx, having_come_in and having_put_on his_hands on_him, so_that he_may_receive_sight.
   13 And Rx-G‹Ananias›G-Rx answered: master, I_heard from many concerning this man, as_much_as he_did evil to_the holy ones of_you, in G‹H‹Hierousalēm, 14 and here he_is_having authority from the chief_priests, to_bind all calling the name of_you.
   15 But the master said to him: Be_going, because this man is a_vessel of_choice to_me, to_bear the name of_me both before the pagans also kings, and the_sons of_Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx, 16 for I will_be_showing to_him as_much_as it_is_fitting him to_suffer for the name of_me.
   17 And Rx-G‹Ananias›G-Rx went_away and came_in into the house, and having_laid_on on him his hands he_said: G‹H‹Saulos/(Shā'ūl)›H›G, brother, the master has_sent_out me G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, the one having_been_seen by_you on the road in_which you_were_coming, so_that you_may_receive_sight and may_be_filled with_the_ holy _spirit.
   18 And immediately fell_away something of_him from the eyes like scales, and, he_received_sight, and having_risen_up he_was_immersed, 19 and having_taken food, was_strengthened.
   And he_became some days with the apprentices/followers in G‹H‹Damaskos/(Dammeseq)›H›G.
   20 And immediately in the synagogues, he_was_proclaiming G‹H‹Yēsous that this one is the son of_god.
   21 And all were_Rx-marvelling-Rx hearing, and they_were_saying: Is not this the one having_persecuted the ones calling this name in, G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G, and here for this he_had_come, in_order_that having_been_bound, he_may_bring them to the chief_priests.
   22 But G‹H‹Saulos was_being_ more _strengthened, and was_confounding G‹Youdaiōns›G dwelling in G‹H‹Damaskos, teaching that this one is the chosen_one/messiah.
   23 And when many days were_being_fulfilled, the G‹Youdaiōns›G plotted_together to_kill him, 24 but the plot of_them was_known to_G‹H‹Saulos.
   and They_were_watching_closely also the gates both day and night, so_that they_may_kill him, 25 and the apprentices/followers of_him having_taken him by_night through the wall, they_let_ him _down, having_lowered him in a_basket.
   26 And having_arrived in G‹H‹Hierousalēm, he_was_attempting to_be_being_joined_together to_the apprentices/followers.
   But all were_fearing him, not believing that he_is a_apprentice/follower.
   27 But G‹Barnabas›G having_taken_hold_of him, brought him to the ambassadors, and described to_them how he_saw the master on the road, and that he_spoke to_him, and how he_spoke_boldly in G‹H‹Damaskos in the name of_G‹H‹Yēsous.
   28 And he_was with them, entering_in and going_out into G‹H‹Hierousalēm, speaking_boldly in the name of_the master.
   29 He_was_ both _speaking and was_debating with the G‹Hellēnistēs›G, but they were_attempting to_kill him.
   30 But having_known it, the brothers brought_ him _down to G‹Kaisareia›G, and they_sent_ him _away to G‹Tarsos›G.
   31 The indeed Therefore assembly throughout all of_Rx-G‹Youdaia›G-Rx, and G‹H‹Galilaia/(Gālīl)›H›G, and G‹H‹Samareia/(Shomərōn)›H›G, was_having peace, being_built and going in_the fear of_the master, and it_was_being_multiplied in_the exhortation of_the holy spirit.
   32 And it_became G‹Petros›G passing_through through all regions, to_come_down also to the holy ones dwelling_in G‹H‹Ludda/(Lod)›H›G.
   33 And he_found there a_ certain _man by_the_name G‹Aineas›G, lying_down for eight years on a_pallet, who was having_been_paralyzed.
   34 And G‹Petros›G said to_him: G‹Aineas›G, G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G chosen_one is_healing you, rise_up, and make_the_bed for_yourself.
   And immediately he_rose_up.
   35 And all the ones dwelling_in G‹H‹Ludda and G‹H‹Assarōn/(Shārōn)›H›G, saw him, who turned_back to the master.
   36 And in G‹Yoppē›G was a_certain apprentice/follower by_the_name G‹Tabētha›G, which being_interpreted is_being_called: the_Gazelle|G‹Dorkas›G.
   She was full of_ good _works, and of_alms that she_was_doing.
   37 And it_became in those days, she having_ailed to_die_off.
   And having_washed her they_put in an_upper_room.
   38 And G‹H‹Ludda being near to_G‹Yoppē›G, the apprentices/followers having_heard that G‹Petros›G is in it, they_sent_out two men to him imploring: You_may_ not _delay to_pass_through to us.
   39 And G‹Petros›G having_risen_up, came_together with_them, who having_arrived, they_brought_up into the upper_room, and all the widows stood_by by_him, weeping and showing the_tunics and clothes, as_much_as G‹Dorkas›G was_making being with them.
   40 But G‹Petros›G having_throw_out all outside, and having_knelt his knees he_prayed, and having_turned_back to the body said: G‹Tabētha›G, rise_up.
   And she opened_up the eyes of_her, and having_seen G‹Petros›G, she_sat_up.
   41 And having_given his_hand to_her, he_raised_ her _up, and having_called the holy ones and the widows, he_presented her living.
   42 And it_became known throughout all of_G‹Yoppē›G, and many believed on the master.
   43 And it_became many days to_remain in G‹Yoppē›G, with a_certain Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx, a_tanner.
  Act 10  And a_ certain _man in G‹Kaisareia›G by_the_name G‹Kornēlios›G, a_centurion of of_the_Cohort being_called G‹from_Italia›G, 2 devout and revering god with all the household of_him, doing many alms to_the people, and beseeching of_god through everything.
   3 About the_ninth hour of_the day he_saw in a_vision clearly, as_if, an_angel of_god having_come_in to him, and having_said to_him: G‹Kornēlios›G.
   4 And he, having_looked_intently at_him and having_become frightened, said: What is_it, master.
   And he_said to_him: The prayers of_you, and the alms of_you, went_up for a_memorial before god.
   5 And now send men to G‹Yoppē›G, and send_for a_certain Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx, who is_being_called G‹Petros›G.
   6 This one is_being_lodged with a_certain Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx a_tanner, whose house is by the_sea.
   7 And when the angel speaking to_him, went_away, having_called two of_the house_servants and a_ devout _soldier of_the ones continuing with_him, 8 and having_explained all things to_them, he_sent_ them _out to G‹Yoppē›G.
   9 And on_the day of_next, those journeying and nearing to_the city, G‹Petros›G went_up on the housetop to_pray, about the_hour sixth.
   10 But he_became hungry and was_wanting to_taste, but them preparing, a_trance became on him, 11 and he_is_observing heaven having_been_opened_up, and an_ certain _object coming_down, as a_ by_four _linen_sheet, great corners being_let_down on the earth, 12 in which was_being all the quadrupeds, and reptiles of_the earth, and birds of_the sky.
   13 And a_voice became to him: Having_risen_up, G‹Petros›G, sacrifice and eat.
   14 But G‹Petros›G said: By_no_means, master, because I_ never _ate any common and unclean thing.
   15 And a_voice said again for the_second time to him: What god cleansed, you be_ not _defiling.
   16 And this became for thrice, and immediately the object was_taken_up into heaven.
   17 And while G‹Petros›G by himself was_thoroughly_perplexing, what might_be the vision that he_saw, see, the men having_been_sent_out from G‹Kornēlios›G, having_inquired for_the house of_Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx, stood_by at the gate.
   18 And having_called, they_were_inquiring if Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx, who is being_called G‹Petros›G, is_being_lodged here.
   19 And G‹Petros›G pondering about the vision, the spirit said, to_him: See three men are_seeking you.
   20 But having_risen_up, come_down and be_going with them, doubting nothing, because I have_sent_ them _out.
   21 And G‹Petros›G having_come_down, to the men said: See I am whom you_all_are_seeking, what is the cause for which you_all_are_coming.
   22 And they said: G‹Kornēlios›G a_centurion, righteous man and revering god, and being_attested by all the nation of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G, was_called by an_ holy _angel, to_send_for you to the house of_him, and to_hear words from you.
   23 Therefore having_called_ them _in.
   he_lodged.
   And on_the day of_next having_risen_up, he_came_out with them, and some of_the brothers from G‹Yoppē›G came_together with_him.
   24 And on_the day of_next, he_came_in into G‹Kaisareia›G.
   And G‹Kornēlios›G was expecting them, having_called_together the relatives of_him and close friends.
   25 And as it_became G‹Petros›G, to_come_in G‹Kornēlios›G having_met with_him , having_fallen at his feet, he_worshipped him.
   26 But G‹Petros›G raised him saying: Rise_up, I also myself am a_human.
   27 And conversing with_him, he_came_in and he_is_finding many having_come_together.
   28 And he_was_saying to them: You_all are_knowing how unlawful it_is for_a_ G‹Youdaiōns›G _man to_be_being_joined_together or to_be_approaching to_an_other_tribe.
   god to_and_ showed _me, to_be_calling not_one a_person common or unclean.
   29 Therefore also having_been_sent_for I_came unquestionably.
   Therefore I_am_inquiring for_what statement you_all_sent_for me.
   30 And G‹Kornēlios›G was_saying: From fourth day until this hour, I_was praying in the house of_me the ninth hour, and see, a_man stood before me in shining clothing, 31 and he_is_saying: G‹Kornēlios›G, the prayer of_you was_listened_to and the alms of_you were_reminded before god.
   32 Therefore send to G‹Yoppē›G and summon Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx, who is_being_called G‹Petros›G, this one is_being_lodged in the_house of_Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx, a_tanner by the_sea.
   33 Therefore I_ immediately _sent to you, and you did well therefore.
   having_arrived now we all are_being_present before god, to_hear all the things having_been_commanded to_you by the master.
   34 And G‹Petros›G having_opened_up mouth said: In truth I_am_grasping that god is not a_favourer, 35 but in every nation, the one revering him and working righteousness, is acceptable to_him.
   36 The word he_sent_out to_the sons of_Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx, gospel_preaching peace through G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G chosen_one/messiah, this one is master of_all.
   37 You_all have_known the word having_become throughout all Rx-G‹Youdaia›G-Rx, having_begun from G‹H‹Galilaia/(Gālīl)›H›G, after the immersion that G‹Yōannēs›G proclaimed, 38 G‹H‹Yēsous from G‹Nazaret›G, how god anointed him with_the_ holy _spirit and power, who passed_through doing_good and healing all the ones being_oppressed by the devil, because god was with him.
   39 And we are witnesses of_all things that he_did both in the region of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G and in in_G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G, whom also they_killed, having_hanged him on a_cross.
   40 This one god raised on_the third day, and gave him to_become manifest, 41 not to_all the people, but to_the_witnesses having_been_previously_appointed by god, to_us, who ate_with and drank_with with_him after the time him to_rise_up from the_dead.
   42 And he_commanded to_us to_proclaim to_the people, and to_testify that this one is the one having_been_designated by god, as_judge of_the_living and the_dead.
   43 To_this one all the prophets are_testifying, everyone believing in him to_receive forgiveness of_sins through the name of_him.
   44 G‹Petros›G still speaking these words, the holy spirit fell_on on all the ones hearing the word.
   45 And the believers from the_circumcision, as_many_as came_together with_G‹Petros›G Rx-marvelled-Rx, that the gift of_the holy spirit has_been_poured_out even on the pagans.
   46 For they_were_hearing of_them speaking with_tongues, and magnifying god.
   Then G‹Petros›G answered, 47 Surely_not anyone is_able to_forbid the water these to_ not _be_immersed, who received the holy spirit, as we_ also _did.
   48 and He_commanded them in the name of_G‹H‹Yēsous chosen_one to_be_immersed.
   Then they_asked him to_remain_on some days.
  Act 11  And the ambassadors and the brothers being in Rx-G‹Youdaia›G-Rx heard that the pagans also received the word of_god.
   2 and when G‹Petros›G went_up to G‹H‹Hierousalēm, the ones of the_circumcision were_doubting with him, 3 saying, that He_came_in to men, having uncircumcision, and ate_with with_them.
   4 But G‹Petros›G having_begun, was_explaining to_them consecutively, saying, 5 I was in the_city of_G‹Yoppē›G praying, and in a_trance I_saw a_vision, an_ certain _object coming_down like a_ by_its_four _linen_sheet, great corners being_let_down out_of heaven, and it_came until me, 6 on which having_looked_intently I_was_observing, and I_saw the quadrupeds of_the earth, and the wild_beasts, and the reptiles, and the birds of_the sky.
   7 And I_ also _heard from_a_voice saying to_me: G‹Petros›G having_risen_up, sacrifice and eat.
   8 But I_said By_no_means, master, because common or unclean never came_in into the mouth of_me.
   9 But the_voice answered for a_second time out_of heaven: What god cleansed, you be_ not _defiling.
   10 And this became for thrice, and all was_pulled_up again into heaven.
   11 And see, immediately three men stood_by at the house in which we_were, having_been_sent_out from G‹Kaisareia›G to me.
   12 And the spirit told to_me, to_come_together with_them, having_doubted nothing.
   And these six brothers also came with me, and we_came_in into the house of_the man.
   13 He_reported and to_us how he_saw the angel in the house of_him, having_been_stood and having_said: Send_out to G‹Yoppē›G, and send_for Rx-G‹Simōn›G-Rx, the one being_called G‹Petros›G, 14 who will_be_speaking words to you, in which you will_be_being_saved and all the household of_you.
   15 And at the time me to_begin to_be_speaking, the holy spirit fell_on on them, as also on us in the_beginning.
   16 And I_was_reminded of_the word of_the master, how he_was_saying: G‹Yōannēs›G on_one_hand immersed with_water, on_the_other_hand you_all will_be_being_immersed with the_ holy _spirit.
   17 Therefore if god gave the same gift to_them, as also to_us having_believed on the master G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G chosen_one/messiah, who was I powerful to_forbid god.
   18 And having_heard these things, they_kept_quiet and glorified god saying: Consequently god also gave repentance to life to_the pagans.
   19 The ones therefore indeed having_been_dispersed by the tribulation having_become concerning G‹Stefanos›G, passed_through to G‹Foinikē›G, and G‹Kupros›G, and G‹Antioⱪeia›G, speaking the word to_no_one except only to_G‹Youdaiōns›G.
   20 But were some of them men, G‹from_Kupros›Gs and G‹onesfrom_Kurēnē›G, who having_come into G‹Antioⱪeia›G, were_speaking also to the G‹Hellēns›G, gospel_preaching the master G‹H‹Yēsous.
   21 And the_hand of_the_master was with them, and a_great number having_believed, turned_back to the master.
   22 And the word concerning them was_heard in the ears of_the assembly being in G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G, and they_sent_away G‹Barnabas›G as_far_as G‹Antioⱪeia›G, 23 who having_arrived, and having_seen the grace of_god, was_elated and was_exhorting all to_be_remaining with_the master with_purpose of_heart, 24 because he_was a_ good _man, and full of_the_ holy _spirit and of_faith.
   And a_ large _crowd was_added to_the master.
   25 And he_came_out to G‹Tarsos›G to_seek_out G‹H‹Saulos/(Shā'ūl)›H›G, 26 and having_found him, he_brought him to G‹Antioⱪeia›G.
   And it_became to_them also to_be_gathered_together in the assembly a_ whole _year, and to_teach a_ large _crowd, and to_call first the apprentices/followers, followers_of_the_messiah.
   in.
   G‹Antioⱪeia›G.
   27 And in these days, prophets came_down from G‹H‹Hierousalēm to G‹Antioⱪeia›G.
   28 And one from them by_the_name G‹Agabos›G having_stood_up, signified by the spirit, a_ great _famine to_be_going going_to_be over all the inhabited_world, which became during G‹Klaudios›G.
   29 And as anyone of_the apprentices/followers was_prospering, each of_them designated to_send for service to_the brothers dwelling in Rx-G‹Youdaia›G-Rx, 30 which they_ also _did, having_sent_out it to the elders by the_hand of_G‹Barnabas›G and G‹H‹Saulos.
  Act 12  And concerning that time, Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx the king laid_on his_hands to_mistreat some of_the ones from the assembly.
   2 And he_killed G‹H‹Yakōbos/(Ya'aqov)›H›G, the brother of_G‹Yōannēs›G, with_a_sword.
   3 And having_seen that is pleasing it_the G‹Youdaiōns›G, he_proceeded to_ also _capture G‹Petros›G (and those_were the_days of_non-fermented bread), 4 whom also having_arrested, he_put in prison, having_given_over him to_four squads_of_four of_soldiers to_be_guarding him, wishing after the passover_feast to_bring_ him _up to_the people.
   5 therefore on_one_hand G‹Petros›G was_being_kept in the prison, on_the_other_hand prayer was earnestly becoming by the assembly to god concerning him.
   6 And when Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx was_going to_bring_ him _forth on_ that _night, G‹Petros›G was being_fallen_asleep between two soldiers, having_been_bound with_ two _chains, and guards before the door were_guarding the prison.
   7 And see, an_angel of_the_master stood_by, and a_light shined in the prison_cell.
   And having_struck the side of_G‹Petros›G, he_raised him saying: Rise_up in quickness.
   And the chains from his hands fell_from.
   of_him.
   8 And the angel said to him: Gird yourself and tie_on the sandals of_you.
   And he_did thus.
   And he_is_saying to_him: Clothe the coat of_you, and be_following after_me.
   9 And having_come_out he_was_following, and he_had_ not _known that what becoming by the angel is true, but he_was_supposing to_be_seeing a_vision.
   10 And having_passed_through the_first guard and the_second, they_came to the iron gate, leading into the city, which automatic was_opened_up to_them, and having_come_out they_went_ahead on_ one _street, and immediately the angel withdrew from him.
   11 And G‹Petros›G having_become to himself said: Now I_have_ truly _known that master sent_away the angel of_him, and rescued me out_of the_hand of_Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx and all the expectation of_the people of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G.
   12 And having_become_aware_of it, he_came to the house of_G‹H‹Maria/(Mirəyām)›H›G, the mother of_G‹Yōannēs›G, who is being_called Rx-G‹Markos›G-Rx, where many were having_been_convened_together and praying.
   13 And of_him having_knocked the door of_the gate, a_servant_girl by_the_name G‹Ɽodē›G went_ahead to_answer.
   14 And having_recognized the voice of_G‹Petros›G, from joy she_ not _opened_up the gate, but having_run_in she_reported G‹Petros›G to_have_stood before the gate.
   15 And they to her said: You_are_raving_mad.
   But she was_insisting to_be_having thus.
   And they were_saying: It_is the angel of_him.
   16 But G‹Petros›G was_continuing_on knocking, and having_opened_up it they_saw him, and they_Rx-marvelled-Rx.
   17 But having_gestured to_them with_his hand to_be_keeping_silent, he_described how the master led_ him _out from the prison.
   And he_said: Report these things to_G‹H‹Yakōbos/(Ya'aqov)›H›G and to_the brothers.
   And having_come_out, he_was_gone to another place.
   18 And having_become day, there_was no little disturbance among the soldiers, what consequently became G‹Petros›G.
   19 And Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx having_sought_after him and not having_found him, having_examined the guards, commanded them to_be_led_away to_death.
   And having_come_down from Rx-G‹Youdaia›G-Rx to G‹Kaisareia›G, he_was_staying.
   20 And he_was raging with_the_G‹H‹Turos/(Tsor)›H›G and G‹H‹Sidōn/(Tsīdōn)›H›G, and with_one_accord they_were_coming to him, and having_persuaded G‹Blastos›G, who was over the bedchamber of_the king, they_were_requesting peace, because_of that the region of_them to_be_being_nourished by the royal.
   21 And on_the_appointed day, Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx, having_dressed_in the_royal clothing, having_sat_down on the tribunal, was_publicly_addressing to them.
   22 And the public was_crying_out: The_voice of_a_god, and not of_a_human.
   23 And immediately an_angel of_the_master struck him, for that he_ not _gave the glory to_god, and having_become worm-infested, he_stopped_breathing.
   24 But the word of_the of_god was_growing and was_being_multiplied.
   25 And G‹Barnabas›G and G‹H‹Saulos/(Shā'ūl)›H›G returned to G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G, having_fulfilled the service, having_taken_along_with them G‹Yōannēs›G, having_been_called Rx-G‹Markos›G-Rx.
  Act 13  And there_were prophets and teachers in G‹Antioⱪeia›G, in the assembly being: jointly G‹Barnabas›G, and G‹H‹Sumeōn/(Shimə'ōn)›H›G who being_called G‹Niger›G, and G‹Loukios›G the G‹from_Kurēnē›G, And G‹Manaēn›G raised_with of_Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx of_the quarter_ruler, and G‹H‹Saulos.
   2 And of_them ministering to_the master and fasting, the holy spirit said: Indeed set_apart to_me G‹Barnabas›G and G‹H‹Saulos, for the work which I_have_called_ them _to.
   3 Then having_fasted, and having_prayed, and having_laid_on their hands on_them, they_sent_away them.
   4 Therefore indeed They having_been_sent_out by holy spirit, came_down to G‹Seleukeia›G, and from_there they_sailed_away to G‹Kupros›G.
   5 And having_become in G‹Salamis›G, they_were_proclaiming the word of_the of_god in the synagogues of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G.
   And they_were_ also _having G‹Yōannēs›G, an_attendant.
   6 And having_passed_through all the island until G‹Pafos›G, they_found a_man, a_certain G‹Youdaiōns›G false_prophet magician, to_whose name was G‹Bariēsous›G, 7 who was with the proconsul G‹Sergios›G G‹Paulos›G, a_ intelligent _man.
   He, having_called_to G‹Barnabas›G and G‹H‹Saulos, sought_after to_hear the word of_god.
   8 But G‹Elumas›G the magician (for thus is_being_translated the name of_him was_resisting against_them) seeking to_pervert the proconsul from the faith.
   9 But G‹H‹Saulos, the one also called G‹Paulos›G, having_been_filled with_the_ holy _spirit, having_looked_intently at him 10 said: Rx-Oh-Rx son of_the_devil full of_all deceit and all fraud, enemy of_all righteousness, not will_you_be_ceasing perverting the straight ways of_the master.
   11 And now see, the_hand of_the_master on you, and you_will_be blind, not seeing the sun until a_season.
   and immediately a_mist and darkness fell on him, and going_around he_was_seeking one_leading_by_hand.
   12 Then the proconsul having_seen what having_become, he_believed being_astonished at the teaching of_the master.
   13 And the ones around him G‹Paulos›G having_been_launched from G‹Pafos›G, came to Rx-G‹Pergē›G-Rx of_G‹Pamfulia›G.
   But G‹Yōannēs›G having_went_away from them, he_returned to G‹H‹Hierousalēm.
   14 But they, having_passed_through from Rx-G‹Pergē›G-Rx, arrived to G‹Antioⱪeia›G G‹Pisidia›G, and having_come into the synagogue on_the day of_the sabbaths, they_sat_down.
   15 And after the public_reading of_the law and of_the prophets, the synagogue_leaders sent_out to them saying: Men, brothers, if among you_all there_is any word of_exhortation toward the people, be_speaking it.
   16 And G‹Paulos›G having_stood_up, and having_gestured with_his hand said: Men, G‹H‹ones_from_Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G, and you_all revering god, hear me.
   17 The god of_the people of_this Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx chose the fathers of_us, and exalted the people in the sojourn in the_land of_G‹H‹Aiguptos/(Miʦərayim)›H›G, and with his_arm high, he_led_out them out_of it, 18 and the_time he_sustained them in the desert about, forty_year, 19 and having_taken_down seven nations in the_land of_Rx-G‹H‹Ⱪana'an/(Kina'an)›H›G-Rx, he_passed_down the land of_them, 20 about four_hundred years and fifty.
   And after these things, he_gave them judges until G‹H‹Samouēl/(Shəmū'ēl)›H›G the_prophet.
   21 And_from_there they_requested a_king, and god gave to_them G‹H‹Saulos/(Shā'ūl)›H›G, son of_Rx-G‹H‹Kis/(Qīsh)›H›G-Rx, a_man of the_tribe of_G‹H‹Beniamin/(Binəyāmīn)›H›G, for_ forty _years.
   22 And having_removed him, he_raised G‹H‹Dauid/(Dāvid)›H›G to_them for a_king, to_whom also he_spoke having_testified: I_found G‹H‹Dauid the son of_G‹H‹Yessai/(Yishay)›H›G: a_man according_to the heart of_me, who will_be_doing all the wills of_me.
   23 Of the seed of_this one god according_to promise, brought to_Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx a_Rx-saviour-Rx, G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, 24 of_G‹Yōannēs›G having_publicly_proclaimed before the_face of_the entrance of_him, a_immersion of_repentance to_all the people of_Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx.
   25 And while G‹Yōannēs›G was_fulfilling the course, he_was_saying: What you_all_are_suspecting me to_be.
   I am_ not _he, but see, he_is_coming after me, of_whom I_am not worthy to_untie the sandal of_his feet.
   26 Men, brothers, sons of_the_descent of_G‹H‹Abra'am/('Avərāhām)›H›G, and you_all among you_all revering god, to_us the word of_ this _salvation was_sent_away.
   27 For the ones dwelling in G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G and the rulers of_them, having_not_known this one and the voices of_the prophets, who being_read on every sabbath, having_judged him they_fulfilled them.
   28 And having_found not_one cause for_death, they_requested Rx-G‹Pilatos›G-Rx him to_be_killed.
   29 And when they_finished all the things having_been_written concerning him, having_taken_down him from the cross, they_put him in a_tomb.
   30 But god raised him from the_dead, 31 who was_seen for more days, to_the ones having_come_up_with him from G‹H‹Galilaia/(Gālīl)›H›G to G‹H‹Hierousalēm, who are now witnesses of_him to the people.
   32 And we are_gospel_preaching to_you_all the the promise having_become to fathers, 33 that god has_fulfilled this to_the children of_us, having_raised_up G‹H‹Yēsous, as also in the second psalm it_has_been_written: you are son of_me, today I have_bore you.
   34 And that raised_ him _up from the_dead, no_longer going to_be_returning to decay, thus he_has_said, I_will_be_giving to_you_all the devout faithful of_G‹H‹Dauid.
   35 Therefore also in another psalm he_is_saying: you will_ not _be_giving the devout Rx-one-Rx of_you to_see decay.
   36 For on_one_hand G‹H‹Dauid having_attended to_the counsel of_god to_his_own generation, was_fallen_asleep and was_added to the fathers of_him, and saw decay.
   37 On_the_other_hand which one god raised not saw decay.
   38 Therefore it_let_be known, to_you_all, men, brothers, that through this one, forgiveness of_sins is_being_proclaimed to_you_all, from all things of_which you_all_were_ not _able to_be_justified in the_law of_G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G, 39 everyone believing in this one is_being_justified.
   40 Therefore be_watching_out, lest the word having_been_said in the prophets may_come_over: 41 watch, you scoffers, and wonder and be_perishing, because I am_doing a_work in the days of_you_all, a_work which by_no_means you_all_may_ not _believe, if someone may_be_describing_in_detail it to_you_all.
   42 And of_them departing, they_were_imploring these words to_be_spoken to_them on the afterward sabbath.
   43 And having_been_released of_the synagogue, many of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G and of_the worshipping converts followed after_G‹Paulos›G and G‹Barnabas›G, who addressing to_them, were_persuading them to_be_remaining in_the grace of_god.
   44 And on_the coming sabbath, almost all the city was_gathered_together to_hear the word of_god.
   45 But the G‹Youdaiōns›G having_seen the crowds, they_were_filled with_jealousy and they_were_speaking_against against_the_ slandering _things being_spoken by G‹Paulos›G.
   46 and, G‹Paulos›G and G‹Barnabas›G Having_spoken_boldly said, it_was necessary the word of_god first to_be_spoken To_you_all.
   Since and you_all_are_pushing_ it _away, and not worthy you_all_are_judging yourselves of_eternal life, see, we_are_being_turned to the pagans.
   47 For thus the master has_commanded to_us: I_have_set you for a_light of_the_pagans, you to_be for salvation to the_last of_the earth.
   48 And hearing it the pagans, they_were_rejoicing and were_glorifying the word of_the master, and as_many_as were having_been_appointed to eternal life believed.
   49 And the word of_the master was_being_carried_through through all the region.
   50 But the G‹Youdaiōns›G incited the prominent worshipping women, and the leaders of_the city, and they_stirred_up a_persecution against G‹Paulos›G and G‹Barnabas›G, and they_throw_ them _out from the regions of_them.
   51 But they, having_shaken_off the dust of_the feet against them, came to G‹Ikonion›G.
   52 And the apprentices/followers were_being_filled with_joy and the_ holy _spirit.
  Act 14  And it_became, in G‹Ikonion›G with the same them to_come_in into the synagogue of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G, and to_speak thus so_that a_great multitude of_ both _G‹Youdaiōns›G and G‹Hellēns›G to_believe.
   2 But the G‹Youdaiōns›G having_disbelieved stirred_up and mistreated the hearts of_the pagans against the brothers.
   3 Therefore on_one_hand they_stayed much time, speaking_boldly for the master, the one testifying the word of_the grace of_him, to_giving signs and wonders to_be_becoming through the hands of_them.
   4 On_the_other_hand the multitude of_the city was_divided, and on_one_hand they were with the G‹Youdaiōns›G, on_the_other_hand they with the ambassadors.
   5 And when an_impulse both of_the pagans and G‹Youdaiōns›G with the rulers of_them became, to_mistreat and to_throw_stones at_them, 6 having_become_aware_of, they_fled_down to the cities of_G‹Lukaonia›G, G‹Lustra›G, and G‹Derbē›G, and the surrounding_region, 7 and_there they_were gospel_preaching.
   8 And a_certain man, in G‹Lustra›G powerless by_the feet, who never walked was_sitting lame from the_womb of_the_mother of_him.
   9 This man was_hearing of_G‹Paulos›G speaking, who having_looked_intently at_him and having_seen that he_is_having faith to_be_healed, 10 said with_a_loud voice: Stand_up straight on the feet of_you.
   And he_sprang_up and was_walking.
   11 And the crowds having_seen what G‹Paulos›G did, lifted_up the voice of_them In_G‹Lukaonia›Gn saying: The gods having_been_likened to_men, came_down to us.
   12 They_were_calling both G‹Barnabas›G: G‹Zeus›G, and G‹Paulos›G: G‹Hermas›G, since he was the one leading of_the matter.
   13 And the the_priest of_G‹Zeus›G, being before the city, having_brought bulls and garlands to the gates, he_was_wanting to_be_sacrificing with the crowds.
   14 But the ambassadors G‹Barnabas›G and G‹Paulos›G having_heard, having_torn the robes of_themselves, they_rushed_out into the crowd, crying_out 15 and saying: Men, why are_you_all_doing these things.
   We also are humans like_natured with_you_all, evangelizing you_all to_be_turning_back from these useless things to living god: who made the heaven, and the earth, and the sea, and all the things in them.
   16 Who in the generations having_gone_by, allowed all the nations to_be_going to_the ways of_them.
   17 And_yet left himself not without_witness, working_good from_heaven to_you_all giving rains and fruitful seasons, filling with_food and the hearts of_you_all gladness.
   18 And saying these things, with_difficulty they_restrained the crowds not to_be_sacrificing to_them.
   19 But G‹Youdaiōns›G Came_over from G‹Antioⱪeia›G and G‹Ikonion›G, and having_persuaded the crowds, and having_stoned G‹Paulos›G, they_were_dragging him outside the city, thinking him to_have_died.
   20 But of_the apprentices/followers having_surrounded him, having_stood_up he_came_in into the city.
   And on_the day of_next he_came_out with G‹Barnabas›G to G‹Derbē›G.
   21 And having_gospel_preached that city, and having_apprentice/followerd many, they_returned to G‹Lustra›G, and to G‹Ikonion›G, and to G‹Antioⱪeia›G, 22 strengthening the souls of_the apprentices/followers, exhorting them to_be_remaining_in in_the faith, and that it_is_fitting us to_come_in into the kingdom of_god through many tribulations.
   23 And having_chosen elders for_them in assembly, having_prayed with fastings, they_entrusted them to_the master on whom they_had_believed.
   24 And having_passed_through G‹Pisidia›G, they_came to G‹Pamfulia›G, 25 and having_spoken the word of_the master in Rx-G‹Pergē›G-Rx, they_came_down to Attalia, 26 and_from_there they_sailed_away to G‹Antioⱪeia›G, whence they_were having_been_given_over to_the grace of_god, for the work that they_fulfilled.
   27 And having_arrived and having_gathered_together the assembly, they_were_declaring as_much_as god did with them, and that he_opened_up a_door of_faith to_the pagans.
   28 And they_were_staying no little time with the apprentices/followers.
  Act 15  And some having_come_down from Rx-G‹Youdaia›G-Rx, were_teaching the brothers, If you_all _may_ not _be_circumcised to_the custom of_G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G, you_all_are_ not _being_able to_be_saved.
   2 And dissension and no little debate having_become by_G‹Paulos›G and G‹Barnabas›G with them, they_determined G‹Paulos›G and G‹Barnabas›G and some others from them to_be_going_up, to the ambassadors and elders in G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G about this question.
   3 therefore indeed The having_been_sent_forward by the assembly, they_were_passing_through both G‹Foinikē›G and G‹H‹Samareia/(Shomərōn)›H›G, describing_in_detail the conversion of_the pagans, and they_were_producing great joy to_all the brothers.
   4 And having_arrived in G‹H‹Hierousalēm, they_were_accepted by the assembly, and the ambassadors, and the elders, and they_declared as_much_as god did with them.
   5 But some of_the ones of the sect of_the G‹Farisaios_sect›G having_believed rose_up, saying, It_is_fitting to_be_circumcising them, and to_be_commanding them to_be_keeping the law of_G‹H‹Mōsēs.
   6 And the ambassadors and the elders were_gathered_together, to_see about this matter.
   7 And having_become much debate, G‹Petros›G having_stood_up said to them: Men, brothers, you_all are_knowing that from ancient days among you_all, god chose for_the pagans to_hear by the mouth of_me, the word of_the gospel and to_believe.
   8 And god the heart_knower testified to_them, having_given them the holy spirit as also to_us, 9 and he_distinguished nothing between both us and them, having_purified the hearts of_them by_the faith.
   10 Therefore now why are_you_all_testing god, to_put_on a_yoke on the neck of_the apprentices/followers, that neither the fathers of_us nor we were_able to_bear.
   11 But by the grace of_the the_master G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, we_are_believing to_be_saved also_those in which manner.
   12 And all the multitude kept_silent, and they_were_hearing from_G‹Barnabas›G and G‹Paulos›G, explaining as_much_as god did, signs and wonders among the pagans by them.
   13 And after them to_keep_silent, G‹H‹Yakōbos/(Ya'aqov)›H›G answered saying: Men, brothers, hear from_me.
   14 G‹H‹Sumeōn/(Shimə'ōn)›H›G explained as first god visited, to_take out_of the_pagans a_people for_the name of_him.
   15 And with_this are_agreeing_together the words of_the prophets as it_has_been_written, 16 After these things I_will_be_returning and I_will_be_rebuilding_up the tabernacle of_G‹H‹Dauid/(Dāvid)›H›G which having_fallen, and of_it having_been_overturned, I_will_be_rebuilding_up and I_will_be_restoring it, 17 so_that the remnant of_the people may_seek_out the master, also all the pagans, on whom has_been_called the name of_me on them, is_saying the_master doing these things, 18 known from eternity.
   19 Therefore I am_judging to_ not _be_troubling to_the ones from the pagans, turning_back to god, 20 but to_write to_them to_be_keeping_away from_the pollutions of_idols, and sexual_immorality, and the strangled animal, and blood.
   21 For G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G from ancient generations in_every city the ones proclaiming him, is_having being_read in the synagogues on every sabbath.
   22 Then it_supposed to_the ambassadors and the elders with all the assembly, having_chosen men from them, to_send them to G‹Antioⱪeia›G with G‹Paulos›G and G‹Barnabas›G, G‹H‹Youdas/(Yəhūdāh)›H›G being_called G‹Barsabbas›G and G‹Silas›G, leading men among the brothers, 23 having_written by the_hand of_them: the ambassadors and the elders, brothers, to_be_greeting to_the ones in G‹Antioⱪeia›G, and Rx-G‹H‹Suria/('Arām)›H›G-Rx, and G‹Kilikia›G, brothers from the_pagans.
   24 Since we_heard that some from us to_whom we_ not _instructed having_come_out, disturbed you_all by_ upsetting _words the hearts of_you_all, 25 it_supposed to_us having_become with_one_accord, having_chosen men to_send to you_all, with G‹Barnabas›G and G‹Paulos›G the beloved of_us, 26 men having_given_over the lives of_them for the name of_the master of_us, G‹H‹Yēsous chosen_one/messiah.
   27 Therefore we_have_sent_out G‹H‹Youdas and G‹Silas›G, and them reporting the same things by word.
   28 For it_supposed to_the holy spirit and to_us, nothing more burden to_be_being_laid_on on_you_all, except necessarily these things: 29 to_be_keeping_away from_idol_sacrificed things, and from_blood, and from_strangled animals, and from_sexual_immorality, from which keeping yourselves, you_all_will_be_doing well.
   Farewell.
   30 Therefore indeed they having_been_sent_away, came_down to G‹Antioⱪeia›G, and having_gathered_together the multitude, they_handed_out the letter.
   31 And having_read it, they_were_elated at the exhortation.
   32 Both G‹H‹Youdas and G‹Silas›G, also themselves being prophets, by much speech, exhorted the brothers and they_strengthened them.
   33 And having_made some time there, they_were_sent_away with peace from the brothers, to the ones having_sent_ them _out.
   34  35 But G‹Paulos›G and G‹Barnabas›G were_staying in G‹Antioⱪeia›G, teaching and gospel_preaching the word of_the master with many others also.
   36 And after some days, G‹Paulos›G said to G‹Barnabas›G, indeed having_turned_back we_may_visit the brothers in every city, in which we_proclaimed the word of_the master, how they_are_having.
   37 And G‹Barnabas›G was_wishing to_take_along_with them also G‹Yōannēs›G, being_called Rx-G‹Markos›G-Rx.
   38 But G‹Paulos›G was_considering_worthy it the one having_withdrawn from them from G‹Pamfulia›G and not having_come_together with_them to the work, not to_be_taking_along_with him this one.
   39 And a_provocation became, so_as them to_be_separated from one_another, and G‹Barnabas›G having_taken Rx-G‹Markos›G-Rx, to_sail_away to G‹Kupros›G.
   40 But G‹Paulos›G having_chosen G‹Silas›G, came_out having_been_given_over to_the grace of_the master by the brothers.
   41 And he_was_passing_through Rx-G‹H‹Suria/('Arām)›H›G-Rx and G‹Kilikia›G, strengthening the assemblies.
  Act 16  And he_arrived also to G‹Derbē›G and to G‹Lustra›G.
   And see, a_ certain _apprentice/follower was there by_the_name G‹Timotheos›G, the_son of_a_ believing _woman G‹Youdaiōns›G, but his_father was of_a_Rx-G‹Hellēn›G-Rx, 2 who was_being_attested by the brothers in G‹Lustra›G and G‹Ikonion›G.
   3 G‹Paulos›G wanted this one to_come_out with him, and having_taken he_circumcised him, because_of the G‹Youdaiōns›G being in those places, for all had_known that the father of_him he_was_being a_Rx-G‹Hellēn›G-Rx.
   4 And while they_were_passing_through the cities, they_were_giving_over to_them the decrees to_be_keeping having_been_judged by of_the ambassadors and elders in G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G.
   5 Therefore indeed the assemblies were_being_strengthened in_the faith, and they_were_abounding in_number in_every day.
   6 And they_passed_through G‹Frugia›G and the_G‹Galatikos›G region, having_been_forbidden by the holy spirit to_speak the word in G‹Asia›G, 7 and having_come down to_G‹Musia›G, they_were_attempting to_be_gone into G‹Bithunia›G, and the spirit of_G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G not allowed them, 8 and having_passed_by G‹Musia›G, they_came_down to Rx-G‹Trōias›G-Rx.
   9 And through the_night a_vision was_seen to_G‹Paulos›G, a_ Certain G‹from_Makedonia›G _man was having_stood and imploring him and saying: Having_passed_through into G‹Makedonia›G, give_help to_us.
   10 And when he_saw the vision, immediately we_sought to_come_out to G‹Makedonia›G, concluding that god has_called_to us to_evangelize them.
   11 therefore having_been_launched from Rx-G‹Trōias›G-Rx, we_ran_straight to G‹Samothrakē›G, and on_the_ following _day to New City, 12 and_from_there to Rx-G‹Filippou›G-Rx, which is the_leading city of_the district of_G‹Makedonia›G, a_colony.
   And we_were staying in this city some days.
   13 And on_the day of_the sabbaths, we_came_out outside the gate by a_river, where we_were_thinking prayer to_be, and having_sat_down we_were_speaking to_the women having_come_together.
   14 And a_certain woman by_the_name G‹Ludia›G, a_seller_of_purple of_the_city of_G‹Thuateira›G, worshipping god was_hearing, of_whom the master opened_up her heart, to_be_taking_heed to_the things being_spoken by G‹Paulos›G.
   15 And when she_was_immersed and the house of_her, she_implored saying: If you_all_have_judged me to_be faithful to_the master, having_come_in into the house of_me, be_remaining.
   And she_urged us.
   16 And it_became, of_us going to the prayer place, a_ certain _servant_girl having a_ python _spirit, to_meet with_us, who fortune-telling was_bringing_about much business for_the masters of_her.
   17 This woman following after_G‹Paulos›G and was_crying_out to_us saying: These men are slaves of_ The highest _god, who are_proclaiming to_you_all the_way of_salvation.
   18 And she_was_doing this for many days.
   But G‹Paulos›G having_been_thoroughly_disturbed, and having_turned_back by_the spirit said: I_am_commanding to_you in the_name of_G‹H‹Yēsous chosen_one/messiah to_come_out from her.
   And it_came_out to_ the _same hour.
   19 But the masters of_her having_seen that the hope of_the business of_them, going_out, having_taken_hold_of G‹Paulos›G and G‹Silas›G, they_dragged them into the marketplace before the rulers, 20 and having_brought_ them _forward to_the officers, they_said: These men being G‹Youdaiōns›G are_disturbing the city of_us, 21 and they_are_proclaiming customs that it_is_ not _permitting for_us to_be_accepting nor to_be_practicing, being G‹Ɽōmaios›G.
   22 And the a_crowd rose_up_together against them, and the officers having_torn_off of_them the robes, were_commanding to_be_beating_with_rods them.
   23 And having_inflicted many blows on_them, they_throw them into prison, having_commanded to_the prison_guard to_be_keeping them securely, 24 who having_received such charge, throw them into the inner prison, and secured their feet of_them in the stocks.
   25 But to midnight, G‹Paulos›G and G‹Silas›G praying, were_singing_hymns to_god, and the prisoners were_listening to_them.
   26 And suddenly an_ great _earthquake became, so_that the foundations of_the prison to_be_shaken, and immediately all the doors were_opened_up, and the bonds of_all was_unfastened.
   27 And the prison_guard having_become awoken, and having_seen the doors of_the prison having_been_opened_up, having_drawn his sword he_was_going to_be_killing himself, thinking the prisoners to_have_escaped.
   28 But G‹Paulos›G called with_a_ loud _voice saying: You_may_do nothing harm to_yourself, for we_are all here.
   29 And having_requested lights, he_rushed_in, and having_become trembling, he_fell_before to_G‹Paulos›G and G‹Silas›G.
   30 And having_brought_ them _forth out was_saying: Sirs, what is_fitting me to_be_doing, in_order_that I_may_be_saved.
   31 And they said: Believe in the master G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G and you_will_be_being_saved, you and the household of_you.
   32 And they_spoke the word of_the master to_him, with all the ones in the house of_him.
   33 And having_taken them in that hour of_the night, he_washed them from their wounds, and he_was_immersed, he and the ones of_him all immediately.
   34 And having_brought_ them _up into the house, he_set_before a_table for_them and exulted with_all_the_household, having_believed in_god.
   35 And having_become day, the officers sent_out the policemen saying: Send_away those men.
   36 And the prison_guard reported the words to G‹Paulos›G: The officers /Have/_sent_out, in_order_that you_all_may_be_sent_away.
   Therefore now having_come_out, be_going in peace.
   37 But G‹Paulos›G was_saying to them: Having_beat us with_publicly, uncondemned men being G‹Ɽōmaios›G, they_throw us into prison and now secretly they_are_throwing_ us _out.
   For no, but having_come themselves, them_let_lead_ us _out.
   38 And the policemen reported these words to_the officers.
   And they_were_afraid having_heard that they_are G‹Ɽōmaios›G.
   39 And having_come, they_appealed to_them, and having_led_out them, they_were_asking them to_go_away From the city.
   40 And having_come_out from the prison, they_came_in to G‹Ludia›G, and having_seen them, they_exhorted the brothers and they_came_out.
  Act 17  And having_traveled_through the G‹Amfipolis›G and G‹Apollōnia›G, they_came to G‹Thessalonikē›G, where was a_synagogue of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G.
   2 And according_to the way having_been_accustomed with_G‹Paulos›G, he_came_in to them, and for Three sabbaths, he_discussed with_them from the scriptures, 3 opening_up and setting_before that it_was_fitting the chosen_one/messiah to_suffer, and to_rise_up from the_dead, and saying This G‹H‹Yēsous, whom I am_proclaiming to_you_all is.
   chosen_one.
   4 And some of them were_persuaded and they_were_joined with_G‹Paulos›G and G‹Silas›G, both a_ great _multitude of_the ones G‹Hellēns›G worshipping, and leading a_few women the not.
   5 But the G‹Youdaiōns›G, having_been_jealous and having_taken_aside some evil men of_the marketplaces, and having_formed_a_mob, they_were_distressing the city, and having_approached to_the house of_G‹Yasōn›G, they_were_seeking them to_bring_forth to the public.
   6 And not having_found them, they_were_dragging G‹Yasōn›G and some brothers before the city_council shouting, The ones having_upset the inhabited_world, these are_coming here also, 7 whom G‹Yasōn›G has_welcomed, and these all are_doing in_front_of the decrees of_Rx-G‹Kaisar›G-Rx, saying G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G another king to_be.
   8 And they_disturbed the crowd and the city_council hearing these things.
   9 And having_taken much from G‹Yasōn›G and the rest, they_sent_ them _away.
   10 And the brothers immediately sent_out both G‹Paulos›G and G‹Silas›G by night to G‹Beroia›G, who having_arrived, were_going into the synagogue of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G.
   11 And these were more_noble than the ones in G‹Thessalonikē›G, who received the word with all readiness, in_every day examining the scriptures, if these things might_be_having thus.
   12 therefore indeed Many from them believed, and not a_few of_the prominent Rx-G‹Hellēn›G-Rx women, and men.
   13 But when the G‹Youdaiōns›G from G‹Thessalonikē›G knew that also the word of_god was_proclaimed by G‹Paulos›G in, G‹Beroia›G, they_came also_there, agitating and disturbing the crowds.
   14 And then the brothers immediately G‹Paulos›G sent_away, to_be_going as_far_as to the sea, and both G‹Silas›G and G‹Timotheos›G remained there.
   15 And the ones appointing G‹Paulos›G, brought him to G‹Athēnai›G, and having_received a_commandment for G‹Silas›G and G‹Timotheos›G, that as they_may_come most_quickly to him, they_were_departing.
   16 And G‹Paulos›G in G‹Athēnai›G, of_awaiting them, the spirit of_him was_being_provoked in him, of_observing the city being idolatrous.
   17 Therefore he_was_discussing on_one_hand in the synagogue with_the G‹Youdaiōns›G, and the ones worshipping, and in the marketplace on every day with the ones happening_to_be.
   18 On_the_other_hand some also of_the G‹Epikoureios›G and G‹Stōikos›G philosophers were_conferring with_him, and some were_saying: What might_ this _be_wanting babbler to_be_saying.
   But the others: He_is_supposing to_be a_proclaimer of_strange demons, because he_was_gospel_preaching G‹H‹Yēsous and the resurrection.
   19 and having_taken_hold of_him, they_brought him to the G‹Areios›G Hill saying: Are_we_being_able to_know what is this new, teaching is being_spoken by you.
   20 For you_are_carrying_in some_ surprising _words to the ears of_us.
   Therefore we_are_wishing to_know what_all is_wanting these things to_be.
   21 (And all the_G‹ones_from_Athēnai›G and the visiting strangers were_having_opportunity in not_one other thing, than to_be_telling something or to_be_hearing some newer thing.
  ) 22 And G‹Paulos›G having_been_stood in the_midst of_the G‹Areios›G Hill was_saying: Men, G‹ones_from_Athēnai›G, I_am_perceiving in all things how more_superstitious you_all.
   23 For passing_through and observing the objects_of_worship of_you_all, I_ even _found an_altar on which had_been_inscribed: to_an_unknown god.
   Therefore you_all_are_being_devout not_knowing which, this thing I am_proclaiming to_you_all.
   24 The god having_made the earth and all the things in it, this one being master of_heaven and earth, is_dwelling neither in handmade temples, 25 nor is_being_healed by human hands, additionally_needing of_anything, he giving life, and breath, and the_ all _things to_all, 26 and he_made of one, every nation of_mankind to_be_dwelling on all the_face of_the earth, having_designated the having_been_commanded times and the boundaries of_the dwelling_place of_them, 27 to_be_seeking god, if perhaps surely they_might_grope for_him and might_find him, also surely being not far from one each of_us.
   28 For we_are_living in him and are_being_moved and are, as also some of_the among you_all of_the_poets have_said: for we_are also of_the one descent.
   29 Therefore being descent of_god, we_ought not to_be_thinking about_gold or silver or a_stone mark of_the_craft and thoughts of_human_origin, to_be similar the divine.
   30 Therefore indeed god the times of_ignorance having_overlooked, now he_is_reporting the things to_ all _the people everywhere to_be_repenting, 31 as_much_as he_set a_day in which he_is_going to_be_judging the inhabited_world in righteousness, by a_man to_whom he_designated, having_brought_about faith to_all, having_raised_ him _up from the_dead.
   32 And having_heard about a_resurrection of_the_dead, on_one_hand they were_mocking, on_the_other_hand they said: We_will_be_hearing from_you concerning this also again.
   33 Thus G‹Paulos›G came_out from the_midst of_them.
   34 But some men having_been_joined_together to_him, believed among whom both G‹Dionusios›G the G‹Areopagitēs›G, and a_woman by_the_name G‹Damaris›G, and others with them.
  Act 18  After these things, having_been_departed from G‹Athēnai›G, he_came to Rx-G‹Korinthos›G-Rx.
   2 And having_found a_certain Rx-G‹Youdaios›G-Rx by_the_name G‹Akulas›G, of_Rx-G‹Pontos›G-Rx by_descent, recently having_come from G‹Italia›G, and G‹Priskilla›G wife of_him, because_of the thing G‹Klaudios›G to_have_directed all the G‹Youdaiōns›G to_be_being_departed from Rx-G‹Ɽōmē›G-Rx, he_approached to_them, 3 and because_of to_be the same_trade, he_was_remaining with them and they_were_working, for they_were tent_makers by_craft.
   4 And he_was_discussing in the synagogue on every sabbath, he_was_persuading both G‹Youdaiōns›G and G‹Hellēns›G.
   5 But when both G‹Silas›G and G‹Timotheos›G, came_down from G‹Makedonia›G, G‹Paulos›G was_being_occupied with_the word, testifying to_the G‹Youdaiōns›G, G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G to_be the chosen_one/messiah.
   6 And opposing, them and slandering, having_shaken_off his clothes, he_said to them: The blood of_you_all be on the head of_you_all, I am clean.
   From the time now, I_will_be_going to the pagans.
   7 And having_departed from_there, he_came_in to the_house of_someone by_the_name of_G‹Titos›G G‹Youstos›G, worshipping god, of_whom the house was being_next to_the synagogue.
   8 And G‹Krispos›G the synagogue_leader, believed in_the master with all the household of_him, and many of_the G‹Korinthios›G hearing, were_believing and were_being_immersed.
   9 And the master said in the_night by a_vision to_G‹Paulos›G: Be_ not _fearing, but be_speaking and not you_may_keep_silent, 10 because I am with you, and no_one will_be_inflicting on_you to_mistreat you, because there_is many people to_me in this city.
   11 and he_sat_down a_year and six months, teaching the word of_god among them.
   12 But G‹Galliōn›G being proconsul of_G‹Aⱪaia›G, the G‹Youdaiōns›G stood_against with_one_accord against_G‹Paulos›G, and they_led him to the tribunal 13 saying, Contrary_to the law, this man is_persuading, people to_be_worshipping god.
   14 But G‹Paulos›G going to_be_opening_up his mouth, G‹Galliōn›G said to the G‹Youdaiōns›G: If on_one_hand it_was a_certain wrong or evil crime, Rx-Oh-Rx G‹Youdaiōns›G, according_to the_matter I_had_tolerated of_you_all, 15 on_the_other_hand if it_is questions about a_word, and names, and law, which is among you_all, you_all_will_be_seeing to_it yourselves, I am_ not _wishing to_be a_judge of_these things.
   16 And he_drove_ them _away from the tribunal.
   17 And all having_taken_hold_of G‹Sōsthenēs›G the synagogue_leader, they_were_striking him before the tribunal.
   But nothing of_these things was_caring to_G‹Galliōn›G.
   18 And G‹Paulos›G having_remained many days still, having_bid_goodbye to_the brothers, was_sailing_away to Rx-G‹H‹Suria/('Arām)›H›G-Rx, and with him G‹Priskilla›G and G‹Akulas›G, having_shaved his head in G‹Kegⱪreai›G, for he_was_having a_vow.
   19 And they_arrived to G‹Efesos›G, and_ he_left _those there, and himself having_come_in into the synagogue, he_discussed with_the G‹Youdaiōns›G.
   20 And them asking him for more time to_remain, he_ not _consented, 21 but having_bid_goodbye and having_said, I_will_be_returning to you_all Again, god willing, he_was_launched from G‹Efesos›G.
   22 And having_come_down to G‹Kaisareia›G, having_gone_up and having_greeted the assembly, he_came_down to G‹Antioⱪeia›G.
   23 And having_worked a_certain time, he_came_out passing_through consecutively the G‹Galatikos›G region and G‹Frugia›G, strengthening all the apprentices/followers.
   24 And a_ certain _Rx-G‹Youdaios›G-Rx by_the_name G‹Apollōs›G G‹from_Alexandria›G by_descent, a_scholarly man, arrived to G‹Efesos›G, being powerful in the scriptures.
   25 This one was having_been_instructed the way of_the master, and being_zealous in_spirit, he_was_speaking and was_teaching exactly the things concerning G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, knowing only the immersion of_G‹Yōannēs›G.
   26 And this one began to_be_speaking_boldly in the synagogue.
   But having_heard from_him, G‹Priskilla›G and G‹Akulas›G took_ him _aside, and they_explained the way of_god more_exactly to_him.
   27 And about_him wishing to_pass_through into G‹Aⱪaia›G, the brothers having_encouraged him, wrote to_the apprentices/followers to_welcome him, who having_arrived, contributed much to_the ones having_believed through grace.
   28 For vigorously he_was_thoroughly_refuting publicly against_the G‹Youdaiōns›G, showing G‹H‹Yēsous to_be the chosen_one/messiah by the scriptures.
  Act 19  And it_became at the time, G‹Apollōs›G to_be in Rx-G‹Korinthos›G-Rx, G‹Paulos›G having_passed_through the upper parts, to_come_down to G‹Efesos›G and to_find some apprentices/followers, 2 and said to them: having_believed you_all_received the_ holy _spirit.
   And they said to him: But we_ not_even _heard whether there_is holy spirit.
   3 and, he_said: Therefore into what were_you_all_immersed.
   And they said: Into the immersion of_G‹Yōannēs›G.
   4 And G‹Paulos›G said: G‹Yōannēs›G immersed with_a_immersion of_repentance, saying to_the people that they_may_believe in the one coming after him this is in G‹H‹Yēsous.
   5 And having_heard, they_were_immersed in the name of_the master G‹H‹Yēsous.
   6 And of_G‹Paulos›G having_laying_on on_them his_hands, the holy spirit came on them, and they_were_speaking with_tongues and were_prophesying.
   7 And the all were men about twelve.
   8 And having_come_in into the synagogue, he_was_speaking_boldly for three months, discussing and persuading concerning the kingdom of_god.
   9 But when some were_being_hardened and were_disbelieving, speaking_evil of the way before the multitude, having_withdrew from them he_set_apart the apprentices/followers, in_every day discussing in the school of_G‹Turannos›G.
   10 And this became for two years, so_that all the ones dwelling_in G‹Asia›G to_hear the word of_the master, both G‹Youdaiōns›G and G‹Hellēns›G.
   11 And god was_doing not having_been_ordinary miracles, by the hands of_G‹Paulos›G, 12 so_that even to the ones ailing handkerchiefs or aprons to_be_being_carried_away from the skin of_him, and the diseases to_be_being_released from them, and the the evil spirits to_be_going_out.
   13 But some also the ones G‹Youdaiōns›G exorcists going_around attempted to_be_naming over the ones having the the evil spirits in_the name of_the master G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G saying: I_am_imploring you_all, by_G‹H‹Yēsous, whom G‹Paulos›G is_proclaiming.
   14 and seven sons of_one of_G‹Skeuas›G G‹Youdaiōns›G chief_priest Were doing this.
   15 But the evil spirit answering said to_them: G‹H‹Yēsous I_am_knowing, and G‹Paulos›G I_am_recognizing, but who_all are you_all.
   16 And the man in whom was the evil spirit having_leapt_on, on, them, having_exercised_mastership over_both, it_prevailed against against_them, so_that to_escape out_of that house naked and having_been_wounded.
   17 And this became known to_all, both to_G‹Youdaiōns›G and G‹Hellēns›G, the ones dwelling_in G‹Efesos›G, and fear fell_on on all them, and the name of_the master G‹H‹Yēsous was_being_magnified.
   18 And many of_the ones having_believed, were_coming confessing and declaring the practices of_them.
   19 And many of_the ones having_practiced the magical, having_brought_together their scrolls, they_were_burning_up them before all.
   And they_counted_up the prices of_them, and they_found five ten_thousand of_silver.
   20 Thus the word of_the master was_growing with power and was_prevailing.
   21 And when was_fulfilled these things, purposed G‹Paulos›G in the spirit, having_passed_through G‹Makedonia›G and G‹Aⱪaia›G, to_be_going to G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G having_said, After the time to_become me there, it_is_fitting me also Rx-G‹Ɽōmē›G-Rx to_see.
   22 And having_sent_out into G‹Makedonia›G, two of_the ones serving unto_him, G‹Timotheos›G and G‹Erastos›G, he held_on a_time in G‹Asia›G.
   23 And concerning that time, a_ not little _disturbance became concerning the way.
   24 For a_certain silversmith by_the_name G‹Dēmētrios›G, making temples silver of_G‹Artemas›G, was_bringing_about no little business to_the craftsmen, 25 whom having_convened_together also the workers about such things, he_said: Men, you_all_are_knowing that the prosperity to_us is from this business.
   26 And you_all_are_observing and are_hearing that not only G‹Efesos›G, but almost of_all G‹Asia›G, this G‹Paulos›G having_persuaded, redirected much crowd, saying that the ones by our_hands becoming they_are not gods.
   27 But this is_ not only _risking_danger to_us, the trade to_come into disrepute, but also the temple of_the great goddess of_G‹Artemas›G, to_be_reckoned for nothing, but of_the greatness of_her to_be_going also to_be_being_taken_down, whom all G‹Asia›G and the inhabited_world is_worshipping.
   28 And having_heard, and having_become full of_rage, they_were_crying_out saying: Great is G‹Artemas›G of_the_G‹ones_from_Efesos›G.
   29 And the city was_filled of_confusion, and they_rushed with_one_accord to the theatre, having_seized G‹ones_from_Makedonia›G G‹Gaios›G and G‹Aristarⱪos›G, travelling_companions of_G‹Paulos›G.
   30 But G‹Paulos›G wishing to_come_in to the public, the apprentices/followers were_ not _allowing him.
