   31 And some also of_the G‹Asia›Gn_rulers, being friends to_him, having_sent to him, they_were_imploring him not to_give himself into the theatre.
   32 Therefore indeed others a_certain other thing were_crying_out, for the assembly was having_been_confounded, and the more had_ not _known for_what on_account they_had_come_together.
   33 And out_of the crowd they_concluded G‹Alexandros›G, of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G having_put_ him _forward.
   And G‹Alexandros›G having_gestured his hand, was_wanting to_be_defending to_the public.
   34 But having_recognized that he_is a_Rx-G‹Youdaios›G-Rx, cry there_became one from all, over about two hours crying_out: Great G‹Artemas›G of_the_G‹ones_from_Efesos›G.
   35 And the clerk having_calmed the crowd is_saying: Men, G‹ones_from_Efesos›G, for who is of_the_people, who is_ not _knowing the city of_the_G‹ones_from_Efesos›G being temple_keeper of_the great G‹Artemas›G and of_the fallen_from_G‹Zeus›G image.
   36 Therefore these things being unquestionable, it_is fitting you_all to_be_being having_been_calmed, and to_be_doing nothing reckless.
   37 For you_all_brought these men, neither temple-robbers nor slandering the goddess of_us.
   38 If therefore on_one_hand G‹Dēmētrios›G and the craftsmen with him are_having a_matter against anyone, courts are_being_brought and there_are proconsuls, let_them_be_indicting against_one_another.
   39 On_the_other_hand if you_all_are_seeking_after anything concerning others, it_will_be_being_settled in the lawful assembly.
   40 For we_ also _are_risking_danger to_be_being_indicted of_insurrection concerning the day today, nothing being cause, concerning which we will_ not _be_able to_give_back a_account concerning this disorderly_gathering.
   And having_said these things, he_sent_away the assembly.
  Act 20  And after the time the commotion to_cease, G‹Paulos›G having_sent_for the apprentices/followers and having_greeted having_exhorted, he_came_out to_be_going to G‹Makedonia›G.
   2 And having_passed_through those districts, and having_exhorted them with_ much _speech, he_came to G‹Hellas›G.
   3 And having_worked three months, a_plot by the G‹Youdaiōns›G having_become to_him, going to_be_being_launched into Rx-G‹H‹Suria/('Arām)›H›G-Rx, he_became of_an_opinion to_be_returning through G‹Makedonia›G.
   4 And G‹Sōpatros›G of_Pyrrhus G‹from_Beroia›G, And of_the_G‹ones_from_Thessalonikē›G G‹Aristarⱪos›G and G‹Sekoundos›G, and G‹Gaios›G G‹from_Derbē›G, and G‹Timotheos›G, And the_G‹ones_from_G‹Asia›G›G G‹Tuⱪikos›G and G‹Trofimos›G was_accompanying.
   with_him.
   5 And these having_approached were_remaining with_us in Rx-G‹Trōias›G-Rx.
   6 And we sailed_away from Rx-G‹Filippou›G-Rx after the days of_non-fermented bread, and until five days came to them at Rx-G‹Trōias›G-Rx, where we_stayed seven days.
   7 And on the first day of_the week, us having_been_gathered_together to_break bread, G‹Paulos›G was_discussing with_them, going to_be_departing on_the day of_next, and was_prolonging the speech until midnight.
   8 And there_were many lamps in the upper_room, where we_were having_been_gathered_together.
   9 And a_certain young_man by_the_name G‹Eutuⱪos›G sitting by the window, being_overcome by_ deep _sleep, as_ G‹Paulos›G _discussing on more, having_been_overcome by sleep, he_fell down from the third_story, and was_taken_up dead.
   10 But having_come_down, G‹Paulos›G fell_on on_him and having_embraced him said: Be_ not _being_distressed, for the life of_him is in him.
   11 And having_gone_up, and having_broke the bread and having_tasted it, and for having_ much _conversed until daybreak, thus he_came_out.
   12 And they_brought the boy living, and were_comforted not moderately.
   13 But we, having_approached to the ship, were_launched to G‹Assos›G, from_there going to_be_taking_up G‹Paulos›G, for thus having_been_directed, he_ himself _was going to_be_going_on_foot.
   14 And when he_was_encountering with_us in G‹Assos›G, having_taken_ him _up, we_came to G‹Mitulēnē›G.
   15 And_from_there having_sailed_away, on_the_ following _day we_arrived opposite G‹Ⱪios›G, and on_the next day we_arrived in G‹Samos›G, and on_the_ following _day we_came to G‹Milētos›G.
   16 For G‹Paulos›G had_judged to_sail_past G‹Efesos›G, so_that may_ not _become to_him to_spend_time in G‹Asia›G, for he_was_hurrying if possible it_might_be to_him, the day of_pentecost to_become in G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G.
   17 And from G‹Milētos›G, having_sent to G‹Efesos›G, he_summoned the elders of_the assembly.
   18 And when they_arrived to him, he_said to_them: You_all are_knowing from the_first day from which I_set_foot_in in G‹Asia›G, how I_became with you_all the whole time, 19 serving for_the master with all humility, and tears, and trials, in the plots of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G having_happened, to_me, 20 how I_shrunk_back nothing of_the_ benefitting _things to_ not _declare to_you_all, and to_teach you_all with_publicly and in all homes, 21 testifying to_ both _G‹Youdaiōns›G and to_G‹Hellēns›G, repentance toward god and faith toward the master of_us, G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G.
   chosen_one/messiah.
   22 And now see, I having_been_bound by_the spirit, am_going to G‹H‹Hierousalēm, not having_known the things in it going_to_be_meeting with_me.
   23 except that the holy spirit in_every city is_testifying to_me, saying that bonds and tribulations are_remaining me.
   24 But of_nothing account I_am_making the life precious to_myself, so_as I_may_complete the course of_me, and the service which I_received from the master G‹H‹Yēsous, to_testify the gospel of_the grace of_god.
   25 And now see, I have_known that you_all all among whom I_passed_through proclaiming the kingdom.
   will_ no_longer _be_seeing.
   the face of_me.
   26 Therefore I_am_testifying to_you_all in the today day that I_am pure from the blood of_all, 27 for I_ not _shrunk_back to_ not _declare all the counsel of_god to_you_all.
   28 Be_taking_heed to_yourselves and to_all the flock, among which the holy spirit set you_all overseers, to_be_shepherding the assembly of_the of_god, which he_procured through his his own blood.
   29 I have_known that after the departure of_me heavy wolves will_be_coming_in among you_all, not sparing from_the flock, 30 and from of_you_all yourselves men will_be_rising_up speaking having_been_perverted things, of_the thing to_be_drawing_out apprentices/followers after themselves.
   31 Therefore be_watching, remembering that night and day for_three_year, I_ not _ceased admonishing each one with tears.
   32 And now the things I_am_entrusting you_all to_god, and to_the word of_the grace of_him, being_able to_build and to_give the an_inheritance among all the ones having_been_sanctified.
   33 I_coveted of_silver, or gold, or clothing, of_no_one.
   34 you_all_ yourselves _are_knowing that these hands attended to_the needs of_me and to_the ones being with me.
   35 all things I_showed to_you_all that thus laboring it_is_fitting to_be_taking_care of_the ones faltering, and to_be_remembering about_the words of_the master G‹H‹Yēsous that he said: it_is more blessed, to_be_giving than to_be_receiving.
   36 And having_said these things, having_knelt the knees of_him, he_prayed with them all.
   37 And much weeping became of_all, and having_embraced on the neck of_G‹Paulos›G, they_were_kissing him, 38 distressing most_of_all for the word which he_had_spoken that they_are_ no_longer _going to_be_observing the face of_him.
   And they_were_accompanying him to the ship.
  Act 21  And when it_became us to_be_launched, having_been_withdrawn from them, having_run_straight we_came to Rx-G‹Kōs›G-Rx, and on_the_ next _day to G‹Ɽodos›G, and_from_there to G‹Patara›G.
   2 And having_found a_ship crossing_over into G‹Foinikē›G, having_boarded we_were_launched.
   3 And G‹Kupros›G having_appeared, and having_left it on_the_left, we_were_sailing to Rx-G‹H‹Suria/('Arām)›H›G-Rx and we_came_down at G‹H‹Turos/(Tsor)›H›G, for there the ship was unloading the cargo.
   4 And having_sought_out the apprentices/followers, we_remained_on there seven days, who were_saying by the spirit to_G‹Paulos›G not to_be_setting_foot_in to G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G.
   5 And when it_became to_us to_finish_out the days, having_come_out we_were_journeying, wives and children accompanying with us all, as_far_as outside the city, and having_knelt the knees on the shore having_prayed, 6 we_withdrew from_one_another and we_went_up into the ship, and those returned to their own homes.
   7 And we, having_completed the voyage from G‹H‹Turos, arrived to G‹Ptolemais›G, and having_greeted the brothers, we_remained one day with them.
   8 And on_the day of_next, having_come_out we_came to G‹Kaisareia›G, and having_come_in into the house of_Rx-G‹Filippos›G-Rx, the gospel_preacher, being of the seven, we_remained with him.
   9 And with_this man were four daughters, virgins prophesying.
   10 And remaining_on more days, a_certain prophet by_the_name G‹Agabos›G came_down from Rx-G‹Youdaia›G-Rx, 11 and having_come to us, and having_taken_up the belt of_G‹Paulos›G, having_bound of_himself the feet and the hands, he_said: The holy spirit is_saying these things: The man of_whom is this belt, thus the G‹Youdaiōns›G in G‹H‹Hierousalēm will_be_binding, and they_will_be_giving_over him into the_hands of_the_pagans.
   12 And when we_heard these things, both we and the of_the_locals were_imploring, him not to_be_going_up to G‹H‹Hierousalēm.
   13 Then G‹Paulos›G answered: What are_you_all_doing, weeping and breaking the heart of_me.
   For I I_am_having ready not only to_be_bound, but also to_die_off in G‹H‹Hierousalēm, for the name of_the master G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G.
   14 And him not being_persuaded, we_kept_quiet having_said: The will of_the master let_be_becoming.
   15 And after these days, having_made_preparations, we_were_going_up to G‹H‹Hierousalēm.
   16 And also of_the apprentices/followers from G‹Kaisareia›G came_together with us, bringing us to_G‹Mnasōn›G a_certain ancient G‹from_Kupros›G apprentice/follower with whom we_may_be_lodged.
   17 And of_us having_become at G‹H‹Hierousalēm, the brothers gladly welcomed us.
   18 and on_the day following, G‹Paulos›G was_entering with us to G‹H‹Yakōbos/(Ya'aqov)›H›G, and all the elders arrived.
   19 And having_greeted them, he_was_explaining by each one, of_what god did among the pagans by the service of_him.
   20 And they having_heard were_glorifying god, and they_said to_him: You_are_observing, brother, how_many myriads are among the G‹Youdaiōns›G having_believed, and they_are_ all _being zealous for_the law.
   21 And they_were_instructed concerning you, that you_are_teaching apostasy from G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G all G‹Youdaiōns›G the ones among the pagans, saying them not to_be_circumcising their children, nor to_be_walking in_the customs.
   22 Therefore what is_it.
   Certainly they_will_be_hearing that you_have_come.
   23 Therefore do this, what we_are_saying to_you.
   Four Men are with_us, having a_vow for themselves.
   24 Having_taken these men, be_purified with them and spend for them, in_order_that they_will_be_shaving his head, and all will_be_knowing that of_which they_have_been_instructed about you nothing is, but you_are_aligning also yourself, keeping the law.
   25 But concerning the pagans having_believed, we sent_out having_judged them to_be_keeping, from_the jointly idol_sacrificed thing, and blood, and strangled animals, and sexual_immorality.
   26 Then G‹Paulos›G having_taken the men, on_the following day with them having_been_purified, was_entering into the temple, proclaiming the fulfillment of_the days of_the purification, until of_which the offering was_offered for each one of_them.
   27 And when the seven days were_going, to_be_being_completed, the G‹Youdaiōns›G from G‹Asia›G, having_seen him in the temple, were_confounding all the crowd, and they_laid_on their hands on him 28 crying_out: Men, G‹H‹ones_from_Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G, be_giving_help.
   This is the man, who teaching all everywhere against the people, and the law, and this place, and still also brought_in G‹Hellēns›G into the temple, and has_defiled this holy place.
   29 For they_were having_previously_seen G‹Trofimos›G the G‹from_Efesos›G in the city with him, whom they_were_thinking that G‹Paulos›G brought_in into the temple.
   30 And the whole city was_stirred, and a_rushing_together of_the people became, and having_taken_hold of_G‹Paulos›G, they_were_dragging him outside the temple, and immediately the doors were_shut.
   31 and seeking to_kill_ him _off, there_went_up an_allegation to_the commander of_the cohort, that all G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G is_being_confounded, 32 who immediately having_taken soldiers and centurions, ran_down on them, and having_seen the commander and the soldiers, they_ceased striking G‹Paulos›G.
   33 Then having_neared, the commander took_hold of_him, and commanded him to_be_bound with_ two _chains, and he_was_inquiring who he_might_be and what he_is having_done.
   34 But others, were_crying_out some other thing in the crowd.
   And him not of_being_able to_know the certain thing because_of the commotion, he_commanded him to_be_being_brought into the barracks.
   35 And when he_became to the stairs, it_happened him to_be_being_borne by the soldiers, because_of the force of_the crowd.
   36 For the multitude of_the people was_following crying_out: Be_Taking_ him _away.
   37 And going to_be_being_brought_in into the barracks, G‹Paulos›G is_saying to_the commander: is_it_permitting to_me to_say something to you.
   And he was_saying: You_are_knowing In_Rx-G‹Hellēn›G-Rx.
   38 Consequently are you not the G‹H‹from_Aiguptos/(Miʦərayim)›H›G, who before these days, having_upset and having_led_out the four_thousand men of_the assassins into the desert.
   39 But G‹Paulos›G said: On_one_hand I am a_G‹Youdaiōns›G a_man, G‹from_Tarsos›G, of_G‹Kilikia›G, a_citizen of_an_ not _insignificant city.
   On_the_other_hand I_am_beseeching of_you, permit to_me to_speak to the people.
   40 And of_ him _having_permitted, G‹Paulos›G having_stood on the stairs, gestured with_his hand to_the people, and great silence having_become, he_called_out in_his G‹Hebraios›G language saying,Act 22  Men, brothers, and fathers, hear to you_all now of_the_defense of_me.
   2 (And having_heard that he_was_calling_out to_them in_the G‹Hebraios›G language, they_brought_about more quietness.
  ) And he_is_saying: 3 I am a_ G‹Youdaiōns›G _man, having_been_born in G‹Tarsos›G of_G‹Kilikia›G, but having_been_brought_up in this city, before the feet of_G‹H‹Gamaliēl/(Gaməlī'ēl)›H›G, having_been_instructed according_to the_exactness of_our ancestral law, being zealous for_god, as all you_all are today, 4 who I_persecuted this way until death, binding and giving_over to prisons, both men and women, 5 as also the chief_priest was_testifying to_me and all the council_of_elders, from whom also having_received letters to the brothers, I_was_going to G‹H‹Damaskos/(Dammeseq)›H›G, going_to_ also _bring the ones being there, having_been_bound to G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G, in_order_that they_may_be_punished.
   6 But it_became to_me journeying, and nearing to_G‹H‹Damaskos about midday, suddenly much light from the sky to_flash_around around me.
   7 And I_fell to the ground, and I_heard of_a_voice saying to_me: G‹H‹Saulos/(Shā'ūl)›H›G, G‹H‹Saulos, why are_you_persecuting me.
   8 And I answered: Who are_you, master.
   And he_said to me: I am G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G the G‹from_Nazaret›G, whom you are_persecuting.
   9 And the ones being with me, on_one_hand they_saw the light, on_the_other_hand they_ not _heard the voice of_the one speaking to_me.
   10 And I_said What may_I_do, master.
   And the master said to me: Having_risen_up be_going to G‹H‹Damaskos, and_there will_be_being_spoken to_you concerning all things that has_been_determined for_you to_do.
   11 But as I_was_ not _focusing_in because_of the glory of_that light, being_led_by_hand by the ones being_with with_me, I_came to G‹H‹Damaskos.
   12 And Rx-G‹Ananias›G-Rx a_certain devout man according_to the law, being_attested by all the G‹Youdaiōns›G dwelling there, 13 having_come to me and having_stood_by, he_said to_me: G‹H‹Saulos, brother, receive_sight.
   And_I looked_up on him to_ the _same hour.
   14 And he said: The god of_the fathers of_us appointed you to_know the will of_him, and to_see the righteous Rx-one-Rx, and to_hear the_voice out_of the mouth of_him.
   15 Because you_will_be a_witness for_him to all people, of_what things you_have_seen and heard.
   16 And now why are_you_waiting.
   Having_risen_up, immerse and wash_away the sins of_you, having_appealed to_the name of_him.
   17 And it_became to_me, having_returned to G‹H‹Hierousalēm, and praying of_me in the temple, me to_become in a_trance, 18 and to_see him saying to_me: Hurry and come_out with quickness out_of G‹H‹Hierousalēm, because they will_ not _be_accepting of_you the_testimony concerning me.
   19 And_I said: master, they are_knowing that I was imprisoning and beating in the synagogues, the ones believing in you.
   20 And when the blood of_G‹Stefanos›G the witness of_you, was_being_poured_out, I_ myself _was also having_stood_by, and consenting, and keeping the clothes of_the ones killing him.
   21 And he_said to me: Be_going, because I will_be_sending_ you _away to far pagans.
   22 And they_were_hearing from_him until this word, and they_lifted_up the voice of_them saying: Be_taking_away such man from the earth, for it_was_ not _befitting him to_be_living.
   23 and them Crying_out, and throwing_down their clothes, and throwing dust into the air, 24 the commander commanded him to_be_being_brought_in into the barracks, having_said him to_be_being_interrogated by_floggings, in_order_that he_may_know for what cause they_were_crying_out thus to_him.
   25 But as they_stretched_ him _out with_the straps, G‹Paulos›G said to the centurion having_stood, is_it_permitting to_you_all to_be_flogging a_man G‹Ɽōmaios›G and uncondemned.
   26 And having_heard it the centurion, having_approached to_the commander, he_reported saying: What are_you_going to_be_doing.
   For this man is a_G‹Ɽōmaios›G.
   27 And having_approached, the commander said to_him: Be_telling to_me, are you a_G‹Ɽōmaios›G.
   And he was_saying: Yes.
   28 and the commander answered: I this acquired citizenship of_a_great sum.
   But G‹Paulos›G was_saying: But I even have_been_born free.
   29 Therefore the ones going to_be_interrogating him immediately withdrew from him, the also and was_ commander _afraid, having_learned that he_is a_G‹Ɽōmaios›G, and because he_was having_bound him.
   30 But on_the day of_next, wishing to_know for_certain, why he_is_being_accused by the G‹Youdaiōns›G, he_released him, and commanded the chief_priests and all the council, to_come_together, and having_brought_down G‹Paulos›G, he_set him among them.
  Act 23  And G‹Paulos›G having_looked_intently at_the council said: Men, brothers, I in_all conscience have_lived_as_citizen good to_god until this day.
   2 And Rx-G‹Ananias›G-Rx the chief_priest commanded to_the ones having_stood_by him, to_be_striking the mouth of_him.
   3 Then G‹Paulos›G said to him: god is_going to_be_striking you, wall having_been_whitewashed.
   And are_ you _sitting judging me according_to the law, and you_are_ violating_law _commanding me to_be_being_struck.
   4 But the ones having_stood_by said: Are_you_insulting the chief_priest of_god.
   5 And G‹Paulos›G was_saying: I_had_ not _known, brothers, that he_is a_chief_priest, for it_has_been_written, you will_ not _be_speaking wrongly a_ruler of_the people of_you.
   6 But G‹Paulos›G having_known that one part is of_G‹Saddoukaios_sect›G, but the the_other of_G‹Farisaios_sect›G, he_was_crying_out in the council: Men, brothers, I am a_G‹Farisaios_sect_member›G, the_son of_G‹Farisaios_sect›G, I am_being_judged concerning the_hope and resurrection of_the_dead.
   7 And of_him speaking this, a_dissension became ˱between˲_the G‹Farisaios_sect›G and G‹Saddoukaios_sect›G, and the multitude was_divided.
   8 For indeed the_G‹Saddoukaios_sect›G are_saying to_be no resurrection, neither an_angel, nor a_spirit, But the_G‹Farisaios_sect›G are_confessing both.
   9 And a_ great _clamor became, and some of_the scribes of_the side of_the G‹Farisaios_sect›G having_stood_up, they_were_contending saying: We_are_finding nothing evil in this man, and what if a_spirit spoke to_him, or an_angel.
   10 And becoming great, dissension, the commander having_been_afraid lest G‹Paulos›G may_be_torn_apart by them, commanded the army having_come_down, to_snatch him from midst of_them, and to_be_bringing him into the barracks.
   11 But on_the following night, the master having_approached to_him, said: Be_having_courage, for as you_testified the things about me at G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G, thus it_is_fitting you to_testify also at Rx-G‹Ɽōmē›G-Rx.
   12 And it_having_become day, the G‹Youdaiōns›G having_made a_disorderly_gathering, cursed themselves, saying neither to_eat nor to_drink, until of_which they_may_kill_off G‹Paulos›G.
   13 And were more than forty the ones in_this having_made conspiracy, 14 who having_approached to_the chief_priests and the elders said: ˱With˲_a_curse we_cursed ourselves, to_taste of_nothing until of_which we_may_kill_off G‹Paulos›G.
   15 Therefore now you_all with the council report to_the commander, so_that he_may_bring_ him _down to you_all, as going to_be_investigating more_exactly the things concerning him, and we are ready to_kill him before the time him to_near, .
   16 But the son of_the sister of_G‹Paulos›G having_heard, the ambush having_arrived, and having_come_in into the barracks, he_reported it to_G‹Paulos›G.
   17 And G‹Paulos›G having_called_to one of_the centurions, he_was_saying, be_bringing_up this young_man to the commander, for he_is_having something to_report to_him.
   18 Therefore indeed the one having_taken him, brought him to the commander, and he_is_saying: The prisoner, G‹Paulos›G, having_called_to me, asked to_lead this young_man to you, having something to_tell to_you.
   19 And the commander having_taken_hold of_the hand of_him, and having_withdrawn by himself, he_was_inquiring: What is it that you_are_having to_report to_me.
   20 And he_said, The G‹Youdaiōns›G decided to_ask you, so_that tomorrow you_may_bring_down G‹Paulos›G into the council, as going to_be_inquiring something more_exactly concerning him.
   21 Therefore you may_ not _be_persuaded by_them, for forty of them men than more are_lying_in_wait him, who cursed themselves neither to_eat nor to_drink, until of_which they_may_kill him, and now they_are ready, waiting_for the promise from you.
   22 Therefore indeed the commander sent_away the young_man having_commanded: To_tell to_no_one that you_reported these things to me.
   23 And having_called_to some two of_the centurions, he_said: Prepare two_hundred soldiers, so_that may_be_gone as_far_as G‹Kaisareia›G, and seventy horsemen, and two_hundred spearmen for the_third hour of_the night.
   24 And mounts to_present, in_order_that having_mounted G‹Paulos›G, they_may_bring_safely_through him to G‹Fēlix›G the governor, 25 having_written a_letter, having this pattern: 26 G‹Klaudios›G G‹Lusias›G, to_be_greeting to_the most_excellent governor G‹Fēlix›G.
   27 this man having_been_captured by the G‹Youdaiōns›G, and going to_be_being_killed by them, having_approached with their army, I_rescued him having_learned that he_is a_G‹Ɽōmaios›G.
   28 And wishing to_know the charge because_of which they_were_indicting against_him, I_brought_down him to the council of_them.
   29 Whom I_found being_indicted concerning questions of_the law of_them, but nothing having indictment worthy of_death or of_bonds.
   30 And having_been_divulged to_me of_a_plot going_to_be against the man, I_sent him from them to you, having_ also _commanded to_the accusers them to_be_speaking before you.
   31 Therefore indeed the soldiers according_to the thing having_been_directed to_them, having_taken_up G‹Paulos›G, brought him by night to G‹Antipatris›G.
   32 But on_the day of_ next, having_allowed the horsemen to_be_going_away with him, they_returned to the barracks, 33 who having_come_in into G‹Kaisareia›G, and having_delivered_up the letter to_the governor, they_ also _presented G‹Paulos›G to_him.
   34 And having_read it, and having_asked of what province he_is, and having_learned that he_is from G‹Kilikia›G, 35 he_was_saying I_will_be_thoroughly_hearing from_you: whenever also the accusers of_you may_arrive, having_commanded for_him to_be_being_guarded in the residence_of_the_governor of_Rx-G‹Hērōdēs›G-Rx.
  Act 24  And after five days, Rx-G‹Ananias›G-Rx the chief_priest came_down with some elders, and G‹Tertullos›G a_certain an_attorney, who reported to_the governor against G‹Paulos›G.
   2 And of_him having_been_called, G‹Tertullos›G began to_be_accusing him saying: Of_great peace obtaining through you, and of_the_reforms becoming to_ this _nation through your provision, 3 both everything and everywhere, most_excellent G‹Fēlix›G we_are_welcoming it, with all thanksgiving.
   4 But in_order_that I _may_ not _be_hindering more for you, in_your gentleness I_am_imploring you to_hear from_us briefly.
   5 For having_found this man a_pestilence, and stirring insurrections to_all the G‹Youdaiōns›G in the inhabited_world, and a_ring_leader of_the of_the G‹Nazōraios›G sect, 6 who even attempted to_profane the temple, also whom we_apprehended.
   7  8 from whom you_will_be_able yourself, having_examined him concerning all these things, to_know of_which things we are_accusing against_him.
   9 And the G‹Youdaiōns›G also piled_on, alleging these things to_be_having thus.
   10 And G‹Paulos›G answered, the governor having_nodded to_him to_be_speaking, this for many years you being judge to_nation Knowing, I_am_ cheerfully _defending the things concerning myself.
   11 Of_you being_able to_know that there_are not more to_me twelve days, from which I_went_up going_to_worship in G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G.
   12 And they_found me neither in the temple discussing with anyone or making a_opposition of_a_crowd, neither in the synagogues, nor in the city, 13 nor are_they_being_able to_stand_by to_you, concerning which now they_are_accusing against_me.
   14 But I_am_confessing this to_you that according_to the way which they_are_calling a_sect, thus I_am_serving unto_the ancestral god, believing in_all the things throughout the law and in_the things having_been_written in the prophets, 15 having a_hope in god, which also these themselves are_waiting_for, a_resurrection to_be_going going_to_be, of_the_righteous both and of_the_unrighteous.
   16 In this also I_ myself _am_exercising, a_ inoffensive _conscience to_be_having toward god and people through everything.
   17 And through more years I_arrived going_to_make alms to the nation of_me and offerings, 18 at which they_found me in the temple having_been_purified, neither with a_crowd, nor with commotion.
   19 But some G‹Youdaiōns›G from G‹Asia›G, who it_was_fitting to_be_being_present before you and to_be_accusing, if anything might_be_having against me.
   20 Or let_ these themselves _say, what they_found wrong, having_stood of_me before the council, 21 than concerning this one voice, which I_cried_out among them having_stood: I am_being_judged by you_all today concerning the_resurrection of_the_dead.
   22 But G‹Fēlix›G he_put_off them, having_known more_exactly the things concerning the way, having_said: Whenever G‹Lusias›G the commander may_come_down, I_will_be_investigating the things concerning you_all, 23 having_directed to_the centurion him to_be_being_kept, and to_be_having relaxation, and to_be_forbidding no_one of_his own people of_him to_be_attending to_him.
   24 But after some days, G‹Fēlix›G having_arrived with G‹Drousilla›G, his own wife being a_Rx-G‹Youdaios›G-Rx, he_sent_for G‹Paulos›G, and heard from_him concerning the faith in chosen_one/messiah.
   25 But him discussing concerning righteousness, and self-control, and the judgment coming, G‹Fēlix›G having_become frightened, answered: the_ Present _time being be_going, and having_taken time, I_will_be_summoning you.
   26 Together also hoping that money will_be_being_given to_him by G‹Paulos›G, therefore also more_frequently sending_for him, he_was_conversing with_him.
   27 But two_years having_been_fulfilled, G‹Fēlix›G received successor G‹Porkios›G G‹Fēstos›G, and wanting to_grant a_favour to_the G‹Youdaiōns›G, G‹Fēlix›G left G‹Paulos›G having_been_bound.
  Act 25  Therefore G‹Fēstos›G having_set_foot_in in_the province after three, days went_up to G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G from G‹Kaisareia›G.
   2 And the chief_priests and the leaders of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G reported to_him against G‹Paulos›G, and they_were_imploring him, 3 requesting a_favour against him, so_that he_may_send_for him to G‹H‹Hierousalēm (making an_ambush to_kill him on the way).
   4 Therefore indeed G‹Fēstos›G answered, G‹Paulos›G to_be_being_kept in G‹Kaisareia›G, and himself to_be_going in quickness to_be_going_out.
   5 Therefore the powerful ones among you_all: he_is_saying, having_gone_down_with, if anything perverse is in the man, them _let_be_accusing against_him.
   6 And having_stayed among them not more eight or ten days, having_come_down to G‹Kaisareia›G, on_the day of_next having_sat_down on the tribunal, he_commanded G‹Paulos›G to_be_brought.
   7 And of_him having_arrived, the G‹Youdaiōns›G having_come_down from G‹H‹Hierousalēm stood_around him, bringing_against many and heavy charges, which they_were_ not _able to_demonstrate, 8 of_G‹Paulos›G defending, I_sinned neither against the law of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G, nor against the temple, nor anything against Rx-G‹Kaisar›G-Rx.
   9 But G‹Fēstos›G wanting to_grant favour with_the G‹Youdaiōns›G, answering to_G‹Paulos›G he_said: Are_you_willing to having_gone_up G‹H‹Hierousalēm concerning these things to_be_judged there before me.
   10 But G‹Paulos›G said: Before the tribunal of_Rx-G‹Kaisar›G-Rx having_stood I_am, where it_is_fitting me to_be_being_judged.
   I_have_done_ nothing _wrong To_the_G‹Youdaiōns›G, as also you very_well are_knowing.
   11 Therefore if on_one_hand I_am_doing_wrong and I_have_done anything worthy of_death, I_am_ not _refusing to_die_off, on_the_other_hand if nothing is true of_which these are_accusing against_me, no_one is_able to_grant me to_them.
   I_am_Appealing to_Rx-G‹Kaisar›G-Rx.
   12 Then G‹Fēstos›G having_conversed_with with the counsel, answered: You_have_appealed to_Rx-G‹Kaisar›G-Rx, you_will_be_going to Rx-G‹Kaisar›G-Rx.
   13 And some days having_elapsed, G‹Agrippas›G the king and G‹Bernikē›G arrived to G‹Kaisareia›G, having_greeted G‹Fēstos›G.
   14 And as they_were_staying there more days, G‹Fēstos›G placed_before before_the king the things concerning G‹Paulos›G saying, certain a_man ˱There˲_is, a_prisoner having_been_left by G‹Fēlix›G, 15 concerning whom of_me having_become in G‹H‹Hierousalēm, the chief_priests and the elders of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G reported, requesting conviction against him, 16 to whom I_answered that it_is not the_custom with_G‹Ɽōmaios›G to_be_granting any person before the one being_accused, might_be_having to face the accusers and the_place of_defense might_take concerning the indictment.
   17 Therefore of_them having_come_together, here, having_made not_one delay, on_the_ next _day having_sat_down on the tribunal, I_commanded the man to_be_brought, 18 concerning whom the accusers having_been_stood they_were_bringing not_one charge, of_which I was_suspecting evil ones.
   19 But they_were_having against him some questions concerning their own superstition, and concerning a_certain G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G having_died, whom G‹Paulos›G was_alleging to_be_living.
   20 And I perplexing, the debate concerning these things, was_asking if might_be_wishing to_be_going to G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G, and_there to_be_being_judged concerning these things.
   21 But G‹Paulos›G having_appealed to_be_kept himself for the investigation of_the Emperor, I_commanded him to_be_being_kept, until of_which I_may_send_ him _up to Rx-G‹Kaisar›G-Rx.
   22 And G‹Agrippas›G said to G‹Fēstos›G: I_was_wishing also myself to_hear from_the man.
   Tomorrow, he_is_saying: you_will_be_hearing from_him.
   23 Therefore on_the day of_next, G‹Agrippas›G and G‹Bernikē›G having_come with great pageantry, and having_come_in into the auditorium with both commanders and men in prominence in_the city, and having_commanded G‹Fēstos›G, G‹Paulos›G was_brought.
   24 And G‹Fēstos›G is_saying: king G‹Agrippas›G, and all you_all being_present_with with_us, men, you_all_are_observing this one, concerning whom all the multitude of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G pleaded with_me, in both G‹H‹Hierousalēm and here, shouting not to_be_fitting him to_be_living no_longer.
   25 But I grasped him to_have_done nothing worthy of_death, and this one himself having_appealed to_the Emperor, I_judged to_be_sending him.
   26 Concerning whom I_am_ not _having any certain to_write to_my master.
   Therefore I_brought_ him _forth before you_all, and most_of_all before you, king G‹Agrippas›G, so_that the examination having_become, I_may_have something I_may_write.
   27 For it_is_supposing to_me illogical sending a_prisoner, not also to_signify the charges against him.
  Act 26  And G‹Agrippas›G was_saying to G‹Paulos›G: It_is_being_permitted to_you to_be_speaking concerning yourself.
   Then G‹Paulos›G having_stretched_out his hand was_defending, 2 Concerning all of_which I_am_being_indicted by the_G‹Youdaiōns›G, king G‹Agrippas›G, I_have_considered myself blessed going to_be_defending before you, today.
   3 Most_of_all you being knowledgeable_one of_all the among the_G‹Youdaiōns›G, of_ both _customs and questions, therefore I_am_beseeching you patiently to_hear from_me.
   4 Therefore indeed the livelihood of_me, from youth from the_beginning having_become among the nation of_me and in G‹H‹Hierousalēm, all G‹Youdaiōns›G have_known, 5 knowing_before me originally, if they_may_be_willing to_be_testifying that according_to the most_exact sect of_our religion, I_lived a_G‹Farisaios_sect_member›G.
   6 And now for the_hope of_the promise to the fathers of_us, having_become by god, I_have_stood being_judged, 7 to which the twelve_tribes of_us serving night and day in earnestness, is_hoping to_attain, concerning which the_hope I_am_being_indicted by the_G‹Youdaiōns›G, king.
   8 Why is_it_being_judged unbelievable by you_all, if god is_raising the_dead.
   9 Therefore indeed I supposed to_myself it_to_be_fitting to_do many contrary things to the name of_G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G of_G‹from_Nazaret›G.
   10 Which also I_did in G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G, and many both of_the holy ones I locked_up in prisons, having_received the authority from the chief_priests, and of_them being_killed, I_brought_ a_vote _against them.
   11 And in all the synagogues, often punishing them, I_was_compelling them to_be_slandering, and exceedingly raging_against against_them, I_was_persecuting them as_far_as even to the outside cities.
   12 At which journeying to G‹H‹Damaskos/(Dammeseq)›H›G, with the_authority and permission of_the chief_priests, 13 middle day on the road king I_saw, from_heaven a_light above the brightness like of_the sun having_shone_around me, and the ones journeying with me.
   14 And all of_us having_falling_down to the ground, I_heard a_voice, saying to me in_the G‹Hebraios›G language: G‹H‹Saulos/(Shā'ūl)›H›G, G‹H‹Saulos, why are_you_persecuting me.
   It_is hard for_you to_be_kicking against the_prods.
   15 And I said: Who you_are, master.
   And the master said: I am G‹H‹Yēsous, whom you are_persecuting.
   16 But rise_up, and stand on the feet of_you, for I_was_seen by_you in this, to_appoint you a_attendant and a_witness, both of_which you_saw me and of_which I_will_be_being_seen by_you, 17 rescuing you from the people and from the pagans, to whom I am_sending_ you _out, 18 to_open_up eyes of_them, for_that to_turn_back from darkness to light, and from_the power of_G‹H‹Satan/(Sāţān)›H›G to god, for_that them to_receive forgiveness of_sins and lot among the ones having_been_sanctified by_faith in me.
   19 Whence, king G‹Agrippas›G, I_became not unpersuadable to_the heavenly vision, 20 but to_the ones in G‹H‹Damaskos first and both, in_G‹H‹Hierousalēm, and all the region of_Rx-G‹Youdaia›G-Rx, and to_the pagans, I_was_reporting to_be_repenting and to_be_turning_back to god, worthy of_ works _repentance doing.
   21 On_account these things, the_G‹Youdaiōns›G having_captured me in the temple, were_attempting to_hand_over me.
   22 Therefore having_obtained of_help from god until this day, I_have_stood testifying to_small both and to_great, nothing besides saying of_what things both the prophets and G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G spoke going to_be_becoming, 23 the chosen_one/messiah if suffering, if first by resurrection from_the_dead, is_going to_be_proclaiming light both to_the_people and the pagans.
   24 And of_him defending these things, G‹Fēstos›G with_loud voice is_saying: You_are_raving_mad, G‹Paulos›G.
   The great learning is_turning you to madness.
   25 But G‹Paulos›G: Is_saying I_am_ not _raving_mad: most_excellent G‹Fēstos›G, but I_am_speaking_out words of_truth and sobriety.
   26 For the king is_understanding concerning these things, to whom I_am_ also _speaking speaking_boldly, for I_am_being_persuaded nothing to_be_escaping_notice him anything of_these things not, for this is not having_been_done in a_corner.
   27 king G‹Agrippas›G are_you_believing, in_the prophets.
   I_have_known that you_are_believing.
   28 And G‹Agrippas›G said to G‹Paulos›G: Are_you_persuading me in a_little time to_make a_follower_of_the_messiah.
   29 And G‹Paulos›G said: I_might_hope to_god, both in a_little time and in a_great time, not only you, but also all the ones hearing from_me today, to_become such what_kind also_I am, except of_ these _bonds.
   30 both the king and the governor Stood_up, both G‹Bernikē›G and the ones sitting_with with_them, 31 and having_withdrawn they_were_speaking to one_another saying, This man any not_one worthy thing of_death or of_bonds is_doing.
   32 And G‹Agrippas›G was_saying to_G‹Fēstos›G: This man was_able to_have_sent_away, except he_had_appealed Rx-G‹Kaisar›G-Rx.
  Act 27  And when it_was_judged us to_be_sailing_away to G‹Italia›G, they_were_giving_over both G‹Paulos›G and some other prisoners, to_a_centurion by_the_name G‹Youlios›G, of_the_cohort of_G‹Augustus/(Sebastos)›G.
   2 And having_boarded on_a_ G‹Adramuttēnos›G _ship, we_were_launched going to_be_sailing to the places along G‹Asia›G, of_G‹Aristarⱪos›G being with us, a_G‹from_Makedonia›G of_G‹from_Thessalonikē›G.
   3 Both on_the next day we_were_set_down at G‹H‹Sidōn/(Tsīdōn)›H›G, and G‹Youlios›G having_given_treatment with_human_kindness to_G‹Paulos›G, he_permitted him having_been_gone to his friends, to_obtain of_care.
   4 And_from_there having_been_launched, we_sailed_under G‹Kupros›G, because_of that the winds to_be contrary.
   5 And having_sailed_across the sea along G‹Kilikia›G and G‹Pamfulia›G, we_came_down to G‹Mura›G of_G‹Lukia›G.
   6 And_there the centurion having_found a_ G‹from_Alexandria›G _ship, sailing to G‹Italia›G, he_placed_in us into it.
   7 And in many days, slow_sailing and with_difficulty, having_become along G‹Knidos›G, the wind not further_permitting us, we_sailed_under G‹Krētē›G along G‹H‹Salmōn/(Saləmōn)›H›Ge.
   8 And sailing_along it with_difficulty, we_came to a_ certain _place being_called Beautiful Harbors, to_which was near the_city G‹Lasaia›G.
   9 And much time having_elapsed, and the voyage already being dangerous, because_of that even the fasting already to_have_passed_by, G‹Paulos›G was_advising them 10 saying to_them: Men, I_am_perceiving that the voyage to_be_going going_to_be with damage and much loss, not only of_the cargo and to_the ship, but also the lives of_us.
   11 But the centurion was_being_persuaded by_the captain and the ship_owner rather, than by_the things being_spoken by G‹Paulos›G.
   12 And the harbor being unsuitable to winter, the more presented a_counsel to_be_launched from_there, if somehow they_might_be_able, having_arrived at G‹Foinix›G, to_winter a_harbor of_G‹Krētē›G, looking to the_southwest and to the_northwest.
   13 And of_a_south_wind having_blown_gently, having_supposed of_the purpose to_have_taken_hold, having_taken_up they_were_sailing_along near G‹Krētē›G.
   14 But after not much time, a_ typhoon _wind, being_called the_G‹Eurokludōn›G throw down.
   from_it.
   15 And the ship having_been_seized, and not being_able to_be_facing to_the wind, having_given_up we_were_being_driven_along.
   16 And having_run_under a_certain island being_called G‹Klaudē›G, we_were_able with_difficulty to_become control of_the lifeboat, 17 which having_taken_up, they_were_resorting to_helps, undergirding the ship.
   And fearing lest they_may_run_aground into the shallows_of G‹Surtis›G, having_lowered the gear, thus they_were_being_driven_along.
   18 And of_us being_ violently _storm_tossed, on_the_ next _day they_were_making a_jettison, 19 and on_the third day, they_threw_down the tackle of_the ship their_own_hands.
   20 And neither sun nor stars appearing for more days, and no little storm laying_on us, furthermore all hope, us to_be_being_saved was_being_taken_away.
   21 And of_much abstinence being, then G‹Paulos›G having_been_stood in midst of_them said: It_was_fitting indeed, Rx-Oh-Rx men, having_yielded to_me, not to_be_being_launched from G‹Krētē›G, and to_gain this damage, and the loss.
   22 And_yet now I_am_advising you_all the things to_be_cheering_up, for not_one loss of_life will_be of you_all, except of_the ship.
   23 For an_angel of_god stood_by me this night, of_whose I_am, unto_whom also I_am_serving, 24 saying: Be_ not _fearing, G‹Paulos›G, it_is_fitting you to_stand_before before_Rx-G‹Kaisar›G-Rx, and see, god has_granted to_you all the ones sailing with you.
   25 Therefore be_cheering_up, men, for I_am_believing in_ god that thus it_will_be, according_to which manner it_has_been_spoken to_me.
   26 But it_is_fitting us to_run_aground on a_certain island.
   27 But when the_fourteenth night became, us being_carried_through in the G‹Adrias›G_Sea, to the_middle of_the night, the sailors were_suspecting a_certain to_be_coming_near to_them land.
   28 And having_taken_soundings, they_found twenty fathoms, and a_little time having_passed_by, and again having_taken_soundings, they_found fifteen fathoms.
   29 And fearing lest we_may_run_aground somewhere on rough places, having_thrown_down four anchors from the_stern, they_were_hoping for_day to_become.
   30 And the_sailors seeking to_flee out_of the ship, and having_lowered the lifeboat into the sea, on_under_pretense as going to_be_stretching_out anchors from the_bow, 31 G‹Paulos›G said to_the centurion and to_the soldiers: If these may_ not _remain in the ship, you_all are_ not _being_able to_be_saved.
   32 Then the soldiers cut_off the ropes of_the lifeboat, and they_allowed her to_run_aground.
   33 And until of_which day was_going to_be_becoming, G‹Paulos›G was_exhorting all, to_partake of_food saying: Today the_fourteenth day is, you_all_are_continuing waiting foodless, having_taken nothing.
   34 Therefore I_am_exhorting you_all to_partake of_food, for this is_being for your salvation, for a_hair from the head of_no_one of_you_all will_be_perishing.
   35 And having_said these things, and having_taken bread, he_gave_thanks to_god before all, and having_broke it, he_began to_be_eating.
   36 And all having_become cheerful, they also received of_food.
   37 And we_were all souls in the ship, two_hundred seventy six.
   38 And having_been_satiated of_food, they_were_lightening the ship, throwing_out the wheat into the sea.
   39 And when day became, they_were_ not _recognizing the land, but were_observing a_certain bay having a_shore, on which they_were_counselling, if they_might_be_able to_preserve the ship.
   40 And having_cut_away the anchors, they_were_allowing them in the sea, at_once having_unfastened the ropes of_the rudders, and having_lifted_up the foresail to_the wind blowing, they_were_keeping for the shore.
   41 But having_fallen_among into a_place two_sea, they_ran_ the ship _aground, and on_one_hand the bow having_stuck remained unshakeable, on_the_other_hand the stern was_being_destroyed by the force.
   42 And of_the soldiers, the_counsel became that they_may_kill_off the prisoners, lest anyone having_swum_away may_escape.
   43 But the centurion wishing to_bring_ G‹Paulos›G _safely_through, forbade them of_their counsel, and he_commanded the ones being_able to_be_swimming, having_thrown_off themselves first, to_be_departing on the land, 44 and the rest, on_one_hand some on planks, on_the_other_hand some on some things from the ship.
   And thus it_became, all to_be_brought_safely_through to the land.
  Act 28  And having_been_brought_safely_through, then we_learned that the island is_being_called G‹Melitē›G.
   2 And the foreigners were_bringing_about not just the having_been_ordinary human_kindness to_us, for having_lit a_fire, they_received all us, because_of the rain having_approached, and because_of the cold.
   3 But G‹Paulos›G having_gathered some multitude of_sticks, and having_laid_on them on the fire, a_viper having_come_out from the heat, clamped_down on_the hand of_him.
   4 And when the foreigners saw the wild_beast being_hanged from the hand of_him, they_were_saying to one_another: Certainly this man is a_murderer, whom having_been_brought_safely_through from the sea, justice not allowed him to_be_living.
   5 Therefore indeed he, having_shaken_off the wild_beast into the fire, suffered not_one harm.
   6 But they were_expecting him to_be_going to_be_being_swelled_up, or to_be_falling_down suddenly dead.
   But over much time, them waiting and observing nothing amiss becoming to him, having_changed_their_minds they_were_saying him to_be a_god.
   7 And in the parts about that place, was_being properties to_the leader of_the island by_the_name G‹Poplios›G, who having_accepted us hospitably lodged three days.
   8 And it_became, the father of_G‹Poplios›G to_be_lying_down being_gripped_with with_fevers and dysentery, to whom G‹Paulos›G having_come_in, and having_prayed, having_laid_on the hands on_him, he_healed him.
   9 And this having_become, also the rest in the island having sicknesses were_approaching and were_being_healed, 10 who also they_honored us with_many honors, and being_launched, they_laid_on the things for our needs.
   11 And after three months, we_were_launched in a_ship having_wintered in the island, an_G‹from_Alexandria›G with_a_figurehead to_G‹Zeus›G_twins.
   12 And having_been_set_down at G‹Surakousai›G, we_remained_on three days, 13 whence having_cut_away, we_arrived at G‹Ɽēgion›G.
   And after one day, having_come_on a_south_wind, the_second day we_came to G‹Potioloi›G, 14 where having_found the_brothers, we_were_implored by them to_remain_on seven days.
   And thus we_came to Rx-G‹Ɽōmē›G-Rx.
   15 And_from_there the brothers having_heard, the things concerning us, came to meeting with_us until G‹Appios›G Market and Three Taverns, whom G‹Paulos›G having_seen, having_giving_thanks to_god, took courage.
   16 And when we_came_in to Rx-G‹Ɽōmē›G-Rx, it_was_permitted to_G‹Paulos›G to_be_remaining by himself, with the soldier guarding him.
   17 And it_became after three days, him to_call_together the ones being leaders of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G.
   And them having_come_together, he_was_saying to them: Men brothers I, having_done nothing contrary to_the people or the ancestral customs, a_prisoner from G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G was_given_over into the hands of_the G‹Ɽōmaios›G, 18 who having_examined me, were_wishing to_send_away me, because_of that not_one cause of_death to_be_being in me.
   19 But speaking_against of_the G‹Youdaiōns›G, I_was_compelled to_appeal to_Rx-G‹Kaisar›G-Rx, not as having anything to_be_accusing against_the nation of_me.
   20 Therefore for this cause, I_begged you_all, to_see and to_address, for on_account of_the hope of_Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx, this chain I_am_being_encompassed in.
   21 And they said to him: We neither received letters concerning you from Rx-G‹Youdaia›G-Rx, nor having_arrived anyone of_the brothers reported or spoke anything evil concerning you.
   22 But we_are_considering_worthy to_hear from you what you_are_thinking, for indeed concerning this sect it_is known to_us, that it_is_being_spoken_against everywhere.
   23 And having_determined a_day for_him, more they_came to him to the lodging, to_whom he_was_explaining, testifying the kingdom of_god, and persuading them concerning G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, from both the law of_G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G, and the prophets, from in_the_morning to evening.
   24 And on_one_hand the ones were_being_persuaded by_the things being_spoken, on_the_other_hand the ones were_disbelieving.
   25 And being discordant with one_another, they_were_sending_away, G‹Paulos›G having_spoken one final word: Rightly the holy spirit spoke by G‹H‹Ēsaias/(Yəsha'əyāh)›H›G the prophet to the fathers of_you_all 26 saying: be_gone to this people, and say: ˱In˲_hearing you_all_will_be_hearing, and by_no_means you_all_may_ not _understand, and seeing you_all_will_be_seeing, and by_no_means you_all_may_ not _perceive.
   27 For the heart of_ this _people was_become_dull, and they_ hardly _heard with_their ears of_them, and they_shut the eyes of_them, lest they_may_see with_their eyes, and they_may_hear with_their ears, and they_may_understand with_their heart, and they_may_turn_back, and I_will_be_healing them.
   28 Therefore it_let_be known, to_you_all that this salvation of_god was_sent_out to_the pagans, and they will_be_hearing.
   29  30 And He_remained_in two_ whole _years in his_own rental, and was_welcoming all the ones entering_in to him, 31 proclaiming the kingdom of_god, and unhinderedly teaching the things concerning the master G‹H‹Yēsous chosen_one/messiah, with all boldness.
  

USFM file created 2022-09-24 17:36 by extractVLT v0.50

The source table used to create this file is Copyright © 2022 by https://GreekCNTR.org

USFM file edited 2022-09-24 17:40 by ScriptedBibleEditor v0.14

G‹Ɽōmaios›G

1  G‹Paulos›G, slave of_chosen_one/messiah G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, a_called ambassador, having_been_set_apart for the_gospel of_god, 2 which he_previously_promised through the prophets of_him in the_scriptures holy, 3 concerning the son of_him, having_become of seed of_G‹H‹Dauid/(Dāvid)›H›G according_to the_flesh, 4 having_been_designated the_son of_god in power according_to spirit of_holiness by the_resurrection of_the_dead, G‹H‹Yēsous chosen_one the master of_us, 5 through whom we_received grace and commission to obedience of_faith among all the pagans for the name of_him, 6 among whom are also you_all called ones of_G‹H‹Yēsous chosen_one, 7 to_all the ones being in Rx-G‹Ɽōmē›G-Rx, beloved of_god, called holy ones: grace to_you_all and peace from god the_father of_us and the_master G‹H‹Yēsous chosen_one.
   8 First indeed I_am_giving_thanks to_the god of_me through G‹H‹Yēsous chosen_one for all of_you_all, because the faith of_you_all is_being_proclaimed in all the world.
   9 For witness of_me is god, unto_whom I_am_serving in the spirit of_me in the gospel of_the son of_him, how unceasingly mentioning of_you_all I_am_making 10 always on the prayers of_me, beseeching if somehow now once I_will_be_being_prospered by the will of_god, to_come to you_all.
   11 For I_am_longing to_see you_all, in_order_that a_certain I_may_share gift with_you_all spiritual, in_order that to_be_strengthened you_all, 12 and this is, to_be_encouraged_together among to_you_all, through the among one_another faith, of_you_all both and of_me.
   13 Not and I_am_wanting you_all to_be_not_knowing, brothers, that often I_purposed to_come to you_all, and I_was_forbidden until the time presently, in_order_that some fruit I_may_have also among you_all, as even among the other pagans.
   14 To_G‹Hellēns›G both and to_foreigners, to_the_wise both and the_foolish, a_debtor I_am.
   15 Thus concerning me, eager am_I also to_you_all who are in Rx-G‹Ɽōmē›G-Rx to_gospel_preach.
   16 For not I_am_being_ashamed of_the gospel, for the_power of_god it_is to salvation to_everyone the one believing, to_Rx-G‹Youdaios›G-Rx both first and to_Rx-G‹Hellēn›G-Rx.
   17 For the_righteousness of_god in it is_being_revealed, by faith to faith, as it_has_been_written: and the righteous by faith will_be_living.
   18 For is_being_revealed the_severe_anger of_god from heaven, on all ungodliness and unrighteousness of_people, the truth by unrighteousness restraining, 19 because the known thing of_god, manifest is among them, For god to_them revealed it.
   20 For the invisible things of_him from the_creation of_the_world, by_the workmanship being_understood, is_being_clearly_seen, the both eternal of_him power and divinity, in_order that to_be them inexcusable.
   21 Because having_known god, not as god they_glorified or they_gave_thanks, but they_were_made_useless in the speculations of_them, and was_darkened the unintelligent of_them heart.
   22 Alleging to_be wise, they_were_made_foolish, 23 and they_changed the glory of_the indestructible god into a_likeness of_an_image of_a_mortal human, and birds, and quadrupeds, and reptiles.
   24 Therefore gave_over them god in the desires of_the hearts of_them to impurity, to_be_dishonoring the bodies of_them in themselves, 25 who exchanged the truth of_god into falsehood, and were_worshipped and serving unto_the creation contrary_to the one having_created it, who is blessed to the ages.
   Truly.
   26 Because_of this, gave_over them god to passions of_dishonor, for both female of_them exchanged the natural usage into the contrary_to nature, 27 and likewise also the male having_left the natural usage of_the female, were_burned in the desire of_them toward one_another, male with male the shame producing, and the recompense which it_was_fitting of_the deception of_them, in themselves taking_back.
   28 And as not they_approved god to_be_having in knowledge, gave_over them god to an_unqualified mind, to_be_doing the things not befitting, 29 having_been_filled with_all unrighteousness, wickedness, greediness, evil full of_envy, murder, strife, deceit, maliciousness, gossips, 30 slanderers, god-hating, abusers, proud, braggers, inventors of_evil, to_parents unpersuadable, 31 unintelligent, untrustworthy, unloving, unmerciful, 32 who the just_act of_god having_known that the ones such things doing worthy of_death are, not only them are_practicing, but also they_are_consenting to_the ones practicing.
  Rom 2  Therefore inexcusable you_are, Rx-Oh-Rx person, everyone judging, in for that you_are_judging the other, yourself you_are_condemning, for the same things you_are_doing, the one judging.
   2 But we_have_known that the judgment of_god is according_to truth on the ones such things practicing.
   3 But you_are_reckoning this, Rx-Oh-Rx person, you judging the ones such things practicing, and doing them yourself, that you will_be_escaping the judgment of_god.
   4 Or of_the riches of_the kindness of_him, and of_the forbearance, and of_the patience you_are_despising, not_knowing that the kindness of_god, to repentance you is_leading.
   5 But concerning the hardness of_you and unrepentant heart, you_are_storing_up for_yourself severe_anger in the_day of_severe_anger and revelation the_just_judgment of_god, 6 who will_be_giving_back to_each one according_to the works of_him: 7 to_the ones on_one_hand with endurance in_work good, glory and honor and indestructibility seeking, life eternal, 8 on_the_other_hand to_the ones of selfish_ambition and disbelieving in_the truth, but being_persuaded by_unrighteousness, severe_anger and rage be.
   9 Tribulation and distress, on every soul of_human_origin producing evil, of_Rx-G‹Youdaios›G-Rx both first and of_Rx-G‹Hellēn›G-Rx, 10 but glory, and honor, and peace, to_everyone doing good, to_Rx-G‹Youdaios›G-Rx both first and to_Rx-G‹Hellēn›G-Rx.
   11 For not is favouritism with god.
   12 For as_many_as unlawfully sinned, unlawfully also will_be_perishing, and as_many_as in law sinned, by law will_be_being_judged, 13 for not the listeners of_the_law are righteous with god, but the doers of_the_law will_be_being_justified.
   14 For whenever the_pagans not the_law having, by_nature the things of_the law may_be_practicing, these the_law not having, to_themselves are a_law, 15 who are_displaying the work of_the law, written in the hearts of_them, bearing_witness_with them their conscience, and between one_another, the arguments accusing or also defending them, 16 on that the_day is_judging god the secrets of_people, according_to the gospel of_me, by chosen_one/messiah G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G.
   17 But, if you a_Rx-G‹Youdaios›G-Rx is_being_named, and are_resting_on on_the_law, and are_boasting in god, 18 and are_knowing his will, and are_approving the things carrying_value, being_instructed out_of the law, 19 and you_have_persuaded yourself a_guide to_be of_the_blind, a_light to_the ones in darkness, 20 an_instructor of_the_foolish, a_teacher of_infants, having the appearance of_knowledge and of_the truth in the law, 21 therefore you teaching another, yourself not are_teaching.
   You proclaiming not to_be_stealing, you_are_stealing.
   22 You saying not to_be_committing_adultery, you_are_committing_adultery.
   You detesting idols, you_are_temple-robbing.
   23 Who in law are_boasting through the transgression of_the law, god you_are_dishonoring.
   24 For the name of_god because_of you_all is_being_slandered among the pagans, as it_has_been_written.
   25 Circumcision for on_one_hand is_benefiting, if the_law you_may_be_practicing, on_the_other_hand if a_transgressor of_law you_may_be_may_be, the circumcision of_you, uncircumcision has_become.
   26 Therefore if the uncircumcision, the just_acts of_the law may_be_keeping, not the uncircumcision of_him for circumcision will_be_being_reckoned.
   27 And will_be_judging the by nature uncircumcision, the law finishing, you who through the_letter and circumcision are a_transgressor of_law.
   28 For not the one on the outward a_Rx-G‹Youdaios›G-Rx is, nor the in the outward in flesh circumcision, 29 but the one on the secret a_Rx-G‹Youdaios›G-Rx is, and circumcision is of_heart, by the_spirit, not by_the_letter, of_whom the praise not of humans, but of god.
  Rom 3  Therefore is what the additional thing of_the Rx-G‹Youdaios›G-Rx, or what is the benefit of_circumcision.
   2 Much in every manner.
   First for indeed that they_were_entrusted the oracles of_god.
   3 For what if disbelieved some.
   Not the unbelief of_them, the faith of_god will_be_nullifying.
   4 Never it_might_become.
   And let_be_becoming god true, and every person a_liar, just_as it_has_been_written: so_that you_may_be_justified in the words of_you, and you_will_be_overcoming in the time to_be_being_judged you.
   5 But if the unrighteousness of_us, of_god the_righteousness is_demonstrating, what we_will_be_saying.
   Not unrighteous is god, the one inflicting the severe_anger.
   (According_to human_origin I_am_speaking.
  ) 6 Never it_might_become.
   Otherwise how will_be_judging god the world.
   7 If but the truth of_god in my falsehood abounded to the glory of_him, why still also_I as a_sinner am_being_judged.
   8 And not as we_are_being_slandered, and as are_saying some us to_be_saying, We_may_practice evil, in_order_that may_come good.
   Of_whom their judgment just is.
   9 Therefore what.
   We_are_having_advantage.
   Not certainly, for we_previously_charged, G‹Youdaiōns›G both and G‹Hellēns›G, all under sin to_be.
   10 As it_has_been_written, not one there_is righteous, not_even one, 11 not there_is understanding, not there_is the one seeking_out god.
   12 All turned_away, together they_were_being_useless, not one there_is practicing kindness, not there_is as_much_as praise.
   13 A_tomb having_been_opened_up the throat is of_them, with_the tongues of_them they_were_deceiving: poison of_asps is under the lips of_them, 14 of_whom their mouth of_cursing and bitterness is_being_full, 15 sharp are the feet of_them, to_pour_out blood… 16 destruction and misery in the ways of_them, 17 and the_way of_peace not they_knew.
   18 Not is reverence of_god in_front_of the eyes of_them.
   19 And we_have_known that as_much_as the law is_saying, to_the ones in the law it_is_speaking, in_order_that every mouth may_be_shut, and under_judgment may_become all the world to_god.
   20 Because by works of_law, not will_be_being_justified any flesh before him, for through the_law is the_knowledge of_sin.
   21 But now apart_from law, the_righteousness of_god has_been_revealed, being_attested by the law and the prophets, 22 and the_righteousness of_god through faith of_G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G chosen_one/messiah, toward all the ones believing, for no there_is distinction.
   23 For all sinned and are_being_fallen_short of_the glory of_god, 24 being_justified undeservedly by_the of_him grace, through the redemption in chosen_one G‹H‹Yēsous, 25 whom set_forth god as_an_atonement, through faith in the of_him blood, for a_sign of_the righteousness of_him, because_of the forbearance of_the having_previously_happened sins 26 in the forbearance of_god, for the sign of_the righteousness of_him in the present time, in_order that to_be him righteous and justifying the one of faith in_G‹H‹Yēsous.
   27 Therefore is where the boasting.
   It_was_excluded.
   Through what law.
   of_works.
   No, but through a_law of_faith.
   28 Therefore we_are_reckoning to_be_being_justified by_faith a_person, apart_from works of_law.
   29 Or of_G‹Youdaiōns›G is_he the god only.
   Not also of_pagans.
   Yes, also of_pagans, 30 if_indeed one god is, who will_be_justifying the_circumcision by faith, and the_uncircumcision through the faith.
   31 Therefore law we_are_nullifying through faith.
   Never it_might_become.
   But the_law we_are_establishing.
  Rom 4  Therefore what we_will_be_saying, to_have_found G‹H‹Abra'am/('Avərāhām)›H›G the forefather of_us according_to the_flesh.
   2 For if G‹H‹Abra'am by works was_justified, he_is_having a_boast, but not toward god.
   3 For what the scripture is_saying.
   And believed G‹H‹Abra'am in_god, and it_was_reckoned to_him for righteousness.
   4 And to_the one working, the reward not is_being_reckoned by grace, but by debt.
   5 But to_the one not working, but believing in the one justifying the ungodly, is_being_reckoned the faith of_him for righteousness, 6 just_as also G‹H‹Dauid/(Dāvid)›H›G is_saying the blessing of_the person to_whom god is_reckoning righteousness apart_from works: 7 blessed are_they, of_whom were_forgiven their lawlessness and of_whom were_covered-up their sins.
   8 Blessed is the_man, of_whom by_no_means not may_reckon the_master sin.
   9 therefore is blessing this on the circumcision, or also on the uncircumcision.
   For we_are_saying: /Was/_reckoned to_G‹H‹Abra'am the faith for righteousness.
   10 Therefore how it_was_reckoned.
   In circumcision being, or in uncircumcision.
   Not in circumcision, but in uncircumcision, 11 and the_sign he_received of_circumcision, a_seal of_the righteousness of_the faith in the uncircumcision, in_order that to_be him father of_all the ones believing through uncircumcision, in_order that to_be_reckoned to_them righteousness, 12 and father of_circumcision to_the ones not of circumcision only, but also to_the ones aligning in_the steps in uncircumcision of_faith, of_the father of_us G‹H‹Abra'am.
   13 For not by law the promise was to_G‹H‹Abra'am or the descendants of_him, that heir him to_be of_the_world, but by righteousness in_faith.
   14 For if the ones of law are heirs, has_been_voided faith and has_been_nullified the promise.
   15 For the law severe_anger is_producing, where and no there_is law, neither is transgression.
   16 Because_of this is of faith, in_order_that according_to grace, in_order that to_be confirmed, the promise to_all the seed, not to_the seed of the law only, but also to_the seed of the_faith of_G‹H‹Abra'am, who is the_father of_all of_us, 17 as it_has_been_written, a_father of_many nations I_have_appointed you, in_front_of whom he_believed, god the one giving_life to_the dead, and calling the things not being as being.
   18 Who contrary_to hope, in hope believed, in_order that to_become him the_father of_many nations, according_to the word having_been_spoken: thus will_be the descendants of_you.
   19 And not having_faltered in_the faith, he_observed the of_himself body already having_been_made_dead, a_hundred_year old about being, and the death of_the womb of_G‹H‹Sarra/(Sārāh)›H›G, 20 but at the promise of_god, not he_was_doubted in_unbelief, but he_was_strengthened in_faith, having_given glory to_god, 21 and having_been_fully_assured that what he_has_promised, able he_is also to_do.
   22 Therefore also it_was_reckoned to_him for righteousness.
   23 Not but it_was_written because_of him only, that it_was_reckoned to_him, 24 but also because_of us, to_whom it_is_going to_be_being_reckoned, to_the ones believing in the one having_raised G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, the master of_us, from dead, 25 who was_given_over for the transgressions of_us, and was_raised for the justification of_us.
  Rom 5  Therefore having_been_justified by faith, peace we_may_be_having with god, through the master of_us, G‹H‹Yēsous chosen_one/messiah, 2 through whom also the access we_have_had, by by_faith into grace this, in which we_have_stood, and we_are_boasting in hope of_the glory of_god.
   3 Not and only that, but also boasting in our tribulations, having_known that tribulation endurance is_producing, 4 and endurance provenness, and provenness hope.
   5 And hope not is_disgracing, because the love of_god has_been_poured_out in the hearts of_us through the_spirit holy, the one having_been_given to_us.
   6 Still for chosen_one, being of_us weak still, according_to the_time for the_ungodly died_off.
   7 For rarely for a_righteous man anyone will_be_dying_off, for for the good, possibly someone even is_daring to_die_off.
   8 But is_demonstrating the of_himself love to us god, that still sinners being of_us, chosen_one for us died_off.
   9 Therefore by_much more having_been_justified now by the blood of_him, we_will_be_being_saved by him from the severe_anger.
   10 For if enemies being, we_were_reconciled to_god through the death of_the son of_him, by_much more having_been_reconciled, we_will_be_being_saved by the life of_him.
   11 Not and only this, but also boasting in god, through the master of_us, G‹H‹Yēsous chosen_one, through whom now the reconciliation we_received.
   12 Because_of this, as by one man sin into the world came_in, and by sin death, also thus to all people death passed_through, for that all sinned, 13 for until the_law, sin was in world, but sin not is_being_imputed, not being the_law.
   14 But reigned death from G‹H‹Adam/('Ādām)›H›G until G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G, even over the ones not having_sinned in the likeness of_the transgression of_G‹H‹Adam, who is a_pattern of_the one coming.
   15 But not like the transgression, thus also is the gift.
   For if by_the of_the one man transgression, the many died_off, by_much more the grace of_god and the gift in grace, which is of_the one man, G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G chosen_one, to the many abounded.
   16 And not as by one man having_sinned, the gift, the for on_one_hand judgment of one transgression, to condemnation, on_the_other_hand the the_gift of many transgressions, to just_act.
   17 For if by_the of_the one man transgression, death reigned by the one man, by_much more the ones the abundance of_grace and of_the gift of_righteousness receiving, in life will_be_reigning, by the one man, G‹H‹Yēsous chosen_one/messiah.
   18 Therefore consequently as by one transgression, to all people to condemnation, thus also by one just_act, to all people for justification of_life.
   19 For as by the one disobedience of_the man, sinners were_appointed the many, thus also by the obedience of_the one man, righteous will_be_being_appointed the many.
   20 And the_law slipped_in, in_order_that may_abound the transgression, but where abounded sin, overflowed grace, 21 in_order_that as reigned sin in death, thus also grace may_reign through righteousness, to life eternal through G‹H‹Yēsous chosen_one the master of_us.
  Rom 6  Therefore what we_will_be_saying.
   We_may_be_continuing_on in_sin, in_order_that grace may_abound.
   2 Never it_might_become.
   Who we_died_off to_sin, how still we_will_be_living in it.
   3 Or you_all_are_not_knowing, that as_many_as we_were_immersed into chosen_one G‹H‹Yēsous, into the death of_him we_were_immersed.
   4 Therefore we_were_buried_with with_him through immersion into death, in_order_that as was_raised chosen_one from dead by the glory of_the father, thus also we in newness of_life may_walk.
   5 For if grown_together we_have_become in_the likeness of_the death of_him, but also of_the resurrection we_will_be, 6 this knowing that the old of_us person was_impaled_on_a_stake_with him, in_order_that may_be_nullified the body of_sin, that no_longer to_be_serving us for_sin.
   7 For the one having_died_off, has_been_justified from sin.
   8 And if we_died_off with chosen_one, we_are_believing that also we_will_be_living_together with_him, 9 having_known that chosen_one having_been_raised from dead, no_longer is_dying_off, death of_him no_longer is_mastering.
   10 For what he_died_off, to_sin died_off once_for_all, but what he_is_living, he_is_living to_god.
   11 Thus also you_all, be_reckoning yourselves to_be dead on_one_hand to_sin, on_the_other_hand living to_god in chosen_one G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G.
   12 Therefore not let_be_reigning sin in the mortal of_you_all body, in_order that to_be_submitting in_the lusts of_it.
   13 Not be_presenting the members of_you_all, as_weapons of_unrighteousness to_sin, but present yourselves to_god, as_if from the_dead living, and the members of_you_all, as_weapons of_righteousness to_god.
   14 For sin over_you_all not will_be_mastering, for not you_all_are under law, but under grace.
   15 Therefore what.
   We_may_sin because not we_are under law, but under grace.
   Never it_might_become.
   16 Not you_all_have_known that to_whom you_all_are_presenting yourselves as_slaves for obedience, slaves you_all_are to_whom you_all_are_submitting, whether of_sin to death, or of_obedience to righteousness.
   17 But thankfulness be to_god, that you_all_were slaves of_sin, and you_all_submitted from the_heart, to which you_all_were_given_over the_pattern of_teaching.
   18 And having_been_freed from sin, you_all_were_enslaved to_righteousness.
   19 ˱In˲_human terms I_am_speaking, because_of the weakness of_the flesh of_you_all.
   For as you_all_presented the members of_you_all as_slaves to_impurity, and to_lawlessness further to lawlessness, thus now present the members of_you_all, as_slaves to_righteousness to holiness.
   20 For when slaves you_all_were of_sin, free you_all_were from_righteousness.
   21 Therefore what fruit you_all_were_having then, in which now you_all_are_being_ashamed.
   For the end of_those things death is.
   22 But now, having_been_freed from sin, and having_been_enslaved to_god, you_all_are_having the fruit of_you_all to holiness, and the end is life eternal.
   23 For the wages of_sin is death, but the the_gift of_god is life eternal in chosen_one/messiah G‹H‹Yēsous, the master of_us.
  Rom 7  Or you_all_are_not_knowing, brothers (for to_knowing the_law I_am_speaking), that the law is_mastering over_the person for as_long_as the_time he_is_living.
   2 For the married woman to_the living husband has_been_bound by_law, but if may_die_off the husband, she_has_been_released from the law of_the husband.
   3 Therefore consequently living her husband, an_adulteress he_will_be_calling her, if she_may_become joined to_man another, but if may_die_off the husband, free she_is from the law, not to_be she an_adulteress having_become to_man another.
   4 So_that, brothers of_me, also you_all were_put_to_death to_the law by the body of_the chosen_one, in_order that to_become you_all to_another, to_the one from the_dead having_been_raised, in_order_that we_may_bear_fruit to_god.
   5 For when we_were in the flesh, the passions of_sins through the law was_working in the members of_us in_order that to_bear_fruit to_death.
   6 But now we_were_released from the law, having_died_off in which we_were_being_kept, so_that to_be_serving us in newness of_spirit, and not in_oldness of_letter.
   7 Therefore what we_will_be_saying.
   The law is sin.
   Never it_might_become.
   But sin not I_knew, except by the_law, for the and covetousness, not I_had_known, except the law was_saying: not you_will_be_coveting.
   8 But opportunity having_taken sin by the commandment, produced in me all covetousness, for apart_from the_law, sin dead.
   9 But I was_living apart_from law once, but having_come the commandment, the sin revived, 10 and I died_off, and was_found to_me the commandment, to life, this was to death.
   11 For sin an_opportunity having_taken by the commandment, deceived me and by it killed_off me.
   12 So_as the indeed law is holy, and the commandment is holy, and righteous, and good.
   13 Therefore the good law to_me became death.
   Never it_might_become.
   But sin, in_order_that it_may_be_seen sin by the good law in_me producing death, in_order_that may_become as excess sinful sin by the commandment.
   14 For we_have_known that the the_law spiritual is, but I fleshy am, having_been_sold under sin.
   15 For what I_am_producing, not I_am_knowing, for not what I_am_wanting, this I_am_doing, but what I_am_hating, this I_am_practicing.
   16 But if what not I_am_wanting, this I_am_practicing, I_am_agreeing_with to_the law that it_is good.
   17 And now no_longer I am_producing it, but the sin dwelling_in in me sin.
   18 For I_have_known that not is_dwelling in me, this is in the flesh of_me, good, for that to_be_wanting is_dwelling_with me, but that to_be_producing the good is not.
   19 For not what I_am_wanting, I_am_practicing good, but what not I_am_wanting the_evil, this I_am_doing.
   20 But if what not I_am_wanting, this I_am_practicing, no_longer I am_producing it, but the dwelling in me sin.
   21 I_am_finding consequently the law, in_which wanting me to_be_doing good, that in_me evil is_dwelling.
   22 For I_am_joyfully_concurring in_the law of_god, according_to the inside person, 23 but I_am_seeing another law in the members of_me, warring_against against_the law of_the mind of_me, and making_captive me in the law of_sin, being in the members of_me.
   24 Miserable I am person.
   Who me will_be_rescuing out_of the body of_death this.
   25 Thankfulness be to_god through G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G chosen_one/messiah the master of_us.
   Therefore consequently myself I, with_the on_one_hand mind am_serving to_the_law of_god, on_the_other_hand with_the the_flesh, to_the_law of_sin.
  Rom 8  ˱There_is˲_not_one consequently now condemnation to_the ones in chosen_one G‹H‹Yēsous, 2 for the law of_the spirit of_life in chosen_one G‹H‹Yēsous, freed you from the law of_sin and death.
   3 For powerless is of_the law, in that it_was_faltering through the flesh, god of_himself the_son having_sent, in the_likeness of_flesh sin, and concerning sin, condemned sin in the flesh, 4 in_order_that the just_act of_the law may_be_fulfilled in us, the ones not according_to the_flesh walking, but according_to the_spirit.
   5 For the ones according_to flesh being, the things of_the flesh are_thinking, but the ones according_to spirit, the things of_the spirit.
   6 For the mindset of_the flesh is death, but the mindset of_the spirit is life and peace.
   7 Because the mindset of_the flesh is enmity toward god, for to_the law of_god not it_is_being_subjected, for not_even it_is_able.
   8 And the ones in flesh being, to_god to_bring_pleasure not are_being_able.
   9 And you_all not are in flesh, but in spirit, if_indeed the_spirit of_god is_dwelling in you_all.
   But if anyone the_spirit of_chosen_one not is_having, this one not is of_him.
   10 But if chosen_one is in you_all, the on_one_hand body dead because_of sin, on_the_other_hand the spirit life because_of righteousness.
   11 But if the spirit of_the one having_raised G‹H‹Yēsous from the_dead is_indwelling in you_all, the one having_raised from the_dead chosen_one G‹H‹Yēsous will_be_giving_life also to_the mortal bodies of_you_all, through the indwelling of_him of_spirit in you_all.
   12 Therefore consequently, brothers, debtors we_are, not to_the flesh, according_to flesh to_be_living.
   13 For if according_to the_flesh you_all_are_living, you_all_are_going to_be_dying_off, but if by_the_spirit the practices of_the body you_all_are_putting_to_death, you_all_will_be_living.
   14 For as_many_as by_the_spirit of_god are_being_led, these the_sons of_god are.
   15 For not you_all_received a_spirit of_slavery again to fear, but you_all_received the_spirit of_adoption_as_sons, by whom we_are_crying_out: father, father.
   16 Himself the spirit is_bearing_witness_with with_the spirit of_us that we_are children of_god.
   17 And if children, also heirs, heirs on_one_hand of_god, on_the_other_hand fellow-heirs of_chosen_one/messiah, if_indeed we_are_suffering_with him, that also we_may_be_glorified_with him.
   18 For I_am_reckoning that not worthy are the sufferings of_the present time, with the going glory to_be_revealed to us.
   19 For the eager_expectation of_the creation, the revelation of_the sons of_god is_eagerly_waiting.
   20 For to_the uselessness, the creation was_subjected, not willingly, but because_of the one having_subjected it, in hope 21 that also itself the creation will_be_being_freed from the slavery of_corruption, into the freedom of_the glory of_the children of_god.
   22 For we_have_known that all the creation is_groaning_together and is_travailing_together until the time now.
   23 Not and only that, but also ourselves, the first-fruit of_the spirit having, we also ourselves in ourselves are_groaning, adoption_as_sons eagerly_waiting, the redemption of_the body of_us.
   24 For in_the hope we_were_saved, but hope being_seen, not is hope, for what is_seeing anyone, he_is_hoping.
   25 But if what not we_are_seeing we_are_hoping, through endurance we_are_eagerly_waiting.
   26 And likewise also the spirit is_helping with_the weakness of_us, for who we_may_pray as it_is_fitting, not we_have_known, but itself the spirit is_interceding with_groanings inexpressible.
   27 And the one searching our hearts has_known what is the mindset of_the spirit, because according_to god, it_is_pleading for the_holy ones.
   28 And we_have_known that to_the ones loving god, all things is_working_together god for good, to_the ones according_to his_purpose called being.
   29 Because whom he_foreknew, also he_predetermined similar to_the image of_the son of_him, in_order that to_be him firstborn among many brothers.
   30 And whom he_predetermined, these also he_called, and whom he_called, these also he_justified, and whom he_justified, these also he_glorified.
