   31 Therefore what we_will_be_saying to these things.
   If god is for us, who is against us.
   32 Who surely from_his own son not spared, but for us all gave_over him, how not also with him, the things all to_us he_will_be_granting.
   33 Who will_be_indicting against the_chosen ones of_god.
   god is the one justifying.
   34 Who is the one condemning.
   chosen_one/messiah G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G the one having_died_off, but rather having_been_raised who, also is at the_right hand of_god, who also is_pleading for us.
   35 Who us will_be_separating from the love of_the god Tribulation, or distress, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or danger, or sword.
   36 As it_has_been_written, on_account of_you, we_are_being_put_to_death all day, we_were_reckoned as sheep of_slaughter.
   37 But in these things all, we_are_beyond_conquering through the one having_loved us.
   38 For I_have_been_persuaded that neither death, nor life, nor angels, nor rulers, nor having_presented things, nor coming things, nor powers, 39 nor height, nor depth, nor any creation other, will_be_able us to_separate from the love of_god, in chosen_one G‹H‹Yēsous, the master of_us.
  Rom 9  The_truth I_am_speaking in chosen_one, not I_am_lying, bearing_witness_with with_me of_the conscience of_me in the_spirit holy 2 that sorrow to_me is great, and unceasing sorrow in_the heart of_me.
   3 For I_was_hoping a_curse to_be myself, I from the chosen_one for the brothers of_me, fellow-citizen of_me, according_to flesh, 4 who are G‹H‹ones_from_Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G, of_whose is the adoption_as_sons, and the glory, and the covenant, and the lawgiving, and the sacred_service, and the promises, 5 of_whose are the fathers, and of whom is the chosen_one, according_to flesh being over all god, blessed to the ages.
   Truly.
   6 Not but it_is such_as, that has_fallen_from the word of_god.
   For not all the ones of Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx these, Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx are.
   7 Nor because they_are seed of_G‹H‹Abra'am/('Avərāhām)›H›G all children, but: in G‹H‹Isa'ak/(Yiʦəḩāq)›H›G will_be_being_named to_you descendants.
   8 This is not the children of_the flesh, these are children of_god, but the children of_the promise is_being_reckoned for descendants.
   9 For of_the_promise a_word this is: concerning time this, I_will_be_coming, and there_will_be to_G‹H‹Sarra/(Sārāh)›H›G a_son.
   10 Not and only this, but also G‹H‹Ɽebekka/(Rivəqāh)›H›G by one sexual_intercourse, having of_G‹H‹Isa'ak, the father of_us, 11 for not_yet having_been_born, nor having_done any good or bad, in_order_that the according_to choice purpose of_god may_be_remaining, 12 not of works, but of the one calling, it_was_said to_her, the greater will_be_serving for_the lessor.
   13 As it_has_been_written: G‹H‹Yakōb/(Ya'aqov)›H›G I_loved, but G‹H‹Ēsau/('Ēsāv)›H›G I_hated.
   14 Therefore what we_will_be_saying.
   Not unrighteousness with god is_there.
   Never it_might_become.
   15 For to_G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G he_is_saying: I_will_be_showing_mercy to_whom I_may_be_showing_mercy, and I_will_be_having_compassion to_whom I_may_be_having_compassion.
   16 Therefore consequently not of_the one willing it_is, nor of_the one running, but of_being_merciful god.
   17 For is_saying the scripture to_G‹H‹Faraō/(Farə'oh)›H›G, for same reason this I_raised_up you, so_that I_may_display in you the power of_me, and so_that may_be_proclaimed the name of_me in all the earth.
   18 Therefore consequently to_whom he_is_wanting, he_is_showing_mercy, but whom he_is_wanting, he_is_hardening.
   19 You_will_be_saying therefore to_me: Therefore why still he_is_blaming.
   For against_the the_counsel of_him who has_resisted.
   20 Rx-Oh-Rx person, indeed_rather you who are, the one answering_back to_god.
   Not will_be_saying the formed thing, to_the one having_formed it: why me you_made thus.
   21 Or not is_having authority the potter over_the clay, out_of the same lump to_make one on_one_hand to honor vessel, on_the_other_hand one to dishonor.
   22 And if wanting god to_display his severe_anger, and to_make_known the powerful of_him, bore in much patience, the_vessels of_severe_anger having_been_prepared for destruction, 23 and in_order_that he_may_make_known the riches of_the glory of_him on the_vessels of_mercy, which he_previously_prepared for glory, 24 whom even he_called, us not only from the_G‹Youdaiōns›G, but also from the_pagans.
   25 As also Hosea he_is_saying: I_will_be_calling the not people of_me: The_people of_me, and the woman not having_been_loved: Having_been_loved.
   26 And it_will_be in the place where it_was_said Not the_people of_me you_all are, there they_will_be_being_called sons of_god the_living.
   27 And G‹H‹Ēsaias/(Yəsha'əyāh)›H›G is_crying_out concerning Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx: if may_be the number of_the sons of_Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx, as the sand of_the sea, the remnant will_be_being_saved.
   28 For his_word completing and cutting_short will_be_executing the_master on the earth.
   29 And as has_previously_said G‹H‹Ēsaias: except the_master of_armies abandoned to_us descendants, like G‹H‹Sodoma/(Şədom)›H›G would we_were_become, and like G‹H‹Gomorra/('Amorāh)›H›G would we_were_likened.
   30 Therefore what we_will_be_saying.
   That the_pagans not pursuing righteousness, grasped righteousness, and righteousness by faith, 31 But Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx persecuting a_law of_righteousness to the_law not attained.
   32 For_reason why.
   Because it_was not by faith, but as by works.
   They_stumbled over_the stone of_stumbling, 33 as it_has_been_written: see, I_am_laying in G‹H‹Siōn/(Tsiuōn)›H›G a_stone of_stumbling, and a_rock of_offense, and the one believing in him, not will_be_being_disgraced.
  Rom 10  Brothers, the indeed good_pleasure of_my heart, and the petition to god, for them is for salvation.
   2 For I_am_testifying to_them that zeal for_god they_are_having, but not according_to knowledge.
   3 For not_knowing the of_god righteousness, and their own seeking to_establish, to_the righteousness of_god not they_were_subjected.
   4 For the_end of_law is chosen_one/messiah, for righteousness to_everyone believing.
   5 For G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G is_writing of_the righteousness of the_law, the having_practiced them person, will_be_living by it.
   6 But the of faith righteousness thus is_saying: not you_may_say in the heart of_you: Who will_be_going_up into heaven.
   (This is chosen_one to_bring_down), 7 or: who will_be_coming_down into the abyss.
   (This is chosen_one from the_dead to_bring_up).
   8 But what it_is_saying.
   Near you the word is, in the mouth of_you, and in the heart of_you, this is the word of_faith which we_are_proclaiming.
   9 That if you_may_confess with the mouth of_you: master G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, and you_may_believe in the heart of_you that god him raised from the_dead, you_will_be_being_saved.
   10 For in_the_heart it_is_being_believed to righteousness, and in_the_mouth it_is_being_confessed to salvation.
   11 For is_saying the scripture: everyone believing in him not will_be_being_disgraced.
   12 For no there_is distinction ˱between˲_Rx-G‹Youdaios›G-Rx both and Rx-G‹Hellēn›G-Rx, for the same master of_all, being_rich toward all the ones calling him.
   13 For everyone that may_call on_the name of_the_master, will_be_being_saved.
   14 Therefore how they_may_call on whom not they_believed.
   And how they_may_believe of_whom not they_heard.
   And how they_may_hear apart_from proclaiming.
   15 And how they_may_proclaim if not they_may_be_sent_out.
   As it_has_been_written: how beautiful are the feet of_the ones gospel_preaching good things.
   16 But not all submitted to_the gospel.
   For G‹H‹Ēsaias/(Yəsha'əyāh)›H›G is_saying: master, who believed in_the report of_us.
   17 Consequently faith is by hearing, and hearing by the_word of_chosen_one.
   18 But I_am_asking, not not they_heard.
   Indeed_rather: into all the earth, came_out the voice of_them, and to the ends of_the inhabited_world, the words of_them.
   19 But I_am_asking, not Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx not knew.
   First G‹H‹Mōsēs is_saying: I will_be_making_jealous you_all, by those not a_nation, by a_nation unintelligent, I_will_be_angering you_all.
   20 And G‹H‹Ēsaias is_daring and is_saying: I_was_found by the ones me not seeking, manifest I_became to_the ones me not asking.
   21 But to Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx he_is_saying: all day, I_stretched_out the hands of_me to a_people disbelieving and speaking_against.
  Rom 11  Therefore I_am_asking, not pushed_away god the people of_him.
   Never it_might_become.
   For also I an_Israelite am, of the_seed of_G‹H‹Abra'am/('Avərāhām)›H›G, of_the_tribe of_G‹H‹Beniamin/(Binəyāmīn)›H›G.
   2 Not pushed_away god the people of_him, whom he_foreknew.
   Or not you_all_have_known in G‹H‹Ēlias/('Ēliyyāh)›H›G what is_saying the scripture, how he_is_pleading with_god against Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx.
   3 master, the prophets of_you they_killed_off, the altars of_you they_tore_down, and_I was_left only, and they_are_seeking the life of_me.
   4 But what is_speaking to_him the revelation.
   I_left to_myself seven_thousand men, who not bowed the_knee to_G‹H‹Baal/(Ba'al)›H›G.
   5 Therefore thus also in the present time, a_remnant according_to the_choice of_grace has_become.
   6 But if by_grace, no_longer it_is of works, otherwise grace no_longer is_becoming grace.
   7 Therefore what.
   What is_seeking_after Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx, this not it_obtained, but the the_choice obtained it, and the rest were_hardened, 8 as it_has_been_written: gave to_them god a_spirit of_stupor: eyes not to_be_seeing, and ears not to_be_hearing, to the today day.
   9 And G‹H‹Dauid/(Dāvid)›H›G is_saying: let_be_become the table of_them for a_snare, and for a_trap, and for an_offense, and for a_repayment to_them.
   10 Let_be_darkened the eyes of_them, not to_be_seeing, and the back of_them through all bend.
   11 Therefore I_am_asking not they_stumbled, in_order_that they_may_fall.
   Never it_might_become.
   But in_the of_them transgression, salvation is to_the pagans, in_order that to_make_jealous them.
   12 But if the transgression of_them, riches of_the_world is, and the loss of_them, riches of_the_pagans, by_how_much more the fullness of_them.
   13 To_you_all but I_am_speaking, the pagans.
   For as_much_as therefore indeed am I of_the_pagans an_ambassador, the service of_me I_am_glorifying, 14 somehow I_may_make_jealous of_me the flesh, and I_may_save some from them.
   15 For if the rejection of_them is reconciliation of_the_world, what is the acceptance except life from the_dead.
   16 And if the first-fruit is holy, also the lump, and if the root is holy, also the branches.
   17 But if some of_the branches were_broken_off, and you a_wild_olive_tree being were_engrafted among them, and a_fellow-partaker of_the root of_the fatness of_the olive_tree you_became, 18 not be_boasting over_the branches.
   But if you_are_boasting, not you the root are_bearing, but the root is_bearing you.
   19 Therefore you_will_be_saying: /Were/_broken_off branches, in_order_that I may_be_engrafted.
   20 Rightly, by_their unbelief they_were_broken_off, but you by_faith have_stood.
   Not high be_thinking, but be_fearing.
   21 For if god from_the according_to nature branches not spared, neither from_you he_will_be_sparing.
   22 Therefore see, the_kindness and severity of_god, on on_one_hand the ones having_fallen, severity, on_the_other_hand to you, kindness of_god, if you_may_continue_on in_the kindness, otherwise also you will_be_being_cut_off.
   23 And also_those if not they_may_be_continuing_on in_unbelief, they_will_be_being_engrafted, for powerful is god again to_engraft them.
   24 For if you out_of the according_to nature were_cut_off wild_olive_tree, and contrary_to nature were_engrafted into a_cultivated_olive_tree, by_how_much more these, who according_to nature will_be_being_engrafted in_their own olive_tree.
   25 For not I_am_wanting you_all to_be_not_knowing, brothers, mystery this, in_order_that not you_all_may_be in yourselves prudent, that a_hardening in part to_Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx has_become, until of_which the fullness of_the pagans may_come_in, 26 and thus all Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx will_be_being_saved, as it_has_been_written: will_be_coming out_of G‹H‹Siōn/(Tsiuōn)›H›G the one rescuing, he_will_be_turning_away ungodliness from G‹H‹Yakōb/(Ya'aqov)›H›G.
   27 And this is to_them, the from me covenant: whenever I_may_take_away the sins of_them.
   28 Concerning on_one_hand the gospel, enemies because_of you_all, on_the_other_hand concerning the choice, beloved because_of the fathers.
   29 For unregrettable are the gifts and the calling of_god.
   30 For as you_all once disbelieved in_god, but now you_all_were_shown_mercy by_the of_these disbelief, 31 thus also these now disbelieved in_your mercy, in_order_that also they now may_be_shown_mercy.
   32 For imprisoned god the ones all in disbelief, in_order_that to_all he_may_show_mercy.
   33 Rx-Oh-Rx the_depth of_riches, both of_wisdom and knowledge of_god.
   How unsearchable are the judgments of_him, and untraceable the ways of_him.
   34 For who knew the_mind of_the_master, or who a_counselor of_him became.
   35 Or who previously_given to_him, and will_be_being_repaid to_him.
   36 Because from him, and through him, and to him are, the things all.
   To_him be the glory to the ages.
   Truly.
   Rom 12  Therefore I_am_exhorting you_all, brothers, by the compassions of_god, to_present the bodies of_you_all a_sacrifice living, holy, to_god well_pleasing, the logical sacred_service of_you_all.
   2 And not be_conforming to_age this, but be_being_transformed by_the renewal of_the mind, in_order that to_be_approving you_all, what is the will of_god, the good, and well_pleasing, and perfect.
   3 For I_am_saying through the grace having_been_given to_me, to_everyone being among you_all, not to_be_over_esteeming beyond what it_is_fitting to_be_thinking, but to_be_thinking in_order that to_be_being_sensible, to_each as god allotted a_measure of_faith.
   4 For just_as in one body, many members we_are_having, and the the_members all not the same is_having practicing, 5 thus the many, one body we_are in chosen_one/messiah, and each one of_one_another members.
   6 But having gifts according_to the grace having_been_given to_us special: whether prophecy, according_to the relationship of_the faith, 7 or service, in the service, or the one teaching, in the teaching, 8 or the one exhorting, in the exhortation, the one sharing, in generosity, the one leading, with earnestness, the one showing_mercy, with cheerfulness.
   9 ˱Let˲_your love be unhypocritical.
   Abhoring evil, being_joined_together to_good, 10 with_the brotherly_love toward one_another dearly_devoted be, in_honor one_another preferring, 11 in_earnestness not reluctant, in_spirit being_zealous, for_the master serving, 12 in_hope rejoicing, in_tribulation enduring, in_prayer attending, 13 to_the needs of_the holy ones sharing, in_hospitality pursuing.
   14 Be_blessing the ones persecuting, you_all be_blessing and not be_cursing.
   15 To_be_rejoicing with rejoicing ones, to_be_weeping with weeping ones.
   16 The same thing toward one_another thinking, not the exalted things thinking, but to_the humble being_condescending.
   Not be_becoming prudent with yourselves.
   17 To_no_one evil for evil giving_back, providing good things before all people.
   18 If possible of you_all, with all people being_at_peace.
   19 Not yourselves avenging, beloved, but give place to_severe_anger, for it_has_been_written: to_me is vengeance, I will_be_repaying, is_saying the_master.
   20 But if may_be_hungering the enemy of_you, be_feeding him, if he_may_be_thirsting, be_giving_to_drink him, for this doing, charcoal of_fire you_will_be_heaping on the head of_him.
   21 Not be_being_overcome by evil, but be_overcoming with good evil.
  Rom 13  Every soul to_the_authorities being_above let_be_being_subjected, for not there_is authority, except by god, and the authorities being by god having_been_appointed they_are.
   2 So_then the one opposing against_the authority, against_the of_god ordinance has_resisted, and the ones having_resisted, on_themselves judgment will_be_receiving.
   3 For the rulers not are a_fear to_good work, but to_evil.
   And you_are_wanting not to_be_fearing the authority.
   good be_practicing, and you_will_be_having praise from him.
   4 For of_god the_servant he_is to_you for good.
   But if evil you_may_be_practicing, be_fearing, for not vainly the sword he_is_bearing, For of_god a_servant he_is, an_avenging for severe_anger to_the one evil doing.
   5 Therefore necessity it_is to_be_being_subjected, not only because_of the severe_anger, but also because_of conscience.
   6 Because_of for this, also taxes you_all_are_finishing, for ministers of_god they_are, for same thing this persevering.
   7 Give_back to_all the obligations: to_the one tax, tax, to_the one revenue, revenue, to_the one respect, respect, to_the one honor, honor.
   8 To_no_one nothing be_owing, except one_another to_be_loving, for the one loving the other, the_law has_fulfilled.
   9 For : not you_will_be_committing_adultery: not you_will_be_murdering: not you_will_be_stealing: not you_will_be_coveting, and if any other commandment in word this, is_being_summed_up: you_will_be_loving the neighbor of_you as yourself.
   10 love to_the one near evil not is_doing, therefore the_fullness of_the_law love is.
   11 And this having_known the time, that the_hour already you_all out_of sleep to_be_raised, for now nearer of_us is salvation, than when first we_believed.
   12 The night progressed, and the the_day has_neared.
   Therefore we_may_put_away the works of_darkness, and we_may_dress_in the weapons of_light.
   13 As in the_day properly we_may_walk, not in_carousing and drunkenness, not in_sexual_intercourse and wantonness, not in_strife and jealousy.
   14 But dress_in the master G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G chosen_one/messiah, and for_the flesh provision not be_making, for its desires.
  Rom 14  And the one faltering in_the faith be_receiving, not for distinctions on_his_speculations.
   2 Rx-one-Rx on_one_hand is_believing to_eat all things, on_the_other_hand the one faltering vegetables is_eating.
   3 The one eating, the one not eating not him _let_be_scorning, and the one not eating, the one eating not him _let_be_judging, For god him received.
   4 You who are, the one judging another's house_servant.
   To_his own master he_is_standing or is_falling.
   But he_will_be_being_stood, for is_able the master to_stand him.
   5 Rx-one-Rx on_one_hand is_judging a_day beyond another day, on_the_other_hand one is_judging every day alike.
   Each in his own mind, let_be_being_fully_assured.
   6 The one thinking the day special, to_the_master he_is_thinking.
   And he eating, to_the_master he_is_eating, for he_is_giving_thanks to_the to_god, and the one not eating, to_the_master not is_eating, and is_giving_thanks to_god.
   7 For no_one of_us to_himself is_living, and no_one to_himself is_dying_off.
   8 If for both we_may_be_living, to_the master we_are_living, and if we_may_be_dying_off, to_the master we_are_dying_off.
   If therefore both we_may_be_living, and if we_may_be_dying_off, of_the master we_are.
   9 For for this chosen_one died_off and lived, in_order_that both over_the_dead and the_living he_may_mastering.
   10 But you why are_judging the brother of_you.
   Or also you why are_scorning the brother of_you.
   For all we_will_be_standing_before before_the tribunal of_god.
   11 For it_has_been_written: am_living I, is_saying the_master that to_me will_be_bowing every knee, and will_be_confessing every tongue to_god.
   12 Therefore consequently each of_us concerning himself, an_account will_be_giving to_god.
   13 Therefore no_longer one_another we_may_be_judging, but this judge rather, not to_be_putting stumbling to_your brother or temptation.
   14 I_have_known and I_have_been_persuaded in the_master G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G that nothing is unclean by itself, except to_the one reckoning anything unclean to_be, to_that one unclean it_is.
   15 If for because_of food, the brother of_you is_being_sorrowed, no_longer according_to love you_are_walking.
   Not with_the food of_you that one be_destroying, for whom chosen_one/messiah died_off.
   16 Not therefore let_be_being_slandered of_you_all the good.
   17 For not is the kingdom of_god food and drink, but righteousness, and peace, and joy in spirit holy.
   18 For the one in this serving for_the chosen_one, well_pleasing to_god is and approved by_the people.
   19 Therefore consequently the things of_peace we_are_persecuting, and the things of_building for one_another.
   20 Not on_account food, be_tearing_down the work of_god.
   All things indeed clean are, but evil to_the person through a_stumbling block eating.
   21 Good it_is nor to_eat meats, nor to_drink wine, nor anything in which the brother of_you is_stumbling, or is_being_stumbled, or is_ailing.
   22 You the_faith which are_having, to yourself be_having before god.
   Blessed is the one not judging himself in what he_is_approving.
   23 But the one doubting, he_may_eat, he_has_been_condemned, because it_is not of faith, and everything which is not of faith, sin is.
  Rom 15  And ought we, the powerful, the weaknesses of_the powerless to_be_bearing, and not to_ourselves to_be_bringing_pleasure.
   2 Each of_us to_the one near him _let_be_bringing_pleasure to the good for building.
   3 For also the chosen_one not to_himself brought_pleasure, but as it_has_been_written: the derisions of_the ones deriding you, fell_on on me.
   4 For as_much_as was_previously_written, for our teaching was_written, in_order_that through endurance and through the exhortation of_the scriptures, hope we_may_be_having.
   5 And the god of_endurance and exhortation, might_give to_you_all the same to_be_thinking with one_another according_to G‹H‹Yēsous, chosen_one, 6 in_order_that with_one_accord, with one mouth, you_all_may_be_glorifying the god and father of_the master of_us, G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G chosen_one.
   7 Therefore be_receiving one_another, as also the chosen_one received you_all, to the_glory of_god.
   8 I_am_saying for the_chosen_one a_servant to_become of_the_circumcision for the_truth of_god, in_order that to_confirm the promises to_the fathers 9 and the the_pagans, for mercy to_glorify god, as it_has_been_written: because_of this I_will_be_confessing to_you among the_pagans, and to_the name of_you I_will_be_singing_praises.
   10 And again he_is_saying: be_gladdened, pagans, with the people of_him.
   11 And again: be_praising, all the pagans, the master, and them_let_praise him all the peoples.
   12 And again G‹H‹Ēsaias/(Yəsha'əyāh)›H›G is_saying: there_will_be the root of_G‹H‹Yessai/(Yishay)›H›G, and the one rising_up to_be_ruling over_the_pagans, in him the_pagans will_be_hoping.
   13 And the god of_hope might_fill you_all with_all joy and peace in that to_be_believing, in_order that to_be_abounding you_all in hope in the_power of_the_spirit holy.
   14 And I_have_been_persuaded, brothers of_me, also myself I concerning you_all, that also yourselves full are of_goodness, having_been_filled with_all knowledge, being_able also one_another to_be_admonishing.
   15 But more_boldly I_wrote to_you_all in part, as reminding you_all, because_of the grace having_been_given to_me by god, 16 in_order that to_be me a_minister of_chosen_one/messiah G‹H‹Yēsous to the pagans, sacredly-servicing the gospel of_god, in_order_that may_become the offering of_the pagans acceptable, having_been_sanctified by the_spirit holy.
   17 Therefore I_am_having boasting in chosen_one G‹H‹Yēsous the things with god.
   18 For not I_will_be_daring anything to_be_speaking, of_what things not produced chosen_one through me, for obedience of_the_pagans by_word and work 19 in power of_signs and wonders in the_power of_the_spirit of_god, so_that me from G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G and around unto G‹Illurikon›G, to_have_fulfilled the gospel of_the chosen_one, 20 and thus I_am_being_ambitious to_be_gospel_preaching, not where was_named chosen_one, in_order_that not on another's foundation I_may_be_building, 21 but as it_has_been_written: to_whom not it_was_declared concerning him, they_will_be_seeing, and those_who not have_heard, they_will_be_understanding.
   22 Therefore also I_was_being_hindered often to_come to you_all.
   23 But now no_longer a_place having in regions these, and a_longing having to_come to you_all for many years, 24 when I_may_be_going to G‹Spania›G, for I_am_hoping passing_through to_see you_all, and by you_all to_be_sent_forward there, if of_you_all first in part I_may_be_filled.
   25 But now I_am_going to G‹H‹Hierousalēm serving unto_the holy ones.
   26 took_pleasure for G‹Makedonia›G and G‹Aⱪaia›G a_fellowship certain to_make for the poor of_the holy ones in G‹H‹Hierousalēm.
   27 For they_took_pleasure and debtors they_are of_them, for if in_the spiritual things of_them shared the pagans, they_are_ought also in to_the material things to_minister to_them.
   28 Therefore this having_accomplished, and having_sealed fruit this, I_will_be_going_away by you_all into G‹Spania›G.
   29 And I_have_known that coming to you_all, in the_fullness of_the_blessing of_chosen_one, I_will_be_coming.
   30 And I_am_exhorting you_all, by the master of_us, G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G chosen_one, and by the love of_the spirit, to_contend_together with_me in the prayers for me to god, 31 that I_may_be_rescued from the ones disbelieving in Rx-G‹Youdaia›G-Rx, and the service of_me which is in G‹H‹Hierousalēm acceptable to_the holy ones may_become, 32 in_order_that in joy I_may_come to you_all by the_will of_god, I_may_find_rest with_you_all.
   33 And the god of_peace be with all of_you_all.
   Truly.
   Rom 16  And I_am_commending to_you_all G‹Foibē›G, the sister of_us, being also a_servant of_the assembly in G‹Kegⱪreai›G, 2 in_order_that you_all_may_accept her in the_master worthily of_the_holy ones, and may_stand_by by_her in whatever of_you_all she_may_be_needing matter, for also she a_supporter of_many was_become and of_me myself.
   3 Greet G‹Priska›G and G‹Akulas›G, the fellow-workers of_me in chosen_one/messiah G‹H‹Yēsous, 4 who for the life of_me, the of_themselves neck laid_down, to_whom not I only am_giving_thanks, but also all the assemblies of_the pagans, 5 and the in the_house of_them assembly.
   Greet G‹Epainetos›G, the beloved of_me, who is a_first-fruit of_G‹Asia›G for chosen_one.
   6 Greet G‹H‹Maria/(Mirəyām)›H›G, who much labored for you_all.
   7 Greet G‹Andronikos›G and G‹Younias›G, fellow-citizens of_me and the fellow-prisoners of_me, who are notable among the ambassadors, who also before me have_become in chosen_one.
   8 Greet G‹Amplias›G, the beloved in the_master.
   9 Greet G‹Ourbanos›G, the fellow-worker of_us in chosen_one, and G‹Staⱪus›G the beloved of_me.
   10 Greet G‹Apellēs›G, the approved in chosen_one.
   Greet the ones of the ones of_G‹Aristoboulos›G.
   11 Greet G‹Hērōidiōn›G, the fellow-citizen of_me.
   Greet the ones of the ones of_G‹Narkissos›G being in the_master.
   12 Greet G‹Trufaina›G and G‹Trufōsa›G, the ones laboring in the_master.
   Greet G‹Persis›G, the beloved, who much labored in the_master.
   13 Greet G‹Ɽoufos›G, the chosen in the_master, and the mother of_him and of_me.
   14 Greet G‹Asugkritos›G, G‹Flegōn›G, G‹Hermēs›G, G‹Patrobas›G, G‹Hermas›G, and the with them brothers.
   15 Greet G‹Filologos›G and G‹Youlia›G, G‹Nēreus›G and the sister of_him, and G‹Olumpas›G, and the with them all holy ones.
   16 Greet one_another with a_kiss holy.
   Are_greeting you_all the assemblies all of_the chosen_one.
   17 And I_am_exhorting you_all, brothers, to_be_looking_out for_the ones dissensions and temptations contrary_to the teaching that you_all learned making, and be_turning_away from them.
   18 For such men unto_the master of_us for_chosen_one not are_serving, but unto_the of_themselves belly, and by the smooth_speech and blessing, they_are_deceiving the hearts of_the innocent.
   19 For the of_you_all obedience, to all reached.
   Over therefore you_all I_am_rejoicing, but I_am_wanting you_all wise to_be in good, and innocent in evil.
   20 And the god of_peace will_be_crushing G‹H‹Satan/(Sāţān)›H›G under the feet of_you_all in quickness.
   The grace of_the master of_us, G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G with you_all be.
   21 Is_greeting you_all G‹Timotheos›G, the fellow-worker of_me, and G‹Loukios›G, G‹Yasōn›G, and G‹Sōsipatros›G, the fellow-citizen of_me.
   22 /Am/_greeting you_all I, G‹Tertios›G, the one having_written the letter, in the_master.
   23 Is_greeting you_all G‹Gaios›G, the host of_me, and all of_the assembly.
   Is_greeting you_all G‹Erastos›G, the manager of_the city, and G‹Kouartos›G the brother.
   24  25 And to_the one being_able you_all to_strengthen, according_to the gospel of_me, and the proclamation of_G‹H‹Yēsous chosen_one/messiah according_to the_revelation of_the_mystery in_times the_eternal having_been_kept_silent, 26 but having_been_revealed now and by the_scriptures prophetic, according_to the_command of_the eternal god for obedience of_faith, to all the nations having_been_made_known.
   27 To_the_only wise god through G‹H‹Yēsous chosen_one, to_which is the glory to the ages.
   Truly.
