2 G‹Timotheos›G

1  G‹Paulos›G, an_ambassador of_chosen_one/messiah G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, by the_will of_god, according_to promise of_life in chosen_one G‹H‹Yēsous, 2 to_G‹Timotheos›G beloved child: grace, mercy, peace, from god the_father and chosen_one G‹H‹Yēsous the master of_us.
   3 Thankfulness I_am_having to_god, unto_whom I_am_serving from my_parents with a_pure conscience, as unceasing I_am_having the for you mentioning, in the petitions of_me, night and day, 4 longing you to_see, having_remembered of_you of_the tears, in_order_that with_joy I_may_be_filled, 5 remembrance having_taken of_the in you unhypocritical faith, which dwelt first in the grandmother of_you, G‹Lōis›G, and in_the mother of_you, G‹Eunikē›G, and I_have_been_persuaded that also in you it_is.
   6 For which cause I_am_reminding you to_be_rekindling the gift of_god, which is in you by the laying_on of_the hands of_me.
   7 For not gave to_us god a_spirit of_fear, but of_power, and of_love, and of_sensibility.
   8 Therefore not may_be_ashamed the testimony of_the master of_us, nor me, the prisoner of_him, but suffer_together for_the gospel, according_to the_power of_god, 9 the one having_saved us, and having_called with_a_calling holy, not according_to the works of_us, but according_to his_own purpose and grace, having_been_given to_us in chosen_one G‹H‹Yēsous before times eternal, 10 but having_been_revealed now, by the appearing of_the Rx-saviour-Rx of_us, chosen_one G‹H‹Yēsous, having_nullified on_one_hand death, on_the_other_hand having_illuminated life and indestructibility through the gospel, 11 to which was_appointed I a_proclaimer, and an_ambassador, and a_teacher.
   12 For which cause also these things I_am_suffering, but not I_am_being_ashamed, for I_have_known in_whom I_have_believed, and I_have_been_persuaded that powerful he_is, the deposit of_me to_guard for that day.
   13 The_pattern be_having of_being_sound words, which from me you_heard, in faith and love in chosen_one G‹H‹Yēsous.
   14 The good deposit keep, by the_spirit holy dwelling in us.
   15 You_have_known this, that were_turned_away from_me all who are in G‹Asia›G, of_whom is G‹Fugelos›G and G‹Hermogenēs›G.
   16 Might_give mercy the master to_the of_G‹Onēsiforos›G household, because often me he_refreshed, and the chain of_me not was_ashamed, 17 but having_become in Rx-G‹Ɽōmē›G-Rx, earnestly he_sought me and found 18 (might_give to_him the master, to_find mercy from the_master in that day), and as_much_as in G‹Efesos›G he_served, better you are_knowing.
  Ti-2 2  Therefore you, child of_me, be_being_strengthened in the grace in chosen_one/messiah G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G.
   2 And the things you_heard from me through many witnesses, these entrust to_faithful people, who worthy will_be also others to_teach.
   3 Suffer_together as a_good soldier of_chosen_one G‹H‹Yēsous.
   4 No_one soldiering is_being_entangled with_the of_living affairs, in_order_that to_the one having_enlisted him he_may_bring_pleasure.
   5 And if also may_be_competing anyone, not is_being_crowned, if not lawfully he_may_compete.
   6 The laboring farmer it_is_fitting first of_the fruits to_be_partaking.
   7 Be_understanding what I_am_saying, for will_be_giving to_you the master insight in all things.
   8 Be_remembering G‹H‹Yēsous chosen_one, having_been_raised from the_dead, of the_seed of_G‹H‹Dauid/(Dāvid)›H›G, according_to the gospel of_me, 9 in which I_am_suffering_hardship unto bonds as a_criminal.
   But the word of_god not has_been_bound.
   10 Because_of this, all things I_am_enduring because_of the chosen ones, in_order_that also they of_salvation may_obtain in chosen_one G‹H‹Yēsous with glory eternal.
   11 Trustworthy is the saying: for if we_died_together with_him, also we_will_be_living_together with_him, 12 if we_are_enduring, also we_may_reign him, if we_will_be_disowning him, also_that one will_be_disowning us, 13 if we_are_disbelieving, that one faithful is_remaining, for to_disown himself not he_is_able.
   14 These things be_reminding them, testifying before god, not he_is_quibbling against nothing useful, to the_ruin of_the ones hearing.
   15 Be_earnest yourself approved to_present to_god, a_worker unashamed, cutting_straight the word of_truth.
   16 And profane empty_babblings be_avoiding, on for more they_will_be_progressing of_ungodliness, 17 and the word of_them as gangrene spreading will_be_having, of_whom is G‹Humenaios›G, and G‹Filētos›G, 18 who concerning the truth deviated, saying the the_resurrection already to_have_become, and are_overturning the of_some faith.
   19 The however solid foundation of_god has_stood, having seal this: knew the_master the ones being of_him, and: let_withdraw from unrighteousness everyone naming the name of_the_master.
   20 In and a_great house, not there_is only vessels golden and silver, but also wooden and earthen, and some on_one_hand for honor, on_the_other_hand some to dishonor.
   21 Therefore if anyone may_clean_out himself from these things, he_will_be a_vessel for honor, having_been_sanctified useful to_the master, for every work good having_been_prepared.
   22 And youthful lusts be_fleeing, but be_pursuing righteousness, faith, love, peace, with all the ones calling_on the master out_of pure a_heart.
   23 And foolish and uneducated debates be_refusing, having_known that they_are_bearing quarrels.
   24 And the_slave of_the_master not it_is_fitting to_be_quarrelling, but gentle to_be toward all, teaching, bearing_evil, 25 in gentleness disciplining the ones opposing, perhaps may_give to_them god repentance to a_knowledge of_the_truth, 26 and they_may_recover_sobriety out_of the of_the devil snare, having_been_caught by him, in_order that of_that one the_will.
  Ti-2 3  But this be_knowing, that in the_last days will_be_presenting times dangerous.
   2 For will_be people selfish, money_lovers, braggers, proud, slanderous, to_their_parents unpersuadable, ungrateful, unholy, 3 unloving, irreconcilable, diabolical, intemperate, untamed, unwholesome, 4 betrayers, reckless, having_been_conceited, lovers_of_pleasure rather than lovers_of_god, 5 having an_appearance of_devoutness, but the power of_it having_disowned, and these be_turning_from.
   6 Out_of for these, are the ones slipping_in into houses, and making_captive silly_women, having_been_heaped with_sins, being_led by_lusts various, 7 always learning, and never to a_knowledge of_the_truth to_come being_able.
   8 ˱By˲_which and manner G‹Yannēs›G and G‹Yambrēs›G resisted against_G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G, thus also these are_resisting against_the truth, people having_been_depraved the_mind, unqualified concerning the faith.
   9 But not they_will_be_progressing to more, for the folly of_them evident will_be to_all, as also the folly of_those became.
   10 And you followed of_me with_the teaching, the conduct, the purpose, the faith, the patience, the love, the endurance, 11 the persecutions, the sufferings, such_as to_me became in G‹Antioⱪeia›G, in G‹Ikonion›G, in G‹Lustra›G, such_as persecutions I_bore_under, and_yet out_of all things, me rescued the master.
   12 Also and all the ones wanting to_be_living devoutly in chosen_one/messiah G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G will_be_being_persecuted.
   13 But evil people and swindlers will_be_progressing to the worse, deceiving and being_strayed.
   14 And you be_remaining in what things you_learned and you_were_convinced_of, having_known from whom_all you_learned them, 15 and that from a_baby the the_sacred writings you_have_known, being_able you to_make_wise to salvation through faith in chosen_one G‹H‹Yēsous.
   16 Every scripture is god-breathed and beneficial for teaching, for rebuke, for correction, for discipline in righteousness, 17 in_order_that complete may_be the of_god person, toward every work good having_been_finished_out.
  Ti-2 4  I_am_testifying before god and chosen_one G‹H‹Yēsous, the one going to_be_judging the_living and the_dead, both the appearing of_him, and the kingdom of_him: 2 proclaim the word, stand_by conveniently, ˱and˲_unseasonably, rebuke, give_rebuke, exhort, with all patience and teaching.
   3 For there_will_be a_time when of_the being_sound teaching not they_will_be_tolerating, but according_to own desires, to_themselves they_will_be_accumulating teachers, being_tickled by_the ear, 4 and from on_one_hand the truth hearing they_will_be_turning_away, on_the_other_hand to myths they_will_be_being_turned_away.
   5 But you be_being_sober in all things, suffer_hardship, as a_good soldier of_chosen_one G‹H‹Yēsous the_work do of_a_gospel_preacher, the service of_you fully_assure.
   6 For I already am_being_poured_out, and the time of_the departure of_me has_approached.
   7 good fight I_have_fought, the course I_have_finished, the faith I_have_kept.
   8 Furthermore is_laid_away for_me the of_righteousness crown, which will_be_giving_back to_me the master in, that day, the righteous judge, not and only to_me, but also to_all the ones having_loved the appearing of_him.
   9 Be_earnest to_come to me quickly, 10 For G‹Dēmas›G me was_abandoning, having_loved the present age, and was_gone to G‹Thessalonikē›G, G‹Krēskēs›G to G‹NOT_Galilaia_NOT›G, G‹Titos›G to G‹Dalmatia›G.
   11 G‹Loukas›G is only with me.
   Rx-G‹Markos›G-Rx having_taken_up, be_bringing him with yourself, for he_is to_me useful for the_service.
   12 But G‹Tuⱪikos›G I_sent_out to G‹Efesos›G.
   13 The cloak that I_left_behind in Rx-G‹Trōias›G-Rx with G‹Karpos›G, on_coming be_bringing, and the scrolls, most_of_all the parchments.
   14 G‹Alexandros›G the coppersmith, great to_me harm displayed, will_be_giving_back to_him the master according_to the works of_him, 15 whom also you be_guarding, for exceedingly he_resisted against_our words.
   16 In first of_me defense, no_one with_me appeared, but all me abandoned, not to_them it_might_have_reckoned.
   17 But the master by_me stood_by, and strengthened me, in_order_that through me the proclamation may_be_fully_assured, and may_hear all the pagans, and I_was_rescued out_of the_mouth of_the_lion.
   18 Will_be_rescuing me the master from every work evil, and he_will_be_saving into the kingdom of_him heavenly, to_whom is the glory to the ages of_the ages.
   Truly.
   19 Greet G‹Priska›G and G‹Akulas›G, and the of_G‹Onēsiforos›G house.
   20 G‹Erastos›G remained in Rx-G‹Korinthos›G-Rx, But G‹Trofimos›G I_left_behind in G‹Milētos›G ailing.
   21 Be_earnest before winter to_come.
   Is_greeting you G‹Euboulos›G, and G‹Poudēs›G, and G‹Linos›G, and G‹Klaudia›G, and the brothers all.
   22 The master G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G with the spirit of_you be.
   grace be with you_all.
  

USFM file created 2022-09-24 17:36 by extractVLT v0.50

The source table used to create this file is Copyright © 2022 by https://GreekCNTR.org

USFM file edited 2022-09-24 17:40 by ScriptedBibleEditor v0.14

G‹Titos›G

1  G‹Paulos›G, a_slave of_god, an_ambassador and of_G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G chosen_one/messiah, according_to the_faith of_the_chosen ones of_god, and knowledge of_the_truth, which is according_to devoutness, 2 in the_hope of_life eternal, which the unlying god promised before times eternal, 3 but revealed the word of_him in_seasons his_own in the_proclamation, which I was_entrusted according_to the_command of_god, the Rx-saviour-Rx of_us 4 to_G‹Titos›G, my_genuine child, according_to our_common faith: grace and peace from god the_father and chosen_one G‹H‹Yēsous, the Rx-saviour-Rx of_us.
   5 For_reason_of This, I_left_behind you in G‹Krētē›G, in_order_that you_may_set_in_order the things lacking, and may_appoint elders in /every/_city as I directed to_you, 6 if anyone is unindictable, the_husband of_one wife, having believing children, not in accusation of_intemperance or insubordinate.
   7 For It_is_fitting the overseer to_be unindictable as a_manager of_god, not self-willed, not easily_angered, not winebibbing, not a_bully, not greedy, 8 but hospitable, a_lover_of_good, sensible, righteous, devout, self-controlled, 9 upholding of_the faithful word according_to the teaching, in_order_that he_may_be powerful both to_be_exhorting with teaching being_sound, and to_be_rebuking the ones speaking_against it.
   10 For many Are insubordinate, useless_talkers, and deceivers, most_of_all the ones of the circumcision, 11 whom it_is_fitting to_be_silencing, who are_overturning whole households, teaching the things not it_is_fitting, for_reason_of shameful gain.
   12 Someone Said of them, an_own prophet of_them: G‹ones_from_Krētē›G always are liars, evil wild_beasts, idle bellies.
   13 This testimony is true.
   For which cause be_rebuking them severely, in_order_that they_may_be_being_sound in the faith, 14 not giving_heed to_G‹Youdaiōns›G myths and the_commandments of_humans turning_away the truth.
   15 All things are pure to_the pure, but to_the ones having_been_defiled and unbelievers, nothing is pure, but both the mind, and conscience of_them has_been_defiled.
   16 They_are_confessing to_have_known god, but by_their works they_are_disowning him, being detestable and unpersuadable, and unqualified for any good work.
  Tit 2  You but be_speaking the things it_is_befitting to_being_sound teaching.
   2 The_older_men sober to_be, dignified, sensible, being_sound in_faith, in_love, in_endurance.
   3 The_older_women likewise in behavior reverent, not diabolical, not to_wine much having_been_enslaved, good_teaching, 4 in_order_that they_are_making_sensible the new women husband-loving to_be, children-loving, 5 sensible, pure, homemakers, good, being_subjected to_their own husbands, in_order_that not the word of_god may_be_being_slandered.
   6 The younger men likewise be_exhorting, to_be_being_sensible, 7 about all things yourself bringing_about an_example of_good works, in your teaching, incorruption, dignity, 8 speech healthy, irreproachable, in_order_that the man of contrary may_be_swayed, nothing having to_be_saying concerning us bad.
   9 Slaves to_their_own masters to_be_being_subjected in all things, well_pleasing to_be, not speaking_against, 10 not embezzling, but all faith displaying good, in_order_that the teaching of_the Rx-saviour-Rx of_us, god, they_may_be_adorning in all things.
   11 /Has/_appeared for the grace of_god, salvation to_all people, 12 instructing us that having_disowned ungodliness and worldly lusts, sensibly and justly, and devoutly, we_may_live in the present age, 13 waiting_for the blessed hope, and the_appearing of_the glory of_the great god and Rx-saviour-Rx of_us, G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, chosen_one/messiah 14 who gave himself for us, in_order_that he_may_redeem us from all lawlessness, and may_purify to_himself a_people chosen, zealous of_good works.
   15 These things be_speaking, and be_exhorting, and be_rebuking, with all command.
   No_one of_you let_be_disregarding.
  Tit 3  Be_reminding them to_rulers, to_authorities, to_be_being_subjected, to_be_yielding, for every work good ready to_be, 2 no_one to_be_slandering, peaceable to_be, gentle, all displaying gentleness toward all people.
   3 Were for once also we foolish, unpersuadable, being_strayed, serving in_lusts and gratifications various, in malice and envy going_by, hateful, hating one_another.
   4 When but the kindness and the love_of_mankind has_appeared of_the Rx-saviour-Rx of_us, god, 5 not by works in righteousness, that practiced we, but according_to the of_him mercy, he_saved us, through the_washing of_regeneration and renewal of_the_spirit holy, 6 whom he_poured_out on us richly, through G‹H‹Yēsous chosen_one, the Rx-saviour-Rx of_us, 7 in_order_that having_been_justified by_the of_that one grace, heirs we_may_be_become, according_to the_hope of_life eternal.
   8 Trustworthy is the saying, and concerning these things I_am_wishing you to_be_confirming: in_order_that may_be_caring of_good works to_be_leading, the ones having_believed in_god.
   These things is good and beneficial to_people.
   9 Foolish but debates, and genealogies, and strifes, and quarrels legal, be_avoiding, they_are for unprofitable and useless.
   10 A_sectarian person after one and a_second admonition be_refusing, 11 having_known that has_been_perverted such person and is_sinning, being self-condemned.
   12 Whenever I_may_send G‹Artemas›G to you or G‹Tuⱪikos›G, be_earnest to_come to me into G‹Nikopolis›G, there for I_have_judged to_winter.
   13 G‹Zēnas›G the lawyer and G‹Apollōs›G earnestly send_forward, in_order_that nothing to_them may_be_lacking.
   14 Let_be_learning and also our people of_good works to_be_leading for the necessary needs, in_order_that not they_may_be unfruitful.
   15 Are_greeting you the ones with me all.
   Greet the ones loving us in the_faith.
   grace be with all of_you_all.
  

USFM file created 2022-09-24 17:36 by extractVLT v0.50

The source table used to create this file is Copyright © 2022 by https://GreekCNTR.org

USFM file edited 2022-09-24 17:40 by ScriptedBibleEditor v0.14

G‹Filēmoni›G

1  G‹Paulos›G, a_prisoner of_chosen_one/messiah G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, and G‹Timotheos›G, our brother, to_G‹Filēmoni›G, the beloved and fellow-worker of_us, 2 and to_G‹Apfia›G, the sister, and to_G‹Arⱪippos›G, the fellow-soldier of_us, and to_the in the_house of_you assembly: 3 grace to_you_all and peace, from god father of_us and the_master G‹H‹Yēsous chosen_one.
   4 I_am_giving_thanks to_the god of_me always, mentioning of_you making in the prayers of_me, 5 hearing of_you the love and the faith, that you_are_having toward the master G‹H‹Yēsous, and toward all the holy ones, 6 so_that the fellowship of_the faith of_you, active may_become in the_knowledge of_every good thing in us toward chosen_one.
   7 For joy great I_had and exhortation, by the love of_you, because the hearts of_the holy ones has_been_refreshed by you, brother.
   8 Therefore, much in chosen_one boldness having, to_be_commanding to_you what is fitting, 9 because_of love rather I_am_exhorting you such being, as G‹Paulos›G (an_older_man and now also a_prisoner of_chosen_one G‹H‹Yēsous), 10 I_am_exhorting you for the of_mine child, whom I_bore in my bonds, G‹Onēsimos›G, 11 once to_you useless, but now to_you and to_me useful, 12 whom I_sent_up to_you him, this is my heart, 13 whom I was_wishing with myself to_be_keeping, in_order_that for you unto_me he_may_be_serving in the bonds of_the gospel, 14 but apart_from your opinion, nothing I_wanted to_do, in_order_that not as according_to necessity the good of_you may_be, but according_to willing.
   15 For possibly because_of this, he_was_separated for an_hour, in_order_that eternal him you_may_receive_fully, 16 no_longer as a_slave, but above a_slave, a_brother beloved, most_of_all to_me and how_much rather to_you, both in the_flesh and in the_master.
   17 Therefore if me you_are_having a_partner, receive him as me.
   18 But if anything he_did_wrong to_you or is_owing you, this to_me be_imputing.
   19 I G‹Paulos›G wrote it with_my /own/_hand, I will_be_paying_back it, in_order_that not I_may_be_saying to_you that even yourself to_me are_additionally_owing.
   20 Yes, brother, I from_you might_benefit in the_master, refresh of_me the heart in chosen_one.
   21 Having_persuaded by_the obedience of_you, I_wrote to_you, having_known that even above what I_am_saying, you_will_be_doing.
   22 And together also be_preparing for_me a_lodging, for I_am_hoping that through the prayers of_you_all, I_will_be_being_granted to_you_all.
   23 Is_greeting you G‹Epafras›G, fellow-prisoner of_me in chosen_one/messiah G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, 24 Rx-G‹Markos›G-Rx, G‹Aristarⱪos›G, G‹Dēmas›G, G‹Loukas›G, the fellow-workers of_me.
   25 The grace of_the master of_us, G‹H‹Yēsous chosen_one, with the spirit of_you_all be.
   Truly.
  

USFM file created 2022-09-24 17:36 by extractVLT v0.50

The source table used to create this file is Copyright © 2022 by https://GreekCNTR.org

USFM file edited 2022-09-24 17:40 by ScriptedBibleEditor v0.14

G‹Hebraios›G

1  Many_ways and many_ways long_ago, god, having_spoken to_the fathers in the prophets 2 in the_last days these, spoke to_us by his_son, whom he_appointed heir of_all things, through whom also he_made the ages, 3 who being the_radiance of_his glory and the_representation of_the reality of_him, and bearing the things all by_the word of_the power of_him, the_purification of_sins having_made, sat_down at the_right hand of_the majesty on high.
   4 ˱By˲_so_much better than having_become angels, to_as_much_as more_special beside them, he_has_inherited a_name.
   5 For to_which he_said once of_the angels: son of_me are you, I today have_bore you.
   And again: I will_be to_him for father, and he will_be to_me for son.
   6 And whenever again he_may_bring_in his firstborn into the inhabited_world, he_is_saying: and let_worship before_him all the_angels of_god.
   7 And to on_one_hand the angels he_is_saying: the one making the angels of_him spirits, and the ministers of_him of_fire a_flame, 8 on_the_other_hand to the son: the throne of_you, god, to the age of_the age, and the scepter of_righteousness is the_scepter of_the kingdom of_him.
   9 You_loved righteousness and you_hated lawlessness, because_of this, anointed you god, the god of_you, with_the_olive_oil of_exultation beyond the companions of_you.
   10 And: you in the_beginnings, master, the earth established, and works of_the hands of_you are the heavens.
   11 They will_be_perishing, but you are_continuing, and all like a_garment will_be_being_grown_old, 12 and as_if a_covering you_will_be_rolling_up them, like a_garment also they_will_be_being_changed, but you the same are, and the years of_you not will_be_failing.
   13 To but which of_the angels he_has_said once: be_sitting on the_right hand of_me, until I_may_set the enemies of_you, as_a_footstool for_the feet of_you.
   14 Not all they_are ministering spirits, for service being_sent_out, because_of the ones going to_be_inheriting salvation.
   Heb 2  Because_of this, it_is_fitting more_abundantly to_be_giving_heed us to_the things having_been_heard, lest we_may_drift_away.
   2 For if the by angels having_been_spoken word became confirmed, and every transgression and disobedience received a_just penalty, 3 how we will_be_escaping of_so_great having_neglected a_salvation.
   Which a_beginning having_received, to_be_being_spoken by the master, by the ones having_heard to us was_confirmed, 4 testifying_with them of_god by_signs jointly, and wonders, and various miracles, and of_the_spirit holy distributions, according_to the of_him will.
   5 For not to_angels he_subjected the inhabited_world coming, for which we_are_speaking.
   6 But testified somewhere someone saying: what is mankind, that you_are_remembering of_him, or the_son of_man, that you_are_noticing him.
   7 You_made_less him, little something than the_angels, with_glory and honor you_crowned him, 8 all things you_subjected beneath the feet of_him.
   For in that to_subject to_him the things all, nothing he_left to_him insubordinate.
   But now not_yet we_are_seeing to_him the things all having_been_subjected.
   9 But who little something than the_angels having_been_made_less, we_are_seeing G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, because_of the suffering of_death, with_glory and with_honor having_been_crowned, so_that by_the_grace of_god, for everyone he_may_taste of_death.
   10 For it_was_befitting to_him, for whom are the things all, and by whom are the things all, many sons to glory having_brought, the originator of_the salvation of_them, through sufferings to_perfect.
   11 The one for both sanctifying, and the ones being_sanctified, of one all are, for which cause, not he_is_being_ashamed brothers them to_be_calling 12 saying: I_will_be_reporting the name of_you to_the brothers of_me, in the_midst of_the_assembly I_will_be_singing_hymns to_you.
   13 And again: I will_be having_trusted in him.
   And again: see, I and the little_children, whom to_me gave god.
   14 Therefore because the little_children has_sharing of_blood and of_flesh, also he likewise partook of_the same things, in_order_that through his death, he_may_nullify the one the power holding of_death, this is the devil, 15 and may_release these, as_many_as by_fear of_death, through all the time to_be_living, liable were to_slavery.
   16 For not assuredly of_the_angels he_is_taking_hold, but of_the_seed of_G‹H‹Abra'am/('Avərāhām)›H›G he_is_taking_hold.
   17 Whence he_was_ought in all things to_his brothers to_be_likened, in_order_that a_merciful he_may_become and faithful chief_priest in_the things for god, in_order that to_be_being_made_atonement the sins of_the people.
   18 In for which has_suffered he having_been_tempted, he_is_able to_the ones being_tempted to_give_help.
  Heb 3  Whence, brothers holy of_the_calling heavenly, partakers, observe the ambassador and chief_priest of_the confession of_us, G‹H‹Yēsous, 2 faithful being to_the one having_established him, as also G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G in the house of_him.
   3 For of_more this one glory than G‹H‹Mōsēs he_has_been_considered_worthy, by as_much_as more honor than is_having the house itself, the one having_prepared it.
   4 For every house is_being_prepared by someone, but the one all things having_prepared is god.
   5 And G‹H‹Mōsēs on_one_hand faithful in all the house of_him, as a_server for a_testimony of_the things going_to_speak, 6 On_the_other_hand chosen_one/messiah as son over the house of_him, whose house are we, if our confidence and the boast of_our hope we_may_retain.
   7 Therefore as is_saying the spirit holy: today if of_the voice of_him you_all_may_hear, 8 not you_all_may_harden the hearts of_you_all, as in the rebellion, in the day of_trial, in the desert, 9 where tested me the fathers of_you_all by trial, and they_saw the works of_me, 10 for_forty years.
   Therefore I_was_angry with_generation this, and I_said: Always they_are_being_strayed in_their heart, and they not knew the ways of_me, 11 as I_swore in the severe_anger of_me: Never they_will_be_coming_in into the rest of_me.
   12 Be_watching_out, brothers, lest will_be in anyone of_you_all a_heart evil of_unbelief, in that to_withdraw from god the_living.
   13 But be_exhorting yourselves throughout each day, until of_which, today it_is_being_called, in_order_that not may_be_hardened someone of you_all by_the_seduction of_sin.
   14 For partakers of_the chosen_one we_have_become, if_indeed the beginning of_the assurance, until the_end confirmed we_may_retain.
   15 At the time to_be_being_said: today if of_the voice of_him you_all_may_hear, not you_all_may_harden the hearts of_you_all, as in the rebellion.
   16 For some having_heard rebelled.
   But not all the ones having_come_out out_of G‹H‹Aiguptos/(Miʦərayim)›H›G by G‹H‹Mōsēs.
   17 And with_whom_all he_was_angry for_forty years.
   Not was_it with_the ones having_sinned, of_whose corpses fell in the desert.
   18 And to_whom_all he_swore not going_to_be_coming_in into the rest of_him, except to_the ones having_disbelieved.
   19 And we_are_seeing that not they_were_able to_come_in because_of unbelief.
  Heb 4  Therefore we_may_be_afraid, lest being_left a_promise to_come_in into the rest of_him, may_be_supposing anyone of you_all to_have_falling_short.
   2 Also for we_are having_been_gospel_preached to_us just_as also_those, but not benefited the word of_their hearing those, not having_been_united_together with_faith to_the ones having_heard.
   3 for we_are_coming_in into the_rest, the ones having_believed, as he_has_said: as I_swore in the severe_anger of_me: Never they_will_be_coming_in into the rest of_me, and_yet his works from the_foundation of_the_world having_been_become.
   4 For he_has_spoken somewhere concerning the seventh day thus: and rested god on the day seventh from all the works of_him, 5 and in this again: never they_will_be_coming_in into the rest of_me.
   6 Therefore because it_is_being_retained for_some to_come_in into it, and the ones previously having_been_gospel_preached, not came_in because_of disbelief, 7 again a_certain is_designating day: today, by G‹H‹Dauid/(Dāvid)›H›G saying after so_much time, as has_been_previously_said: today if of_the voice of_him you_all_may_hear, not you_all_may_harden the hearts of_you_all.
   8 For if them G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G rested, not would about another he_was_speaking after these things day.
   9 Consequently is_being_retained a_sabbath_rest for_the people of_god.
   10 For the one having_come_in into the rest of_him, also he rested from the works of_him, as from his own works god did.
   11 Therefore we_may_be_earnest to_come_in into that rest, in_order_that lest by the same someone example may_fall of_disbelief.
   12 For living is the word of_god, and active, and sharper, beyond any sword double_edged, even penetrating until the_division of_soul and spirit, of_joints both and marrows, and able_to_judge of_the_thoughts and intentions of_the_heart.
   13 And no there_is creation hidden before him, but all things naked and having_been_exposed are to_the eyes of_him, with whom to_us is the account.
   14 Therefore having a_chief_priest great, having_passed_through the heavens, G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, the son of_god, we_may_be_taking_hold of_our confession.
   15 For not we_are_having a_chief_priest not being_able to_sympathize with_the weaknesses of_us, but having_been_tempted in all things by likeness without sin.
   16 Therefore we_may_be_approaching with boldness to_the throne of_grace, in_order_that we_may_receive mercy, and grace we_may_find, for opportune help.
  Heb 5  For every chief_priest from people being_taken for people is_being_appointed in_the things for god, in_order_that he_may_be_offering gifts and sacrifices for sins, 2 to_be_forbearing being_able with_the ones not_knowing and being_strayed, because also he is_being_encompassed with_weakness, 3 and because_of it he_ought, as for the people thus also for himself, to_be_offering for sins.
   4 And not on_himself anyone is_taking the honor, but being_called by god, just_as also G‹H‹A'arōn/('Aharon)›H›G.
   5 Thus also the chosen_one/messiah not himself glorified to_be_become a_chief_priest, but the one having_spoken to him: son of_me are you, I today have_bore you.
   6 As also in another he_is_saying: you are a_priest to the age according_to the order of_G‹H‹Melⱪisedek/(Maləkkī-ʦedeq)›H›G.
   7 Who in the days of_the flesh of_him, petitions both and supplications, to the one being_able to_be_saving him from death, with clamor mighty and tears having_offered, and having_been_listened_to from reverence.
   8 Although being a_son, he_learned from what things he_suffered obedience, 9 and having_been_perfected, he_became to_all the ones submitting to_him the_cause of_salvation eternal, 10 having_been_designated by god a_chief_priest according_to the order of_G‹H‹Melⱪisedek.
   11 Concerning whom much to_us speech, and hard_to_explain to_be_speaking, because sluggish you_all_have_become in_the hearing.
   12 For even ought to_be teachers because_of the time, again need you_all_are_having of_the one to_be_teaching you_all, someone the principles of_the beginning of_the oracles of_god, and you_all_have_become need having of_milk, not of_solid food.
   13 For everyone partaking of_milk is inexperienced in_the_word of_righteousness, for an_infant he_is.
   14 But for_the_mature is solid food, of_who because_of practice their senses having_been_trained, having for distinction, of_good both and evil.
  Heb 6  Therefore having_left the of_the beginning of_the chosen_one word, to perfection we _may_be_being_brought, not again a_foundation laying_down of_repentance from dead works, and faith in god, 2 of_washings teaching, and of_laying_on of_hands, and of_the_resurrection of_the_dead, and of_judgment eternal.
   3 And this we_will_be_doing, if_indeed may_be_permitting god.
   4 For impossible it_is the ones once having_been_enlightened, and having_tasted of_the gift heavenly, and partakers having_been_become of_the_spirit holy, 5 and the_good having_tasted of_god the_word, and the_powers of_the_coming age, 6 and having_fallen_away, again to_be_renewing them to repentance, impale_on_a_stakeing in_themselves the son of_god, and publicly_shaming him.
   7 For land having_drunk the on it coming often rain, and bearing vegetation suitable, for_those because_of whom also it_is_being_cultivated, is_partaking of_blessing from god, 8 but bringing_out thorns and thistles, unqualified is and a_curse near, of_which the end is to burning.
   9 But we_have_been_persuaded concerning you_all, beloved, of_the better things and having of_salvation, if even thus we_are_speaking.
   10 For not unrighteous is god, to_forget about_the work of_you_all, and of_the love which you_all_displayed toward the name of_him, having_served unto_the holy ones and serving.
   11 And we_are_desiring each of_you_all the same to_be_displaying earnestness, toward the full_assurance of_the hope until the_end, 12 in_order_that not sluggish you_all_may_become, but imitators of_the ones through faith and patience, inheriting the promises.
   13 For to_G‹H‹Abra'am/('Avərāhām)›H›G having_promised god, because by no_one he_was_having greater to_swear, he_swore by himself 14 saying: if surely blessing, I_will_be_blessing you, and multiplying, I_will_be_multiplying you.
   15 And thus having_been_patient, he_obtained by_the promise.
   16 For people by the greater one are_swearing, and of_all to_them controversy an_end is, for confirmation the oath given.
   17 In which more_abundantly wishing god to_show to_the heirs of_the promise, the unchangeable of_the counsel of_him, guaranteed it by_an_oath, 18 in_order_that by two matters unchangeable, in which impossible it_is to_lie for_god, strong exhortation we_may_be_having, having_taken_refuge to_take_hold_of of_the lying_before hope, 19 which as an_anchor we_are_having of_the soul, certain both and confirmed, and coming_in into the inner side of_the curtain, 20 where a_forerunner for us came_in, G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, according_to the order of_G‹H‹Melⱪisedek/(Maləkkī-ʦedeq)›H›G, a_chief_priest having_become to the age.
  Heb 7  For this G‹H‹Melⱪisedek, king of_G‹H‹Salēm/(Shālēm)›H›G, priest of_god the highest, who having_met with_G‹H‹Abra'am returning from the slaughter of_the kings, and having_blessed him, 2 to_whom also a_tenth of everything allotted G‹H‹Abra'am, first on_one_hand being_translated king of_righteousness, on_the_other_hand then also king of_G‹H‹Salēm, which is: king of_peace, 3 fatherless, motherless, without_genealogy, neither beginning of_days, nor of_life end having, but having_been_likened to_the son of_god, he_is_remaining a_priest in continual.
   4 And be_observing how_great is this one, to_whom a_tenth G‹H‹Abra'am, gave out_of the best_spoils, the patriarch.
   5 And the ones on_one_hand from the sons of_Rx-G‹H‹Leui/(Lēvī)›H›G-Rx the priestly_office receiving, a_commandment are_having to_be_tithing the people according_to the law, this is the brothers of_them, although having_come_out out_of the loin of_G‹H‹Abra'am, 6 on_the_other_hand the one not being_traced from them, has_tithed G‹H‹Abra'am, and the one having the promises, he_has_blessed.
   7 But apart_from from_all controversy, the lessor by the better is_being_blessed.
   8 And here on_one_hand tithes dying_off people are_receiving, on_the_other_hand there being_attested that he_is_living.
   9 And as so_to_speak to_say, through G‹H‹Abra'am/('Avərāhām)›H›G, even Rx-G‹H‹Leui/(Lēvī)›H›G-Rx, the one tithes receiving, has_been_tithed.
   10 For still in the loin of_his father he_was, when met with_him G‹H‹Melⱪisedek.
   11 If therefore indeed perfection by the G‹H‹Leuitēs/(from_tribe_of_Lēvī)›H›G priesthood was, the for people on it has_been_legislated, what still need was_there according_to the order of_G‹H‹Melⱪisedek, for_another to_be_rising_up priest, and not according_to the order of_G‹H‹A'arōn/('Aharon)›H›G to_be_being_called.
   12 For being_replaced the priesthood, from necessity also of_law a_changing is_becoming.
   13 With for whom is_being_said these things, of_tribe another has_partaken, from which no_one served at_the altar.
   14 For quite_evident it_is, that out_of G‹H‹Youda/(Yəhūdāh)›H›G has_risen the master of_us, for which a_tribe concerning priests nothing G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G spoke.
   15 And more_abundant still very_evident it_is, if according_to the likeness of_G‹H‹Melⱪisedek/(Maləkkī-ʦedeq)›H›G, is_rising_up priest another, 16 who not according_to the_law of_a_commandment fleshy has_become, but according_to the_power of_a_life indestructible.
   17 For it_is_being_testified, you are a_priest to the age according_to the order of_G‹H‹Melⱪisedek.
   18 An_annulment for on_one_hand is_becoming of_going_before the_commandment, because_of the of_it weak and unprofitable, 19 (for nothing perfected the law), on_the_other_hand the_introduction of_a_better hope, by which we_are_nearing to_god.
   20 And to as_much_as not apart_from oath, the ones for on_one_hand without an_oath are priests having_become, 21 on_the_other_hand the one with an_oath by the one saying to him: swore the_master, and not will_be_being_regretful: You are a_priest for the age, 22 by so_much also of_a_better covenant, has_become the_guarantee, G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G.
   23 And the ones on_one_hand more are having_become priests, because_of that by_death to_be_being_forbidden to_be_continuing_with, 24 on_the_other_hand the one because_of that to_be_remaining him for the age, permanent is_holding the priesthood.
   25 Whence even to_be_saving to the full_extent he_is_able, the ones approaching through him to_god, always living in_order that to_be_pleading for them.
   26 For such for_us also was_befitting a_chief_priest, devout, innocent, undefiled, having_been_separated from sinners, and higher than the heavens having_become, 27 who not is_having in_every day necessity, as the chief_priests, previously for his own sins sacrifices to_be_offering_up, then for_the sins of_the people, for this he_did once_for_all, himself having_offered_up.
   28 The for law men is_appointing as_chief_priests having weakness, the but word of_the oath, which is after the law, a_son, for the age having_been_perfected.
  Heb 8  And the_point in the things being_spoken: such we_are_having a_chief_priest, who sat_down on the_right of_the throne of_the majesty in the heavens, 2 of_the holy places a_minister and of_the tabernacle true, which pitched the master, not humans.
   3 For every chief_priest in_order that to_be_offering, gifts both and sacrifices is_being_appointed, whence it_is necessary to_be_having something also for_this one that he_may_offer.
   4 If on_one_hand therefore he_was on earth, not_even he_was a_priest, being offering according_to law the gifts, 5 who for_a_copy and shadow are_serving of_the heavenly realms, as has_been_warned G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G, going to_be_accomplishing the for: tabernacle, be_seeing he_is_saying: you_will_be_making all things according_to the pattern having_been_shown to_you in the mountain.
   6 On_the_other_hand now of_a_more_special he_has_obtained ministry, by_as_much_as also of_a_better is covenant the_mediator, which on better promises has_been_legislated.
   7 For if first covenant that was blameless, not would for_a_second was_being_sought place.
   8 For blaming to_them he_is_saying: see, the_days are_coming, is_saying the_master, and I_will_be_accomplishing, with the house of_Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx, and with the house of_G‹H‹Youda/(Yəhūdāh)›H›G, a_covenant new, 9 not according_to the covenant that I_made with_the fathers of_them, in the_day of_having_taken_hold of_me by_the hand of_them, to_lead_out them out_of the_land of_G‹H‹Aiguptos/(Miʦərayim)›H›G, because they not remained_in in the covenant of_me, and_I neglected of_them, is_saying the_master.
   10 Because this is the covenant, which I_will_be_covenanting with_the house of_Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx after days those, is_saying the_master, giving laws of_me into the mind of_them, and on the_hearts of_them I_will_be_writing them, and I_will_be to_them for god, and they will_be to_me for people.
   11 And by_no_means not they_may_teach each the citizen of_him, and each the brother of_him saying: Know the the_master, because all will_be_knowing me, from the_little to great of_them.
   12 Because merciful I_will_be to_the unrighteousness of_them, and of_the sins of_them by_no_means not I_may_be_reminded more.
   13 In that to_be_saying: New, he_has_grown_old the first.
   But the thing being_grown_old and aging is near disappearance.
  Heb 9  /Was/_having therefore indeed the first covenant just_acts of_sacred_service, and the holy place earthly.
   2 For a_tabernacle was_prepared the first room, in which were the both lampstand and the table, and the presence of_the bread, which is_being_called the_holy place.
   3 And after the second curtain was a_tabernacle, being_called the_holy of_holies, 4 the_golden having incense_altar and the ark of_the covenant, having_been_covered_around on_every_side with_gold, in which jar golden having the manna, and the staff of_G‹H‹A'arōn/('Aharon)›H›G having_sprouted, and the tablets of_the covenant.
   5 And above it, heavenly_beingss of_glory overshadowing the mercy_seat, concerning which not it_is now to_be_speaking in part.
   6 And these things thus having_been_prepared, into on_one_hand the first tabernacle room, through everything are_entering the priests, the sacred_services accomplishing, 7 on_the_other_hand into the second, once in_the year only the chief_priest goes, not without blood, which he_is_offering for himself and the of_the people sins_of_ignorance.
   8 This making_evident the spirit holy is, ˱that˲_not_yet to_have_revealed the of_the holy places way, still of_the first tabernacle room having standing, 9 which is a_parable for the time having_presented, in which gifts both and sacrifices are_being_offered, not being_able concerning conscience to_perfect the one serving, 10 only in foods, and drinks, and special washings, just_acts of_the_flesh, until the_time of_reformation imposing.
   11 But chosen_one/messiah having_appeared as_chief_priest, of_the having_become good things, by the greater and more_perfect tabernacle, neither of_handmade this is, not of_this creation, 12 nor by blood of_goats and calves, but through his own blood, he_came_in once_for_all into the holy places, eternal redemption having_found.
   13 For if the blood of_goats, and bulls, and the_ashes of_a_heifer, sprinkling the ones having_been_defiled, is_sanctifying them for the of_the flesh purification, 14 by_how_much more the blood of_the chosen_one, who through the_spirit eternal, himself offered blameless to_god, will_be_purifying the conscience of_you_all from dead works, in_order that to_be_offering_divine_service unto_god the_living.
   15 And because_of this, of_a_covenant new the_mediator he_is, so_that death having_become for the_redemption of_the concerning the first covenant transgressions, the promise may_receive the ones having_been_called of_the eternal inheritance.
   16 For where a_covenant there_is, the_death necessity there_is to_be_being_brought of_the one having_covenanted it.
   17 For a_covenant with dead bodies confirmed is, because never it_is_being_effective, when is_living the one having_covenanted it.
   18 Whence neither the first covenant apart_from blood has_been_dedicated.
   19 For having_been_spoken every commandment according_to the law by G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G to_all the people, having_taken the blood of_calves, and of_goats, with water, and wool scarlet, and hyssop, itself both the scroll and all the people, he_sprinkled 20 saying: this the blood of_the covenant, which commanded toward you_all god.
   21 Both the and, tabernacle, and all the vessels of_the ministry, with_the blood likewise he_sprinkled.
   22 And almost by blood all things is_being_cleansed according_to the law, and apart_from bloodshed, not is_becoming forgiveness.
   23 Therefore necessity it_was the on_one_hand copies of_the things in the heavens with_these to_be_being_purified, on_the_other_hand themselves the heavenly things with_better sacrifices than these.
   24 For not into handmade came_in holy places chosen_one, representatives of_the true, but into itself heaven, now to_be_manifested in_the presence of_god for us.
   25 Neither in_order_that often he_may_be_offering himself, as the chief_priest is_coming_in into the holy places in_every year with blood another's, 26 otherwise it_was_fitting him often to_suffer from the_foundation of_the_world.
   But now once in the_completion of_the ages, for the_annulment of_sin by the sacrifice of_him he_has_been_revealed.
   27 And in as_much_as it_is_laid_away to_people once to_die_off, and after this judgment, 28 thus also the chosen_one/messiah once having_been_offered in_order that of_many to_offer_up the_sins, out_of a_second time apart_from sin will_be_being_seen to_the ones him eagerly_waiting for salvation.
  Heb 10  For a_shadow having the law of_the coming good things, not itself the image of_the matters, in_every year with_the same sacrifices, which they_are_offering to continual, never are_being_able the ones approaching to_perfect.
   2 Because not would they_ceased being_offered, because_of that not_one to_be_having anymore conscience of_sins, the ones serving once having_been_cleansed.
   3 But in them there_is a_remembrance of_sins in_every year.
   4 For impossible it_is for_the_blood of_goats and of_bulls to_be_taking_away sins.
   5 Therefore coming_in into the world, he_is_saying: sacrifice and offering not you_wanted, but a_body you_prepared for_me.
   6 Whole_burnt_offerings and sacrifices for sin not you_took_pleasure.
   7 Then I_said: See I_am_coming (in the_scroll of_the_scroll it_has_been_written concerning me) to_do god the will of_you.
   8 Earlier saying, sacrifices, and offerings, and whole_burnt_offerings, and offerings for sin, neither you_wanted, nor you_took_pleasure (which according_to law are_being_offered), 9 then he_has_said: see, I_am_coming to_do the will of_you.
   He_is_killing the first covenant, in_order_that the second he_may_establish.
   10 By that will, having_been_sanctified we_are through the offering of_the body of_G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G chosen_one once_for_all.
   11 And every indeed priest has_stood in_every day ministering, and the same often offering sacrifices, which never are_being_able to_take_away sins.
   12 But this one one for sins having_offered sacrifice, in continual: sat_down at the_right hand of_god, 13 for_the rest, awaiting until may_be_put the enemies of_him a_footstool for_the feet of_him.
   14 For by_one offering, he_has_perfected for continual the ones being_sanctified.
   15 And is_testifying to_us also the spirit holy, for after to_have_said, 16 this is the covenant which I_will_be_covenanting with them after days those, is_saying the_master, giving the_laws of_me in the_hearts of_them, also in the mind of_them I_will_be_inscribing them… 17 and of_the sins of_them, and of_the lawlessness of_them, no not I_will_be_being_reminded anymore.
   18 And where forgiveness of_these is, no_longer there_is an_offering for sin.
   19 Therefore having, brothers, confidence for the entrance of_the holy places by the blood of_G‹H‹Yēsous, 20 which he_dedicated for_us a_way recent and living through the curtain, this is of_the flesh of_him, 21 and a_priest great over the house of_god, 22 we_may_be_approaching with a_true heart in full_assurance of_faith, having_been_sprinkled our hearts from a_conscience evil, and having_been_washed our body with_water pure.
   23 We_may_be_retaining the confession of_our hope unwavering, for faithful is the one having_promised, 24 and we_may_be_observing one_another toward provocation to_love and to_good works, 25 not abandoning the gathering_together of_ourselves, as the_custom with_some, but exhorting also by_so_much more, with_as_much_as you_all_are_seeing nearing the day.
   26 For willingly sinning of_us after the time to_receive the knowledge of_the truth, no_longer for sins is_being_retained a_sacrifice, 27 but fearful a_certain expectation of_judgment, and of_fire fury to_be_consuming going the hostiles.
   28 Having_rejecting anyone the_law of_G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G without two compassions by or three witnesses is_dying_off.
   29 ˱By˲_how_much it_is_being_supposed of_worse he_will_be_being_considered_worthy punishment, the one the son of_god having_trampled, and the blood of_the covenant common having_considered, by which he_was_sanctified, and the spirit of_grace having_insulted.
   30 For we_have_known the one having_said: to_me vengeance is, I will_be_repaying, and again: will_be_judging the_master the people of_him.
   31 A_fearful thing to_fall_in into the_hands of_god the_living it_is.
   32 But be_being_reminded of_the earlier days, in which having_been_enlightened a_great competition endured of_sufferings, 33 this on_one_hand by_derisions both and tribulations being_publicly_exposed, on_the_other_hand this partners of_the ones thus being_conducted them having_been_become.
   34 For both with_the prisoners you_all_sympathized, and the theft of_the things possessing of_you_all with joy you_all_accepted, knowing to_be_having yourselves a_better possession, and remaining.
   35 Not therefore you_all_may_throw_away the boldness of_you_all, which is_having a_great reward.
   36 For of_endurance you_all_are_having need, in_order_that the will of_god having_done, you_all_may_receive_back the promise.
   37 For still little as_much_as, as_much_as the one coming will_be_coming, and not will_be_delaying.
   38 And the righteous one of_me by faith will_be_living, and if he_may_shrink_back, not is_taking_pleasure the soul of_me in him.
   39 But we not are of_shrinking_back to destruction, but of_faith to the_procuring of_the_soul.
  Heb 11  And is faith of_being_hoped things the_assurance, of_matters the_conviction not being_seen.
   2 In for this were_attested the elders.
   3 ˱By˲_faith we_are_understanding to_have_prepared the ages by_the_word of_god, for which not from things being_seen, the thing being_seen to_have_become.
   4 ˱By˲_faith a_more excellent sacrifice, G‹H‹Abel/(Hevel)›H›G than Rx-G‹H‹Kain/(Qayin)›H›G-Rx offered to_god, through which he_was_attested to_be righteous, testifying to the gifts of_him to_god, and through it, having_died_off still he_is_speaking.
   5 ˱By˲_faith G‹H‹Enōⱪ/(Ḩanōkə)›H›G was_translated, not to_see death: and not was_being_found, because translated him god, for before the changing, he_has_been_attested to_have_pleased to_god.
   6 And without faith, impossible it_is to_please him, for to_believe it_is_fitting the one approaching to_god that he_is, and to_the ones seeking_out him, a_rewarder is_becoming.
   7 ˱By˲_faith having_been_warned, G‹H‹Nōe/(Noḩa)›H›G, concerning the things not_yet being_seen, having_been_devout, prepared an_ark for the_salvation of_the household of_him, by which he_condemned the world, and of_the according_to faith righteousness, became heir.
   8 ˱By˲_faith being_called, G‹H‹Abra'am/('Avərāhām)›H›G, submitted to_come_out into a_place that he_was_going to_be_receiving for an_inheritance, and came_out not knowing where he_is_coming.
   9 ˱By˲_faith he_sojourned in the_land of_the promise as a_stranger, in tents having_dwelt with G‹H‹Isa'ak/(Yiʦəḩāq)›H›G and G‹H‹Yakōb/(Ya'aqov)›H›G, the fellow-heirs of_the promise same, 10 for he_was_awaiting the foundations having city, of_which the_craftsman and builder is god.
   11 ˱By˲_faith even herself G‹H‹Sarra/(Sārāh)›H›G power for the_conception of_seed received, also beyond time of_age, because faithful she_considered the one having_promised.
   12 Therefore also from one man they_were_become, and these having_been_made_dead: as the stars of_the sky in_multitude, and as the sand, by the lip of_the sea, the innumerable.
   13 In faith died_off these all, not having_accepted the promises, but from_afar them having_seen, and having_greeted, and having_confessed, that strangers and aliens they_are on the earth.
   14 For the ones such things saying, are_manifesting that a_homeland they_are_seeking_after.
   15 And if on_one_hand of_that they_are_remembering from which they_walked_out, they_were_having would time to_return.
   16 On_the_other_hand now of_a_better homeland they_are_aspiring, this is of_a_heavenly homeland.
   Therefore not is_being_ashamed of_them god, god to_be_being_called of_them, for he_prepared for_them a_city.
   17 ˱By˲_faith has_offered G‹H‹Abra'am G‹H‹Isa'ak being_tested, and his only_begotten was_offering, the one the promises having_accepted, 18 to whom it_was_spoken, in G‹H‹Isa'ak will_be_being_named to_you descendants, 19 having_reckoned that even from the_dead to_be_raising him powerful was god, whence him also in a_parable he_received_back.
   20 ˱By˲_faith also concerning coming things, blessed G‹H‹Isa'ak, G‹H‹Yakōb, and G‹H‹Ēsau/('Ēsāv)›H›G.
   21 ˱By˲_faith G‹H‹Yakōb, dying_off, each of_the sons of_G‹H‹Yōsēf/(Yōşēf)›H›G blessed, and worshipped on the extremity of_the staff of_him.
   22 ˱By˲_faith G‹H‹Yōsēf, dying, concerning the exodus of_the sons of_Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx remembered, and concerning the bones of_him commanded.
   23 ˱By˲_faith G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G, having_been_born, was_hidden for_three_month by the fathers of_him, because they_saw beautiful the little_child was, and not they_were_afraid of_the edict of_the king.
   24 ˱By˲_faith G‹H‹Mōsēs, great having_become, disowned to_be_being_called the_son of_the_daughter of_G‹H‹Faraō/(Farə'oh)›H›G, 25 rather having_chosen to_be_suffering_hardship_with with_the people of_god, than the_temporary to_be_having of_sin enjoyment, 26 greater riches than having_considered the of_G‹H‹Aiguptos/(Miʦərayim)›H›G treasures, the derision of_the chosen_one/messiah, for he_was_looking toward the reward.
   27 ˱By˲_faith he_was_leaving G‹H‹Aiguptos, not having_been_afraid of_the rage of_the king, for the invisible one as seeing, he_endured.
   28 ˱By˲_faith he_has_made the passover_feast and the sprinkling of_the blood, in_order_that not the one destroying the firstborn may_touch of_them.
   29 ˱By˲_faith they_passed_through the Red Sea, as through dry land, of_which a_trial having_taken, the G‹H‹from_Aiguptos/(Miʦərayim)›H›Gs were_swallowed_up.
   30 ˱By˲_faith the walls of_G‹H‹Yeriⱪō/(Yərīḩō)›H›G fell, having_been_surrounded for seven days.
   31 ˱By˲_faith G‹H‹Ɽaⱪab/(Rāḩāv)›H›G the prostitute not perished_with with_the ones having_disbelieved, having_received the spies with peace.
   32 And what more I_may_be_saying.
   Will_be_failing for me describing the time, concerning G‹H‹Gedeōn/(Gidə'ōn)›H›G, G‹H‹Barak/(Bārāq)›H›G, G‹H‹Sampsōn/(Shiməshvn)›H›G, G‹H‹Yefthae/(Yifəttāḩ)›H›G, G‹H‹Dauid/(Dāvid)›H›G both and G‹H‹Samouēl/(Shəmū'ēl)›H›G, and the prophets, 33 who by faith conquered kingdoms, did righteousness, obtained by_promises, shut the_mouths of_lions, 34 extinguished the_power of_fire, escaped the_mouths of_the_sword, were_enabled from weakness, were_become mighty in war, the_armies routed of_strangers.
   35 They_received back women by resurrection the dead of_them, and others were_tortured, not having_accepted their redemption, in_order_that of_a_better resurrection they_may_obtain, 36 and others of_mockings and of_floggings trial received, and still of_bonds and prison.
   37 They_were_stoned, they_were_sawn, they_were_tempted, by murder of_the_sword they_died_off, they_went_around in sheepskins, in goat skins, being_deficient, being_oppressed, being_mistreated, 38 of_whom not was worthy the world, in deserts being_strayed, and mountains, and caves, and holes of_the earth.
   39 And these all having_been_attested through their faith, not they_received_back the promise, 40 of_god for us better thing some having_foreseen, in_order_that not apart_from us they_may_be_perfected.
  Heb 12  So_then also we, so_much having encompassing around_us a_cloud of_witnesses, burden having_put_away every and the well_encompassing sin through endurance, may_be_running the lying_before before_us race, 2 looking_out to the of_our faith originator and perfecter, G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, who for the lying_before before_him joy, endured the_cross, of_its_shame having_despised: at and of_the throne of_god the_right hand has_sat_down.
   3 For consider the one such having_endured by sinners against themselves controversy, in_order_that not you_all_may_falter, in_the souls of_you_all being_exhausted.
   4 Not_yet unto blood you_all_stood_against, against sin struggling, 5 and you_all_have_forgotten of_the exhortation, which to_you_all as to_sons is_discussing: son of_me, neither be_regarding_lightly of_the_discipline of_the_master, nor be_being_exhausted by him being_rebuked, 6 for whom is_loving the_master, he_is_disciplining, and he_is_chastising every son whom he_is_accepting.
   7 For discipline you_all_are_enduring, as with_sons with_you_all is_being_disciplined god, for what son is whom not is_disciplining his_father.
   8 But if without you_all_are discipline, of_which partakers have_become all, consequently bastard and not sons you_all_are.
   9 Thereafter the indeed of_the flesh of_us fathers we_were_having as_instructors, and we_swayed, not much rather we_will_be_being_subjected to_the father of_spirits, and we_will_be_living.
   10 The ones for on_one_hand for little days according_to the thing supposing to_them were_disciplining us, on_the_other_hand the one for the thing benefitting, in_order that to_partake of_the holiness of_him.
   11 All but discipline for on_one_hand the things being_present, not is_supposing of_joy to_be, but of_sorrow, on_the_other_hand later the_fruit peaceable to_the ones by it having_been_trained is_giving_back of_righteousness.
   12 Therefore your having_been_weakened hands, and your having_been_paralyzed knees, restore, 13 and paths straight be_making for_the feet of_you_all, in_order_that not the lame may_be_turning_away, but may_be_healed rather.
   14 Peace be_pursuing with all, and holiness, which without no_one will_be_seeing the master.
   15 Overseeing lest anyone falling_short from the grace of_god, lest any root of_bitterness upward sprouting may_be_troubling, and by it may_be_defiled the many, 16 lest any sexually_immoral or profane one, as G‹H‹Ēsau/('Ēsāv)›H›G, who for one food, was_given_back the birthright of_himself.
   17 for you_all_have_known that also afterward wanting to_inherit the blessing, he_was_rejected, for of_repentance place not he_found, although with tears having_sought_out it.
   18 For not you_all_have_approached, being_touched and having_been_burned with_fire, and to_darkness, and to_darkness, and to_whirlwind, 19 and of_a_trumpet to_the_sound, and to_a_voice of_words, which the ones having_heard, excused not to_be_added to_them the_word, 20 not for they_were_bearing the thing being_instructing: even_if a_wild_beast may_touch of_the mountain, it_will_be_being_stoned, 21 and thus fearful was the thing being_manifested, ˱that˲_G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G said: terrified I_am and trembling.
   22 But you_all_have_approached to_G‹H‹Siōn/(Tsiuōn)›H›G Mount and the_city of_god the_living, the_G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G heavenly, and to_myriads of_angels to_the_assembly, 23 and to_the_assembly of_the_firstborn, having_been_registered in the_heavens, and to_the_judge god of_all, and to_the_spirits of_the_righteous ones having_been_perfected, 24 and of_a_covenant new to_the_mediator, G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, and to_the_blood of_sprinkling, a_better thing speaking than G‹H‹Abel/(Hevel)›H›G.
   25 Be_watching_out, lest you_all_may_refuse the one speaking.
   For if those not escaped_out on earth, having_refused the one warning them, much rather we the ones the one from the_heavens turning_away, 26 of_whose voice the earth shook then, but now he_has_promised saying: still once more I will_be_shaking, not only the earth, but also heaven.
   27 And the phrase: still once more, is_making_evident the of_the things being_shaken changing, as those having_been_made, in_order_that may_remain the things not being_shaken.
   28 Therefore a_kingdom unshakeable receiving, we_may_be_having grace, by which we_may_be_serving pleasingly for_god with reverence and reverence.
   29 For also the god of_us is a_fire consuming.
  Heb 13  brotherly_love let_be_remaining.
   2 of_hospitality not be_forgetting, through for this, escaped_notice some having_lodged angels.
   3 Be_remembering of_the prisoners, as having_been_bound_with them, the ones being_mistreated as also yourselves being in the_body.
   4 Honored is wedding in all and the bed be undefiled, the_sexually_immoral for and adulterers will_be_judging god.
   5 Ungreedy your manner, being_sufficed with_the things being_present, for he has_said: by_no_means not you I_may_give_up, nor by_no_means not you I_may_abandon.
   6 So_as having_confidence us to_be_saying: the_master is to_me helper, and not I_will_be_being_afraid, what will_be_doing to_me a_human.
   7 Be_remembering about_the ones leading of_you_all, who spoke to_you_all the word of_god, of_whom observing the outcome of_their conduct, be_imitating their faith.
   8 G‹H‹Yēsous chosen_one/messiah, yesterday and today, the same is, and to the ages.
   9 ˱By˲_teachings various and strange, not be_being_carried_away, for good it_is by_grace to_be_being_confirmed the heart, not with_foods, in which not were_benefited the ones walking.
   10 We_are_having an_altar, from which to_eat not are_having the_right, the ones in_the tabernacle serving.
   11 For of_what is_being_carried_in of_animals the blood for sin into the holy places by the chief_priest, of_these the bodies is_being_burned_up outside the camp.
   12 Therefore also G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, in_order_that he_may_sanctify by his own blood the people, outside the gate of_the camp suffered.
   13 So_now we_may_be_coming_out to him outside the camp, the derision of_him bearing.
   14 For not we_are_having here remaining a_city, but the city coming we_are_seeking_after.
   15 Through him therefore we_may_be_offering_up the_sacrifice of_praise through all to_god, this is the_fruit of_the_lips confessing to_the name of_him.
   16 and of_the_good_deed and of_fellowship not be_forgetting, for with_such sacrifices is_being_pleased god.
   17 Be_being_persuaded by_the ones leading of_you_all, and be_yielding, for they are_watching for the souls of_you_all, as an_account going_to_give_back, in_order_that with joy this they_may_be_doing, and not groaning, for unprofitable for_you_all this would_be.
   18 Be_praying for us, for we_are_being_persuaded that a_good conscience we_are_having, in all things well wanting to_be_being_conducted.
   19 And more_abundantly I_am_exhorting you this to_do, in_order_that more_quickly I_may_be_restored to_you_all.
   20 And the god of_peace, the one having_brought_up from the_dead the Shepherd of_the sheep great, by the_blood of_the_covenant eternal, the master of_us, G‹H‹Yēsous, 21 might_prepare you_all in every good thing, in_order that to_do the will of_him, to_him, doing in us what is well_pleasing before him, through G‹H‹Yēsous chosen_one, to_whom be the glory to the ages of_the ages.
   Truly.
   22 But I_am_exhorting you_all, brothers, be_tolerating of_my word of_exhortation, for also through of_little I_wrote to_you_all.
   23 You_all_are_knowing the brother of_us, G‹Timotheos›G, having_been_sent_away, with whom if more_quickly he_may_be_coming, I_will_be_seeing you_all.
   24 Greet all the ones leading of_you_all, and all the holy ones.
   Are_greeting you_all the ones from G‹Italia›G.
   25 grace be with all of_you_all.
   Truly.
