USFM file edited 2022-09-24 17:40 by ScriptedBibleEditor v0.14

Rx-G‹H‹Youdas/(Yəhūdāh)›H›G-Rx

1  Rx-G‹H‹Youdas/(Yəhūdāh)›H›G-Rx, slave of_G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G chosen_one/messiah, and brother of_G‹H‹Yakōbos/(Ya'aqov)›H›G, to_the ones called having_been_loved by god the_father, and having_been_kept in_G‹H‹Yēsous chosen_one: 2 mercy to_you_all, and peace, and might_have_multiplied love.
   3 Beloved, making all earnestness to_be_writing to_you_all concerning the common salvation of_us, I_had necessity to_write to_you_all, exhorting you to_be_contending for_the faith having_been_given_over once to_the holy ones.
   4 For some people sneaked_in long_ago having_been_previously_written for this judgment, ungodly ones, replacing the grace of_the god of_us into wantonness, and disowning the only master and master of_us, G‹H‹Yēsous chosen_one.
   5 And to_remind you_all I_am_wishing, having_perceived you_all once all things, that G‹H‹Yēsous having_saved a_people out_of the_land of_G‹H‹Aiguptos/(Miʦərayim)›H›G, in_the second place destroyed the ones not having_believed.
   6 And the_angels not having_kept the rule of_themselves, but having_left_behind their own dwelling, has_kept in_ eternal _bonds under darkness to the_judgment of_the_great day.
   7 As G‹H‹Sodoma/(Şədom)›H›G and G‹H‹Gomorra/('Amorāh)›H›G, and the cities around them, having_fornicated in_a_similar manner to_these, and having_gone_away after different flesh, they_are_lying_before an_example of_ the_justice undergoing eternal _fire.
   8 Likewise however also these dreaming ones, are_defiling the_flesh on_one_hand, on_the_other_hand they_are_rejecting mastership, on_the_other_hand they_are_slandering glories.
   9 But G‹H‹Miⱪaēl/(Mīkā'ēl)›H›G the archangel, when disputing with_the devil, was_discussing about the body of_G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G, dared not to_bring_ a_judgment of_slander _against, but said, the_master might_give_rebuke to_you.
   10 But these as_much_as on_one_hand they_have_ not _known they_are_slandering, on_the_other_hand as_much_as naturally as illogical animals are_understanding, they_are_being_corrupted in these things.
   11 Woe to_them.
   Because they_were_gone in_the way of_Rx-G‹H‹Kain/(Qayin)›H›G-Rx, and they_were_poured_out to_the deception of_G‹H‹Bala'am/(Bilə'ām)›H›G for_reward, and in_the controversy of_Rx-G‹H‹Kore/(Qoraḩ)›H›G-Rx they_perished.
   12 These are the ones in the love_feasts of_you_all, stains fearlessly feasting_with, shepherding themselves, waterless clouds being_carried_away by of_winds, unfruitful late_autumn trees having_died_off twice having_been_uprooted, 13 wild waves of_the_sea foaming_out the shame of_themselves, wandering stars, to_whom the darkness of_darkness has_been_kept to the_age.
   14 And G‹H‹Enōⱪ/(Ḩanōkə)›H›G the_seventh from G‹H‹Adam/('Ādām)›H›G prophesied also to_these, saying: see, the_master came among holy myriads of_him, 15 to_execute judgment against all, and to_rebuke all the ungodly concerning all their works of_ungodliness of_them, which they_acted_ungodly, and concerning all the hard things, of_which ungodly sinners spoke against him.
   16 These are grumblings complaining, following according_to the lusts of_them, and the mouth of_them is_speaking arrogant words, Rx-marvelling-Rx people for_reason_of benefit.
   17 But you_all, beloved, be_reminded of_the words having_been_previously_spoken by the ambassadors of_the master of_us, G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G chosen_one/messiah, 18 that they_were_saying to_you_all: in the_last time will_be mockers following according_to the of_ungodliness lusts of_themselves.
   19 These are the ones dividing, soulish, not having the_spirit.
   20 But you_all beloved, building_ yourselves _up.
   in_the holiest faith of_you_all, praying in the_ holy _spirit.
   21 We_may_keep yourselves in the_love of_god, waiting_for the mercy of_the master of_us, G‹H‹Yēsous chosen_one, to eternal life.
   22 And on_one_hand be_showing_mercy to_some doubting, 23 some be_saving on_the_other_hand snatching out_of the_fire, and be_showing_mercy to_some with fear, hating even the clothes having_been_stained by the flesh.
   24 And to_the_ infallible _one being_able to_keep you_all, and to_stand blameless in_front_of the glory of_him, with exultation, 25 to_the_only god Rx-saviour-Rx of_us, through G‹H‹Yēsous chosen_one the master of_us, glory, majesty, dominion, and authority, before all the age, and now, and to all the ages.
   Truly.
  

USFM file created 2022-09-24 17:36 by extractVLT v0.50

The source table used to create this file is Copyright © 2022 by https://GreekCNTR.org

USFM file edited 2022-09-24 17:40 by ScriptedBibleEditor v0.14

Revelation

1  The_revelation of_G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G chosen_one/messiah, which gave to_him god, to_show to_the slaves of_him, what things it_is_fitting to_become in quickness, and he_signified it, having_sent_out through the angel of_him to_the slave of_him, G‹Yōannēs›G, 2 who testified the word of_god, and the testimony of_G‹H‹Yēsous chosen_one, as_much_as he_saw.
   3 Blessed is the one reading and the ones hearing the words of_the prophecy, and keeping the things in it having_been_written, for the the_time is near.
   4 Seven G‹Yōannēs›G to_the assemblies in G‹Asia›G: grace to_you_all and peace, from the one being, and who was, and who coming, and from the seven spirits, who are before the throne of_him, 5 and from G‹H‹Yēsous chosen_one, the witness faithful, the firstborn of_the dead, and the ruler of_the kings of_the earth.
   To_the one loving us, and having_released us from the sins of_us in the blood of_him, 6 and made us a_kingdom, priests to_god and father of_him, to_him be the glory and the dominion to the ages.
   Truly.
   7 See he_is_coming with the clouds, and will_be_seeing him every eye, and who him they_pierced, and will_be_mourning over him all the tribes of_the earth.
   Yes.
   Truly.
   8 I am the first_letter and the last_letter, is_saying the_master, god: the one being, and who was, and who coming, the almighty.
   9 I G‹Yōannēs›G, the brother of_you_all, and fellow-partaker in the tribulation, and kingdom, and endurance, in G‹H‹Yēsous, became in the island being_called G‹Patmos›G, because_of the word of_god and the testimony of_G‹H‹Yēsous.
   10 I_became in the_spirit on the master's day, and I_heard behind me a_voice loud like of_a_trumpet 11 saying: What you_are_seeing, write in a_scroll, and send to_the seven assemblies: to G‹Efesos›G, and to Rx-G‹Smurna›G-Rx, and to G‹Pergamos›G, and to G‹Thuateira›G, and to Rx-G‹Sardeis›G-Rx, and to G‹Filadelfeia›G, and to G‹Laodikeia›G.
   12 And I_turned_back to_be_seeing the voice which was_speaking with me.
   And having_turned_back, I_saw seven lampstands golden, 13 and in the_midst of_the lampstands: similar son of_man, having_dressed_in reaching_the_feet, and having_been_girded_about at the breasts a_belt golden.
   14 And the head of_him and his hairs were white, as_though wool white as snow, and the eyes of_him like a_flame of_fire, 15 and the feet of_him similar to_burnished_bronze as in a_furnace of_having_been_refined, and the voice of_him like the_voice of_waters many, 16 and was_holding in the right hand of_him seven stars, and out_of the mouth of_him a_sword double_edged sharp going_out, and the face of_him like the sun is_shining in the power of_it.
   17 And when I_saw him, I_fell at the feet of_him, as_though dead.
   And he_put the right hand of_him on me saying: Not be_fearing, I am the first and the last, 18 and living and I_became dead, and see, living I_am to the ages of_the ages, and I_am_having the keys of_death and of_G‹Hadēs›G.
   19 Therefore write what things you_saw, and what things they_are, and what things is_going to_become after these things.
   20 The seven mystery of_the stars, which you_saw on the right hand of_me, and the seven lampstands golden: the seven stars, seven the_angels of_the assemblies are, and the seven lampstands the_seven assemblies are.
  Rev 2  To_the angel in G‹Efesos›G assembly write: These things is_saying the one taking_hold_of the seven stars in the right hand of_him, the one walking in the_midst of_the seven lampstands golden: 2 I_have_known the works of_you, and the labor and endurance of_you, and that not you_are_being_able to_bear evil, and you_tested the ones saying themselves to_be ambassadors, and not they_are, and you_found them false, 3 and endurance you_are_having, and you_bore because_of the name of_me, and not you_all_having_wearied.
   4 But I_am_having against you that the love of_you first you_were_leaving.
   5 Therefore be_remembering from_where you_have_fallen and repent, and the first works do.
   And if not, I_am_coming to_you and will_be_removing the lampstand of_you out_of the place of_it, if not you_may_repent.
   6 But this you_are_having, that you_are_hating the works of_the G‹Nikolaitēs›G, which also_I am_hating.
   7 The one having an_ear, him_let_hear what the spirit is_saying to_the seven assemblies.
   To_the one overcoming, I_will_be_giving to_him to_eat of the tree of_life, which is in paradise of_god.
   8 And to_the angel of_the in Rx-G‹Smurna›G-Rx assembly write: These things is_saying the first and the last, who became dead and lived: 9 I_have_known of_you the tribulation and poverty (but rich you_are), and the slander of the ones saying of_the_G‹Youdaiōns›G to_be themselves, and not they_are, but are a_synagogue of_G‹H‹Satan/(Sāţān)›H›G.
   10 Not be_fearing what you_are_going to_be_suffering.
   See is_going to_be_throwing some the devil of you_all into prison, in_order_that you_all_may_be_tested, and you_all_will_be_having tribulation ten for_days.
   Be_becoming faithful until death, and I_will_be_giving to_you the crown of_life.
   11 The one having an_ear, him_let_hear what the spirit is_saying to_the assemblies.
   The one overcoming by_no_means not may_be_injured by the death second.
   12 And to_the angel of_the in G‹Pergamos›G assembly write: These things is_saying the one having the sword double_edged sharp: 13 I_have_known where you_are_dwelling, where the throne of_G‹H‹Satan is, and you_are_taking_hold_of the name of_me, and not disowned the faith of_me, even in the days of_Antipas, the witness of_me faithful of_me, who was_killed_off among you_all, where G‹H‹Satan is_dwelling.
   14 But I_am_having against you a_few things, because you_are_having some there taking_hold_of the teaching of_G‹H‹Bala'am/(Bilə'ām)›H›G, who was_teaching to_Balak to_throw a_temptation before the sons of_Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx, to_eat idol_sacrificed things and to_commit_sexual_immorality.
   15 Thus are_having some also you, taking_hold_of the teaching of_the_G‹Nikolaitēs›G likewise.
   16 Therefore repent.
   And if not, I_am_coming to_you quickly, and I_will_be_warring with them with the sword of_the mouth of_me.
   17 The one having an_ear, him_let_hear what the spirit is_saying to_the assemblies.
   To_the one overcoming, I_will_be_giving to_him of_the manna having_been_hidden, and I_will_be_giving to_him a_stone white, and on the stone a_name new having_been_written, which no_one has_known, except the one receiving it.
   18 And to_the angel of_the in G‹Thuateira›G assembly write: These things is_saying the son of_god, the one having the eyes of_him like a_flame of_fire, and the feet of_him similar to_burnished_bronze: 19 I_have_known of_you the works, and love, and faith, and service, and endurance of_you, and the works of_you, the last more than the first.
   20 But I_am_having against you that you_are_allowing the woman Jezebel, the woman calling herself a_prophetess, and she_is_teaching and is_misleading my slaves to_commit_sexual_immorality, and to_eat idol_sacrificed food.
   21 And I_gave to_her time, in_order_that she_may_repent, and not she_willed to_repent of the sexual_immorality of_her.
   22 see, I_am_throwing her into a_bed, and the ones committing_adultery with her into tribulation great, if not they_will_be_repenting of the works of_her.
   23 And the children of_her I_will_be_killing_off with death, and will_be_knowing all the assemblies that I am the one searching minds and hearts, and I_will_be_giving to_you_all to_each according_to the works of_you_all.
   24 But to_you_all I_am_saying to_the rest in G‹Thuateira›G, as_many_as not are_having teaching this, who not they_knew the deep things of_G‹H‹Satan/(Sāţān)›H›G, as they_are_saying, not I_am_throwing on you_all another burden.
   25 However what you_all_are_having, take_hold_of until of_which I_may_come.
   26 And the one overcoming and keeping until the_end the works of_me: I_will_be_giving to_him authority over the nations… 27 and he_will_be_shepherding them with a_rod iron, as the vessels pottery is_being_crushed, 28 as also_I have_received from the father of_me, and I_will_be_giving to_him the star morning.
   29 The one having an_ear, him_let_hear what the spirit is_saying to_the assemblies.
  Rev 3  And to_the angel of_the in Rx-G‹Sardeis›G-Rx assembly write: These things is_saying the one having the seven spirits of_god and the seven stars: I_have_known of_you the works, that the_name you_are_having, that you_are_living, and_yet dead you_are.
   2 Be_becoming watching, and strengthen the other things, which were_going to_die_off, for not I_have_found of_you works, having_been_fulfilled before the god of_me.
   3 Therefore be_remembering how you_have_received and heard, and be_keeping it and repent.
   Therefore if not you_may_watch, I_will_be_coming like a_thief, and by_no_means not you_may_know what hour I_will_be_coming on you.
   4 But you_are_having a_few names in Rx-G‹Sardeis›G-Rx, who not soiled the clothes of_them, and they_will_be_walking with me in white garments, because worthy they_are.
   5 The one overcoming, thus will_be_being_clothed in clothes white, and by_no_means not I_will_be_wiping_out the name of_him from the scroll of_life, and I_will_be_confessing the name of_him before the father of_me, and before the angels of_him.
   6 The one having an_ear, him_let_hear what the spirit is_saying to_the assemblies.
   7 And to_the angel of_the in G‹Filadelfeia›G assembly write: These things is_saying the true Rx-one-Rx, the holy Rx-one-Rx, having the key of_G‹H‹Dauid/(Dāvid)›H›G, the one opening_up and no_one will_be_shutting, and shutting and no_one is_opening_up: 8 I_have_known of_you the works.
   See I_have_given before you a_door having_been_opened_up, which no_one is_able to_shut it, because little you_are_having power, and_yet you_kept of_me the word, and not you_disowned the name of_me.
   9 See I_may_be_giving those of the synagogue of_G‹H‹Satan/(Sāţān)›H›G, the ones saying themselves G‹Youdaiōns›G to_be, and not they_are, but they_are_lying, see, I_will_be_making them that they_will_be_coming and will_be_kneeling before the feet of_you, and they_may_know that I loved you.
   10 Because you_kept the word of_the endurance of_me, also_I you will_be_keeping out_of the hour of_the of_trial going to_be_coming on the inhabited_world whole, to_test the ones dwelling on the earth.
   11 I_am_coming quickly, be_taking_hold_of what you_are_having, in_order_that no_one may_take the crown of_you.
   12 The one overcoming, I_will_be_making him a_pillar in the temple of_the god of_me, and out by_no_means not he_may_come_out anymore, and I_will_be_writing on him the name of_the god of_me, and the name of_the city of_the god of_me, the new G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G, the one coming_down out_of heaven from the god of_me, and the name of_me new.
   13 The one having an_ear, him_let_hear what the spirit is_saying to_the assemblies.
   14 And to_the angel of_the in G‹Laodikeia›G assembly write: These things is_saying the Truly, the witness faithful and true, the beginning of_the creation of_god: 15 I_have_known of_you the works, that neither cool you_are nor hot.
   Profit cool you_were or hot.
   16 Thus, because lukewarm you_are, and neither hot nor cold, I_am_going you to_spit out_of the mouth of_me.
   17 Because you_are_saying, Rich I_am, and I_have_become_rich, and nothing need I_am_having, and not you_have_known that you are miserable, and pitiful, and poor, and blind, and naked.
   18 I_am_counselling to_you to_buy from me gold having_been_refined by fire, in_order_that you_may_be_rich, and clothes white, in_order_that you_may_clothe yourself, and not may_be_revealed the shame of_the nakedness of_you, and eyesalve to_rub_in the eyes of_you, in_order_that you_may_be_seeing.
   19 I as_many_as may_be_loving, I_am_rebuking and I_am_disciplining, therefore be_being_zealous and repent.
   20 See I_have_stood at the door and I_am_knocking, if anyone may_hear of_the voice of_me and may_open_up the door, I_will_be_coming_in to him, and I_will_be_dining with him, and he with me.
   21 The one overcoming, I_will_be_giving to_him to_sit_down with me on the throne of_me, as also_I overcame, and sat_down with the father of_me on the throne of_him.
   22 The one having an_ear, him_let_hear what the spirit is_saying to_the assemblies.
  Rev 4  After these things I_looked, and see, a_door having_been_opened_up in heaven, and the voice first that I_heard was like a_trumpet speaking with me saying: Go_up here, and I_will_be_showing to_you what it_is_fitting to_become after these things.
   2 Immediately I_became in the_spirit, and see, a_throne was_lying in heaven, and on the throne sitting, 3 and the one sitting was similar in_appearance to_a_stone, jasper and sardius, and priests around the throne was similar in_appearance to_an_emerald.
   4 And around the throne were twenty thrones four, and on thrones twenty four elders sitting, having_been_clothed in white, and on the heads of_them crowns golden.
   5 And out_of the throne are_going_out lightnings, and voices, and thunders.
   And seven lamps of_fire being_burned before the throne, which is the seven spirits of_god, 6 and something before the throne was like a_sea glass, similar to_crystal.
   And in the_midst of_the throne and around the four, throne creatures were, being_full of_eyes ahead and behind.
   7 And the creature first was similar to_a_lion, and the second creature similar to_a_calf, and the third creature having the face as of_a_human, and the fourth creature similar to_an_eagle flying.
   8 And the four creatures, one by one of_them, having each six wings, around and inside they_are_being_full of_eyes, and rest not they_are_having day and night saying: holy, holy, holy, master god almighty, who was, and who being, and who coming.
   9 And whenever will_be_giving the creatures glory, and honor, and thanksgiving, to_the one sitting on the throne, the one living to the ages of_the ages, 10 will_be_falling the twenty four elders before the one sitting on the throne, and they_will_be_worshipping before_the one living to the ages of_the ages, and they_will_be_throwing the crowns of_them before the throne saying, 11 Worthy you_are, the master and the god of_us, to_receive glory and honor and power, because you created the things all, and for the will of_you they_were, and they_were_created.
  Rev 5  And I_saw on the right hand of_the one sitting on the throne a_scroll, having_been_written inside and behind, having_been_sealed_up seven with_seals.
   2 And I_saw an_angel strong, proclaiming in in_a_voice loud: Who worthy to_open_up the scroll, and to_break the seals of_it.
   3 And no_one was_able in heaven, and_not on the earth, nor beneath the earth, to_open_up the scroll, nor to_be_seeing it.
   4 And I_was_weeping much, because no_one worthy will_be_being_found to_open_up the scroll, nor to_be_looking it.
   5 And one of the elders is_saying to_me: Not be_weeping.
   See overcame the lion of the tribe of_G‹H‹Youda/(Yəhūdāh)›H›G, the root of_G‹H‹Dauid/(Dāvid)›H›G, to_open_up the scroll, and the seven seals of_it.
   6 And I_saw in the_midst of_the throne and of_the four creatures and in the_midst of_the elders, a_lamb having_stood as having_been_slain, having seven horns and seven eyes, which are the seven spirits of_god, having_been_sent_out into all the earth.
   7 And he_came and has_taken it out_of the right hand of_the one sitting on the throne.
   8 And when he_took the four, scroll the creatures and the twenty four elders fell before the lamb, having each a_harp and bowls golden being_full of_incenses, which are the prayers of_the holy ones.
   9 And they_are_singing a_song new saying: Worthy you_are to_take the scroll, and to_open_up the seals of_it, because you_were_slain, and bought to_god us by the blood of_you, out_of every tribe, and tongue, and people, and nation, 10 and you_made them to_the god of_us, a_kingdom and priests, and they_will_be_reigning on the earth.
   11 And I_looked, and I_heard the_voice of_angels many around the throne, and of_the creatures, and of_the elders, and was the number of_them myriads of_myriads and thousands of_thousands, 12 saying with_a_voice loud: Worthy is the lamb having_been_slain, to_receive power, and riches, and wisdom, and strength, and honor, and glory, and blessing.
   13 And every creature which in heaven, and on the earth, and beneath the earth, and on the sea, and the things in them all, I_heard saying: To_the one sitting on the throne and to_the lamb be blessing, and honor, and glory, and dominion, to the ages of_the ages.
   14 And the four creatures were_saying: Truly.
   And the elders fell and worshipped.
  Rev 6  And I_saw, when opened_up the lamb one of of_the seven seals, and I_heard from_one of the four creatures, saying as with_a_voice of_thunder: Be_coming.
   2 And I_looked, and see, a_horse white, and the one sitting on it having a_bow, and was_given to_him a_crown, and he_came_out conquering, and that he_may_conquer.
   3 And when he_opened_up the seal second, I_heard from_the second creature saying: Be_coming.
   4 And came_out another horse red, and to_the one sitting on it, was_given to_him to_take the peace from the earth, and in_order_that one_another they_will_be_slaying, and was_given to_him a_sword great.
   5 And when he_opened_up the seal third, I_heard from_the third creature saying: Be_coming.
   And I_looked, and see, a_horse black, and the one sitting on it, having a_scale in the hand of_him.
   6 And I_heard something like a_voice in the_midst of_the four creatures saying: A_Rx-G‹ⱪoinix_dd measuredd*›G-Rx of_wheat three, for_a_G‹dēnarion_coin›G and Rx-G‹ⱪoinix_dd measuredd*›G-Rx of_barley for_a_G‹dēnarion_coin›G, but the olive_oil and the wine not you_may_injure.
   7 And when he_opened_up the seal fourth, I_heard the_voice of_the fourth creature saying: Be_coming.
   8 And I_looked, and see, a_horse green, and the one sitting on it, the_name to_him was Death, and G‹Hadēs›G was_following with him, and was_given to_them authority over the fourth of_the earth, to_kill_off with sword, and with famine, and with death, and by the wild_beasts of_the earth.
   9 And when he_opened_up the fifth seal, I_saw beneath the altar, the souls having_been_slain because_of the word of_god, and because_of their testimony which they_were_having.
   10 And they_cried_out with_a_voice loud saying: Until when the master holy and true, not you_are_judging and are_avenging the blood of_us, from the ones dwelling on the earth.
   11 And was_given to_them each a_robe white, and it_was_said to_them that they_may_rest a_time still little, until may_be_fulfilled also the fellow-slaves of_them, and the brothers of_them, the ones going to_be_being_killed_off as also they.
   12 And I_saw when he_opened_up the seal sixth, and an_earthquake great there_became, and the sun became black as sackcloth hairy, and the moon whole became like blood, 13 and the stars of_the sky fell to the earth, as a_fig_tree is_throwing the unripe_figs of_it, by a_wind great being_shaken.
   14 And heaven was_separating like a_scroll being_rolled_up, and every mountain and island out_of the places of_them moved.
   15 And the kings of_the earth, and the magnates, and the commanders, and the rich, and the mighty, and every slave and free man, hid themselves in the caves and among the rocks of_the mountains, 16 and they_are_saying to_the mountains and to_the rocks: Fall on us, and hide us from the_face of_the one sitting on the throne, and from the severe_anger of_the lamb, 17 because came the day great of_the severe_anger of_them, and who is_able to_be_stood.
   Rev 7  After this I_saw four angels having_stood on the four corners of_the earth, taking_hold_of the four winds of_the earth, in_order_that neither may_be_blowing the_wind on the earth, nor on the sea, nor on any tree.
   2 And I_saw another angel, going_up from the_rising of_the_sun, having the_seal of_god the_living, and he_cried_out with_a_voice loud to_the four angels to_whom was_given to_them to_injure the earth and the sea 3 saying: Not you_all_may_injure the earth, neither the sea nor the trees, until we_may_seal the slaves of_the god of_us on the foreheads of_them.
   4 And they_heard the number of_the ones having_been_sealed, hundred forty four thousands, having_been_sealed out_of every tribe of_the_sons of_Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx: 5 out_of the_tribe Twelve of_G‹H‹Youda/(Yəhūdāh)›H›G thousands having_been_sealed, out_of the_tribe Twelve of_G‹H‹Ɽoubim/(Rə'ūvēn)›H›G thousands, out_of the_tribe Twelve of_Rx-G‹H‹Gad/(Gād)›H›G-Rx thousands, 6 out_of the_tribe Twelve of_G‹H‹Asēr/('Āshēr)›H›G thousands, out_of the_tribe Twelve of_G‹H‹Nefthaleim/(Nafəttālī)›H›G thousands, out_of the_tribe Twelve of_G‹H‹Manassēs/(Mənashsheh)›H›G thousands, 7 out_of the_tribe Twelve of_G‹H‹Sumeōn/(Shimə'ōn)›H›G thousands, out_of the_tribe Twelve of_Rx-G‹H‹Leui/(Lēvī)›H›G-Rx thousands, out_of the_tribe Twelve of_G‹H‹Isaⱪar/(Yissāskār)›H›G thousands, 8 out_of the_tribe Twelve of_G‹H‹Zaboulōn/(Zəvūlūn)›H›G thousands, out_of the_tribe Twelve of_G‹H‹Beniamin/(Binəyāmīn)›H›G thousands, out_of the_tribe of_G‹H‹Yōsēf/(Yōşēf)›H›G Twelve thousands having_been_sealed.
   9 After these things I_looked, and see, crowd great, which to_number it no_one was_able, out_of every nation, and tribes, and peoples, and tongues, having_stood before the throne and before the lamb, having_been_clothed in_robes white, and palm_branches in the hands of_them, 10 and they_are_crying_out with_a_voice loud saying: salvation to_the god of_us, to_the one sitting on the throne and to_the lamb.
   11 And all the angels had_stood around the throne, and the elders, and the four creatures, and they_fell before the throne on the faces of_them, and they_worshipped before_god 12 saying: Truly.
   blessing, and glory, and wisdom, and thanksgiving, and honor, and power, and strength be, to_the god of_us to the ages of_the ages.
   Truly.
   13 And answered one of of_the elders, saying to_me: These, having_been_clothed in_the robes white, who_all they_are and from_where they_came.
   14 And I_have_said to_him: master of_me, you you_have_known.
   And he_said to_me: These are the ones coming out_of the tribulation great, and they_washed the robes of_them, and they_whitened them in the blood of_the lamb.
   15 Because_of this, they_are before the throne of_god, and they_are_serving unto_him day and night in the temple of_him, and the one sitting on the throne will_be_sheltering over them.
   16 Neither they_will_be_hungering anymore, nor they_will_be_thirsting anymore, nor not may_fall on them the sun, nor any burning, 17 because the lamb who is among the_middle of_the throne will_be_shepherding them, and will_be_guiding them to of_life springs of_waters, and will_be_wiping_out god every tear from the eyes of_them.
  Rev 8  And whenever he_opened_up the seal seventh, became silence in heaven for_about an_half_hour.
   2 And I_saw the seven angels, who before god have_stood, and they_were_given to_them seven trumpets.
   3 And another angel came and was_stood at the altar, having a_censer golden, and was_given to_him incenses much, in_order_that he_will_be_giving it with_the prayers of_the holy ones all on the altar golden before the throne.
   4 And went_up the smoke of_the incenses with_the prayers of_the holy ones out_of the_hand of_the angel before god.
   5 And has_taken the angel the censer, and filled it from the fire of_the altar, and he_throw it on the earth, and there_became thunders, and sounds, and lightnings, and an_earthquake.
   6 And the seven angels having the seven trumpets prepared themselves, in_order_that they_may_trumpet.
   7 And the first trumpeted, and there_became hail and fire having_been_mixed with blood, and it_was_throw on the earth, and the third of_the the_earth was_burned_up, and the third of_the trees was_burned_up, and all grass green was_burned_up.
   8 And the second angel trumpeted, and something like a_mountain great with_fire being_burned, was_throw into the sea, and became the third of_the sea blood, 9 and died_off the third of_the creatures in the sea having life, and the third of_the ships were_ruined.
   10 And the third angel trumpeted, and fell out_of the sky a_star great, being_burned like a_torch, and fell on the third of_the rivers, and on the springs of_the waters, 11 and the name of_the star is_being_called Wormwood.
   And became the third of_the waters into wormwood, and many of_the people died_off from the waters, because they_were_made_bitter.
   12 And the fourth angel trumpeted, and was_struck the third of_the sun, and the third of_the moon, and the third of_the stars, in_order_that may_be_darkened the third of_them, and the day not may_appear for_the third of_it, and the night likewise.
   13 And I_looked, and I_heard from_one eagle flying in midair, saying with_a_voice loud: Woe, woe, woe, to_the ones dwelling on the earth, for the other voices of_the three trumpet of_the angels going to_be_trumpeting.
   Rev 9  And the fifth angel trumpeted, and I_saw a_star out_of the sky having_fallen to the earth, and was_given to_him the key of_the pit of_the abyss, 2 and he_opened_up the pit of_the abyss, and went_up smoke out_of of_the pit, like the_smoke of_a_furnace great, and was_darkened the sun and the air by the smoke of_the pit.
   3 And out_of the smoke came_out locusts to the earth, and was_given to_them power, like are_having power the scorpions of_the earth.
   4 And it_was_said to_them that neither they_may_injure the grass of_the earth, nor any green thing, nor any tree, except the people who not are_having the seal of_god on their foreheads.
   5 And it_was_given to_them, in_order_that not they_may_kill_off them, but in_order_that they_will_be_being_tormented five for_months, and the torment of_them is like torment of_a_scorpion, whenever it_may_fall on a_person.
   6 And in days those, will_be_seeking people death, and by_no_means not they_will_be_finding it, and they_will_be_desiring to_die_off, but is_fleeing death from them.
   7 And the likenesses of_the locusts was likenesses to_horses having_been_prepared for war, and something on the heads of_them were like crowns similar to_gold, and the faces of_them like the_faces of_humans, 8 and they_were_having hairs like the_hairs of_women, and the teeth of_them like of_lions were, 9 and they_were_having breastplates like breastplates iron, and the sound of_the wings of_them as the_sound of_chariots of_horses many running into war, 10 and they_are_having tails to_similar to_scorpions and stings, and in the tails of_them is the power of_them to_injure people five for_months.
   11 They_are_having over themselves a_king, the angel of_the abyss, the_name to_him In_G‹Hebraios›G is, G‹H‹Abaddōn/('Avadōn)›H›G, and in Rx-G‹Hellēn›G-Rx he_is_having, the_name G‹Apolluōn›G.
   12 woe the first went_away, see, is_coming still two woes after these things.
   13 And the sixth angel trumpeted, and I_heard one voice from the horns of_the altar golden before god, 14 saying to_the sixth angel, having the trumpet: Release the four angels, having_been_bound at the river great G‹Eufratēs›G.
   15 And were_untied/released the four angels, having_been_prepared for the hour, and day, and month, and year, in_order_that they_may_kill_off the third of_mankind.
   16 And the number of_the armies of_the horsemen were two ten_thousand of_ten_thousand, I_heard the number of_them.
   17 And thus I_saw the horses in my vision, and the ones sitting on them: having breastplates fiery, and hyacinthine, and sulfurous, and the heads of_the horses like the_heads of_lions, and out_of the mouths of_them is_going_out fire, and smoke, and sulfur.
   18 By three plagues these were_killed_off the third of_mankind by the fire, and the smoke, and the sulfur, going_out out_of the mouths of_them.
   19 For the power of_the horses in the mouth of_them is and in the tails of_them, for the tails of_them are similar to_serpents, having heads, and with them they_are_injuring.
   20 And the rest of_the people, who not were_killed_off by plagues these, not_even they_repented of the works of_the hands of_them, in_order_that not they_will_be_worshipping the demons, and the idols golden, and silver, and bronze, and stone, and wooden, which neither to_be_seeing are_being_able, nor to_be_hearing, nor to_be_walking.
   21 And neither they_repented of the murders of_them, nor of the sorceries of_them, nor of the wickedness of_them, nor of the the_thefts of_them.
  Rev 10  And I_saw another angel mighty, coming_down out_of heaven, having_been_clothed in_a_cloud, and the rainbow on the head of_him, and the face of_him like the sun, and the feet of_him like pillars of_fire, 2 and having in the hand of_him a_little_scroll having_been_opened_up.
   And he_put the foot of_him right on the sea, and his the_left on the earth, 3 and he_cried_out with_a_voice loud as a_lion is_roaring.
   And when he_cried_out, spoke the seven thunders the of_themselves voices.
   4 And when spoke the seven thunders, I_was_going to_be_writing, but I_heard a_voice out_of heaven saying: Seal what things spoke the seven thunders, and not them you_may_write.
   5 And the angel, whom I_saw having_stood on the sea and on the land, lifted_up the hand of_him right to heaven, 6 and swore to to_the one living to the ages of_the ages: who created heaven and the things in it, and the earth and the things in it, and the sea and the things in it, that time no_longer will_be.
   7 But in the days of_the voice of_the angel, seventh whenever he_may_be_going to_be_trumpeting, also was_finished the mystery of_god, as he_gospel_preached to_the of_himself slaves, and the prophets.
   8 And the voice that I_heard out_of heaven, again was speaking with me, and saying: Be_going, take the scroll having_been_opened_up in the hand of_the angel, having_stood on the sea and on the land.
   9 And I_went_away to the angel, telling to_him to_give to_me the little_scroll.
   And he_is_saying to_me: Take and devour it, and it_will_be_making_bitter of_you the stomach, but in the mouth of_you, it_will_be sweet as honey.
   10 And I_took the little_scroll out_of the hand of_the angel, and I_devoured it, and it_was in the mouth of_me as honey sweet, and when I_ate it, was_filled the stomach of_me.
   11 And they_are_saying to_me: It_is_fitting you again to_prophesy concerning peoples, and nations, and tongues, and kings many.
  Rev 11  And was_given to_me a_rod similar to_a_staff saying: Be_raising, and measure the temple of_god, and the altar, and the ones worshipping in it.
   2 And the courtyard outside the temple, throw_out outside and not it you_may_measure, because it_was_given also to_the nations, and the city holy they_will_be_treading forty for_months two.
   3 And I_will_be_giving to_the two witnesses of_me, and they_will_be_prophesying for_days two_hundred a_thousand sixty, having_been_clothed in_sackcloth.
   4 These are the two olive_trees and the two lampstands, before the master of_the earth having_stood.
   5 And if anyone them is_wanting to_injure, fire is_going_out of the mouth of_them, and is_devouring the enemies of_them.
   And if anyone may_want them to_injure, thus because_of him to_be_killed_off.
   6 These are_having the power to_shut the sky, in_order_that no rain may_be_raining in_the days of_the prophecy of_them, and power they_are_having over the waters, to_be_turning them into blood, and to_strike the earth with every plague, as_often_as they_may_want.
   7 And whenever they_may_finish the testimony of_them, the wild_beast going_up out_of the abyss will_be_making with them war, and will_be_overcoming them, and will_be_killing_off them.
   8 And the corpse of_them will_be on the road of_the city great, which is_being_called spiritually, G‹H‹Sodoma/(Şədom)›H›G and G‹H‹Aiguptos/(Miʦərayim)›H›G, where also the master of_them was_impaled_on_a_stake.
   9 And they_are_looking of the peoples, and tribes, and tongues, and nations, the corpse of_them three for_days and a_half, and the corpses of_them not they_are_allowing to_be_put into a_tomb.
   10 And the ones dwelling on the earth are_rejoicing over them, and are_being_gladdened, and gifts they_will_be_sending to_one_another, because these prophets two tormented the ones dwelling on the earth.
   11 And after the three days and a_half, the_spirit of_life from god came_in into them, and they_stood on the feet of_them, and fear great fell_on on the ones observing them.
   12 And they_heard a_voice great out_of heaven, saying to_them: Go_up here.
   And they_went_up to the sky in the cloud, and observed them the enemies of_them.
   13 And in that hour became an_earthquake great, and the tenth of_the city fell, and were_killed_off in the earthquake, the_names of_people seven thousands, and the rest frightened became, and they_gave glory to_the god of_heaven.
   14 The woe second went_away, see, is_coming the woe third quickly.
   15 And the seventh angel trumpeted, and became voices great in heaven saying: Became the kingdom of_the world of_the master of_us and of_the chosen_one/messiah of_him, and he_will_be_reigning to the ages of_the ages.
   16 And the twenty four elders before of_god were_sitting on the thrones of_them, fell on the faces of_them, and they_worshipped before_god 17 saying: We_are_giving_thanks to_you, master, god almighty, who being, and who was, and because you_have_taken the power of_you great, and you_reigned.
   18 And the nations were_angered, and came the severe_anger of_you, and the time for_the dead to_be_judged, and to_give the reward to_the slaves of_you, the prophets, and to_the holy ones, and to_the ones fearing the name of_you, the small and the great, and to_ruin the ones ruining the earth.
   19 And was_opened_up the temple of_god in heaven, and was_seen the ark of_the covenant of_him in the temple of_him, and there_became lightnings, and voices, and thunders, and an_earthquake, and hail great.
  Rev 12  And a_sign great was_seen in heaven: a_woman having_been_clothed with_the sun, and the moon was beneath the feet of_her, and on the head of_her a_crown twelve of_stars, 2 and in womb having child, and she_is_crying_out laboring_in_birth, and being_tormented to_bear.
   3 And was_seen another sign in heaven: and see, a_dragon red great having seven heads, and ten horns, and on the heads of_him seven crowns, 4 and the tail of_him is_dragging the third of_the stars of_the sky, and he_throw them to the earth.
   And the dragon was_standing before the woman going to_bear, in_order_that whenever she_may_bear, the child of_her he_may_devour it.
   5 And she_bore a_son a_male, who is_going to_be_shepherding all the nations with a_rod iron, and was_snatched the child of_her to god, and to the throne of_him.
   6 And the woman fled into the desert, where she_is_having there a_place having_been_prepared by god, in_order_that there they_may_be_nourishing her for_days two_hundred thousand sixty.
   7 And became war in heaven, G‹H‹Miⱪaēl/(Mīkā'ēl)›H›G and the angels of_him to_war with the dragon.
   And the dragon warred and the angels of_him, 8 and not prevailed, nor a_place was_found for_them anymore in heaven.
   9 And was_throw down the dragon the serpent great ancient, who being_called, the_false_accuser, and G‹H‹Satan/(Sāţān)›H›G, the one deceiving the inhabited_world whole, he_was_throw down on the earth, and the angels of_him with him were_throw down.
   10 And I_heard a_voice great in heaven saying: Now became the salvation, and the power, and the kingdom of_god of_us, and the authority of_the chosen_one/messiah of_him, because was_throw down the accuser of_the brothers of_us, the one accusing them before the god of_us, day and night.
   11 And they overcame him because_of the blood of_the lamb, and because_of the word of_the testimony of_them, and not they_loved the life of_them until death.
   12 Because_of this be_being_gladdened, heavens, and you_all in them sheltering.
   woe the earth and the sea, because came_down the devil to you_all, having rage great, having_known that a_little time he_is_having.
   13 And when saw the dragon that he_was_throw on the earth, he_persecuted the woman, who bore the male child.
   14 And were_given to_the two woman wings of_the eagle great, in_order_that she_may_be_flying into the desert into the place of_her, where she_is_being_nourished there a_time, and times, and a_half of_a_time, from the_face of_the serpent.
   15 And throw the serpent out_of the mouth of_him after the woman, water as a_river, in_order_that her a_flood may_make.
   16 And gave_help the earth to_the women, and opened_up the earth the mouth of_it, and swallowed_up the river, which throw the dragon out_of the mouth of_him.
   17 And was_angered the dragon with the women, and went_away to_make war with the rest of_the children of_her, keeping the commandments of_god, and holding the testimony of_G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G.
   18 And he_was_stood on the sand of_the sea.
  Rev 13  And I_saw out_of the sea a_wild_beast going_up, having ten horns and seven heads, and on the horns of_it ten crowns, and on the heads of_it a_name of_slander.
   2 And the wild_beast that I_saw was similar to_a_leopard, and the feet of_it like of_a_bear, and the mouth of_it like the_mouth of_a_lion.
   And gave to_it the dragon the power of_him, and the throne of_him, and authority great.
   3 And one of the heads of_it as having_been_slain to death, and the wound of_the death of_it was_healed.
   And was_being_Rx-marvelled-Rx all the earth after the wild_beast, 4 and they_worshipped before_the dragon, because he_gave his authority to_the wild_beast, and they_worshipped before_the wild_beast saying: Who is similar to_the wild_beast, and who is_able to_war with it.
   5 And was_given to_it a_mouth speaking great things and slander, and was_given to_it authority to_work forty for_months two.
   6 And it_opened_up the mouth of_it to slander against god, to_slander the name of_him, and the tabernacle of_him, the ones in heaven sheltering.
   7 And was_given to_it authority over every tribe, and people, and tongue, and nation.
   8 And will_be_worshipping it all the ones dwelling on the earth, whom has_been_written the name of_him in scroll of_life of_the lamb, having_been_slain from the_foundation of_the_earth.
   9 If anyone is_having an_ear, him_let_hear.
   10 If anyone is_going into captivity, he_is_going, if anyone with the_sword is_killing_off, it_is_fitting him by the_sword to_be_killed_off.
   Here is the endurance and the the_faith of_the holy ones.
   11 And I_saw another wild_beast going_up out_of the earth, and it_was_having two horns similar to_a_lamb, and it_was_speaking like a_dragon.
   12 And the authority of_the first wild_beast all it_is_doing before it.
   And it_is_making the earth and the ones in it dwelling, in_order_that they_will_be_worshipping the wild_beast first, of_whom was_healed the wound of_death of_it.
   13 And it_is_performing signs great, that even fire it_may_be_making out_of the sky to_be_coming_down to the earth before the people.
   14 And it_is_deceiving dwelling on the earth, because_of the signs that it_was_given to_it to_perform before the wild_beast, telling to_the ones dwelling on the earth, to_make an_image to_the wild_beast, who is_having the wound of_the sword, and lived.
   15 And it_was_given to_it to_give spirit to_the image of_the wild_beast, in_order_that also may_speak the image of_the wild_beast, and may_make as_many_as not will_be_worshipping before_the image of_the wild_beast they_may_be_killed_off.
   16 And it_is_making all, the small and the great, and the rich and the poor, and the free and the slaves, that they_may_give to_them a_mark on the hand of_them right, or on the forehead of_them, 17 and that not someone may_be_able to_buy or to_sell, except the one having the mark, the name of_the wild_beast, or the number of_the name of_it.
   18 Here wisdom is: the one having a_mind let_count the number of_the wild_beast, for the_number of_a_man it_is, and the number of_it is six_hundred ten six.
  Rev 14  And I_looked, and see, the lamb having_stood on the Mount of_G‹H‹Siōn/(Tsiuōn)›H›G, and with him a_hundred forty four thousands having the name of_him, and the name of_the father of_him, having_been_written on the foreheads of_them.
   2 And I_heard a_sound out_of heaven, as the_sound of_waters many, and as the_sound of_thunder loud, and the sound that I_heard was like of_harpists playing_the_harp with the harps of_them.
   3 And they_are_singing a_song new before the throne, and before the four creatures, and the elders.
   And no_one was_able to_learn the song, except the hundred forty four thousands, having_been_bought from the earth.
   4 These are those who with women not were_defiled, for virgins they_are.
   These are the ones following after_the lamb wherever he_is_going_away.
   These were_bought from mankind as_first-fruit to_god and to_the lamb, 5 and in the mouth of_them not was_found a_falsehood, for blameless they_are.
   6 And I_saw another angel flying in midair, having the_gospel eternal to_gospel_preach to the ones dwelling on the earth, and on every nation, and tribe, and tongue, and people, 7 saying with a_voice loud: Be_revering the god, and give to_him glory, because came the hour of_the judgment of_him, and worship before_the one having_made heaven, and the earth, and the_sea, and the_springs of_waters.
   8 And an_other second angel followed saying: Fell, fell G‹H‹Babulōn/(Bāvel?)›H›G great, who of the wine of_the rage of_the sexual_immorality of_her, she_has_given_to_drink all the pagans.
   9 And an_other angel third followed after_them, saying with a_voice loud: If anyone is_worshipping the wild_beast and the image of_it, and is_receiving a_mark on the forehead of_him, or on the hand of_him, 10 also he will_be_drinking of the wine of_the rage of_ of_god, having_been_mixed undiluted in the cup of_the severe_anger of_him, and he_will_be_being_tormented in fire and sulfur before the angels the_holy and before the lamb.
   11 And the smoke of_the torment of_them to the_ages of_the_ages is_going_up, and not they_are_having rest, day and night, the ones worshipping the wild_beast and the image of_it, and if anyone is_receiving the mark of_the name of_it.
   12 Here the the_endurance of_the holy ones is, the ones keeping the commandments of_god, and the faith of_G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G.
   13 And I_heard of_a_voice out_of heaven saying: Write: Blessed are the dead in the_master dying_off from now.
   Yes, Is_saying the spirit: in_order_that they_will_be_being_rested from the labors of_them, the for works of_them is_following with them.
   14 And I_looked, and see, a_cloud white, and on the cloud sitting one similar the_son of_man, having on the head of_him a_crown golden, and in the hand of_him a_sickle sharp.
   15 And another angel came_out crying_out of the temple, with a_voice loud to_the one sitting on the cloud: Send the sickle of_you and reap, because came the hour to_reap, because was_withered the harvest of_the earth.
   16 And throw the one sitting on the cloud the sickle of_him on the earth, and was_reaped the earth.
   17 And another angel came_out out_of the temple in heaven, having also he a_sickle sharp.
   18 And another angel out_of the altar, having authority over fire, and he_called with_a_voice loud to_the one having the sickle sharp saying: Send of_you the sickle sharp, and pick the clusters from_the vine of_the earth, because ripened the grapes of_it.
   19 And throw the angel the sickle of_him to the earth, and picked the vine of_the earth, and throw them into the winepress of_the rage of_god great.
   20 And was_trodden the winepress outside the city, and came_out blood out_of the winepress, until the bridles of_the horses from thousand G‹stadion_measure›Gs six_hundred.
  Rev 15  And I_saw another sign in heaven, great and Rx-marvellous-Rx, seven angels having seven plagues the last, because in them was_finished the rage of_god.
   2 And I_saw something like a_sea glass having_been_mixed with_fire, and the ones overcoming of the wild_beast, and of the image of_it, and of the number of_the name of_it, having_stood on the sea glass, having harps of_god.
   3 And they_are_singing the song of_G‹H‹Mōsēs/(Mosheh)›H›G, the slave of_god, and the song of_the lamb saying: Great and Rx-marvellous-Rx are the works of_you, master god almighty.
   righteous and true are the ways of_you, king of_the ages.
   4 Who by_no_means not may_be_afraid, master, and will_be_glorifying the name of_you, because you_only devout are.
   Because all the nations will_be_coming and they_will_be_worshipping before you, because the just_acts of_you were_revealed.
   5 And after these things I_looked, and was_opened_up the temple of_the tabernacle of_the testimony in heaven, 6 and came_out the seven angels having the seven plagues out_of of_the temple, having_dressed_in stone pure shining, and having_been_girded_about around their chests belts golden.
   7 And one of the four creatures gave to_the seven seven angels bowls golden, being_full of_the rage of_god, the one living to the ages of_the ages.
   8 And was_filled the temple with_smoke from the glory of_god, and from the power of_him, and no_one was_able to_come_in into the temple, until may_be_finished the seven seven plagues of_the angels.
  Rev 16  And I_heard of_a_loud voice from the temple, saying to_the seven angels: Be_going and be_pouring_out the seven bowls of_the rage of_god into the earth.
   2 And went_away the first, and poured_out the bowl of_him on the earth, and it_became an_ulcer evil and evil on the people having the mark of_the wild_beast, and the ones worshipping before_the image of_it.
   3 And the second poured_out the bowl of_him into the sea, and it_became blood as of_the_dead, and every soul of_life died_off the things in the sea.
   4 And the third poured_out the bowl of_him into the rivers and the springs of_the waters, and they_became blood.
   5 And I_heard from_the angel of_the waters saying: righteous you_are, the one being, and the one was, devout one, because these things you_judged.
   6 Because the_blood of_holy ones and of_prophets they_poured_out, and blood to_them have_given to_drink, worthy they_are.
   7 And I_heard of_the altar saying: Yes, master god almighty, true and righteous are the judgements of_you.
   8 And the fourth poured_out the bowl of_him on the sun, and was_given to_him to_scorch the people with fire.
   9 And were_scorched the people with_burning great, and they_slandered the name of_god, the one having authority over plagues these, and not they_repented to_give to_him glory.
   10 And the fifth poured_out the bowl of_him on the throne of_the wild_beast, and became the kingdom of_it having_been_darkened, and they_were_biting the tongues of_them out_of the misery, 11 and they_slandered the god of_heaven for the miseries of_them, and for the ulcers of_them, and not they_repented of the works of_them.
   12 And the sixth poured_out the bowl of_him on the river great G‹Eufratēs›G, and was_dried_up the water of_it, in_order_that may_be_prepared the way of_the kings of the_east sun.
   13 And I_saw out_of the mouth of_the dragon, and out_of the mouth of_the wild_beast, and out_of of_the mouth of_the false_prophet, three spirits unclean as_if frogs, 14 for they_are spirits of_demons performing signs, to_be_going_out to the kings the inhabited_world whole, to_gather_together them to the war great day of_god almighty.
   15 (See I_am_coming like a_thief.
   Blessed is the one watching and keeping the clothes of_him, in_order_that not naked he_may_be_walking, and they_may_be_seeing the shame of_him.
  ) 16 And he_gathered_together them to the place being_called In_G‹Hebraios›G G‹Harmagedōn/(Mount Megiddon)›G.
   17 And the seventh poured_out the bowl of_him in the air, and came_out a_voice loud from the temple from the throne saying: It_has_become.
   18 And became lightnings, and and voices, and thunders, an_earthquake became great, such_as not became, from of_which mankind became on the earth, the_so_great earthquake was thus great.
   19 And became the city great into three parts, and the cities of_the nations fell, and G‹H‹Babulōn/(Bāvel?)›H›G the great was_reminded before god, to_give to_her the cup of_the wine of_the rage of_the severe_anger of_him.
   20 And every island fled, and the_mountains not were_found.
   21 And a_hail great, about a_G‹talanton_of_silver›G_weight, is_coming_down out_of the sky on the people, and slandered the people god, for the plague of_the hail, because great is the plague of_it exceedingly.
  Rev 17  And came one of the seven angels of_the ones having the seven bowls, and he_spoke with me saying: Come, I_will_be_showing to_you the judgment of_the prostitute great sitting on waters many, 2 with whom committed_sexual_immorality the kings of_the earth, and were_being_drunk the ones dwelling_in the earth with the wine of_the sexual_immorality of_her.
   3 And he_carried_away me into a_desert in the_spirit.
   And I_saw a_woman sitting on a_wild_beast scarlet, being_full with_names of_slander, having seven heads and ten horns.
   4 And the woman was having_been_clothed in_purple and scarlet, and having_been_gilded gold, and stone precious, and pearls, holding a_cup golden in the hand of_her, being_full of_abominations and the unclean of_the sexual_immorality of_her, 5 and on the forehead of_her was a_name having_been_written: Mystery G‹H‹Babulōn the great, the mother of_the prostitutes, and of_the abominations of_the earth.
   6 And I_saw the woman being_drunk with the blood of_the holy ones, and with the blood of_the witnesses of_G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G.
   And I_Rx-marvelled-Rx, having_seen her wonder great.
   7 And said to_me the angel: For_reason why you_Rx-marvelled-Rx.
   I you will_be_telling the mystery of_the woman, and of_the wild_beast bearing her, having the seven heads and the ten horns.
   8 The wild_beast that you_saw was, and not is, and is_going to_be_going_up out_of the abyss, and into destruction to_be_going.
   And will_be_marvelling the ones dwelling on the earth, whose not has_been_written the names in the scroll of_life from the_foundation of_the_earth, seeing the wild_beast, that it_was and not is and_yet will_be_being_present.
   9 Here is the mind having seven: wisdom the seven heads mountains are, where the woman is_sitting on them.
   And seven kings are: 10 five fell, one is, the other not_yet came, and whenever he_may_come, a_little time him it_is_fitting to_remain 11 and the wild_beast which was, and not is, also himself an_eighth is, and of the seven it_is, and into destruction it_is_going.
   12 And the ten horns which you_saw, ten kings are, who a_kingdom thus received, but authority as for_one kings hour they_are_receiving with the wild_beast.
   13 These one opinion are_having, and the power and the authority of_them to_the wild_beast they_are_giving.
   14 These with the lamb will_be_warring, and the lamb will_be_overcoming them, because master of_masters he_is and king of_kings, and the ones with him, called, and chosen, and faithful.
   15 And he_is_saying to_me: The waters that you_saw, where the prostitute is_sitting, peoples and crowds are, and nations and tongues.
   16 And the ten horns that you_saw and the wild_beast, these will_be_hating the prostitute, and having_been_desolated they_will_be_making her and naked, and the fleshes of_her they_will_be_eating, and her they_will_be_burning_up with with_fire.
   17 For god gave into the hearts of_them to_do the opinion of_him, and to_do one opinion, and to_give the kingdom of_them to_the wild_beast, until will_be_being_accomplished the words of_god.
   18 And the woman whom you_saw is the city great, having a_kingdom over the kings of_the earth.
  Rev 18  After these things I_saw another angel coming_down out_of heaven, having authority great, and the earth was_illuminated with the glory of_him.
   2 And he_cried_out with a_mighty voice saying: Fell, fell G‹H‹Babulōn/(Bāvel?)›H›G the great.
   And it_became a_dwelling_place of_demons, and a_prison of_every spirit unclean, and a_prison of_every bird unclean, and having_been_hated.
   3 Because of of_the rage of_the sexual_immorality of_her, have_drunk all the nations, and the kings of_the earth with her committed_sexual_immorality, and the merchants of_the earth by the power of_the sensuality of_her became_rich.
   4 And I_heard another voice from heaven saying: Come_out the people of_me out_of her, in_order_that not you_all_may_participate in_the sins of_her, and of the plagues of_her, in_order_that not you_all_may_receive, 5 because were_joined_together of_her sins until heaven, and remembered god the wrongs of_her.
   6 Give_back to_her as also she gave_back, and double the double, according_to the works of_her, in the cup which she_mixed, mix to_her double, 7 as_much_as she_glorified herself and lived_sensuously, so_much give to_her torment and mourning.
   Because in the heart of_her she_is_saying, I_am_sitting queen… and a_widow not I_am and mourning by_no_means not I_may_have_known.
   8 Because_of this, in one day will_be_coming the plagues of_her, death, and mourning, and famine, and with fire she_will_be_being_burned_up, because mighty is the_master god having_judged her.
   9 And will_be_weeping and will_be_mourning for her the kings of_the earth, with her having_committed_sexual_immorality and having_lived_sensuously, whenever they_may_be_seeing the smoke of_the burning of_her, 10 from afar having_stood, because_of the fear of_the torment of_her saying: Woe, woe, the city great G‹H‹Babulōn, the city strong.
   Because in_one hour came the judgment of_you.
   11 And the merchants of_the earth are_weeping and are_mourning for her, because the cargo of_them no_one is_buying no_longer, 12 cargo of_gold, and of_silver, and of_stone precious, and of_pearls, and of_linen, and of_purple, and of_silk, and of_scarlet, and all wood citron, and every object ivory, and every object of wood most_precious, and of_bronze, and of_iron, and of_marble, 13 and cinnamon, and amomum, and incenses, and ointment, and frankincense, and wine, and olive_oil, and fine_flour, and wheat, and cattle, and sheep, and of_horses, and of_carriages, and of_bodies, and souls of_humans.
   14 And the fruit of_you of_the desire of_the soul went_away from you, and all the sleek things and splendid things destroyed from you, and no_longer by_no_means not them will_be_finding.
   15 The merchants of_these things having_become_rich, from her from afar will_be_standing, because_of the fear of_the torment of_her, weeping and mourning 16 saying: Woe, woe, you city great, having_been_clothed in_linen, and purple, and scarlet, and having_been_gilded with gold, and stone precious, and pearl.
   17 Because in_one hour was_desolated so_much riches.
   And every captain, and every the one to a_place sailing, and sailors, and as_many_as the sea are_working, from afar stood 18 and they_cried_out, seeing the smoke of_the burning of_her saying: What is similar to_the city great.
   19 And they_throw dust on the heads of_them, and they_cried_out, weeping and mourning saying: Woe, woe, the city great, in which became_rich all the ones having the ships in the sea by the wealth of_her.
   Because in_one hour she_was_desolated.
   20 Be_being_gladdened over her, heaven, and holy ones, and ambassadors, and prophets, because judged god the judgment for_you_all by her.
   21 And took_up one angel a_stone mighty like stone great, and he_throw it into the sea saying: Thus with_violence will_be_being_throw G‹H‹Babulōn/(Bāvel?)›H›G the great city, and by_no_means not it_may_be_found anymore.
   22 And the_sound of_harpists, and musicians, and flute_players, and trumpeters, by_no_means not may_be_heard in you anymore, and every craftsman by_no_means not may_be_found in you anymore, and the_sound of_a_grinding_stone by_no_means not may_be_heard in you anymore, 23 and the_light of_lamp by_no_means not may_shine in you anymore, and the_voice of_a_bridegroom and of_a_bride by_no_means not may_be_heard in you anymore, because the merchants of_you were the magnates of_the earth, because by the sorcery of_you were_deceived all the nations.
   24 And in her the_blood of_prophets and of_holy ones was_found, and of_all the ones having_been_slain on the earth.
  Rev 19  After these things I_heard something like a_voice loud of_a_crowd great in heaven saying: H‹Praise_Yāh›H.
   salvation, and glory, and power be, of_the god of_us.
   2 Because true and righteous are the judgements of_him, because he_judged the prostitute great, who was_corrupting the earth with the sexual_immorality of_her, and he_avenged the blood of_the slaves of_him out_of the_hand of_her.
   3 And secondly they_have_said: H‹Praise_Yāh›H.
   And the smoke of_her is_going_up to the ages of_the ages.
   4 And fell the elders twenty four, and the four creatures, and they_worshipped to_god, the one sitting on the throne saying: Truly.
   H‹Praise_Yāh›H.
   5 And a_voice from the throne came_out saying: Be_praising unto_the god of_us, all the slaves of_him, the ones revering him, the small and the great.
   6 And I_heard something like the_voice of_a_crowd great, and as the_sound of_waters many, and like a_sound of_thunders mighty saying: H‹Praise_Yāh›H, because reigned the_master, the god of_us almighty.
   7 We_may_be_rejoicing and may_be_exulting, and we_may_give the glory to_him, because came the wedding of_the lamb, and the wife of_him prepared herself.
   8 And it_was_given to_her, in_order_that she_may_clothe herself in_linen shining clean, for the linen the just_acts of_the holy ones is.
   9 And he_is_saying to_me: Write: Blessed are the ones to the supper of_the wedding of_the lamb having_been_invited.
   And he_is_saying to_me: These words true are.
   of_god.
   10 And I_fell before the feet of_him to_worship before_him.
   And he_is_saying to_me: Be_seeing to_it not, a_fellow-slave of_you I_am, and the brothers of_you holding the testimony of_G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, before_god worship.
   For the testimony of_G‹H‹Yēsous is the spirit of_prophecy.
   11 And I_saw heaven having_been_opened_up, and see, a_horse white, and the one sitting on it, Faithful being_called and true, and in righteousness he_is_judging and is_warring.
   12 And the eyes of_him are a_flame of_fire, and on the head of_him crowns many, having name having_been_written, which no_one has_known, except he, 13 and having_been_clothed in_a_robe having_been_dipped in_blood, and has_been_called the the_name of_him, the word of_god.
   14 And the armies in heaven was_following after_him on horses white, having_dressed_in linen white pure.
   15 And out_of the mouth of_him is_going_out a_sword sharp, in_order_that with it he_may_strike the nations: and he will_be_shepherding them with a_rod iron, and he is_treading the winepress of_the wine of_the rage of_the severe_anger of_god almighty.
   16 And he_is_having on his robe and on the thigh of_him, a_name having_been_written: king of_kings and master of_masters.
   17 And I_saw one angel having_stood in the sun, and he_cried_out with a_voice loud, saying to_all the birds flying in midair: Come, be_gathered_together to the supper great of_god, 18 in_order_that you_all_may_eat the_fleshes of_kings, and fleshes of_commanders, and the_fleshes of_mighty, and the_fleshes of_horses, and of_the ones sitting on them, and the_fleshes of_all, free men both and slaves, and small and great.
   19 And I_saw the wild_beast, and the kings of_the earth, and the armies of_them, having_been_gathered_together to_make war with the one sitting on the horse, and with the army of_him.
   20 And was_caught the wild_beast, and with him the the_false_prophet, the one having_done the signs before him, by which he_deceived the ones having_received the mark of_the wild_beast, and the ones worshipping before_the image of_him.
   Living were_throw the two into the lake of_fire, being_burned with sulfur.
   21 And the rest were_killed_off with the sword of_the one sitting on the horse, having_come_out out_of the mouth of_him, and all the birds were_satisfied with the fleshes of_them.
  Rev 20  And I_saw an_angel coming_down out_of heaven, holding the key of_the abyss, and a_chain great in the hand of_him.
   2 And he_apprehended the dragon, the serpent ancient, who is the_false_accuser and G‹H‹Satan/(Sāţān)›H›G, and he_bound him for_a_thousand years, 3 and he_throw him into the abyss, and shut and sealed it over him, in_order_that not he_may_deceive anymore the nations, until may_be_finished the thousand years, after these things, it_is_fitting him to_be_released a_little time.
   4 And I_saw thrones, and they_sat_down on them, and judgment was_given to_them, and the souls of_the ones having_been_beheaded because_of the testimony of_G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, and because_of the word of_god, and whoever neither worshipped the wild_beast, nor the image of_him, and not took the mark on their forehead, and on the hand of_them, and they_lived and reigned with the for_a_Thousand chosen_one/messiah years.
   5 The rest of_the dead not lived, until may_be_finished the thousand years.
   This is the resurrection first.
   6 Blessed and holy is the one having a_part in the resurrection first.
   Over these the second death not is_having authority, but they_will_be priests of_god and of_the chosen_one, and they_will_be_reigning with him for_the thousand years.
   7 And whenever may_be_finished the thousand years, will_be_being_released G‹H‹Satan out_of the prison of_him, 8 and he_will_be_coming_out to_deceive the nations in the four corners of_the earth, G‹H‹Gōg/(Gōg)›H›G and G‹H‹Magōg/(Māgōg)›H›G, to_gather_together them to the war, of_whom the number of_them is like the sand of_the sea.
   9 And they_went_up on the breadth of_the earth, and surrounded the camp of_the holy ones, and the city having_been_loved.
   But came_down fire out_of the sky and it_devoured them.
   10 And the devil, the one deceiving them, was_throw into the lake of_fire and of_sulfur, where were also the wild_beast and the false_prophet, and they_will_be_being_tormented day and night for the ages of_the ages.
   11 And I_saw a_throne great white, and the one sitting on on_it, whose from the face fled the earth and heaven, and place not was_found for_them.
   12 And I_saw the dead, great and small, having_stood before the_throne, and scrolls were_opened_up, and another scroll was_opened_up, which is of_the scroll of_life.
   And were_judged the dead out_of the things having_been_written in the scrolls according_to the works of_them.
   13 And gave the sea the dead in it, and death and G‹Hadēs›G gave the dead in them, and they_were_judged each according_to the works of_them.
   14 And death and G‹Hadēs›G were_throw into the lake of_fire.
   This the second death is, the lake of_fire.
   15 And if anyone not was_found in the scroll of_life having_been_written, he_was_throw into the lake of_fire.
  Rev 21  And I_saw a_heaven new and an_earth new, for the the_first heaven and the first earth went_away, and the sea not is anymore.
   2 And the city holy, G‹H‹Hierousalēm/(Yərūshālam)›H›G the_new, I_saw coming_down out_of heaven from god, having_been_prepared as a_bride, having_been_adorned for_the husband of_her.
   3 And I_heard of_a_voice great out_of the throne saying: See the tabernacle of_god is with humans, and he_will_be_sheltering with them, and they the_peoples of_him will_be, and himself god will_be with them, 4 and he_will_be_wiping_out every tear from the eyes of_them, and death not will_be anymore, neither mourning, nor clamor, nor misery, not will_be anymore.
   The first things went_away.
   5 And said the one sitting on the throne: See new I_am_making all things.
   And he_is_saying to_me: Write, because these words faithful and true are.
   6 And he_said to_me: They_have_become.
   I am the first_letter and the last_letter, the beginning and the end.
   I to_the one thirsting will_be_giving of the spring of_the water of_life undeservedly.
   7 The one overcoming will_be_inheriting these things, and I_will_be to_him god, and he will_be to_me a_son.
   8 But to_the fearful, and unbelieving, and having_been_detested, and murderers, and the_sexually_immoral, and sorcerers, and idolaters, and all liars, the portion of_them is in the lake being_burned with_fire and sulfur, which is the death second.
   9 And came one of the seven angels, having the seven bowls, being_full of_the seven plagues last, and he_spoke with me saying: Come, I_will_be_showing to_you the bride, the wife of_the lamb.
   10 And he_carried_away me in the_spirit to a_mountain great and high, and he_showed to_me the city holy G‹H‹Hierousalēm, coming_down out_of heaven from god, 11 having the glory of of_god.
   The radiance of_it similar to_a_stone most_precious, as to_a_stone jasper crystalizing, 12 having a_wall great and high, having twelve gates, and at the gates twelve angels, and names having_been_inscribed, which is of_the twelve tribes of_the_sons of_Rx-G‹H‹Israēl/(Yisərā'ēl)›H›G-Rx.
   13 From the_east three gates, and from the_north three gates, and from west three gates, and from the_south three gates.
   14 And the wall of_the city having twelve foundations, and in them the_twelve twelve names of_the ambassadors of_the lamb.
   15 And the one speaking with me was_having a_measure reed golden, in_order_that he_may_measure the city, and the gates of_it, and the wall of_it.
   16 And the city four_cornered is_lying, and the length of_it as_much_as the breadth.
   And he_measured the city with_the reed at twelve G‹stadion_measure›Gs thousands, the length, and the breadth, and the height of_it, equal is.
   17 And he_measured the wall of_it, of_a_hundred forty four cubits, a_measure of_human_origin that is also of_the_angel.
   18 And was the structure of_the wall of_it was jasper, and the city was gold pure, similar to_glass clean.
   19 the foundations of_the wall of_the city with_every stone precious having_been_adorned.
   The foundation the first was jasper, the second sapphire, the third chalcedony, the fourth emerald, 20 the fifth sardonyx, the sixth sardius, the seventh chrysolite, the eighth beryl, the ninth topaz, the tenth chrysoprase, the eleventh hyacinth, the twelfth amethyst.
   21 And the twelve twelve gates were pearls, each one each of_the gates was of one pearl.
   And the road of_the city was gold pure as glass transparent.
   22 And a_temple not I_saw in it, for the master god almighty the_temple of_it is, and the lamb.
   23 And the city neither need is_having of_the sun nor of_the moon that they_may_be_shining in_it, for the glory of_god enlightened it, and the lamp of_it is the lamb.
   24 And will_be_walking the nations by the light of_it, and the kings of_the earth are_bringing the glory of_them into it.
   25 And the gates of_it by_no_means not may_be_shut by_day, for night not will_be there.
   26 And they_will_be_bringing the glory and the honor of_the nations into it.
   27 And by_no_means not may_come_in into it any unclean thing, and the one practicing abomination and a_falsehood, except the ones having_been_written in the scroll of_life of_the lamb.
  Rev 22  And he_showed to_me a_river of_water of_life shining as crystal, going_out out_of the throne of_god and of_the lamb.
   2 In the_middle of_the road of_it and of_the river, from_here and from_there, the_tree of_life producing twelve fruits, according_to month each to_be_giving_back the fruit of_it, and the leaves of_the tree are for the_healing of_the nations.
   3 And any curse not will_be anymore.
   And the throne of_god and of_the lamb in it will_be, and the slaves of_him will_be_serving unto_him.
   4 And they_will_be_seeing the face of_him, and the name of_him on the foreheads of_them.
   5 And night not will_be anymore, and not they_are_having need of_the_light of_a_lamp and of_the_light of_the_sun, because the_master god is_illuminating on them, and they_will_be_reigning to the ages of_the ages.
   6 And he_said to_me: These words are faithful and true, and the master, the god of_the spirits of_the prophets, sent_out the angel of_him, to_show to_the slaves of_him which things it_is_fitting to_become in quickness.
   7 And see, I_am_coming quickly.
   Blessed is the one keeping the words of_the prophecy of_scroll this.
   8 And_I G‹Yōannēs›G am the one seeing.
   and hearing These things.
   And when I_heard and I_saw, I_fell to_worship before the feet of_the angel showing to_me these things.
   9 And he_is_saying to_me: Be_seeing to_it not, a_fellow-slave of_you I_am and of_the brothers of_you, the prophets, and of_the ones keeping the words of_scroll this.
   before_god worship.
   10 And he_is_saying to_me: Not you_may_seal the words of_the prophecy of_scroll this, the for time near is.
   11 The one doing_wrong, him_let_do_wrong still, and the filthy, him _let_be_being_filthy still, and the righteous, righteousness him_let_practice still, and the holy, him _let_be_sanctified still.
   12 See I_am_coming quickly, and the reward of_me with me, to_give_back to_each as the work is of_him.
   13 I am the first_letter and the last_letter, the first and the last, the beginning and the end.
   14 Blessed are the ones washing the robes of_them, in_order_that it_will_be the right of_them to the tree of_life, and by_the gates they_may_come_in into the city.
   15 Outside are the dogs, and the sorcerers, and the the_sexually_immoral, and the murderers, and the idolaters, and everyone loving and practicing falsehood.
   16 I, G‹H‹Yēsous/(Yəhōshū'a)›H›G, sent the angel of_me, to_testify to_you_all these things in the assemblies.
   I am the root and the descent of_G‹H‹Dauid/(Dāvid)›H›G, the star shining, morning.
   17 And the spirit and the bride are_saying: Be_coming.
   And the one hearing him_let_say: Be_coming.
   And the one thirsting let_be_coming, the one wanting him_let_take the_water of_life undeservedly.
   18 /Am/_testifying I to_everyone hearing the words of_the prophecy of_scroll this: if anyone may_add_on to them, will_be_adding_on god to him the plagues having_been_written in scroll this.
   19 And if anyone may_take_away from the words of_the scroll of_prophecy this, will_be_taking_away god the part of_him from the tree of_life and out_of the city holy, of_the things having_been_written in scroll this.
   20 Is_saying the one testifying these things: Yes, I_am_coming quickly.
   Truly.
   Be_coming, master G‹H‹Yēsous.
   21 The grace of_the master G‹H‹Yēsous with the holy ones.
   Truly.
  

OET-LV Index
